State Master is fun for all ages and its a game in which younger players can often beat older players as they tend to be better at retaining facts.



================ HOW TO PLAY


================NUMBER OF PLAYERS
2 to 6

OBJECTIVE
Finish the game with the most cards.

COMPONENTS
50 State Cards
6 Colored Dice
1 Category Die
1 Map Card

SETUP
Shuffle State Cards.
Place 5 State Cards on the table with the flag side up for each player in the game: 10 cards if there are 2 players, 15 cards if there are 3 players, etc.
Place the Blank Map face up on the table.
Place the Filled Map face down on the table.
Each player chooses a colored die.

ROUND PLAY
Each player rolls his/her die to decide who will be Player 1 for Round 1.
Player 1 puts his/her die on top of one of the State Cards.
Moving clockwise, each player puts his/her die on of a different State Card.
Player 1 then rolls the Category Die.
Each player, starting with Player 1 and moving clockwise, must then say the correct answer for his/her chosen state for the category shown. For example, if the die says "CAPITAL," a player with his/her die on New York would say "Albany."
If a player correctly answers the category question, that player tries to locate his/her state on the Blank Map.

ENDING A ROUND
Players who answer correctly and are able to locate their states win their cards. All others replace them face down on the table (but not before studying the card a little so they can get the right answer the next round).

WINNING THE GAME
Rounds continue until fewer State Cards remain face down than there are players in the game. The player with the most State Cards at end of the game is the winner.

name: Die verrückte Reise durch Rheinland-Pfalz
description:
Die verrückte Reise durch Rheinland-Pfalz has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Rheinland-Pfalz, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

name: Die verrückte Reise durch Nordrhein-Westfalen
description:
Die verrückte Reise durch Nordrhein-Westfalen has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Nordrhein-Westfalen, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

name: Die verrückte Reise durch Baden-Württemberg
description:
Die verrückte Reise durch Baden-Württemberg has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Baden-Württemberg, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

name: The Light Speed Cup
description:
A high speed death race against the clock. Drivers have a limited time to out wit, out manoeuvre and out pace the competition. Their fission powered Skimmers speed along future highways ramming each other and firing dangerous energy weapons to try and secure a win in the controversial Light-Speed Cup. When the race starts the clock starts and players have until the time runs out to wipe their opponents off of the track. They can aggressively pursue the other racers and try to destroy them, they can speed ahead and try to force the other vehicle off of the end of track or they can duck and dodge allowing the other Skimmers to tear each other apart before speeding home to victory. Which ever player’s Skimmer is in the best condition when the clock reaches zero wins the Cup. This game is a thrill packed adrenaline ride where mayhem reigns and there is never a dull moment!The LSC moto is Action Not Protraction!

This games puts 2-6 players in control of one Skimmer (futuristic race car) each. They race each other along an never ending treadmil like race track that is made out of 4 rolling tiles. When the race starts an electronic timer is started, it has between 10 and 15 minutes on it per player, and when the timer runs out and the buzzer souds the game is over. Durring the game players have to ram and shoot at each other to try and destroy the enemy skimmers before the timer runs out. Each skimmer has different strengths and weaknesses and players get to choose their own drivers which also have unique talents. There is another way of destroy other skimmers and that is to get so far ahead of them that when the track is rolled they fall off of the back of it. In this way the lightly amoiured fast skimmers can win the game aswell.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Tuut Tuut
description:
A player press the locomotive's chimney, and the train rolls along the track. When the train comes to the the first station, the player pushes the chimney and thus stops the train.

The player takes any passenger from the station who he thinks has the same color as his station. He shows the other players what color the passenger has under their "feet".

If the color matches the station, the player places the passenger at his station and then starts the train by pressing the chimney.

If the color does not match, the player puts the passenger back on the train, after showing the other players what color it is, and starts the train.

The train moves to the next station and the next player will have a turn.

The winner is the player who has collected the three passengers in the same color as his station.

name: Challenge and Persuade
description:
Challenge and Persuade is a game of argument!

In this game, players develop arguments and challenge each others’ ideas. The game cards provide easy-to-read facts for any level player to construct an argument around topics at the nexus of energy, water, and climate. An adjective card (e.g. Lasting, Sustainable, Lucrative) is drawn each round that the players must use in conjunction with their fact cards to construct an argument. A Judge decides the winning argument using his own criteria. The player with the winning argument wins the round, and the first player to win three rounds wins the game!

Challenge and Persuade is a fun and social card game that challenges players to think about the choices we have in balancing our need for water and energy with the challenge of minimizing climate change.

Smart!
Through play, this game teaches fundamental knowledge about our environment, challenges players’ understanding of facts, and guides players to construct solid and convincing arguments. Challenge and Persuade teaches concepts and strengthens communication strategies required to engage in scientific discussions concerning our world today. Developed with a team of experienced scientists, gamers, and educators, Challenge and Persuade is aligned to national science standards and may be used in a variety of science, government and policy courses.

Fun!
This game, developed with teenagers and adults in mind, is engaging and stimulating for a wide range of ages. The game can quickly turn into a lively discussion involving current topics on water, energy, and climate.

Social!
Challenge and Persuade is an intensely interactive game in which players either act as Presenter or Judge. The presenters draw fact cards and construct convincing arguments to present to the judge. While the judge decides which argument is strongest, any player may challenge an argument!

name: Commander Mark's Fantastic Galactic Imagination Explorer
description:
"Welcome to my new Fantastic Galactic Imagination Explorer 3-D drawing game! Look at the dynamic NEW SECRET CITY ADVENTURES mural on your game board to become familiar with this imaginary universe. All game players are TRAVELERS and all game pieces are your PASSPORTS to these exciting places!

As you travel through the game, you'll learn about THE NEW SECRET CITY. The object of the game is to keep on playing until you can draw your very own completed version of THE NEW SECRET CITY ADVENTURES mural! Are you ready! Here we go!"
-from a flyer (an Introduction from "Commander Mark") in the game box

Described as "The Ultimate 3-D Drawing Game", this is definitely a game for hyperactive youngsters. Players travel around the board collecting points and trying to learn and practice the "12 Magic Words of Drawing".

Various activities on the game board ask the player to draw pictures, complete short stories, and find creative explanations for objects on the board's artwork.

name: Fast Bucks
description:
The game has 2 decks of cards: Fast Buck Cards (FB) and Market Value Cards (MV). Each player is dealt 7 FB cards, and a FB card is dealt face down in the middle of the table. This is the bonus card.

Players may draw 1 FB card per turn from the deck or the discard pile. They then check their FB cards for 3 of a kind and place them face down on the table. The player then draws a MV card, and follows what it says. It can either affect your hand's value or have you draw another FB or MV card.

When a player has no more FB cards in hand, that player gets a $150,000 bonus and the bonus card is revealed. If a player has a card that matches the bonus in hand, that player receives a $250,000 bonus. The other cards on the table are then scored. Play continues until someone reaches $1,000,000.

name: Das Schuldenkarussell
description:
Objective: ballance your income/your expenses; learn mechanism of insolvency
- acting by turns -
roll the die: each player moves forward according number on a circle; ending on a marked space draw appropiate card and follow instructions. Players are at the mercy of luck - but can protect themselves by spending their money carefully, underwriting riscs, ... Game ends after agreed time or completed circles.

note:
produced by F.X. Schmid; playing time strongly dependend on no. of participants; suitable for school classes.

name: Historia Eine historische Rätselrallye durch die Stadt Gmünd und das Lieser- und Maltatal
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 120; learn more about historical facts of the local region.
- acting by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; draw appropiate (coloured) card and give correct answer; successful? Roll/move again (max 4 times). Ending on a red space (event card) follow instructions.

name: Zwischen Harz und Heide
description:
Objective: give most correct answers within a given time; learn more about the (greater) Braunschweig region
- acting by turns -

Choose a starting place; move on a grid according die roll; draw appropriate card - city or 'Hoppla' - and give correct answer/follow instructions.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bambus-Bären-Bande Reise um die Welt
description:
Objective: collect as many animals cards (pairs) as possible, bringing them back home & gaining bonus chips.
- acting by turns -

Roll the die and move forward on a circle; flip appropiate animal card; finding a matching pair you may bring them gome gaining a bonus chip; a dragon will let you fly, a rat will turn over all already flipped cards.

Game ends after all animals are brought home.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Land Grab
description:
A game for 2-players.

Materials

4 pawns, 2 black and 2 white.

49 Othello like tiles, black on one side and white on the other.

Definitions

Claim - An orthogonally adjacent group of friendly tiles.
Adjacent – adjacent from this point on will be considered orthogonally adjacent.

Goal

Win by capturing all of your opponent’s pawns or by having the largest claim.

Setup

Lay out the 49 tiles into an 7x7 black and white checkerboard pattern.

Then alternately starting with black, place a pawns onto an empty friendly color tile.

Rules

On a turn you must take one of the following actions.

1) Select an empty enemy colored tile that is in a straight line (horizontally or diagonally) with one of your friendly pawns, then flip this tile over and move the friendly pawn placing it on top of the tile just flipped or

2) Capture an enemy pawn by approach, this is done by moving a friendly pawn to an empty enemy tile (this tile must also be flipped over before completing the capture) that is adjacent to an enemy pawn, provided that the enemy pawn is on the continuation of the capturing pawns's movement line (which could be horizontally or diagonally) or

3) Move a friendly pawn freely within a claim that is occupied by that pawn.

The game ends when one of the following occurs.

1. When all enemy pawns are captured or

2. When players are unable of following either rules #1 or #2 after 2 consecutive turns.

Finally add up the tiles in your claims, the player with the largest claim or the player that managed to capture all the enemy pawns is the winner. If by chance there is a tie, look at each player’s second largest claim and so forth.

Restrictions

Unless performing a capture, you can't flip a tile of an opponent's claim if that claim is occupied by an opponent's piece.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Point to Point Movement

name: Marry me?!
description:
O que seria da vida sem alguém ao nosso lado? Amizades que podem virar paixão e por que não amor?
Em marry me?! Os jogadores são pessoas em busca de sua cara metade, com gostos variados, que ao longo dos anos passaram por vários relacionamentos, terão recaídas com os “ex”, para que no final possam dizer em alto e bom som “–Marry me?” (-casa comigo?) ou não
(a vida não é perfeita).
Do que você gosta?
Pessoas mais velhas? Pessoas jovens? Loiras(o)? Morenas(o)? , independente do seu gosto pessoal, no fim o que vai realmente importar é ser feliz.

English translation:
What would life be without someone on our side? Friendships that can turn to passion and, why not, love?

In marry me?! Players are people searching for their soul mate, with varying tastes. Over the years, they may have gone through several relationships, and may relapse with an "ex", so in the end they can say loud and clear "Marry me?" (House me?) or not
(Life is not perfect).

What do you like?

Regardless of your personal taste in the end what will really matter in this game is to be happy.
mechanics: Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track, Worker Placement

name: Truth
description:
Truth is a strategic Pattern making game of Divine proportions; featuring 270 graphic Scripture cards, with a Bible verse on each card!

Become Champion of Truth by receiving Blessings, Rewards, and Victory Points, from creating various types of Patterns.

Draw and Play cards each turn. Thwart your peers from making patterns, while building your own. Making certain patterns give various special bonuses to your efforts.

There are 3 ways to win the game:
1. Collect 10 Victory Points
2. Achieve the Creation Pattern (6 Scriptures)
3. Achieve the Atonement Pattern (10 Spirits)

The first to meet one of the above Victory Conditions is proclaimed Champion of Truth!

name: Flipping Pennies
description:
A children's game in which the two players each flip pennies, or some other coin, at the same time.

The players take turns calling "odd" or "even", then both players reveal their coin simultaneously.

Heads/Tails or Tails/Heads is odd

Heads/Heads or Tails/Tails is even.

This isn't much of a game, and there are ways to cheat!! But if done fairly it is a perfect example of an "Dice Rolling". The coins are randomizers. d2 or d6 doesn't matter!

So the game would play just the same if the two players rolled d6 dice and noted if the sum of the dice was "Odd or Even." Since this is a gambling game too, the players would have to each bet a stake of 1 penny.

name: Mich laust der Affe
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching the top of a palm tree with all 3 of your apes
- moving by turns -

A palm tree is built up (trunk acts as a board).

Each player tries to climb up to the top (palm branches) with his 3 apes by rolling 2 dice. Obtaining a double a chimpanzee is moved instead - kicking down all apes he's passing on the trunk (up or down).

Note: translation of the title 'I'm deloused by an ape' with the meaning: getting surprised

name: Vereint gegen den Feind
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 80 precisely
- moving by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game; use two dice until space 50 is passed. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Note:
Due to breeches (seen on the board) game should had been published later than 1936, likely also later than 1938 (Klee take over) although there is no 'Christian Herbart clover' logo. Theme is glorified by Nazi propaganda.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Racing, World War II

name: Schlaraffenland
description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

Each player moves forward according die/dice roll (use one die only during very first three rounds and after passing space 90);
follow instructions glued into the lid ending on a marked space.

Notes:

Translation: cockaigne, mythical land of plenty;
Educational approach praising work & diligence;
Likely published ~1910s; as usual cute pewter pawns
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Fantasy, Novel-based, Racing

name: Die Reise um die Erde
description:
Objective: be the first turning back home (space 110); learn more about the world.
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on marked space follow instructions glued into lid;

Notes:
Should had been published ~1900s;
Activities like visiting an opium den in China convey a feeling about the spirit of that time

name: Wir 5
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 100; learn more about chocolate
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game, describing the process of getting raw materials for chocolate production; ending on marked space see instructions; some spaces require usage of a letter die.

Note:
Game was delivered with 250 gr. chocolates inside.

name: Zahlenzirkus
description:
Objective: Learn numbers between 1 and 24
- acting by turns -

Flip 24 tiles upside down (symbols or numbers) - other corresponding 24 matching tiles stay visible.

Randomly draw one one of the flipped tiles and find within a given time the matching one; the 'puzzle' concept let you prove if right or wrong.

Game ends after all tiles are merged. Player with most matching pairs is the winner.

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – B Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – D Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, World War II

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, World War II

name: Rund um das Mittelmeer
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 60 (Nimes)
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; starting from Marseille each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a black marked space follow instructions.

name: Asteroil
description:
From the rules:

Asteroil is the game of space mining. Into the vast reaches of the solar system two players maneuver the space fleets of competing corporations as they vie for the immeasurable wealth contained in the asteroids. Repulse cruisers hyperspace in and out to gain position while the space refineries close in fast. The company that meets its quota first gets the jump on the market to control the world's supply of platinum, titanium and gold.

Description:

Asteroil is an abstract strategy game played on a 12x12 square grid. Each player controls a space refinery and four repulse cruisers. A turn consists of moving a piece one space in any direction, jumping a cruiser in or out of hyperspace (off the board; jumping in allows the cruiser to go to any space), or firing a cruiser's repulsion beam at an asteroid. The beam causes the asteroid to move away from the cruiser; ideally the player's space refinery is on the other side of the asteroid, allowing it to be captured. The player who manages to capture three of the six asteroids wins the game.

name: Pyramad
description:
From the rules:

Pyramad is the game of pyramid power. The cosmic forces of intuition and chance meet head on with the powers of observation and logic in this multilevel game for two players. Like the Pharaohs of ancient Egypt, each players seeks to build and possess a pyramid by stacking cards drawn from the special 92-card deck. Until the last card is played, you will be hanging on the edge of your throne.

Description:

Pyramad is played on a 6x6 square grid using 92 square cards. Each card shows a pattern of four squares colored red, blue, or white; red and blue are the players' colors and white is neutral.

On a turn a player either draws a card or plays a card (playing is required if a player has five cards in hand). A card can be played on an empty space or on the intersection of four cards, but the latter play can only be made if the intersection has fewer than three squares of the opponent's color.

The object is to either place the single card on the sixth level of the pyramid or make it impossible for your opponent to play.

name: Vorsicht! Das neue Verkehrsspiel
description: The players may start from any space and use any route they want. They have to pass all 10 numbered spaces to win the game. The movement is determined by a die. If a player doesn't obey a traffic rule, he gets a penality point. Before passing a traffic light, the player has to roll the color die. Only on a roll of "green" he may pass the crossroads. If he rolls "red" he has to wait a turn and try again. The first player who finishes the game with the least penality points, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Natur in Gefahr: Unsere bedrohte Tierwelt
description:
The players have to get from the starting space on the main track around the board till they reach the starting space again. At some points they have to leave the main track and use the side trails. If a player reaches a numbered space he has to answer a question. If he gives a wrong answer, he has to go back to the last red space and use the next available side trail. If he gives a wrong answer on a side trail, he has to wait a turn before he may move again. When a player gets on an occupied space, he kicks the other player back to the last red space. The first player who is back at the starting space wins the game.

This game was published in the early 1970s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das große Speedway und Sandbahnrennen
description:
The goal of the game is to win the motorcycle race. At the x and o spaces the players advance to the next x or o space and may change the track while doing so. On spaces marked with a letter, the players have to follow the special instructions in the game rules.

There are two different races to choose from:
Speedway: Team race with 4 runs over 4 laps each.
Sandbahnrennen: single race with 1 run over 8 laps.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Maleficium
description:
Maleficium is a competitive fantasy game for 2-6 players, with no player elimination. Players assume the role of one of twelve Magi, each with a unique set of abilities and who practice one of six specialised schools of magic. Players may develop their magi's powers throughout the game.

Spell-casting is done through the combination of a spell vocabulary to create different effects. For balance, effects are weighted, and action points are used.

A distribution of negative points, rather than the pursuit of positive points, is intended to encourage closer games. There is a set-collection sub-game for players who get loaded up on negative points early where they can access special abilities. There is also a trading mechanic and simultaneous monster combat.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Mythology

name: Menagerie: War of the Arklords
description:
Notorious, immoral, murderous beings, with no interest beyond extending their own sovereignty by the exploitation of others.


Yes, that’s you; an Arklord.


Your sole objective is to capitalize upon indigenous species by enthralling the strongest to become your enslaved warriors. To unleash havoc upon their planet, and subdue all that oppose you without mercy.


My, what a despicable being you are!


No one can stop you. The natural order beckons at your every command.
But hold! This cannot be! Some insignificant others dare to interfere with your indomitable conquests! None are fearless against your supreme power!
Unless . . . yes, it has begun.
Now we shall see who is the greatest amongst opposing Arklords!


Uh oh, company is coming.


MENAGERIE: War of the Arklords is a quick playing “4X” card game (explore, expand, exploit, and exterminate) depicting the conflict between 2 to 4 Arklords (players) who gather and subjugate creatures, amassing powerful armies to reign over the lands to directly or indirectly defeat the opposing Arklords.

The play area is created from a random pattern of concealed region cards with the size and shape of the area dependent upon the number of players. Each turn, players will spend action points, selecting from a variety of tasks – move and explore the land, gather creatures, initiate combat, draw cards, or call upon an overwhelming force of obliteration.

name: Bimbo's Mondfahrt
description:
Objective: be the first reaching the moon.
- moving by turns -
Starting from earth each player chooses a different route (green, red, blue, black) and moves forward according die roll; ending on a marked space (star) follow instructions.

name: Wali, Yoté, Le Furet
description:
Includes rules to play three games: Wali, Yoté, Le Furet.

Wali is a traditional game played on a 5x6 rectangular board. Each player has 12 game piece in his own color.

At the beginin in each turn, each player places a stone from the reserve to any empty space on the board which is not adjacent (orthogonal) to a friendly stone. If a player cannot drop more stones, he must pass. This continues until all stones are placed on the board, or no more stones can be placed.

After that, in each turn, each player moves a stone to an empty adjacent (orthogonal) cell. If he is able to make 3 in a rows (not more or less) he may capture one enemy stone.

The player who capture all of his opponents stones wins the game.

Yote is a traditional African capturing game in the Checkers family. It's played on a 5x6 board with 12 pieces per player and no standard setup, instead the players take turns placing their stones. Captures are made by jumping. In addition one can have the ability to jump multiple pieces. (A player that has just captured a opponents piece can capture another piece for each piece jumped.)

name: Forest: Monster Breeder
description:
Monster Breeder is a fast paced worker placement game with a bluffing element. This game is tiny (in its simplest form the game consists of 2 cards and a dollar's worth of pocket change).

In this game, each player takes on the role of one of over 30 different bosses. Each boss has its own unique combination of monsters that it can summon and/or spells that it can cast. In this game, all of the monsters are represented by coins. Pennies are the smallest monsters, nickels are bigger, dimes are bigger still, and quarters are the most powerful monsters that can be summoned.

To begin the game, each player selects a boss card to use and takes 3 pennies as starting monsters. The game consists of 5 rounds. On each round, players will simultaneously place their coins. They can create new monster and/or cast spells by placing coins on their boss card. They can attack other players by placing coins face-up next to their boss card or defend by placing coins tails-up next to boss card. At the end of the 5th round, each player adds up the points for his/her monsters (pennies are worth 1 point each, bigger monsters are worth more). The player with the most points wins.

There are over 5 different modes of play. Some modes (free expansion rules) will accommodate 3, or 4 players. Free Print and Play version available!
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Das neue Kriegsspiel
description:
Das neue Kriegsspiel is a wargame based on chess-like mechanics.

It tries to be a simpler version of Johann C. L. Hellwig's
"Versuch eines aufs Schachspiel gebaueten taktischen Spiels von zwey und mehreren Personen zu spielen".

The main goal of the game is to conquer the enemy fortress, with Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery. The movement of the pieces and combat is very similar to chess. The game is played on a square gridded board with 600 squares, which depict terrain like mountains, towns, water and swamps.
publishers: Franz Joseph Rötzel, L. J. Hjerta

name: Großer Preis vom Nürburgring
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone (space 0/76)
- moving by turns -
Each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a coloured space follow instructions like: skip turns/roll a special number to leave that space/ jump...

Note:
Rules printed on the board;
Likely published mid 1960s
Game was sponsored by Aral (now a BP subsidiary)

name: Piratenjagd
description:
Two frigates hunt 15 pirate ships. To win the game, the pirates have to get 7 ships into the bay. The frigates win if they sink 9 pirate ships. The frigates can move in all directions, the pirates only forward. A frigate sinks a pirate ship by jumping over it on a free space.

This is a variant of Fox and Geese.

name: Auf Schleichpfaden mit Karl May
description:
Objective: being Karl May - reach (=escape) with one of your 4 trappers one corner; being an Indian tribe - catch the very last trapper and escape successfully with one of your Indians (reaching the centre or one corner) OR catch the last of the Indian tribe who caught the last trapper and escape....
- moving by turns -

Determine who becomes the trapper (highest number).

Trappers start in the centre, each Indian tribe in a different corner (depending on no. of participants). Moving by die, a '6' let you move again. All Indians try to catch trappers; trappers try to escape, but may catch Indians, too. An enemy is caught if your pawn's move ends exactly on opponent's position. After all trappers are caught Indians will fight for the loot.

Note:
Wooden pawns - as if they were manufactured in the Erz mountains

name: Kommt mit ins Märchenland
description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 130
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a red marked space follow instructions.

name: Das Kriegsspiel, oder das Schachspiel im Großen.
description:
A wargame based on chess-like mechanics.

The goal is to destroy or conquer the enemy Fortress or to capture the enemy King.

The playboard is build out of 460 cubes of different colors.
Whereby:
White represents open ground
Red, walls
Green, woods
Blue, water
Brown, mountains
Black, trenches

Every player has:
1 King
1 General
2 Cavalry Captains
2 Captains
10 Cavalry
20 Infantry
4 Bombardiers
4 Gunners
4 Mortars
2 Conveyances

And several markers:
8 Bridges
7 Scaling Ladders
6 Gabions
4 Bombs
publishers: Gebroeders van Arum, Heinrich Friedrich Müller

name: Napoleon
description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 145; learn more about Napoleon's life
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a marked space (green&red) follow instructions glued into the lid

note:
published in commemoration of the Battle of Leipzig (1813)
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Napoleonic, Racing

name: Die 10 kleinen Negerbuben
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 56 precisely
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll&Move' game; move forward according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.
note:
likely published during 1920s; story is based on 'Ten Little Injuns' from Septimus Winner.

name: Tabula Rasa
description:
The game is for two competing players seated opposite each other. It uses 25 double sided tiles and a dividing marker. The objective is to remove all your opponent’s tiles from the board.

The tiles have 5 separate actions printed on them and a black side and a white side. Players use matching pairs of tiles (one black and one white) to perform these actions to win the game.

Tiles are placed in a line and players travel left to right utilising their own tiles and then their opponents’. During play tiles are flipped over when one player uses them making them available for the competing player to use.

name: Modern Times: Wheels of Industrialization
description:
Modern Times: Wheels of Industrialization is a Eurogame styled boardgame, bordering with a puzzle. IT uses resource management combined with the board rotation mechanic.

Player’s goal is to build from one to three factories using resources available or produced in ever changing environment. But be warned, each production comes with the price. And there are also taxes to be paid to the government…

Game is made for Board Game Geek Solitaire P'n'P contest 2014
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/thread/1179655/2014-solitaire-p...

name: World Tours
description: A party game in which players race to create a chain of destinations by consulting twelve timetables (or 'Key Cards') scattered around the game space. Each Key Card lists twenty departure points with the departure time for the associated destination. Players log the times (to show that they really have seen the key card) and seek the next destination. The winner is the first to turn in a Journey Card listing twelve destinations and their associated departure times.

name: Hop 'n Stop
description:
A racing game with The Smurfs.

Every player has two Smurfs. Everyone also has a stopper (Gargemel). In his first turn, the player moves the runner (with a die roll). In the second turn, the stopper must be moved.
If the stopper comes on a place where a smurf is, that smurf has to start again.

Winning the game: be the first to get your two smurfs on the finish.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Lawless Town
description:
A Lawless Town is trick-taking game set in the Wild West where players must swing deals and spend their cash to pay one another off in order to come out ahead.

The game is played over the course of three round in which each player will be dealt a hand of cards which are then then use to win tricks. Unlike other trick-taking games, in A Lawless Town each trick has at least two winners.

Next players will bribe and haggle with one another in order to convince the trick winners to distribute their awards in ways that are favorable to the briber's plan.

name: Symmetric
description: Part of the Bagged Game Originals line, Symmetric is a symmetrically balanced abstract strategy game for two players. A player wins by having one Counter in each of their opponent's three starting spaces at the center of the board.

name: Mensch paß auf!
description:
Objective: Be the first finishing a round trip though the city (space 1 - 100); learn more about traffic rules.
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a red marked space tell gamemaster/other players what to do if you see this traffic sign.
note:
published during 1930's (increasing traffic); large box shows Nazi emblem Hakenkreuz; cute pewter pawns.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reise durch deutsche Großstadte
description:
Objective: Starting in Berlin be the first finishing a round trip through Germany. Learn more about the big cities of Germany.
- moving by turns -
each player moves forward according die roll; ending on a white space (city) follow instructions.

note:
likely published during 1920s
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Jewels of the Sultan
description:
The goal of this game is to acquire the color jewels that will score in the present round, as well as in future rounds until all jewels have been dispersed and the game ends after the final round. However, you don't want any of the white colored jewels, as they are worthless and will never score.

(Setup) From Box Top:
Put all of the jewels into a global stash to one side of the playing area. Give each player a Persian Rug. Choose one player to be the first Sultan. Give that player the Sultan pawn, the Sultan cards, and the dice.

(Play) Summarized From the Box Top:
The Sultan, using the dice, adds 10 jewels of the rolled color into a single pile for that round. The Sultan then divides the pile in any manner they choose among each of the players, so long as each player pile contains at least one item. Finally the sultan secretly determines which color will score at the end of the given round using the Sultan cards. The position of the Sultan then passes to the next player, and play continues until all jewels have been dispersed and final scoring occurs.

name: fehde
description:
A tactical game for two.
Your goal is to capture the enemies knight, represented by a spherical peg. You start the game with the Knight in the front row, pawns are beside and behind him. Movement is one field in any direction by any playing piece. Capturing is done by jumping over enemy pieces which is in case a must. Pawns are only allowed to move in your own territory and the neutral area of the board, knights can move anywhere. Pawn are aloud to jump over pieces that are placed on the corner spaces of the enemy territory when they land in the neutral area.

name: Sboura Destinations
description:
The name "Sboura" comes from the Greek word for "a spinning top" and included in the game is a numbered spiiner that's used to determine which cards are picked from a deck of destination cards.

Players will enjoy hours of educational fun testing their knowledge and counting skills by answering the many questions asked on the game cards while collecting, paying out and trading Sboura points for each card.

There is, of course, a hitch! Within the card desk, there are 16 cards that contain NO questions. These cards have some strange characters that will give instructions that MUST BE FOLLOWED, some will help you, others will definitely not.

It is basically a trivia game. At the start of the game you start with 544 dollars (yes, 544) you then put 100 dollars in the pot. The first player rolls the dreidel (yup, it's a dreidel with numbers on it). The spinner then gets asked 3 questions, each one harder than the last. For each one they get right, they get money out of the pot corresponding to the amount shown on the card for the question. If they get it wrong, they pay the amount shown on the card to the pot. When the pot is empty, the game is over. The most dollars at the end of the game wins.

name: PrinciPals
description:
PrinciPals is a 2 player cardgame where you try to be the first principal to get 3 full classes of students. Or be the one with the most classes.

It's a microgame which means few components but still meaningfull decisions to be made.

Do you use the student card for it's action or do you play it in your class for its number of students...
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Mit Köpfchen im Verkehr
description:
The players start as pedestrians. Later they use a bike and a tram. All blue spaces have to be visited. On several spaces the Players have to explain different traffic situations. If the do this rigth they get a point (green marker) awarded. If not they get a red penality marker (negative points). The traffic lights are placed in the center of the game board. At the roll of a 6, the player may adjust the traffic lights or the arms of the traffic cop on the game board to close the road for opposing players.
The winner is not the player who ist the first to get to the finish space, but the player who gets the most points.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Street Life
description:
"Street life. The Homeless Survival Game - uses a portion of the proceeds from sales of Street Life to help the needy and Homeless".
The players try to accumulate money while going around the Monopoly type board.
This is typical spin and move game.

name: Broad City Affairs
description:
English description:

In Broad City Affairs each player plays the role of a Don of a gangster family in a turbulent American city of the 1930s. Each Don will work to make his family the most powerful crime family of the Broad City. Players will set up their smuggling rings, open brothels, control the casinos and gambling in the city, traffic with unlawful alcohol shipments, control the unions and bribe to politicians... But they must be smart enough to don't arouse too much suspicions in the incorruptible side of the law. Their guys can arrested in police raids and the district attorney might his eyes over their affairs.

The mechanism of the game is based on area control and workers placement, allowing a higher level of interaction with the other players when each player defends his business and try to hinder his opponents.

A game takes about 90 minutes and offers a lot of options to seize the victory. Will you bribe to politicians to control the crime underworld? Will you become into the new "Capo di tutti capi" by controlling the streets and the monopolizing the smuggling rings? or will you do it controlling the unions? All plays are different: 23 historic events (start of the World War II , end of the Prohibition, Capone arrest...) can modify each play and offer new targets, troubles and options. Nobody said that the thirties were easy years.


Spanish description:

En Broad City Affairs cada jugador representa un Don de una familia mafiosa en una turbulenta ciudad estadounidense en la década de los 30. Cada Don trabajará para llevar a su familia a ser la más influyente en la ciudad y así ganar la partida. Para ello deberá establecer redes de contrabando, abrir negocios de alterne, controlar las casas de juegos, traficar con el alcohol ilegal, controlar los sindicatos, sobornar a políticos… todo aquello que solían hacer los mafiosos por aquél entonces. Pero deberá ser suficientemente astuto como para no despertar demasiadas sospechas en los “incorruptibles” del lado de la ley, evitando que sus hombres caigan en redadas de la policía o que los fiscales pongan la lupa sobre sus asuntos. Por si fuera poco, las otras familias de la mafia lucharán por el control del crimen en la ciudad y no estarán demasiado dispuestas a compartir el pastel.
La mecánica de Broad City Affairs se basa en el control de zonas y la colocación de trabajadores obligando a un alto nivel de interacción entre los jugadores y permitiendo que cada jugador defienda sus negocios y estorbe a sus oponentes.

Las partidas duran aproximadamente 90 minutos y presentan muchas opciones para alzarse con el triunfo. ¿Te harás con el control del mundo del crimen por medio de los sobornos a los políticos? ¿Será el control de las calles y el monopolio de las redes de contrabando los que te convertirán en el nuevo Capo di tutti capi? ¿O tal vez lo hará tu mano de hierro sobre los sindicatos? Además, ninguna partida es igual que la anterior: 23 eventos históricos (el comienzo de la Segunda Guerra Mundial, el fin de la Ley Seca, la condena de Al Capone…) podrán modificar cada partida, ofreciendo nuevos retos diferentes en cada una de ellas. Nadie dijo que los años 30 fuesen unos años sencillos.

name: Bid Six
description:
OBJECT:
Have the highest total score after five rounds of play.

GAME OVERVIEW:
In BID SIX, each round of play begins with one player rolling a set of six white dice and arranging them in a row in the middle of the table. All players then use their own deck of 30 cards (28 bidding cards and 2 blocking cards) to win as many of the six dice as possible by placing one card next to each die.

The highest bidding card for each die wins that die and its points, unless someone plays a blocking card for that die. A blocking card blocks ALL players from winning the die, including the person who played the blocking card. Used cards must be discarded at the end of each round.

If a player wins a “TRIPLE” (a group of any 3 dice) in a single round of play, they get to roll 1, 2, or 3 of the black dice for additional bonus points, depending on the numbers on the three dice in their TRIPLE. Roll 1 bonus die for a BASIC TRIPLE (any three numbers), 2 dice for a STRAIGHT TRIPLE (numbers in sequence), and 3 dice for a THREE-OF-A-KIND TRIPLE (all the same number).

The player or team with the highest score after all five rounds of play (when all cards have been used) wins the game!
mechanics: Action Queue, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Doggerland Miniature Skirmish Game
description:
Doggerland Miniature Skirmish Game is a fast-play, skirmish-level fantasy miniature system that has been co-written by S.E. Lantry and Andrea Sfiligoi.

As with Songs of Blades and Glory, it uses an action-point system that requires no book-keeping. The rules are designed to be simple, fast and fun so that a mini campaign of several games can be played in a single evening.

The Basic Game follows closely to the SoBG model, i.e., the game includes statistics for 180+ monsters and heroes, and details to be able to create your own. Also there are campaign rules where your warband grows more powerful after every battle, and six basic scenarios.

Advanced Rules include the use of an expandable and customizable deck of cards used fro initiative, environmental effects, defence and building a result into historic proportions.

The game offers co-operative and competitive play Adventures, and can be played in 15mm and 28mm.

Funding for this Kickstarter project was canceled by the project creator on May 30 2014.

name: Interstellar Crisis
description: Interstellar Crisis is a skirmish miniatures space combat wargame set in the year 5318. It utilizes a unique movement deck and vector movement to simulate how ships would really move in space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Great Escape
description:
User summary:

A push-your-luck game with a deck building mechanism.

Players are criminals in a prison and try to dig their way out. All players start with a deck consisting of cards with numbers 0–3 (mostly 0), representing how far they've dug. Each round, players simultaneously reveal the first 3 cards of their deck, and then all players get in turn to choose to either go on digging or give up for the day. Those who give up for the day get a couple of benefits such as getting new cards for their deck and/or removing one of the cards they've revealed. Those who continue must turn over one of four guard cards, risking getting caught. If they get caught, they don't get any benefits for this round. If not caught, they get to reveal another 3 cards; rinse and repeat.

Once all have chosen to give up for the day, players put all revealed cards in any order they choose in their discard pile, and then place their discard pile face down beneath their deck, hence "programming" the deck.

The first player to be able to reveal 20 dig points in one and the same round wins the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck

name: Quinque Mora
description:
User summary:

A card drafting game in which players try to collect poker hands. Players start with 6 special cards, each with a priority number and a special effect. Each turn the players select one of these cards, and the lowest priority gets to pick one of the five face-up trump cards on the table to add to his collection. The special cards are equipped with a special effect that also happens.

The player with the best poker hand after 6 rounds wins.

name: Sabrina L'Apprentie Sorciere
description:
TV series adaption
Objective: be the first completing a set of
ingredients/tools to achieve a master degree regarding witchcraft.
- moving by turns -
Move around the board according dice roll collecting the stuff you need (depending on the space you end your turn). There are 3 different sort of spaces: sorcery, character and chance. To increase your abilities you must find matching combinations.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: De weg naar Kralingen
description:
The goal is to get to "De Admiraal", the municipality building with the least amount of dimes.

Everybody receives a start fund of 5 dimes to play with. If the bank is empty, it means everybody is out of luck until somebody needs to pay taxes again.

The unfortunate one who is broke can beg for money with the "rich" people. If that doesn't happen he or she needs to return a minimum of 15 blocks to a white space.

The game is influenced by a dice, chance cards challenges, tact, charm and experience.

name: Strange Planet
description:
A science vessel lands un an unexplored planet and a group of scientists sets out from the ship to gather data on the planet's history and wildlife, also encountering hostile aliens!

It will be up to you, as one of the science team members, whether to take the chance to collect more Data in the dangerous alien wilds, return to your Ship with the Data you've already collected, or strike out on your own to hunt the Aliens before they hunt you!

Also, when you return to the Ship, afraid to explore further, you can continue to be involved in the Mission by "analyzing" the data you've collected, using it to "bet" on the continuing Mission.

At the end of the game, after five Missions, players compare their Data totals, and the player with the most Data wins.

Strange Planet is a push-your-luck card game with elements of betting and set collection.

name: Leprechauns
description:
Roll with the punches!
There's a rowdy ruckus in the land of Leprechauns.
Perhaps it's their penchant for porter, or maybe it's because they're giddy for gold. Either way, it's time to play. Pick up your Shillelagh and join in the frey.

Leprechaun is an all out battle for gold. It's a dice rolling game with a bit of press your luck. Players represent Leprechauns gathering gold coins, fighting over gold coins, and bolstering by drinking beer and gathering 4 leaf clovers.

Play consists of drawing 3 dice from the bag, choosing an action showing on the dice and then deciding if they wish to press their "luck of the Irish" by drawing additional dice from the bag, or they may bank what they have already acquired.

Gather, Fight or Bolster your way to the most gold to win.

name: Danger at the Walls
description:
It’s a well-worn story by now in the Land of Danger: An army attacking a castle. Somehow, though, the story keeps happening, and another bellicose mob has advanced on the imposing walls of someone else’s keep. The clash to control those walls is at hand. Lead the Blue attackers or the Red defenders, using clever card play and a touch of luck to control more sections of the wall than your opponent

The game consists of 54 cards -- 5 walls, a Red personal deck of 8 cards, a Blue personal deck of 8 cards, and a main deck of 33 cards.

Players take turns playing Archer, Cannon, Attack, Leader and Flag cards from their hands to the different walls. Archers & Cannons each have a strength value, and the player with the most total strength at a wall controls it. Attacks remove the opponent's cards, Leaders each have a unique ability that impacts how strength is calculated at a wall, and Flags lock down the control of a wall and trigger the end game.

The player controlling the most walls at the end of the game is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Campaign of first 9 years
description:
Second issue game of Wargame Japanese History #21.

This game uses the same rule and map as "Aterui saga". But it uses different counters.

This campaign is less popular even in Japan. It started in 1051 more than 200 years after Aterui saga. And it ended in 1062.
Basically, this campaign was conducted by the central government against an unloyal Abe-clan.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: VCS: Das Königsspiel
description:
The players move on the game board through several levels, where they have to answer questions from different themed game cards or follow the instructions on the Event Cards. If a Player answers a question correctly, he continnues till he doesn't know the correct answer to a question or an Event Card ends his move. Movement is determined by a die. The first player to reach the center of the game board, wins the game.

This game was produced as a promotional giveaway for the Vivento Customer Services GmbH, a subsidiary company of Deutsche Telekom AG.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Investars
description:
Investars is a collaborative game, where players work together to collectively achieve Big Goals, accumulate money in their retirement savings account, use their individual salaries to Invest in companies, and try to get all their pieces back Home to retire and win.

Investars is played in rounds, each simulating a decade in your life. The team starts in their 20s with a salary, multiple Stock Tokens to invest in companies, and empty savings accounts. Every round starts with paying salaries, doubling the value of each savings account, and rolling the dice to find which companies pay off investments - or potentially go out of business. If companies go out of business, their tiles are removed from the game, potentially blocking players' paths to the Big Goals and Home. Then, it is the team’s turn, and each player makes several actions toward winning the game: Move, Invest, Achieve, Save, or Withdraw.

With good planning, lots of teamwork, and a bit of luck, players will achieve their Big Goals and retire in style as successful Investars!

As a bonus, while you're having fun playing Investars, you'll also learn a bit about compound interest, savings accounts, and planning for long-term goals. In short, you'll learn how to be better investors!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Educational, Party Game

name: Salt Merchant
description:
Your grandfather started a salt manufacturing business fifty years ago. After thriving for many years, the salt business is now in trouble. Faced by tough competition and a lack of good management, there's a risk of business going bankrupt. It's up to you to take up this challenge and save this family business.

Salt Merchant is a card game of business, luck, math and strategy. Each player becomes a salt merchant and tries to outplay other players and become the first to set up the maximum number of salt manufacturing factories and hence earn maximum money. Your challenges are to acquire good labor and factories, dig more salt water wells, and automate your factories. There's tough competition, too, so you have to be smart, make the right moves, and set-up factories of all different types if you want to regain lost glory.

name: Twizmo! Original
description:
Twizmo! is made up of two parts. A Twizmo cube, which is a twistable puzzle cube with 9 faces per side, and a deck of square cards. In Twizmo Original, the faces and cards are made up of 6 symbols. The 54 cards have 9 of each symbol, as does the Twizmo cube.

Twizmo! Original’s simple rules bely the use of spatial and deductive reason along with strategy and a little bit of luck needed for a win. Its thoughtful pace is great for bringing young and old minds together and its universal appeal transcends language and culture.

Twizmo! is all about creating sets of three matching icons. Players take turns twisting the cube, with the goal of creating “three-in-a row” groups of similar icons on the top panel. A “3-in-a-row” set on the cube allows a player to collect all of the visible cards with the matching icon.

When players have collected 3 cards with the same icon, they may turn that set face down; that card set is “closed” and cannot be taken by another player.

To win the game, collect the most card sets, or at any time during the game, collect a set of all nine matching cards for an instant win!
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: The Animal Farm
description:
The Animal Farm is a team competitive board game based on an animal farm where team must try to enclose animal in our fence , collect and sell resources to be the winner .

The Animal Farm is a 2v2 or 1v1 game that will prove your ability to understand your partner's strategy without talking to him. In the meantime, you must protect yourself from the other team that attempts to overthrow your plans.

A game of The Animal Farm is divided in 20 rounds, each one consisting of four turns. Every turn, a player can perform one action: Play an Action Card , Draw some Action Cards , use Nursery to create a new animal, put a wood fence on the board (here players can enclose available animals), collect a resource generated by an owned animals or go to the market where they can sell resources or satisfy orders.

By selling goods or satisying orders in the market, a player collects Victory Point for his team. At the end of the game, the team that has the most Victory Point wins the game.

name: Super KGB
description:
Super KGB contains both Project CIA: The Secret Formula and Project KGB: The Double Agent.

Called "Spy Training Games", they were originally issued in 1973 by House of Games Corporation Limited (Bramalea, Ontario, Canada). The two board games are distinct, different, and have different rules. The two board games can be united together and played following the instructions as "The Deluxe Game" or "Super KGB".

In "Project CIA: the secret formula", 17 envelopes are scattered in designated spots on the board game. One of the 17 envelopes has the secret formula. By rolling the dice, players move around the board game and as they pass over the positions where the envelopes are, they pick up the tile and see if it has the secret formula printed on the bottom of the tile. The winner of the game is the one that exits the board game from one of its four entrance/exit gates.

There is a clear moving piece representing a security guard that moves around from one room to another room. If a player finds himself inside a room with the security guard, he/she has one turn to exit the room.

In Game 2, you're either an agent trying to identify the double agent, or you're the latter, sabotaging the training camp. Deception and deduction will keep you scrambling!

Super KGB is what you get when you combine both games 1 and 2. Waddingtons included extra pieces in both sets so you could play a Deluxe version of either game using both boards. Super KGB can be played by up to six, whereas the component games are limited to four.

This is the version from Waddington's with both games in one box.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rough Waters Ahead
description:
Survivors are trying to brave the treacherous waters while stranded in the ocean awaiting their helicopter rescue, are you here to save them? NO! You're here to drown them!

Survivors are held up in a structure and players flick dice at the structure hoping to drown as many as possible.

There are 4 rounds and each person drowned is worth a different amount of points. Score the most points by the end of the 4th round and win the game.

Rough Waters Ahead is a print-on-demand dexterity game available on The Game Crafter's website.

name: Bergreise Ein neues Würfelspiel
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 42
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; choose one of three different routes before you start; there in no space '1' on the board - you must roll at least a '2' getting started. Ending on a red marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

Note:
Published likely early 1920s.

name: Töff-Töff!
description:
Objective:
Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll&Move' game; ending on a red or blue marked space follow instructions.

Note:
Likely published mid 1920s.

name: Todd Parr's I'm Going on a Trip...A Worldly Game of Travel and Chance
description:
From the back of the box:

Grab your bag and get ready...You're going on a trip! How many places will you travel to and how will you get there? Will you go to the mountains or a tropical island? Will you visit a museum or an amusement park? Each time you reach one of your travel destinations, you collect a souvenir to pack in your suitcase. Whoever packs their suitcase fastest is the winner!

The suspense builds as players draw chance cards and use clever strategy to collect their souvenirs before other players get theirs. One bad move can change the outcome, so it's a race to the finish to see who will win!

Object of the Game:
Players travel the game board hoping to collect the Souvenirs and Transportation cards they need to fill their suitcases. The first player to finish packing his or her own suitcase wins the game!

name: Ay mi Cuba!
description:
"Viajar a lo largo de una provincia de Cuba designada, respondiendo correctamente preguntas de seis diferentes categorias. Para ganar, un jugador (o equipo) debera llegar al puerto despues de responder correctamente cuatro preguntas de la categoria "No!" consecutivas."

Translation:
Tourism along a designated province of Cuba, correctly answering questions in six different categories. To win, a player (or team) must reach the port after correctly answering four questions of the category "No!" consecutively.

name: Der große Krieg
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 100
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on certain spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...

Note:
Likely published 1916 +/- one year.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, World War I

name: Max und Moritz
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 64
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; each player must buy in; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid:
green - skip one turn; red - earn play money; purple - step 10 spaces forward; blue - step 8 spaces backwards.

Note:
Published likely mid 1930s.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Novel-based, Racing

name: Meanie Rangers
description:
Meanie Rangers is a short, Pokemon style game where players catch Meanies in the wild or duel with other players. Each Meanie appears on a single card with a value of 2-7. After 4 rounds of catching fighting and trading, players are judged on the quality of their entire hand.

Points are allocated for the highest mean score, the highest median, the highest mode and the largest range. The game can be played with POD cards, or with normal playing cards of value 2,3,4,6,7 (one of each suit).

Microgame Contest Entry. Full rules are available for free: See links.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Lion's Wrath: Northern Army List
description:
Lion's Wrath; Northern Army List

Originally scheduled to be released at Xmas'13, the "army list" is a new format replacing the last two unpublished Field Guides prior to Dream Pod 9's announced rules revamp sometime in late 2014 or early 2015.

Unlike the full Field Guides for the New Coalition and Allied Southern Territories the army list formatting does not contain any fluff chapters or a full vehicle compendium.

This book is available only in an electronic format.

From the back cover;

TN 1951

Northern Army List

Includes new vehicles, datacards, how to build your army, updated combat groups and threat values. Plus options for the five Northern factions or a generic force:

- Northern Guard (NG)
- Northern Lights Confederacy Armed Forces (NAF)
- United Mercantile Federation Army (UMFA)
- Western Frontier Protectorate Army (WFPA)
- Northern Territorial Reserves (NTR)
- Generic Northern Army

This 54 page book is an Army List for use with a copy of the most current Heavy Gear Blitz! Core Rulebook. Miniatures, six-sided dice, and a measuring tape are required for play.

For two or more players, ages 8 and up.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Field Support Guide
description:
From the introduction (no back cover);

The Field Support Guide is a free update for Dream Pod 9’s Heavy Gear Blitz tabletop miniatures wargame.

This downloadable pdf is meant to complement the Heavy Gear Blitz Field Manual rulebook which is the current ruleset for the game. It pulls together the universal rules updates that were added in the Perfect Storm: NuCoal Field Guide (NuCoal and PAK factions) and Forged in Fire: Southern Field Guide (all the Southern factions), which are the current army lists of those factions.

And, also includes the Combat Engineering, Medical, plus a few other combat groups from various issues of the Gear-Up e-zine.

Plus Field Manual and Forged in Fire errata, Field Testing of updated Threat Values (TV) for the CEF, Black Talon, Caprice, Eden, Leagueless and Utopian factions for Gear-Up. New and updated datacards round out the guide.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Sol Rising
description:
Humanity finally left the safety of Earth to settle, terraform, and extend their dominion to the other celestial bodies of the Sol system. Aided by the Maanen drive, which allows ships to travel exponentially faster between planetary bodies, and humanity's never-ending push for autonomy, the colonies soon became independent planets. In the ensuing wars, both cold and hot, two powers rose to dominance: the Republic of Mars and United Terra. The political and military impasse has existed for much of the majority of the citizens of the system...

Sol Rising focuses on the conflicts, big and small, of the Sol system primarily involving United Terra and the Martian Republic. You are a Fleet Commander put in charge of the squadrons of your star system. How will you perform your duty when war comes to the Sol system?

Instead of being tasked with merely destroying the enemy every time, every mission is crafted to have unique experiences and objectives. These include things like capturing the enemy space station with marines, escorting a merchant to safety so he can warn the fleet at the next mission, stealthily avoiding detection to plant rebels on an enemy moon, and more. In some missions, your accomplishments and choices will affect the next, triggering ripple effects that make your play through the campaign unique.

In Scenario Play, the players will participate in a single scenario pitting one side against another; the winner is determined by victory conditions set by the scenario (ex. the scenario gives the attacking side the mission of wiping out their opponent and to minimize casualties as much as possible, while the other side is trying to get a specific ship to escape the sector and then to take out as many of the attacker’s ships as possible).

Players in a Campaign game participate in a number of scenarios, each having an effect on the next as the story unfolds; the winner of one scenario will have a better starting position in the next (although care has been taken to ensure there will not be a runaway conquest because of this) and the ultimate victory condition is to win the final scenario in the campaign (if the example scenario above was used as a part of a campaign, the second scenario would change based on the outcome of the first; the number of ships the attacker gets and their starting status in scenario two is determined by the ending of scenario one, and if the defender managed to get their special ship out of the sector they get to choose the starting locations of their ships, rather than using a predefined, unorganized starting layout).

name: Media Markt: das Spiel ...
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Media Markt, a chain of stores in Germany.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Battle of Macysburg
description:
The Battle of Macysburg , a Command and Maneuver scenario, portrays a meeting engagement between two well-matched armies converging on a town that’s important as both supply point and road junction. Two players maneuver armies composed of units representing infantry, cavalry, cannon, skirmishers, and leaders, to capture and hold Macysburg, and chase off or destroy the opposing army. The battle lasts for 3 days, 36 day turns divided by 2 night turns. Units arrive at diverse points on the field during the first 2 days. At night, the armies separate and rally some of the units lost each day.

Command and Maneuver is a simple abstract strategy rules set that allows very rules-light wargames to be constructed. But as Macysburg demonstrates, it does not necessarily mean a light wargame. By abstracting all of the “fiddly bits” of wargames, what gets represented are the basic ideas of command control, supply, and maneuver to obtain both strategic and tactical advantage over your opponent. Since all combat is deterministic, players aren’t trying to overcome the randomness of combat results tables or dice towers or card draws. But they are trying to overcome chaos created by the combination of the combat and leader rules, which often result in units being out of command.

Armies are fragile in this game, and they “feel” that way. Combat is very bloody and unforgiving. If you are not careful in your dispositions and advances, you can lose a major chunk of your army in a very few turns, without adequate compensation. Players quickly find themselves adopting combined arms tactics and using formations and units in ways that look very much like standard tactics of the era. By doing things very differently than most wargames, the CaM games tease out and examine different aspects of war.

Macysburg, an abstract riff on the Battle of Gettysburg, is just one of the scenarios you can build with the CaM package, available in a Print and Play and in a Vassal version. The terrain (woods, hills, and town squares) is movable, allowing for a different set-up of the game each time. The elements of the scenario are broken down, laid out, and discussed for players to see how the scenario is constructed and how to vary it. Other scenarios are available and more will be provided. Players are encouraged to experiment with the system.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement

name: Urosette
description:
Urosette is an abstract strategy game for 2-5 players with a Moroccan theme. It is similar to both Othello and Go.

Players first take turns placing starter tiles (coins) on the game board. Then, they draw a hand of 3 coins, each having a different ability defined by the arrows on the coin. Placing a coin points to one or more other coins not owned by the player, and that player lays claim to those coins by placing a colored token on them. On subsequent turns, claimed coins change hands.

Once a coin is completely surrounded either by other coins or the edge of the board, it is captured by the last player to successfully claim it. This means a coin captured on your turn could go to an opponent.

The game ends when all of the spaces have been filled with coins, and all of the coins have been captured. Each coin has a number on it, add those up and the player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Al Centro
description:
At the center is a board game tiles, abstract, strategic and competitive, 2 to 4 players, about 10 to 40 minutes.

In this game players must wear the tile color by pushing the center of the board with other tiles. To push necessary to match the figures of the tiles in shape and color. It looks easy but you only have a minute and just 5 tiles in hand per turn.
The player who wins 3 rounds will be the winner.

Components: 120 tiles, 1 rule booklet, 1 timer.

Printable files are here and the BSK.

This game will be as p & p for a trial period.

name: Heavy Gear Blitz! Operation: Drop Bears Dive!
description:
Operation: Drop Bears Dive!

[From the back cover;]

"Barrington Gates. Baja. Red Cliffs. Battles that the 08th had paid for in blood against the CEF over thirty cycles ago and now the enemy had returned. Corporal Vandenbosche gripped the control sticks on either side of him in the dark cockpit of his Koala. Anger welled up inside of him as he thought of the loss of his family in the orbital bombardments dropped so casually on his home town.

Today, he would repay the invaders for their crimes. His regiment would drop from the skies and rain hell on the enemy. Looking through his gear's omni-camera, Vandenbosche saw the green light and his squadron commander readying himself to jump from their Orca transport. As Sergeant Mason engaged his gear's SMS and leaped out of the open bay door, he called over the radio, "Boys, I'll meet ya on the ground. Give 'em hell!"

Vandenbosche grinned at his sergeant's order and moved to position himself on the launch track. The clear blue skies seemed incredibly inappropriate for the bloody work in store for the Crazy Eights."

The WFPA 08th Airborne Regiment is one of the oldest regiments in the Western Frontier Protectorate. As a distinguished regiment, the unit is instrumental in many of the key battles the league has waged and represents among the best examples of the WFPA's soldiers and traditions.

Operation: Drop Bears Dive! explores this unique regiment's history and the developments they introduced onto the battlefield. In this book you will find:

- Unit History and Traditions
- WFPA Ranks, Insignia, and Uniforms
- 10 New Campaign Scenarios
- War of the Alliance Rules for Northern Leagues and the CEF
- HACS-01HG-PARA/AST Koala Development History, Technical Data, and Variants
- Five Special Characters with RPG and Blitz! rules for fielding them.
- And a Bonus City Militia Army List to be fielded by the South.
