In the Crash Motor Melee, contestants maneuver around the course while avoiding the walls, other combatants, or their exhaust trails (which consist of potent chemicals that once burned will disable engines of vehicles which take in the fumes through their air intake system.) At the end of each round the smoke clears, vehicles are repaired, and the survivors who avoided the hazards successfully are awarded points. The first driver to reach enough points will be crowned Champion of the Crash Melee!

User summary:

Motor Crash Melee is played on a square grid. Each player controls a car on the grid. At the start of each round, each player selects a new direction for their car (ahead, left or right). Then, they draw a speed card that determines how many squares they move. Each car that crashes into the wall, another car or an exhaust trail is wrecked.

name: I Know New York
description:
I Know New York challenges your knowledge of the Empire State! Collect category markers by answering multiple choice questions as you 'round the clover-leaf board. If you can answer the brainiac-level "I Know It All" questions, you have your pick of markers. Steal an opponent's marker on "Chip Raid" and win when you've gathered all the markers! With 785 unique questions from all regions of New York, this game will allow you to be a part of it. Now go out and spread the news, "I Know New York" is THE new trivia game for everyone who loves New York. Questions cover a broad range of fun and challenging topics, including: Geography, People, History, Sports, Arts, Natural History, & Pop Culture.


Using logic and strategic thinking, "I Know New York" players are rewarded with markers by correctly answering questions from the game cards, which are presented in multiple-choice format.
As players progress through the game board and cross different topics, they find themselves journeying through the rich and diverse history of New York State.
A "Know It All" category for brainiacs!
Multiple-choice questions for the timid.
Even a "Raider" option for the ruthlessly competitive!!!

name: Panzerschiff: Expansion Set
description:
This Expansion provides an additional 48 rated warships (BB, BC, PB, CA) to the standard Panzerschiff game.
(You must own Panzerschiff 2nd ed. to use this Expansion.)

Includes

a 12-page illustrated rules booklet,
Expansion Counter Set #1, and
Expansion Counter Set #2.


The rules provide two new ship types (pocket battleships and heavy cruisers), adds ships from the Russian navy, and includes additional optional rules (including "squadron rules" and Japanese Long Lance torpedoes).

Ships included are:
Britain: Revenge, Royal Oak, Warspite, Barham, Howe, Duke of York, Anson, Nelson, Repulse, Warspite, Malaya, Valiant, Resolution, Kent, and Cumberland;
Germany: Graf Spee, Adm. Scheer, Lutzow, Prinz Eugen, and Adm. Hipper;
France: Suffren and Algerie;
Italy: Duilio, Andrea Doria, Trento, and Trieste;
Japan: Mutsu, Haruna, Hiei, Kirihima, Kako, and Aoba;
USA: Colorado, Maryland, West Virginia, New Jersey, Wisconsin, Washington, South Dakota, Indiana, Massachusetts, Alabama, Guam, Baltimore, and Wichita;
Russia: Arkhangelsk, Kirov, and Voroshilov.

Adding cruisers and additional ships adds versatility and fun to the game system.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Moonbent Path
description:
The game involved players traveling from the centre outwards on a circular board to escape the mysterious "Laken" while trying to get to a mysterious crystal to stop it.
The players moved pieces shaped like strange creatures to escape the Laken. Cards and dice were involved.
categories: Children's Game, Maze, Puzzle, Territory Building

name: Kramforsspelet
description: This is a promotional game from a line of similar ones, each named and themed for a Swedish town, and self-described as a cross between Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit. Players roll and move around the board. At specific points they have the opportunity to acquire properties that allow them to collect rent from other players, or to collect dividends on owned properties; answering trivia questions may be necessary to take these actions or increase their effectiveness. There are also event cards that may require players to answer questions to determine what happens, event spaces that require players to play a game of chance for property ownership, and more. The game may be played until one player goes bankrupt, until all players but one go bankrupt, or for a predetermined amount of time.

name: Double Check
description:
Double Check is a game of Checkers adapted for four players in teams of two. It is played on a 14 x 14 square grid with nine squares of each corner removed, resulting in a cross-shaped checkered board. The game is played on the dark squares only, and each wing of the board has twelve dark squares to host twelve pieces in their starting positions. There are pieces of four colors: black, white, red, and green. Each player chooses a partner and their own color, and sets up their pieces in starting positions opposite the board from each other. Play proceeds clockwise around the board.

Players move their pieces and capture other players the same as in Checkers, moving only towards the opposite side of the board until their pieces can be crowned in their partner's home row, and moving in any direction after. Only opponent's pieces may be jumped or captured. Pieces cannot be crowned in opponent's home rows. Movements are not otherwise restricted on any part of the board. The team who eliminates their opponents' pieces, or prevents them from moving, wins the game.

There is one variant provided for in the game's rules, in which players are allowed to jump their partner's pieces without capturing them.

name: Arkhangelsk
description:
In Arkhangelsk you play a team of soldiers sent to Arkhangelsk to find out why it is no longer responding to communications. At the beginning of the game you just arrived in the camp. You need to get the power on, radio working, and call for evacuation.

On each turn you will draw cards from your deck to gain time to take actions like moving, firing, repairing and searching. You can also use the time to refine your tactics by purchasing cards. The cards in your hand give you both time to take actions and better or more efficient actions.

As the game progresses your deck will become stronger, but the storm will increase in intensity, the sun will set, and stronger creatures will venture forth from the surrounding Siberian wastes.

You will need to balance all your actions carefully to survive the elements, repair the prison, kill the winter creatures and finally make a dash for the airstrip when the plane lands!

name: Air Fleet: Knights of the Sky
description: Air Fleet is a game of aerial combat of the second world war. The players control a squadron of aircraft. This squadron is generally composed of two or three aircraft. The goal is to maneuver on the game table in order to destroy the greatest number of enemy aircraft. There is no limit to the number of players, however it is advised to have only one squadron per player.

name: Counter Terrorist Force
description:
Counter-Terrorist Force is a pure “player vs. player” (1 on 1) game where the main focus is on tactics and realistic combat. The game is played from both sides of the conflict. One person plays the terrorists and the other takes the role of counter-terrorist.
Not only do you execute missions, you also run your own counter terrorist corporation and try to work your way up from scratch. You will also fight occasionally as a terrorist so that your friends can
play as counter terrorist troopers too. Game play can either be single missions to improve your corporation, or otherwise in campaign mode where two campaigns are interwoven – you and your opponent take turns as terrorists - and you both have your own counter-terrorist unit to run every second game in your individual campaign.

name: Flanders Fields
description:
War Games Rules for the Great War.

The Great War has never attracted the attention of war-gamers in the same way that conflicts both before and since have done. There are probably a number of reasons for this but the common perception, especially in the UK, that Great War battles were little more than exercises in mass slaughter ordered by remote and uncaring generals probably has much to do with the reluctance to game this period.
These views are now being re-appraised by a fresh generation of historians and researchers who, without playing down the horrors of the trenches, the scale of the suffering or the terrible cost of a "Big Push", are challenging many previously held ideas.

Flanders Fields is a set of rules which allows players to war game actions from Regiment (Brigade), to Divisional level actions from the war on the western front between 1914 and 1918.

The rules seek to provide an enjoyable gaming experience for all players, regardless of the final result. As such a degree of sportsmanship is necessary between players, it is perfectly acceptable to seek to slaughter the toy soldiers on the table top but in dealings with other players please maintain a degree of sportsmanship. In cases where the interpretation of a rule might be in doubt, for instance whether a unit is in or out of range let the roll of a die or toss of a coin decide.
The rules are divided into four main sections
A brief consideration of those aspects of the Great War which serve to distinguish it from previous and later conflicts.
The main body of the rules.
Generic tables of divisional organisation which may be used to pick forces for a game.
A number of appendices providing extra information and examples.

name: Starship Strike
description:
These rules are designed for a player to control many capital ships in a major fleet action. They are designed to allow players to refight the huge space battles of the Exterminator War.

There are a couple of other sets of Universe-based rules already in existence.

HELLFIRE, which allows players to control a single ship in considerable detail.
Big Burn is for small fleet actions with a degree of detail as to what damage is done.


This set of rules are another step in the abstraction process, designed to make a battle playable in an hour or less, and several battles in a campaign context practical in an evening.
The basic rules concept is a direct steal from the excellent WRG game 'Seastrike' published in, I think 1974.

Inevitably, that original system has mutated somewhat in its conversion to the Universe, and this system is an attempt to reflect the doctrine and practice of 300+ years of space combat in the Universe.

Space battles in the Universe generally take place in the orbital space around a colony world. Combat is generally not 'to the death', and fleets will usually withdraw if overmatched.

Combat is also very greatly influenced by political constraints and the consequent rules of engagement. Similarly, the loss of a capital ship is a major economic loss as it takes a year and a half to build a replacement, and it has significant credit value. (See the Macro Rules for the Humanity Will Prevail Campaign). Captains and admirals are schooled with the prevailing ethos – which is that if an enemy ship breaks off combat you let it go (after all, it might be you next time).
Much of this was challenged during the Exterminator War – where the enemy was an implacable machine intelligence – so when fighting Exterminators the loss of ships is expected. However, that specific threat has now receded.

name: Myrmidons Invasion of the Giant Mutant Ants
description:
Myrmidons pits two players or two teams of players against each other. One player/team plays the US military forces circa 1950s. The other player/team commands a force of giant mutant ants ala the atomic horror movie classic, Them!

The game is designed for tabletop miniatures play (15mm scale human troops are suggested such as Battlefront Games' WW2 Flames of War (FoW). Counters are provided with the game so that new players or those who don't wish to use miniatures can dive right in.

From the Cover:

Giant mutant ants are in the city sewers and the army must save the day! Play the army commander and use your rifle squads, bazookas, flame throwers - - even mechanized units to eliminate the Ant Queen and her minions; or feast on the human intruders as you defend your colony by playing the carnivorous giant ants!
This package contains everything you need to play except six sided die!

Here’s what you get:
•A complete set of play tested rules, using easy-to-learn game mechanics.
•A partial sample turn with accompanying illustrations.
•2-D copies of all required game pieces for first-time players.
•Extensive diagrams and illustrations for “visual learners” to get playing fast!
•SEVEN unique scenarios for hours of gaming fun; play from two to six players!
•Comb binding for ease of play.
•Compatible with Flames of War basing.

name: Stax
description:
Stax is basically a Pachisi variant played by 2 players (each playing with 4 counters each of two colours which start in their respective "jails") or 4 players in partnership each playing one colour. The first player/team to get all 8 counters home wins.
Players alway throw two dice and must always move by exact count. It requires a six to move a counter out of jail.If a player's counter finishes on an opponent's counter then the opponents counter is returned to its jail. Once a player has got all of one colour home, he then requires a six and thereafter may move his other colour or partners colour on his colour's turn turn.
If two or more counters of the same colour land on the same square they form a stack. No opponent's counter may pass a stack. To break a stack a player must first land on the square immediately before that stack. He must then throw successive sixes equal to the number of stack counters plus one. If successful the stack counters are returned to their jail, otherwise the turn ends.
If a multicoloured stack is formed, this does not block movement, it may not attempt to break a stack and if landed on its counters are returned to their jails.

name: Three Kings
description:
Three Kings is a three-player chess puzzle game. Each player represents an "Alliance" of two of the three colors of chess pieces in the game (red, black and white). On each player's turn, they may move a piece prior to adding a new piece to the board.

In Three Kings, check and checkmate are not means to an end, as the object of the game is not to render checkmate, but to have the most points. When a King is put into check or is checkmated, the opposing color(s) involved score points. Because each player represents two colors of pieces, his or her score is mostly the sum of points scored by those two colors. However, each player also has a Hidden Agenda which may increase their score, and each player scores points for captures they make throughout the game.

name: Sunder the Stars
description:
This started as a reworking of the Meka Tac - Giant Stompy Robots Edition rules into a starship combat game, along with the grafting of elements from a lifetime of pushing miniatures around a table while rolling dice.
That didn’t work as planned; the rules did the job, but not well enough to command anything more than a task force of a half-dozen ships per player. The ultimate goal was to handle the battle of fleets but still make the individual ship and how it was maneuvered matter. Some compromises were made, other things were simplified, and few items simply tossed out. The desire was to have a game that would entice new players to starship combat gaming and give an option for battles with larger numbers of ships to those who have fleets at the ready.

name: Fleet of Battle
description:
Fleet of Battle was developed out of Field of Battle by Brent Oman (published by Piquet Inc.). The rules are for ancient naval warfare from Salamis to Actium. They are best for the Punic, Successor and Roman Civil Wars where the quinquireme (five) was the most common 'line of battle' ship. Fleet of Battle is intended for use with fleets of between six and 20 ships per player with an optimum of a dozen or so for an evening’s play. Larger battles can be fought without difficulty, but more than an evening should be set aside for such games.

There is no set ground scale or ship scale. The rules were devised for what felt right using 1:600 model ships. Fleets in classical times were very large, often several hundred ships strong, manned by tens of thousands.With this in mind it is suggested that historical scenarios should be fought using a ratio of one model to 10 - 20 ships.

If using 1:1200 scale models or smaller, use centimetres instead of inches.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Starship Soldier
description:
The rules are about small unit actions of a group or so, deployed planetside for VIP guarding, raiding, hostage rescue, arrest and capture and similar missions.

The rules are intended for use with 15mm scale models, or suitable counters of similar size.
Ground scale: 1 cm = 5 metres
Time scale: 1 game turn = 2-4 minutes
Figure scale: 1 figure = 1 soldier

name: C3: Command Control and Communications
description:
The aim of these rules is to simulate combat in the period 1789-1815.

COURSE OF A GAME
Each game is assumed to be one of the following formats
a) Competitive - each player has a force which is balanced using a points system. The game commences with the opposing forces (starting on or off table) and advancing towards each other, with intent to give battle and destroy the opposing force. Starting with initial contacts from patrols and/or vanguards prompting their commanders to respond. The main forces are deployed in attempts to seize and/or maintain the initiative. Finally one force is defeated and the victors may attempt pursuit. The rules are primarily designed around this type of game.
b) Scenario – each player has a force defined for the scenario which may be based on fictional or historical events. The objectives and victory conditions being defined by the scenario.

REPRESENTATIVE SCALES
There are variable ground and troop scales to allow for varying sizes of engagements. So in effect the ground scale will vary from 1:2500 (i.e. 1mm on the table = 2.5m in life) to 1:30,000 (1mm = 30m). However in any game the ground and troop scales are directly proportionate to each other.

The game is broken into bounds of varying length. For game purposes these are expressed are periods of minutes. The activity of all troops within any bound is directly related to the time span of the bound. For example a five minute bound allows all troops to complete five minutes of activities. However a 500 minute bound allows all troops five hundred minutes of activities. The reason for the variability is to allow for those periods where little or no activity occurs to be passed over.

Troops are represented by figurines and or models based on varying size bases.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Montoro
description:
Montoro is a deduction game where two players compete to get all the goods available. On each turn a player takes the role of "reporting" and his opponent of "manager" where the declarant will announce the number of tricks that will take, and the manager will have to try to thwart the plans of the declarant and make it do more or assets less the number I said. This is a tactical, fast and very pissed game.


Montoro es un juego de deducción donde dos jugadores competirán por conseguir todos los bienes disponibles. En cada turno un jugador toma el rol de “declarante” y su oponente de “gestor”, donde el declarante anunciará el número de bazas que se llevará, y el gestor tendrá que tratar de desbaratar los planes del declarante y hacer que haga más o menos bazas del número que dijo. Se trata de un juego táctico, rápido y con mucha mala leche.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Crust
description:
You are one of “Crust” – the neighborhood pizzeria delivery drivers.

The Pizzeria owner knows that a good pizza delivery is when the pizza arrive to the customer Fast and Hot.

That will make the customer happy and a loyal one.
How can the pizzeria owner know the pizza was served fast and hot?
By the tips the delivery Driver gets from the customers.

That’s why at the end of each day the pizzeria owner checks which delivery driver got the most tips and he give him a bonus and the title “Employee of the day”.

Your mission is to earn the most tips at the end of the day and become “employee of the day”.

How to play the game:

ROUND SETUP
The player picks up a delivery card showing the delivery destination.
The player calculates which the fastest route is for him.
The player throws the dice and advances the number steps indicated by the dice.
The player moves by one count the "pizza marker" that indicates the progress of the delivery.
Each "traffic line" on the road and each “road sign" are progress steps included in the play.
Traffic is only allowed in the direction indicated by the arrows on the road signs.
After this, the next player draws a card and repeats the steps.

PIZZA DELIVERY
Arrival at the delivery destination is considered done when a player threw the dice and moved according to the number on the dice to one of the “traffic lines " located across the entrance (address number) of the same house and between the two road signs on its sides.
After a player has arrived to the house and delivered the pizza he will receive a "tip" in money bills, which depends on how fast he has brought the pizza to the customers. The calculation will be based on the number on which the "pizza marker" is located, that counts of the number of turns that the player played until he arrived to the house.

When the player arrives back to the pizzeria, he picks up another delivery card and repeats the action.

name: Polter-Heist
description: Polter-Heist is for 2-4 players, ages 6+, with a playtime of 45-60 minutes or more. The object of the game is to explore the haunted mansion, uncovering rooms and searching for the hidden Treasure. Along the way you’ll make discoveries that can help you out and encounter ghosts that will deplete your courage or hinder your search. Occasionally you may encounter a benevolent spirit that will help you along the way. Be careful though, because if you get scared to death you’ll become a ghost that can chase down your former friends! You win the game by acquiring the Treasure and getting it out of the house. The ghosts win if everyone in the house gets turned to a ghost. You lose if you are a ghost and one or more players are able to make it out of the house with the Treasure.

name: Time Wars: Strike Team First Edition
description:
The original game of superpowered time traveling vampire hunters.

Players form Strike Teams of unique Time Corps Agents while the Game Master sends them on brief missions into the past with explicit goals which change from adventure to adventure. Characters have Stats, which represent their physical body, and Skills, which represent their learned behaviors. As the Game Master plays out the Timeline of the adventure, the players must creatively apply their powers, try to avoid using the dice to check against their Stats, and increase their Skills, as they navigate the past and meet the goals set for them by Time Corps Supreme Command. But the window into the past is quickly closing - if you don't accomplish your mission in time, you never will!

The First Edition of the game is no longer available for download, and is no longer supported by the publisher.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Time Wars: Strike Team Second Edition
description:
The original game of superpowered time traveling vampire hunters.

In the revised Second Edition rules you will find an improved Skill Point Distribution System, new Powers including the new category of Emergent Powers, over 200 new possible animal hybrids, improved Power rules, an overhauled combat system, and improved language, among many other things!

Players form Strike Teams of unique Time Corps Agents while the Game Master sends them on brief missions into the past with explicit goals which change from adventure to adventure. Characters have Stats, which represent their physical body, and Skills, which represent their learned behaviors. As the Game Master plays out the Timeline of the adventure, the players must creatively apply their powers, try to avoid using the dice to check against their Stats, and increase their Skills, as they navigate the past and meet the goals set for them by Time Corps Supreme Command. But the window into the past is quickly closing - if you don't accomplish your mission in time, you never will!

This game is available for FREE DOWNLOAD as a PDF off of the Time Wars Universe website.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Book, Dice, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Acting, Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Time Wars: Supreme Command Premiere Core Set – Humanity
description:
The future is in peril. Your opponent wishes to rewrite history to meet their Goals, but only one version of the 161sr Century can exist at a time. Send your Time Travelers back into the past, and arm them with the most sophisticated Items you have. You preside as a Supreme Commander in the Time Corps of the Human Republic, tasked with conducting the Time Wars. As you struggle to control the past, you will be faced with the question: Which future will you fight for?

As the world's first deck-stacking game, Time Wars: Supreme Command has no discard pile. Instead, every card which leaves play is returned to the bottom of one or another deck. As you play you can stack your own deck, but so can your opponent. Each card you shed can narrow your strategy, but enhance your opponent's.

With the Premiere Core Set you can play a randomized two player game right out of the box. If you have more than once Core Set you can build custom decks and challenge your friends to multiplayer free-for-all blitzes!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, American Civil War, American West, Bluffing, Card Game, Civil War, Collectible Components, Deduction, Educational, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Medieval, Modern Warfare, Political, Prehistoric, Puzzle, Science Fiction, Spies/Secret Agents, Sports, Vietnam War, World War II
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Simulation, Take That, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Robot Deputies in Outer Space
description:
The Sheriff of Scyprus has mysteriously disappeared allowing crime surrounding the planet to rise dramatically. In Robot Deputies in Outer Space, you are a robot competing to become the new sheriff in town. With the help of an assistant, robots work to collect batteries, a valuable commodity on the planet Scyprus. Batteries are traded to upgrade robot's software, weaponry and disguises. When a robot is equipped, they may choose to venture into space in pursuit of wanted criminals. Once an outlaw has been captured, deputies must decide to take the honest route and put the outlaw behind bars, or free the outlaw and collect bribe money. Taking bribes may allow for bigger upgrades to nail more notorious criminals, but the residents of Scyprus are watching. The deputy who makes the most impressive arrests will be elected Sheriff, while the remaining robots remain deputies.

Robot Deputies in Outer Space is a 2-4 player strategy/ worker placement game. It is designed to be highly portable through utilizing cards instead of a traditional game board.

www.tinspecter.com

name: Transport Express
description: This is a "roll die, move dobber, follow instructions given on square landed on" of the simplest kind. This particular game uses a D6 and is themed on driving a car along a track 96 squares long.

name: Wartour 1990
description:
From the Rulebook:
"Design a tour that will see as many of the battle/military sights (marked on the map with circles and handwritten numbers) as possible without running the tour group ragged so they can enjoy it. So you can compare the level of enjoyment each itinerary possesses, each sight is given a number from 1 to 10 (number assignments explained in other folder).

Collect counters that represent the sights and add up the assigned point numbers. On the back of the Day Record Chart (DRC) are examples of previously played itineraries, so you can compare how you did. Bonuses and penalties for free time, too much driving and random events add to your total point score."

Originally a solitaire game, there is a competitive version with a group arriving at the same location getting fewer points, but rolling on the CRT.

name: Tajemnice Ostrołęki
description:
Tajemnice Ostrołęki is a Polish family board game that focuses on the history of the city Ostrołęka.
Game is played on the board that shows old map of Ostrołęka. Players, represented by the persons from different ages (since medievel times till today) are moving through the city and answering questions about it's history, which results with gathering points.
Game contains board, questions card, counters and four character figures. Rules are short and simple, since game is designed to be played with all family members.

name: Daylight Robbery
description:
Roll and move game for 2-4 players.

Players can either be gangsters attempting to amass £120,000 by robbing houses OR police attempting to capture all of the gangsters before this happens. If at any time the value of all of the unrobbed properties plus the total of cash that gangsters have amassed does not amount to £120,000, then the police automatically win.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Witch: Det magiske spil
description:
You and your friends call yourself "W.I.T.C.H." you have magical powers. You have been assigned to close the nine gates to protect you city Heatherfield against dark forces.

You have to hurry placing your own Witch-tokens on the letters W.I.T.C.H. by the nine gates.

The evil powers makes this task both difficult and exciting. Sometimes you loose the tokens, you have places, other times a monster spawns and prevents you from reaching your target.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Holmes 13: Hope S. Hwang Promo Card
description:
A free Promo card featuring Holmes 13 designer Hope S. Hwang handed out at Tokyo Game Market November 2013.

Can be used as one of the character cards.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game

name: Kuchazu 1944/45
description:
Kuchazu 1944/45 was third, after Yafra and Tantek, game from the "Pacyfik 1941-1945" game series that showed fictional battles at Pacific during the second world war. Whila Yafra focused on the single island battle and Tantek was lagoon battle, this time players have to fight over archipelago.

Kuchazu was published in the 7th issue of "Dragon Hobby" magazine. It contains board and 100 die cut counters. It has two scenarios, taking place during American invasion on the Kuchazu archipelago.
- Impas (American landing)
- Kuchazu (Janapese counter attack)

name: Island Surf
description:
Hop on your finger-sized surf board and race around the islands riding a wave of marbles. Island Surf is a turn-based, dexterity racing game where you chart the island map, plot your course and use your finger-surfing skills to outrace your opponent.

Place your three marbles closely for safe surfing or press your luck with more distanced marbles which could give you the chance to grab the lead. Wiping out on an island slows you down, but jumping over it could cut off your opponent. Pick up the pace by surfing the existing wave or strategically picking from the previous lap's wave.

The first to cross the finish line wins.

name: Puzzle & Dragons Deck-Builder Game Capture! Metadora Dungeon
description: Based on the popular mobile game by GungHo, this is a deck-building game with well-known characters from the mobile game.

name: Blitzpass
description: The Devil's pot cooks! Never before have the 'wilden Kerle' had to make such quick and accurate passes. It's not easy to pass the ball to the right player, whenn they all storm the field at the same time. You must act quickly and still keep a cool head when the thick headed Michi appears. Whoever manages to play all his cards first, wins.

name: Rise of the Aeronauts
description: Rise of the Aeronauts is a steampunk-themed game that lets players take control of a unique faction, such as the Machinists or Steamgunners, and fight against opponents to build the world's first airship. Players must secure rights to resources by conquering opponent's territories and defending their own. Structures can be built that grant players both victory points and various offensive, defensive, or luck benefits. The game runs less than 90 minutes, is quick to pick up, and it has the depth to keep heavy gamers interested.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Yamie Chess
description:
Yamie Chess is a math learning toy for grades kindergarten through 8th grade. The game pairs cartoon characters drawn by award-winning ex-Disney animators with math and science lessons from qualified U.S. educators to inspire young minds. Yamie Chess covers key math and science skills such as algebra, geometry, data analysis, numbers, and measurement.

The game was designed by a group of post-graduate math educators, expert scientists, and U.S. engineers from leading American universities such as MIT, Stanford, Caltech, Columbia, and Vanderbilt University.

Jennifer Shahade, a two-time American women's chess champion, and chess author Jeremy Silman are two of the credited lead designers.

The contents include tournament-size classic chess set with specially cartoon-adapted chess pieces designed for little hands (character images on the bottom of the pieces), an interactive math comic book, and 12 coloring pencils.

The game was officially launched on February 16, 2014, at the New York City Toy Fair.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Educational, Math

name: SANTA purSUIT
description:
SANTA purSUIT is a family-friendly race game using only cards. Each player is trying to race their character around the table, through other players hands, and complete the necessary laps to be the Santa Suit Marathon winner! Something fun to play with family and friends during the holidays. Perfect stocking stuffer!

The game is played in 3 phases, each turn:
1) Pass (simultaneously all players pass cards from their hand to the player to their left, aka. clockwise. Players must pass the number of cards required to get their hand down to 5. If players have less than 7 cards, they must pass at least 1 card, unless they have 0 cards, then they don't need to pass a card).

2) Pick (each player, in turn order, select cards in their opponents hands to press their luck, and advance their own runner. Each card has one of three symbols that either advance, stop, or backup your racer.)

3) Play (after all players have picked cards, then players may play sets as a bonus sprint action for your racer)

If a player has successfully completed the necessary laps in the marathon, they are the winner!

During setup, players can set the number of laps required for each racer to either balance difficulty level for different aged players and/or adjust the total game length.

name: Zero Day
description:
SECURE MESSAGE RECEIVED from _Unknown_User_:
Probability Grid intercept: 0.9%

We need to act now. You know the Grid has grown in power and reach. There's not a registered CPU remaining it doesn't access. Everything is known, everyone is known. If the Grid isn't burned, it will control everything and our humanity will be lost.

I've got the coordinates. It does have a physical mainframe we can strike, burn every program in it. We can show the world the danger complacency created, that we almost gave up our liberty for convenience.

I've got Drone2004 and E-Terrier ready, but we can't do this without you. We lose, and humanity's freedom is gone. Of course, we do this, we'll be heroes. I figure we've got zero chance anyways, so let's call this Zero Day.

In Zero Day, you are a hacker in a civilization built on technology. Your commensurately useful skill set will allow you to write code or reverse engineer it from ...other sources... and piece it together to find exploits that can be used against the oppressive Mainframe. The first player to inject enough exploits into the Mainframe to bring it under their own control wins — but be warned as the Mainframe will not sit idle when it detects intrusions!

Every round you get three hacker action markers that can be used for one of three things:

Building up programs by "writing" them using appropriate sets of code cubes.
Running your programs to acquire exploit discs.
Reverse engineering other programs by swapping your resources for what's already there (which is also how you inject exploits into the Mainframe).


You may retain action markers from round to round, but they (as well as your unused code and other discs) count against your limited total resource capacity. As a result, you must manage your actions and available space, and balance it with the risk that comes with having programs available to others.

name: Gladiators
description:
Gladiators is a tactical action game, where you play a gladiator fighting for Glory in ancient Rome. On each turn, players draw a small hand of Action cards and roll 5 custom dice. The symbols on the dice will shape what cards, gladiator skills and movements the player can make. The player with the most Glory at the end of the match wins.

The tactical decisions are simple but deep: how best to use you
positioning, cards and gladiator skills to maximize your Glory each turn. You also have to be aware of the NPC enemies, other players, and traps in the arena. Using the dangers of the arena to your advantage is key to your survival.

There are multiple match formats, including standard (anyone can attack anyone), coop, grudge match, and more. A single match takes around 30 minutes, but you can also play a full tournament. Tournaments are 3 matches in a row, tweaking decks between each match.

To win, players must pay attention to the crowd. A deck of Crowd cards provides new ways of earning Glory as the match goes on, and the rewards are often far higher than those for simply killing your foes. Completing special objectives earns you Crowd Favor, which is worth a huge chunk of Glory at the end of the match. Favor will go back and forth between players during a match, and it is often the favorite who ends up winning.

In the end, only Glory matters. Even if your gladiator dies, you can still win if you had a glorious death.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: War Prime
description:
War Prime is a sci-fi miniatures war game set in a distant future.

The human empire has explored the stars and taken thousands of systems as their own. But their expiation has made many enemies and their draconian rule has created unrest within their own boarders.

A terrible cosmic anomaly ripped its way though the human empire forcing those from the many planets in its path to evacuate, abandoning homes and resources. This disaster gives the Empire's enemies the opportunity they need to invade and drive the ruling aristocracy out of power. Earth has fallen and humanity is fractured.

The game of War Prime allows players to take up one of many sides in this galactic battle. The initial release of rules includes the divided Humans, the savage Kelk, and the mysterious Amerant.

name: Reise durch Deutschland
description: This is a simple roll and move game. The players start their journey in Berlin and end it in Hamburg. The first player to reach Hamburg winns the game. At the start of their journey, the players use one die. From space 50 on, they can use two dice.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Games of the Goddess
description:
About the Game:

This game is an abstract game designed, created and published by me, Magdala Ramirez. Games people Play is a board game that dares you to go on a quest within the self to uncover your spiritual path. It will take you into the cycles that you encounter in your life and help you to understand how you have evolved. In this world of duality, the system created separation and disconnection within the people. It happened over and over again. Soon, people stopped be-living in themselves and an inner battle began. Chaos, destruction and sadness came into being in the outside world as the human beings became more disconnected and dysfunctional within themselves. Human beings got caught in the cycles that created turmoil within them and peace was no where to be found, until now. Now the human beings are ready to reach themselves by embracing and uncovering the cycles within the self. They are ready to integrate their hearts and birth a higher perception of themselves.

How to Play :

This is an ancient game of serpents and arrows. The arrows make your energy go up and the serpents take your energy down.

Role a dice and use your marker to move across the board. Read about the number you land on and meditate why you are there and where you are going, and where the synchronicity of the dice will take you. You can start if you throw a one on your dice. Then, the game begins! Use as a board marker something personal that has your energy. It could be a ring, a stone, a crystal etc. As you proceed in the game, you are led to different houses and the meaning of each house that you enter into during the game is written in the book that comes with the game.

You win when you became a God-Goddess, the number 68, having perfect control of yourself and using your feminine power with all its divine implications. Meditate on this. Meditate in your circle. You will find this game a beautiful tool to knowing yourself.

name: Triviata the Opera Trivia Game
description:
From the instructions:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: To answer opera questions in six categories, then move your token to Valhalla for a chance to win the game."

My recap: One player rolls the die, moves his pawn and answers the appropriate opera question from a card read by his opponent.

Questions are in the following six categories:

Lives of Opera Composers
Female Singers
Male Singers (and a Few Conductors)
Music, Characters & Plots--Questions about the Opera
Opera Companies
The Media--Recordings, Quotes, Films, Plot Sources

If the question is answered correctly, the player rolls and moves again to another question. If answered incorrectly, play moves to the left.

To win, answer a question correctly in each of six categories, move to Valhalla by exact roll of the die, answer one last question in the category picked by the the opponents.

Sounds like Trivial Pursuit for the Opera buff.

Contains 6 pawns, one die, score pad, trivia cards, roll-up board and the rules.

name: Hull Down
description: Hull Down is a modern tank-to-tank combat game which is produced as a professional, wholesaled item. (Review in Strategy & Tactics Magazine, Vol. III, No. 1)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Wargame, World War II

name: Arbela
description: Arbela is an Avalon Hill-type of game set in the ancient period of combat. (Summary from Strategy & Tactics Magazine, Vol. III No. 1)

name: Micro Arena
description:
Micro Arena is a fantasy gladiatorial combat microgame. Each player creates a team of fantasy creatures and does battle to accumulate the most glory.

On each turn players choose one of eight actions specific to each creature. Then in initiative order, players reveal their selection and take their action. Every action has attack dice, defense number and a move rating along with a skill that allows the player to bend the the rules of the game.

Micro Arena is designed to be quick and fun using minimal components.

name: Imperium Galacticum: HEX
description:
Imperium Galacticum - HEX is a hex-tile based space civilization building strategy game for 2 or more players.

In IG HEX, each player assumes the role of a spacefaring, advanced civilization exploring space, discovering and colonizing planets, researching new technologies and waging interstellar war, with the goal of collecting 12 - 20 Victory Points (the number depends on how long a game players want to play).

Before the game can start, players build a playing field made up of hexagonal space tiles. As the game progresses, space hexes are explored, flipped face up that is and planets discovered my be colonized.

Players earn Victory Points for controlling planets (1 VP per planet they control) as well as for having the greatest total population on all their planets, the most powerful military, the highest research rate, the strongest fleet of spaceships and for having the largest territory.

After each round, Victory Points are calculated and the player who is first to reach 12 - 20 VP is declared the winner!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Dice, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Race To The Big Top
description:
It's a race to the Big Top. The show must go on, but will you make it in time? The Tiger has escaped, the Strongman is picking on you, and a monkey just locked you in a cage. Walk the tightrope and maybe get fired out of a cannon.

On your turn, roll the dice and move. Ccllecting Rescue Cards to protect yourself from the Pitfalls along the way. Try to land on the Big Top spaces to collect Big Top cards which can help you along the way or may allow you to Challenge the other players. Try to land on the Peanut spaces to protect yourself from the other players playing Challenge cards. Be the first to reach the Big Top and WIN!

name: Ascendant Crown
description: Ascendant Crown is a Euro-inspired area control game with a unique take on a dice-based combat system. Players assume the aspiration to conquer the wards of a fortified city and claim the influence over the crown. Players use the Legions of their kingdom to invade and defend a city ward utilizing an easy but unique dice mechanism to attack with and upgrade their forces.

name: Highway to Shell
description:
The goal of Highway to Shell is to navigate your turtles safely across the road to the nature preserve while knocking your enemies back to the zoo with some unfriendly traffic.

The players face up to 6 lanes of dangerous highway they must attempt to guide their turtles across. As turtles move along the road more turtles are randomly placed out at the edge of the road.

The players take turns playing cards from their hands to move turtles, send vehicles down a lane of the highway, or place obstacles on the road to effect movement the movement of turtles and vehicles.

After the required number of turtles make it across the road, players score points depending on how close the turtles are to the preserve.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board

name: Borkum Das Inselspiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Borkum, part of the East Frisian Islands in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Numb3r it!
description:
Numb3r it! is a filler card game of mathematical operations.
The aim of the game is that each player must try to equal or get as close as possible to the target figure of the center of the table. To do this, you must do the mathematical operations that you consider with the cards you have in your hand.

In his turn, the player may pass, or make 2 actions of all the following (without repeating the same action);
-Grab 1 card from one of the two central decks (numbers or operations)
-Make 1 semi-discard *
-Grab 1 semi-discard card from another player
-recover 1 own semi-discard

When neither player wants to play, or neither player can be able to continue playing, the operations of all players will be solved. Each player must put on the table their cards ordered from left to right representing his mathematical operation.
To the result of his operation each player will apply a penalty for each wasted card.

The player that with his mathematical operation (applying his respective penalties) gets be closer to the target figure wins the game.

COMPONENTS:
-100 cards

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Burgwedel
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Burgwedel
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Euskirchen. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Fehmarn Das Inselspiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting fehmarn, an German island in the Baltic Sea.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Juist Das Inselspiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Juist, part of the German East Frisian Islands.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Das Helmstedt-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Helmstedt, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Esslingen
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of esslingen
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Euskirchen. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: das Koblenz-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Koblenz, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Lacrosse  Action Packed Dice Game
description:
A dice game for simulating a game of lacrosse. There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 for the Home Team and 2 for the Visiting Team (1 Offense die and 1 Defense die for each). Players take turns rolling their Offensive die against their opponent's Defense die. Points are scored by comparing the rolls against a chart.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

name: Warriors of Fantasy
description:
Warriors of Fantasy is a Wargaming system that will be aimed at large scale battles using 100’s of miniatures per side. It will hopefully remain fast to play while retaining the depth of individuals.

The Warriors of Fantasy system is geared towards representing medieval combat of all types, from realistic to high fantasy.

The system is designed so you can use any figures from any manufacturer, these rules are written assuming you are using the 28mm scale (Games Workshop or equivalent).

The system is designed to be rules-lite, with only about 10 or so pages of rules to learn to play. To retain depth the game will provide a structure for players to build their own rules around.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: A Torrent of Steel
description:
Micro-armour rules for the Late 20th Century

Designed for 1/300th battles in the period 1950 to 1990, AT oS provides a brigade or divisional level game.

The rules work on the well-proven “fistful of dice” principle, and enable large formations to blaze away at each other without recourse to repeated die rolls. Infantry, artillery and air support are catered for

These rules cover armoured conflicts around the world - the Six Day and Yom Kippur Wars, the Indo-Pakistani Wars the First Gulf War, not to mention unrealised conflicts like a Soviet invasion of Western Europe.

name: Air War-Korea: Air Combat Rules for 1/600, 1/300, 1/144th Miniatures for the Korean War 1950-1953
description:
Miniature Rules for Jet Combat Over the Korean Penisula 1950-1953. Air War-Korea is the third in a line of introductory air combat games designed by David Child-Dennis. Air War-Korea is designed for 1/600th or 1/300th miniatures, although 1/144th can be used by doubling all measurements. Air War-Korea is hopefully the first in a series of games that will focus on specific eras with the second game being set in the skies over Vietnam. Theoretically this game could be played outside with 1/72nd scale models on stakes (with flags replacing the counters. This is my intention for this as it is less complex than other systems of it's kind.

—description from the designer

Air combat rules for 1/600, 1/300 and 1/144th miniatures for the Korean war 1950-1953.

Although jets were used in WW2 and most major powers had developed them by the end of the war, there were no jet vs. jet dogfights. After the war the U.S., England, and Russia frantically improved their engines and airframes, setting the stage for what would be a continual arms race for the next forty or so years.

The Mig-15 came as a shock to Western air forces when it made its debut over the skies of Korea at the start of the Korean War. The first jet to jet dogfights took place with P-80s, F-2 Banshees, and F-84s dueling it out with Mig-15s as North Korean forces attacked down the Korean peninsula, then during the disintegration of those same forces with the UN counterattacks.

When the F-86 Sabre entered combat it completely changed the game and set in motion the classic duel between the Mig-15 and F-86 for the next few years.

Airwar Korea is an introductory level air combat set of miniatures rules that recreates these legendary duels. Players can use F-86s, Mig-15s, carry out ground attacks, and basically any type of mission that was used in the Korean War.

Airwar Korea enables gamers to read through some basic rules, set up a game, and conclude the game in a few hours without having to learn 50+ pages of rules and dozens of charts.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Korean War, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order

name: Return to the River Don
description:
Rules for low level actions in the Russian civil war using 15mm figures.
This set of rules is intended to cover battles in the Russian Civil War at the lower end of the scale, - games covering a regiment or two aside (5 -6 battalions or cavalry regiments) plus the odd assorted Armoured Car or artillery piece. They are supposed to capture the confusion, madness and unique nature of the Russian Civil War through embedding this in the basic mechanisms rather than just adding chrome.

These rules are written for 15mm figures, and are intended to be played on a 6’ x 4’ table, although we play on a 12’ x 5’ usually. So first off you’ll need two armies and a table. Or a floor.
And some scenery.

name: Red Star - White Star
description:
Modern Naval Rules for the 21st Century.

The rules have been designed to give players an accurate, yet manageable game in a 2-3 hour playing time. In these rules, combat occurs in three distinct zones.
(1) Within the horizon.
(2) Over the horizon and
(3) Underwater.
The horizon has a nominal range of up to 24 inches, while beyond the horizon is limited to 48 inches or the average width of a gaming table. Most torpedo attack ranges are limited to 12 inches, although some torpedoes can operate beyond the horizon. The game system allows for a movement rate of 8” per game turn for all vessels and unlimited for aircraft. This gives a reasonable appearance of movement for 1:3000 scale ships.

These rules are intended for ships in the 1200th /3000th or 6000th scale. All dice are D6.

name: The Book and the Gun
description:
Counter Terrorist Warfare in the 21st Century.

This rules set has been developed primarily to focus on an infantry existence in modern day war.

The rules used for fighting a battle with miniature figures on tabletop terrain revolve around basic functions, each of which has many ramifications. A general description follows, and this will offer an overview of what actions a tabletop game covers.

The Book and The Gun is a realistic small unit action war game that is easy to learn and relatively quick to play, while containing the depth needed to meet the players' desire for a realistic tactical tabletop miniatures game. Vehicles and aircraft rules have been abstracted as support for the infantry fight and to that end players should not attempt to recreate large scale mechanized actions with these rules as you will be disappointed.
Players should look at how the rules can be modified to accommodate armies of these periods.

There is no reason, with proper modification, why these rules cannot be used to portray small-scale infantry actions in Vietnam, Korea, and WW2. Indeed, these rules can portray small actions such SWAT rescues and police actions.

So, it is present day, and anywhere in the world you want to take your fire team or squad and fight is up to you and your imagination. Collecting a large army is not necessary in order to play. All it takes is a minimum of 3 soldiers per side and a little bit of model terrain to enter the firefight of your life.

1 full turn equals 2 minutes game scale. Each player turn is one minute in real time.

Troop scale is basically 1 figure represents one man and one vehicle model represents one vehicle.

name: Carnage: Drive to Survive
description:
Carnage is a racing battle game set in Britain in 2020 or so. Players take control of vehicles from humble Reliant Regals to top-spec Lamborghinis, and then kit them out with improbable Equipment and weaponry, with a view to slaughtering similar minded opponents. They take part in “duels”, (races against each other for honour, pride or cash….but mostly cash), in order to better their machines and skills for the next race. What the end goal is of all this, probably no-one knows, and the Police seem strangely absent from all this. Ah well, who said reality was fun?

Players start the game with a kitty of £1000.This is used to buy their vehicle and all specialised items for it. They may in the course of the campaign add money to the kitty by winnings, and spend money on repairs, new weapons & equipment, new vehicles etc.

name: Empires at Sea
description:
Rules for Nautical Wargaming in Antiquity.

It would be impossible within any reasonably brief set of rules to give stats for every variation of vessel which saw action during this time period. What these rules are designed to do is give a sense of naval combat in the age of antiquity, while being streamlined enough to have games played in a reasonable amount of time. Empires at Sea, will classify vessels into one of three types: triremes, quadriremes (including quinqueremes) and heavies (which include the above mentioned hexaremes and other poly-remes).

Empires at Sea is designed to by played with 1/1200th scale ships on an approximately 6’ x 4’ hex-grid playing surface. Typical mats, such as those available from Hotz (Sea Blue felt mat) with 2 inch hexes generally work very well. Alternately, players could utilize 1/600th scale ships (such as Xyston Miniatures) on an 8’ x 6’ mat with 3 or 4 inch hexes if they choose to do so. Both scales work equally well.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: East Africa WW1
description:
These rules are written to re-enact the company level actions fought in East Africa during 1914-1918. the rules are written for 20mm figures. but 1/300 blocks could be used and measurements made in centimetres rather than inches.

Here is your chance to defeat Lettow-Vorbeck's askaris in less than 4 years, land successfully at Tanga, defend the Uganda railway or eliminate those elusive Konigsberg guns.

name: Essence: Handicaps
description:
Essence: Handicaps is the 3rd expansion to Essence: The Game of Insights. It allows the players to face their thoughtforms and to fathom the attitudes they possess.

In the beginning, players get three handicap cards showing limiting attitudes, and the task of getting rid of these until the end of the game.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: GangStars
description:
GangStars is a skirmish game of petty crime in the hood. It’s about street gangs battling it out on the turf, cops trying to fight this and the Mafia seeing to it that their claims are not infringed.

GangStars is a light-hearted game and NOT the attempt to portray street warfare as accurately as possible. It’s just a game for like-minded souls who enjoy some hours of heroic deeds and funny
situations after endless happy hours of painting models and terrain-building.

GangStars is a game where you don’t need to buy tons of miniatures. A small gang of 4 to 6 homies plus their trusted and loved dog is enough to get started and have a lot of interesting memorable games. As you don’t need that many miniatures take your time to paint them as well as you can.

name: Lightning War
description:
Lightning War is a game of warfare during the age of machinery. It is a game of strategy and tactics where battles (of perhaps more than one day) are able to be played in a few hours.
The basic unit of control is the battalion (or national equivalent). This is a unit of individual bases (usually around four), where each base represents a company (or squadron of tanks). This battalion-sized unit is called a combat unit. A group of these combat units, usually two to four, is called a battle group.
An example of a battle group is a British armoured brigade, where the individual armoured regiments are the combat units. The four bases within each represent the squadrons within the regiments.
The focus of Lightning War is not on detail (for instance, range bands and armour penetration tables) but on troop types, the training of the soldiers involved and command control.

All troops and commanders have a quality rating from one (worst) to five (best). This is not the valour of the individual soldier, but a measure of how effective they are in combat.
A turn is two hours and a combat unit (battalion) can perform one or two actions a turn depending on the quality of the troops and a die roll.
Battle groups move sequentially between sides – not one side after the other – depending on the quality of the troops and headquarters involved.
Combat units can become fatigued once they suffer casualties and commands can become exhausted (once half the units within them are fatigued). The effects of fatigue and exhaustion are to slow or even stop advances.
Bases are usually 30mm by 30mm for micro armour, but other sizes can be used. Place as many infantry figures on a base as desired (four or five seems a good number). A vehicle or gun base has one model on it.

name: Das Freiburg-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Freiburg, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Salü Das Saarbrücken Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Saarbrücken, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: MouseHunt: The Board Game
description:
MouseHunt: The Board Game is a board game implementation of the Facebook game MouseHunt developed by hitGrab Inc.

In the game players take on the role of Mouse Hunters in the fantasy kingdom of Gnawnia. They arm mighty weapons to bases and set out cheese to attract different mice ranging from the mundane to the fantastic.

The first hunter to catch all the mice on his list wins.

During their turn a hunter rolls a die to determine, which mouse they attracted. A second die roll will determine, if the trap trap is strong enough to catch the mouse. Weapons, bases, bait and location will modify the attraction and catch rolls. Catching a mouse will get you a bounty, but if you miss other hunters at the location will have a shot at catching the same mouse.

Use the bounty to buy improved weapons, better bait and travel the kingdom to complete your hunting assignment.

name: Earth Expects
description:
Earth Expects is a highly detailed set of tactical space combat rules which emphasise skill over firepower. It is well suited to playing battles from duels to squadron actions; because of the high level of detail large fleet battles can be slow to play and therefore optional rules are provided to speed play in these games.

Earth Expects is designed to represent battles within the solar system between ships capable of manoeuvre at sub light speed. No aliens have been encountered; battles and wars are fought between human factions as they have been since before the dawn of history. Modification for use in a galaxy spanning campaign is straightforward.

name: Restless Natives
description:
A set of simple, fast-play colonial wargames rules for fighting battles between British and Native armies.

Fast and furious battles, where the results were often in the balance right the way though until the end, and where the fortunes of one side or the over could literally change with the turn of a card.

The main elements of the rules remain unchanged, and it is possible for two or more players to fight an interesting battle to a conclusion in under two hours on a 4 foot x 3 foot (120cm x 90cm) tabletop battlefield using approximately two hundred 15mm scale figures.

It is possible to fight larger battles using more figures and a larger battlefield, but the duration of the battle will increase, and in today’s busy world not everyone has the necessary time or space.

The rules do incorporate several novel features. These include:

The use of a standard pack of playing cards to determine the order in which units are able to move, fire, and take part in close combat;
The use of Special Event Cards that the players can use to gain extra movement, firepower, close combat effectiveness, or to rally troops that have failed a morale test and have fled from the battlefield;
The use of the Jokers to determine:
When players have to hand back any unused Special Event Cards.
When the battle will end.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Ancient Foes 2
description:
These rules are designed for short skirmish 15mm Ancient wargames between 2 players. For scales larger than 15mm, such as 25mm, double the measurements or use inches instead of centimetres.
These rules revolve around the ability of leaders to give orders to the soldiers.

name: Das Sachsen-Spiel
description:
The players get tiles that are segments of the map of Sachsen with some added symbols. If they spin a sympol that they have on their tiles, they can place their tile on the game map. The first player who has placed all his tiles on the map, winns the game. There are 3 sets of tiles with their own spinner:
1. agriculture and mineral resources
2. historical events
3. industrial products

This is a promotional game for the ÖVA (Öffentliche Versicherungs-Anstalt der Sächsischen Sparkassen in Dresden)

name: Mog 93
description:
The intent of this small set of wargaming rules is to allow the players to recreate a portion of this battle using miniature figures, scenery and models. Unlike most wargaming rules, all the players in Mog ’93 play the American forces. The Somalis run themselves on ‘auto-pilot’, using a simple scheme of die rolls
to determine where they appear and their actions. The Americans check to see if they get hit any time they perform an action based on the number of armed Somalis who have LOS. These rules assume that
you have some basic wargaming experience, as I have no inclination to write out wargaming basics such as what LOS is and what does and does not constitute cover, etc.

The author’s basic scenario assumes that the initial stage of the mission is complete: The Delta operators have captured and secured the targets, who have been loaded on the vehicles and sent off on their way back to base. The first Blackhawk has been shot down and crashed. At the beginning of play, Rangers and Delta Operators (and SEAL and air force personnel as well, if you have the figures) are on the ground, trying to make their way to secure the crash site and prepare for extraction. What happens from there is up to the players and the dice.

Each player will control a ‘unit’ of American special forces soldiers, typically either a unit of Delta operators or Rangers. The term ‘unit’ is used because you’ll have to decide how many models will form a unit – it can be as large a stick of Rangers (12 models), to as few as two models each if you have a lot of players. My advice to you is to allow each player 4 to 6 models, maximum, as he will need to keep track of ammunition and wounds for each model.
The Somalis will come into play as ‘mobs’. A mob will consist of one or more Somali models, armed, unarmed, or a mixture of both. The Somalis are on autopilot. They are moved according to a protocol described herein, but otherwise perform no actions other than to be on the battlefield, assuming to be firing in whatever direction they are facing at any Americans who happen to be in their LOS.

name: Tulku
description:
Object - To be the player with the most cards at the end of the game.

The Deck – 36 cards ranked from highest to lowest 14,13,12,11,10,9,8,7,6 each in four-color suits red, green, blue and orange.

Before the start of the game each player selects a different trump color suit.

The Deal – The dealer shuffles the deck and deals out all the cards one at a time face down to all the players. Next players look at their hand for any sixes not in their trump suit, these are to be given to the player who has that suit as trumps.

The game is played in three rounds; keep scores for each of the rounds.

The Play – Playing clockwise, the player to the dealers left starts by playing any card from their hand face up to the center of the playing area forming the start of a play stack.

Henceforth on your turn take one of the following actions:

1. Beat the top card of the play stack by playing a higher-ranking card of the same color suit or

2. Play one of your trump cards on top of the play stack. Having done this, you must play another card on top of this one; this second card may be of any rank or color suit the player so chooses or

3. Play a card that is not one of your trump cards to the playing area forming a second play stack adjacent to the previous one, the card must be of a different color suit from the one previously lead. Having done this, you must play another card on top of this one; this second card must be a higher-ranking card of the same color suit. Now all the cards of the previous play stack go to the previous player and kept face down.

When a player is unable to take her turn, she must pass and the stack of cards go to the previous player. If all players pass in succession the game ends.

Scoring – At the end of each round add up all the cards you’ve taken, these are worth 1 point each and then subtract 1 point each for every card left in your hand. Tally each players final scores from all three rounds, the player with the highest score is the winner.

name: Seven Years War
description: These rules have been written to give an easily playable game which reflects the style of European land warfare during the Eighteenth Century, particularly the Seven Years War. To simplify the game a standard size of unit is employed and only a few major formations are permitted. Figures are not removed but a simple record needs to be kept of the status of each unit.

name: Weight of Fire
description:
This is a set of rules for playing games representing small battles in the mid-Eighteenth Century period of European history, using 20-25mm size model soldiers. The rules cover the period from when all European nations adopted the three-man-deep platoon firing system up until the rise of the mass conscript armies of the Napoleonic era; very roughly A.D. 1740-1790, when musketry weight of fire ruled the battlefield. The rules do not try to recreate every aspect of 18th Century warfare; for example, the rules ignore most of the complexities of maneuver.

The rules are intended only to model the “classic” tactics of the period.

The rules are designed for games using 6-12 units per side. A game like this should take about four hours for a pair of opponents familiar with the rules to complete. Typical game setup involves two fairly equal forces facing one another across a game table laid out with terrain models representing hills, woods, streams, etc. Victory conditions to win the game may vary widely, but usually one player wins when a stated number of the enemy’s units have been destroyed or routed off the game table before a set number of turns have been played.

name: Voice of the Guns
description:
Voice of the Guns is a wargames system for European Land Warfare for the period from 1850, when the muzzle-loading rifle became widely adopted, to 1916, when the tank made its appearance on the European battlefield. In that time the cavalry lost its pre-eminence on the battlefield, the artillery developed the art of indirect fire thanks to the introduction of the recoil mechanism, and the machine-gun evolved into a weapon to fear.

The period runs from the Crimean War, up through the wars of Italian Unification, the Austro-Prussian and Franco Prussian Wars, the Russo-Turkish War and on to the early days of the First World War. The system may also be successfully used to re-fight the American Civil War and the Russo-Japanese War of 1904.

The system is intended for large-scale actions up to corps and army level. The basic manoeuvre units are the infantry battalion, the cav
alry squadron and the artillery battery. With the possible exception of independent machine-gun companies, further subdivision of forces is not considered.

The system may be used for any scale of figures from 5-6 mm through 10-12 mm and 15 mm up to 25-28 mm and is not dependent upon specific numbers of figures per unit.

Morale and combat systems have been streamlined to cut down calculation as far as feasible. Where possible, outcomes are automatic. While at the same time, command and control is sophisticated and designed to present players with the sort of tactical and practical problems encountered by real-life generals.

name: The Dawning of the Jet Age
description:
One of the great “what ifs” of the Second World War involves Germany surviving long enough to field a large force of operational jets. By the end of the war the Me-262 and Me-163 had been operational for awhile and there were many others either in the experimental stage or on the design board.
