Jet bombers escorted by jet fighters were certainly not out of the question if the war had gone late into 1945 or early 1946.
But the Allies weren’t exactly unprepared either. Several of their jet designs were approaching the operational stage and could have
set the scene for some fascinating jet battles over Germany.
P-80s escorting B- 29s that are intercepted by a variety of German jets is just one of the many scenarios that these rules will allow
you to simulate.

Dawning of the Jet Age allows gamers to recreate these hypothetical battles as Allied jets try to counter the German jet fighters already in operation. Like many other games in this series,
these rules are designed for a fun and fast game as the basic rules are only a few pages. Gamers should be able to grasp the concepts
and be flying in no time at all and the system can also work for large, multiplayer games.

Feel free to add additional rules, jets, or other WW2 prop driven aircraft to your scenarios. The rules are flexible enough that a little more complexity can be added without loss of playability or more time needed to finish a game.

Dawning of the Jet Age is designed for 1/600th or 1/300th miniatures, although 1/144th can be used by doubling all measurements.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition de l'apéritif Apéricube
description:
Small limited edition of Trivial Pursuit for the French brand Apericube.

Contents:

•1 board
•1 dice
•6 round pies
•36 colored triangles (to fit into the pies)
•110 cards with questions

Categories:
blue: planet Earth
pink: entertainment
yellow: once Upon a time
brown: art and literature
green: aperitif
orange: sports and recreation

The rules are similar to the classical Trivial Pursuit.
This game was never sold in shops.

Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

name: Gettysburg: Devil's Den
description:
This is Gettysburg: Devil's Den for ATS, and expansion for Gettysburg: Turning Point 1863.

The place is the infamous Devil's Den and Little Round top battlefields. The action is INTENSE. You receive a study-pack of 5 additional scenarios (that is the 'just right' amount for students of this battle—you need to spend many hours on each) + a new historical map of the battlefield with LARGE HEXES to make getting into it even more enjoyable (we're not 'married' to some 'official' hex size—we get you the largest hex per map based on overall dimensions).

name: Horse, Musket and Mini Ball
description:
Wargame rules for the 18th and 19th Centuries in 10mm.

The intention is to develop a fast fun set of rules with no paperwork, readable in under an hour and of less than a mere 30 pages. I hope my small contribution provides something you will enjoy.

Players will find that the emphasis had been placed on the American War of Independence and American Civil War. This was done to get the particular troop types of that conflict vetted in these rules. There is no reason why these rules cannot suffice for any European war of the same period.

A basic set of war game rules must provide a vehicle for troop movement, a procedure for deciding combat and a method for accounting for the results of combat (casualties and routed units). Laid over all this, the war gamer must be confounded with command and control issues and logistics problems. All this must be done without unduly complicating the rule system and maintaining game playability and realism.
categories: American Civil War, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Das Region Bonn-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the region around Bonn, an German city.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Das Aachen-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Aachen, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
Likely published early 2000
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Das Bodensee-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the Bodensee (lake Constance), part of Austria, germany and Switzerland.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bremen Eins Das Bremerhaven Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Bremerhaven, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Doo-It
description:
Variant of Mancala played on a 6x2 board with two home pits and pebbles of two different colors.

The objective of the game is to be the first player to empty his own home row.

Ending in the "home" pits is possible only by exact count and earns an extra turn.

The game includes rules for three different variants.

name: Thwart: The Edinburgh Game of Walls
description:
A mix of Backgammon and Quoridor, with very high production values.

The game is played on a square lattice, with pieces on the squares and "walls" in the ridges.
The two player sit at a 90° angle, rather than facing each other, i.e. one player moves left-to-right, while the other bottom-to-top.

The objective is to move the pieces on the other side of the board while blocking the opponent with the walls.

Both pieces and walls are moved according to the throw of a 4-sided dice.

name: Moolah Island
description:
The adventure begins when, after becoming shipwrecked on a desert island, the delegates to the World Economic Convention begin to set up the foundations for a new civilization. To support the development of the budding economy (or “contrary to common sense” - as the opponents would have it), the castaways introduce a micro-version of a Modern Economic System on the island.

The players will run their businesses, trade commodities on the exchange and take out loans, forcing the island’s bank to create new money and pump it into Moolah island’s economic bloodstream.
Will it lead to an economic boom and general prosperity or to a spectacular fall of the island’s civilisation?

The castaways will work as farmers or artisans producing four basic commodities:

fields
crops
tools
luxury goods


The commodities will serve to satisfy their own needs, to increase their production capacity or to trade on the island’s exchange. To make trading possible, the castaways have created their own currency, which they have also named Moolah, after the name of the island, and set up a bank whose task is to keep moolah in the island’s economic circulation by giving loans.

The object of the game is winning the Celebrity Cup for three years in a row. The cup goes to the player who has accumulated the greatest number of luxury goods.

name: Bremen Eins Das Bremen Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Bremen, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Das Norderstedt Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of Norderstedt in Germany.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Das Trier-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting the city of Trier, one of the oldest German cities.

The players move around a board, which consists of 40 squares. On most of the squares are parts of companies, which can be bought. The companies have values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are combined by a color. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he must draw a card and the wins and losses of the business year are settled. According to the outcome the players gain money or have to pay money for their companies.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Calliro
description:
Calliro is a two-player abstract strategy game with tile-placement and pattern-building.

Players should look for the best pattern in their situations by selecting a best color chip. They try to gain the most scores point by building two-score patterns and one-score patterns.

Gameplay: Before play the game each player chooses one of three colors, and the third color is a common color. On your turn you simply place a chip on the game board or flip a chip placed on the game board. After the pattern created, one of the chips in the pattern must be replaced with the Sign Chip and gain score point. The game end when all score points are over or the player chips are all placed on the game board.

name: Tactics: The Famous War Game
description:
"Tactics is a game of skill played with 50 flags on a map of Europe ruled into squares something like a chessboard, with series of lines representing railways which link together certain fortified towns and villages. Play is based on the idea that whenever two opposing forces come to grips, the stronger force captures the weaker."

From the rules booklet.

name: Solo Football Bones
description:
Building on the popularity of Football Bones we have introduced a smaller footprint version.

The game engine remains the same, founded on the Statis Pro Football engine, we have streamlined the game.

We replaced player cards with team sheets and made other changes to the play resolution process that makes a play completed in under a minute and on a tiny TV tray size space.

name: Fahrt ins Blaue
description:
The players start their journey by train at space 1 and travel to space 70 at one of 6 destinations: a small town, the mountains, a forrest, a beach at the sea, a german river and the "Lüneburger Heide".
The destination for each player is chosen randomly at spaces 41 to 46, but can change on some spaces later in the game.
The first player to reach space 70 at any destination winns the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rund um die Welt
description:
The game starts (space 1) and ends (space 149) in Greenland. The first player to return there from his journey around the world, winns the game.
Movement is determined by two dice. On odd doublets the player advances to the next city, on even doublets he has to go back to the last city he passed or visited. When a player gets to a city, he has to tell it's name. If he can do that, he may roll again, if not he has to pass a turn. On the blue spaces (sea) only even eyes count.
From space 129 onward, only one die is used. If a player gets on a space which is occupied by another player, the other player has to go back to the last city.

name: O Jogo dos Doces Desportivos: Lazy Town
description:
Players must transform the seeds on their garden into "sport sweets" (vegetables and fruits), skipping evil Robi, who'll try to throw them on the trash can. Players will do this making the sports movements of Sportacus and the dance ones of Stephanie.

Seeds turn into fruits or vegetable when you make the movements according to the tiles you've drawn. You lose them if you don't make the right movements.

You win when you got four fruits / vegetables on your board.

Different game dinamics according to players age.

name: Astronaut
description:
A game for a solo or multiple players to use actual physics to land the Lunar Exploration Module (LEM) on the Sun, planet, or Earth's moon. Note: Pluto is not not one of planets to land on, so maybe back in 1980, Dr. Cleaver recognized then that it wasn't really a planet!

It is a double-sided 8 1/2 x 11 piece of paper, folded in a manilla envelope) and players have to provide a set of 10 coins, for each player, with each player having a different denomination. The charts on the back include altitude, velocity, and fuel expenditure.

Each turn, a player a)burns fuel, b) calculates velocity, and c) calculate altitude. When the velocity and altitude are both zero, the astronaut landed. If velocity takes the craft to an altitude less than zero, the player crashes.

A solo player determines success by comparing fuel expenditure value to three category ranges: good, fair, or rotten. In multi-player, use the least amount of fuel to land without crashing.

name: Standard Action: The Card Game
description: In Standard Action: the Card Game, players build a 4-member adventuring party and set out to earn a reputation as the greatest adventurers in the world. Each round, players gather party members and important items in Town, and then head out Adventuring to earn Reputation Points. The first player to 10 points is the winner.

name: Who's Your Heavenly Father?
description:
Players aim to deduce who the One True God is, and to become virtuous in His eyes, before Judgment Day.

Each of the 10 possible gods prefers a different combination of the four virtues: Benevolence, Justice, Selfishness, and Xenophobia. Players accumulate virtue tokens by responding to cards with moral dilemmas, hypothetical situations in which they must choose between exhibiting one virtue or another. They may also use Prophet and Skeptic cards to look at the false gods, deducing the identity of the One True God by process of elimination.

Eventually someone will call for Judgment Day, when the One True God is revealed and players receive positive or negative points depending on which virtues that god liked or did not like.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Print & Play, Religious

name: Kölle Das Spielchen
description:
Objective: be the first gaining most winning points after getting rid of all your cards; find correct answers for appropriate questions; learn more about Cologne
- acting by turns -
draw cards (according to number of participants) from a shuffled pile {230 'sag-mal' cards (trivia),90 'mach-mal' cards (action/creativity) and 30 'moment-mal' cards (tactical decisions/gambling)};
active player chooses one of his/her cards, reads the question (mostly a poser, sometimes a stumper) about Cologne trying to find/get the right answer... clockwise. Wrong reply => Must draw an additional card. Correct? Put this card upon your bonus pile (=5 bonus points). No one knows => question master must discard this card upon his/her malus pile.
Game ends after anybody got rid of his/her cards
note:
can also be used as an expansion for Kölle das Stadt-Spiel
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Trivia

name: Die große Reise
description:
simple 'roll&Move' game;
be the first reaching space '100'; ending on a an illustrated space follow instructions glued into the lid

name: Bocce Piatta
description:
Did your Mother tell you not to play ball in the house?
Well, now you can.
With Bocce Piatta you can play a game of Bocce just about anywhere.
Bocce Piatta is a table top version of the classic ball sport Bocce.

The starting player tosses the Pallino disc onto a flat surface and players take turns tossing their Bocce Ball cards in an attempt to get closest to the Pallino. Points are scored just like the real game of Bocce.

Bocce Piatta comes with 12 cards in 3 pairs of warm colors and 3 pairs of cool colors, so it can be played by 2 players or up to 6 players in teams.

Bocce Piatta can be played on just about any flat surface. On the table, the floor, the lawn or even at the beach.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Horse Around
description: A roll and move horse racing/betting game. Each player has anywhere from 1 to 4 horses that race around the board. The board is broken down into 4 "races". Fees are paid to enter each race and bets can be placed on whether the horse wins, shows, or places (determined by die roll/odds). Spaces on the board give player money, cause them to draw cards, cause them to gain additional horses, win/lose bets, etc.

name: Master-Quiz
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching the target space
- acting by turns -
The game master rolls the die, draws an appropriate (=matching colour) question asking the player to the left; and if he/she knows the answer the meeple is move forward. There are six different colours matching with six different themes; additionally special cards (1-2-3; yes/no) involve other players, too.

The game can be run with earlier card games out from the Quick-Quiz series, too.

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Dortmund
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Dortmund each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
note:
game approach is more or less identical with the City Pro Game family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Superreich
description:
Objective: become the wealthiest player at the same time anyone is going bankrupt
- moving/acting by turns -

Active player moves forward according spinner result (inner circle); ending on a 'country'-space spinner may be turned again, but outer circle determines, if purchase is:
accepted/not accepted & money lost/for free;
You may add a house or - if you already own this property - proceed it.
Other spaces may force you to win/loose money or to gamble.
Ending on another player's property you must pay according status.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bejinx
description: Bejinx cards are a game system that can be paired with any tabletop game. Pull a Bejinx card at the beginning of each turn, and follow its instructions. Some of the fun twists let you get extra turns in the paired game, see another player's hidden items, take another player's game items, or step into another player's shoes. A multigame booster also lets you play multiple interacting games at the same time.

name: The Vine Game
description:
In The Vine Game you earn your fortune in the world of wine. You can make money producing wine in your own vineyard or operating a winery. You can also earn money trading in grapes, exporting grapes or by having the best combination of all those strategies.

At various times money, grapes or equipment can be in short supply so alliances and savvy trading between players will give you an advantage. At some point you might need to trash yor alliances to break out on your own and go for gold.

The Vine Game uses money as the means of exchange and has a nice retro feel which will give it a broader cross generational appeal. So your dad will love it too!

name: Home Run SportACTION Baseball Card Game
description:
"It's a race to be the first to assemble your winning baseball team. Collect your Infield, Outfield, Pitcher, Catcher, Batter and score a Home Run. Scout for Recruits and Free Agents. Try not to strike out or hit a fly ball as you compete to pull together your team. Home Run Baseball SportACTION Card Game is the next best thing to being at the ballpark." -- From the Manufacturer.

Using a card drawing mechanic, players attempt to complete their "team,"by assembling one player card for each position (of the same color) and a Home Run card. Different cards represent the different positions -- Infield, Outfield, Pitcher, Batter and Catcher, as well as special cards which cause different game effects, and wild cards which can replace other player cards on your "team."

name: We Still Remain
description:
With a modular map, expandable decks, and the ability to modify key features of the game to make it more or less difficult, We Still Remain caters and expands to meet the needs of all players, from those who are new to the game, to hardened wasteland veterans looking for an extra challenge.

The game features five core game modes that range from a 30-minute, action-packed capture the objective, to an atmospheric 100-plus-minute resource management scenario that highlights the game's role-playing factors, We Still Remain will fit into any part of your game night lineup.

Set in a post-apocalyptic world that has been overrun with the undead, We Still Remain is the story of survivors fighting to survive in a deserted landscape, scavenging loot and harvesting resources that they need to survive, while trying to avoid... the inevitable.

Players can loot, craft, and fortify, or find a weapon and take the fight to the undead. They can work cooperatively or against each other in scenarios that will test their luck, on an ever-changing map that spans three feet. The game is written as a series of diary entries, but the story is yours.

name: Shogyoumujou
description:
A doujinshi (self-published) simulation of the Battle of Dannoura in 1185 (the sea battle that brought the Genpei War in Japan to a close), Shogyoumujou (諸行無常) is a Buddhist concept translated as “the impermanence of all things”. This is the main theme of the “Heike Monogatari”, a gunkimono (war tale) that gives a highly romanticized account of the war and the times that surrounded it. The book details the rise and fall of the Taira warrior house, the losing side at Dannoura. It drives home the point that “all that flourishes must fall” and that in a world of impermanence even the mighty are eventually reduced to “dust before the wind”. It’s a very fitting title, as the battle effectively ended the Taira's reign as a political and military powerhouse.

It has several sub-titles that change according to the game component-the full name is Shogyoumujou: Genpei Arasoi- Setouchi No Koubou-Genpei Saigo No Kassen-Dannoura No Tatakai (諸行無常: 源平の争い-瀬戸内の攻防-源平最後の合戦-壇ノ浦の戦い). This mouthful of a name translates as “Impermanence Of All Things: Genpei Strife-Offense And Defense Of The Seto Inland Sea-End of the Genpei War-Battle of Dannoura.

The game features the naval forces of the Taira and Minamoto warrior houses and their assorted allies. In a strange design decision, the historical situation is somewhat reversed-the Minamoto are severely outnumbered but have stronger units than their Taira foes (the Minamoto substantially outnumbered the Taira but the crews of the Taira ships were far more experienced at sea warfare as the clan first came to power by demonstrating their prowess at fighting pirates). Perhaps this was done to reflect the Minamoto’s lack of seaborne experience (the reduced numbers) but to show their large advantage in tactics (the increased strength)-their commander, Minamoto no Yoshitsune, purportedly ordered his archers to fire upon the rowers of the boats rather than the enemy soldiers (a violation of the unwritten rules of warfare of the day, something that Yoshitsune was notorious for throughout his career). While the game is relatively simple, it has lots of chrome rules that add historical flavor such as the effects of the changing tide on movement and combat, possession of the Imperial Regalia and the Child Emperor Antoku (both initially held by the Taira), defections, the role of leaders, and giving the Taira a couple of unique ship types. Historically, the Minamoto literally used the ‘turning of the tide’ to rout the Taira and were aided by key defections during the battle as well as Yoshitsune’s less than ‘honorable’ tactics. The Taira leader, Munemori, was fished out of the ocean (where he had been thrown by an ally disgusted at his reluctance to commit suicide to avoid capture and dishonor) and eventually executed. However, the Taira denied the Minamoto a complete victory when the matriarch of the clan and her attendants jumped into the ocean with the child Emperor and the Imperial Regalia. While the Minamoto managed to recover two of the three artifacts, the child Emperor died and the sword Kusanagi was lost forever. This was a major disappointment to the Minamoto’s alleged supporter, Retired Emperor Go-Shirakawa. The game’s victory conditions reflect all this, factoring both the Emperor/Regalia and enemy losses into the mix. It’s a fast (10 turns, a couple of hours) and fun play with a manageable amount of units and good balance.

name: HYM, The return of the heroes
description:
Heroes and Mercenaries the return of the heroes is a fantasy-themed eurogame for 1-4 players getting all the feelings that fans of RPGs love with almost no random factor.

Each player gets into the skin of a farmer who must become a hero to the force, evil lurks around every corner, closer to their homes and farms.

Fight bravely, and may keep the skin and perhaps win gold and fame. But remember, not everything is black or white, and no one will look bad if you hire mercenaries to help in the dirtiest and / or difficult tasks.

name: Ruinous
description:
Explore temples and swipe artifacts with your friends! You won't get very far alone, but who knows if your friends can be trusted?

In Ruinous, each player is an adventurer attempting to collect valuable items within dangerous ruins. They must brave these deadly ruins while balancing teamwork and trickery on the way to finding ancient Artifacts - powerful and expensive items that imbue their holders with unique abilities. But be careful: no item or player is safe from treachery! The first player to collect and sell at least $1000 worth of treasure and artifacts wins!

When it's your turn to explore a ruin you may first assemble an adventure party made up of other players in the game. The more people you recruit, the easier it is to overcome traps and obstacles. But keep in mind, they're still your enemies! Offer them a cut of the treasure to encourage cooperation, but remember: in the depths of the world's darkest ruins there are no contracts, there are no witnesses and sometimes only one survivor... So always prepare for an opportunistic backstabbing.

Should you enlist the help of your rivals or attempt to go it alone? Are your fellow adventurers trustworthy? Are you?

name: Forest Sprite
description:
Forest Sprite is a cooperative game for 1-3 players in which players control a team of sprites and forest creatures on a mission to defend their home from an invading force of evil sorcerers and the monsters and misfortune they bring into your forest.

Forest Sprite can be played as a standalone board game (challenge mode) in which player(s) can choose pre-generated character(s) and play any 1 of the Chapters. HOWEVER
Sprite is best enjoyed by playing in campaign mode. In campaign mode, a player creates his or her own character and uses that character to attempt to beat each Chapter in order. Chapters get progressively more challenging, but as your character gains experience, it may attain new levels. When your character attains a new level, experience points can be spent to add new spells and abilities and upgrade stats. Characters will also pick up items as they progress through Chapters and defeat monsters.

Gameplay is pretty simple. The turn begins with the drawing of a mission and moving of any monsters that are on the board. The player may then take 3 actions using his or her character and/or forest animals in order to complete one of the open missions. When players fail missions, monsters get released. If 6 missions are failed, player loses. If the players draw all of the missions and fail less than 6 of them, they win (and gain experience points in campaign mode).

Forest Sprite is a game full of tense decisions. (starting with creating a good character!) There are no dice (the only luck is in the order in which missions are drawn). This is a game of planning, skillful gameplay, and coordination of resources.

2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest Awards;

Best Game
3rd Place

Best Art
2nd Place

Best Thematic Game
2nd Place

Best Large Game
2nd Place

Most Innovative Mechanic
2nd Place (tied)
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Run Dwarf Run!
description:
Players take role of Dwarfs running away from dragon's lair, after stealing it's treasures.

The goal of the game is to give as much of the gold you carry to other players, so they will run slower. In the end, only one dwarf can escape the lair, others will be devoured or burned by the raging dragon.

The game uses a simple take that card mechanic, with cards that makes other player take some of your gold, give some of the gold of all players to one dwarf, or make the dwarf take some gold from the common pile.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Fürth
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Fürth
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Detmold. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Wer kennt Kaiserslautern?
description:
"Who knows Kaiserslautern - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Kaiserslautern.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Mensch haste Worte?
description: The players have to try to form words on the game board. For this they can freely choose from the 344 letters in the game. Each turn, each player may add only 1 letter. If a player completes a word, he gets Points awarded, dependent on the lenght of the Word.

name: Corporal John
description:
Wargames Rules for the Wars of the Late 17th & Early 18th Centuries

The period 1650 to 1712 saw dramatic changes in the conduct of European warfare with the final demise of the pike and the introduction of first the plug-bayonet and then its far handier
successor the socket-bayonet. The heavy cavalry shed most of its armour and began to rely more and more on shock action. The infantry changed over from firing volleys by ranks and adopted the far more flexible platoon firing. Light cavalry began to make its appearance on the battlefield.

Command and control was no less rudimentary. Marlborough’s running footmen, on hand to carry his orders to all parts of the field, were the wonder of the day. A general staff, trained to act as a team, was still years in the future.
And as for the name, Corporal John was the affectionate nickname given to John, first Duke of Marlborough by his troops.
These rules are designed to replicate the warfare of Marlborough and Eugene, of Charles XII and Peter the Great, and of the great Condé and Turrenne. They might easily be used for the conflicts of Cromwell and Prince Rupert or even the wars of Maurice de Saxe. Whichever you choose.
All models fielded under these rules are organised on “element” bases. They can be of any size provided that both sides field their forces on the same size bases. There is no figure-scale as such – the gamer is free to use as many or as few figures as he wishes and the base will accommodate – and no removal of casualties.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dreadnoughts
description:
Naval Warfare in the Age of the Dreadnought.

These rules are designed for naval wargames in the era from the introduction of the turreted battleship until air power took over from surface action as the dominate factor in naval war - this includes the Russo-Japanese War of 1905, WWI and the early part of WWII.

These rules are primarily designed for games where each player commands a squadron of about 4 capital ships & maybe a squadron of light cruisers & a flotilla or two of DD’s. Such games with 1 or 2 players a side can be played comfortably in an evening.

Smaller actions with a ship per player (like the Hood v. Bismark) are good for a quick fun game or as training for beginners.

It is designed for multiplayer games with each player commanding either a single ship or a squadron of a few ships. The principles of the game are:
1. The game is played on a hex grid. The scale of the ship models doesn’t matter as long as they fit in a hex.
2. Each ship has a ship’s log to record proposed manoeuvres and damage. These are magnetic boards with paper overlays with details recorded by positioning magnetic counters.
3. The players secretly record their proposed movement each turn.
4. All the ships are then moved simultaneously in accordance with those proposals.
5. Firing of main guns, secondary armament & torpedoes is then resolved ship by ship.

name: If You Tolerate This
description:
Rules for fighting Divisional level battles from the Spanish Civil War, using 15 mm figures.

The game is played on a grid of offset squares or hexagons. These represent an area 500 yards across. For 15mm figures on 30mm bases use xx squares.

Each area will normally hold a battalion sized unit, plus a support arm, such as an armour section or an artillery battery. A square can, however, contain two battalions if wanted. Squares may hold a maximum, of one artillery battery or tank squadron (unless parked up in reserve)

Note that all the units in a square are subject to the effect of the total hits on the square when casualties are determined.
categories: Book, Civil War, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Execute, execute, execute!
description:
An FBI Hostage Rescue Unit game

The point of this game is to rescue hostages and kill terrorists with automatic weapons. One side is the Terrorists, and the other side is the FBI’s Hostage Rescue unit. Each person can control up to 3 people in a fire team, and they use the same map to control them in the Action phase. The map can be anything from a blueprint to an actual model. The objective of the Terrorists is to get their demands met, or kill the FBI Hostage Rescue guys, forcing the FBI to back down. The point for the FBI is to free the hostages. The hostages follow the team.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: INTSA
description:
International Terrorist Suppression Agency

In this game, you take control of either a force of INTSA Operatives, deployed covertly to infiltrate and destroy from within; a force of armed police and SAS to overtly break sieges with military force; a band of Russian Mafiya Gangsters, who supply the Lincolnists with weapons; or a group of Lincolnist rebels intent of a terror mission only they know of.

The characters
Each character has a number of values that show how good he is. They are:
• Movement (M) – used to make tests to jump obstacles, climb walls, etc.
• Accuracy factor (Ac) – used to determine the effectiveness of your shooting
• Armour factor (Ar) – used to reduce the effectiveness of enemy shooting
• Negotiation factor (N) – used to negotiate the surrender of enemy troops
• Technical factor (T) – used in tests to defuse bombs, hack computers, etc.
• Language factor (L) – used to understand foreign languages
They also have a variety of equipment depending on what type of character he is (more on this in the force selection lists – see the section entitled Force Selection).

Moving
Each character can normally move six inches if models are 20mm to 30mm in size, six centimetres if models are 15mm in size, or 12” if over 30mm in size (not recommended). For measurements, these rules will refer to ‘units’. One unit equates to 1cm in 15mm scale, 1” in 20-30mm scale, and 2” in +30mm scale.

name: Hansel und Gretel ein unterhaltendes Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
A simple roll and move course with events from the Grimm fairy tale.
- be the first reaching space 24/moving by turns -
use the die & move forward: depending on the result/space you land on throw is going to be modified
note:
published ~1900

name: Sword Song Of Edge
description:
Sword Song of Edge is a 2D Dungeon Crawler for 1 to 5 players, with the goal of saving a world plunged in the darkness by recovering the heart of the dungeons, an object of unknown usefulness divided in nine chunks and concealed in the depths of every scene.

The game is composed of nine acts. Each of them can be played idependently, so a single act forms an entertaining adventure. But, each act has been prepared and designed to connect with the other acts. Every new act expands the arsenal which our heroes have and presents the players with more difficulties during their adventure.

Game System

The scenes are represented in 2D. Players move on tiles of 10 x 7 squares, with a simple system to advance or to attack. The tiles are placed in a random manner, forming a dungeon filled with interesting locations and enemies to fight. As the players advances, new tiles are revealed, with new enemies and connections to other tiles or the exit.

When an enemy is revealed, the players will reach for their weapons in order to defeat it and continue their advance.

The goal is simple. To reach the dungeons, overcome the challenges there, find the heart of the dungeon and then reach the exit to finish the adventure.

name: Dragon Raiders
description:
Dragon Raiders is a game where players take on the role of the Dragon, raiding the fantasy kingdom for food (to grow bigger and stronger) and treasures (to gain an advantage over the other Dragons).

Game-play consists of a series of Raid phases, broken up into turns by an Accounting phase (where certain play elements get reset). Each Raid phase consists of three sub-phases; movement, reactive board elements, and combat, in that order. Players accomplish each sub-phase in an order determined by their power ranking. Players choose where to move based on what they think they can successfully raid, or may choose to go on adventures in the deepest forest. After the Dragons move, Knights will come out of their keeps to fight any Dragon nearby (i.e., adjacent to the keep).

Combat consists of rolling 1d6 and adding your Power attribute; you must beat the Defense score of the board element in order to win. A Dragon who does not win his combat must retreat, losing half of his carried treasure as he does so. Dragons must fight other Dragons in the same space first; both roll 1d6 and add their Power, highest total wins. The loser gives half of his treasure to the winner and retreats. Ties result in both dragons retreating without losing any treasure.

The end-game is triggered when a Dragon defeats the King, who sits in his castle at the center of the kingdom. The current Raid phase is finished out, and victory points are totaled. The highest total is considered the strongest Dragon and wins the game!

name: Counterattack
description:
Welcome to Combat soldier. You must lead your troops to victory in midst of defeat.

The tactical desicions you make can send the enemy fleeing the battlefield or witness your own men dying. This game combines detailed skirmish combat designed for fast play but with enough realism and grit to make it realistic and accurate to real combat.

Scale of Game- The turn are supposed to act as if they were fought simultaneously. This is 30 seconds in the game world for a Skirmish
game, Each inch is equal to about 1 foot in the game for skirmish actions.

Organization: This game is meant to be played at a skirmish level. But we have included rules for other styles of gaming which is perfectly fine, but should stay towards platoon-company battles due to the skirmish nature of these rules.

This game can be played with any miniatures you like! They do not have to be from any specific company or manufacturer.

name: The War at Sea 1939-45
description:
Wargaming rules for WW2 naval battles.

This set of rules has been developed to give a reasonably historical result for a large fleet action in about three hours of playing time

Scales and time
Each game turn is calculated to be about 15 minutes and 1000 yards equals one inch on the game table. This game scale works best with 1:3000 scale models. For larger scales such as 1:2400 or 1:1200, double all measurements. For 1:6000 halve all measurements.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: American War of Independence Rules
description:
These rules have been written to give an easily playable game which reflects the style of battles fought during the American War of Independence, and the French and Indian Wars. To simplify the game a standard size of unit is employed and only a few major formations are permitted. Figures are not removed but a simple record needs to be kept of the status of each unit.

These rules assume that 25mm figures will be used, but they can be used for 15mm by using 2/3 the distances specified. The scales are flexible and can be adjusted to reflect the size of battle being fought provided the ratios are maintained.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Linnapeli
description:
In Linnapeli, each player first draws a tile telling which castle(s) out of six possibilities is/are to be built. With 4–6 players each player builds one castle, with 3 players 2, and with 2 players 3 castles. Players then pick tiles and place them on 4*4 grid, trying to avoid errors in placing the tiles or taking tiles that do not belong to their castle(s). The first player to complete his/her castle(s) is the winner.

There are three variations to the gameplay:
1) The easy variation is to keep the common heap of tiles face-up, and the game box with pictures of the castles visible to the players.
2) The hard variation is to keep the common heap of tiles face-up but show the pictures of the castles only shortly in the beginning of the game.
3) The hardest variation is to keep the common heap of tiles face-down.

The castles to be built are Kastelholma, Turun linna, Viipurin linna, Kuusiston linna, Olavinlinna and Kajaanin linna.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Electro Sound Memo
description: The memo game with sounds for children from 4 years. Players put a card in the board so that it can be 'read' by the computer chip. The machine than makes the appropriate sound e.g. use the cow card and the machine will "Moo".Then the child has to remember which button represents that sound. Collect a pre-set number of cards to win.

name: Wastelands: Tribes of the Apocalypse
description:
Wastelands: Tribes of the Apocalypse is set an unknown time after a thermonuclear and chemical war wiped out 90% of Earth’s population. Groups of nomadic wanderers, who somehow managed to survive, banded together to form tribes. Resources have become incredibly scarce, decontaminated resources even more so, and survival has become nigh-on-impossible.
There is, however, one last hope for survival.

NEW EDEN.

A bastion of hope, this fortified stronghold is the last refuge from the apocalyptic wastelands where, if radiation doesn't kill you, another tribe probably will. NEW EDEN is allowing sanctuary to one tribe, but to prove which tribe is the most worthy, an offering must be presented.

Offer what you can to NEW EDEN, and if your offering is the greatest, your tribe will be awarded refuge.

If not? Well, those cockroaches are looking delicious...

In Wastelands: Tribes of the Apocalypse each player is the leader of a Tribe occupying the harsh Wastelands. The aim of the game is to gather resources which you can trade for various offerings on the Black Market. The player who has gathered the greatest offering to present to NEW EDEN gains entry into the city and wins the game.

The other players are doomed to an eternity roaming the desecrated remains of what was once Earth.

name: Ozymandias
description:
Ozymandias is a dice game of pyramidal deconstruction for two players using a Das Spiel set. Ozymandias has much in common with Rummy-style games, but attempts to minimize luck by using a dice pyramid as a source of matching.

The game consists of alternating turns consisting of two *takes*, except for the starting player who performs only a single take. A *take* is the act of removing some number of dice from the edges of the pyramid and scoring them according to their original orientation in the structure.

A player may take a group of dice from the pyramid according to certain scoring sets: runs, 3 of a kind, 4 of a kind, additive (numbers add to a sum), multiplicative (numbers multiply to a product), and others. There are also takes that incur penalties, but that might be useful for setting up larger scoring sets.

The players will continue to take dice from the pyramid until either they both take negative scores on successive turns or all of the dice are removed from the pyramid. The player with the highest score at the end is the winner.

name: Fusilier: A Wargames System for the Flintlock Era
description:
A Wargames System for the Flintlock Era.

Fusilier is a wargames system designed for the period 1700 to 1815. Although it is recognised that flintlocks were used before and after these dates. It was mainly during this period that the flintlock musket and its associated socket-bayonet was the standard arm of the line infantry.

The system is designed to be used with any scale of figures. There is no formal figurescale, the unit sizes being dictated by the base sizes, which in turn are based on the frontages of the prototype units. An infantry battalion might be, for example, ten 25mm figures, twenty 15mm figures or fifty 5 mm figures.

The system is expressly designed for use with large formation games and is unsuitable for actions involving less than brigade strengths. Note that throughout the rules the term “formation” is used to convey the sense of brigade groupings and higher, whereas the term “unit” is used of bodies of troops making up brigades.
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: YS-Opoly
description: This spin off of the timeless game, Monopoly, is based off of the college town to Yellow Springs, Ohio. The properties that can be purchased, tokens, and other game concepts are based off of actual locations and companies from the area that sponsored the production of the game.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Yankee Candle-opoly 40th Anniversary Edition
description: This spin off of the classic board game, Monopoly, is based off of the York Candle company.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Wheels-opoly
description: This spin off of the classic board game, Monopoly, is designed to primarily entertain younger children through the use of cartoon cars and vehicles which you must collect and put up for rent.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Frømænd
description:
In this game you are a team of divers who have to have to go from the upper left corner, around the board to the upper right corner. Along the way you encounter different things:
There are eight red spots; if your diver land there you will be skipped - if another player is on the red field you land on, he is sent back to Start.
On one of the 10 white spots different things occour, it could be that you have to move x spots back/foward.

Each player have three divers. The first to get his three divers to the upper right corner is the winner.

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Köln
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Cologne each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
remarks:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: 8-bit Action Hero: Jungle Adventures
description:
Inspired by a certain sabre wielding hero from 8 bit computer games of the 1980's, 8-bit Jungle Hero is an adventure game played on a map that changes throughout play.

The object of the game is to navigate the labyrinthine jungle paths of the lost valley, surviving the encounters within. Adventurers must locate the lost pieces of an amulet and then make it to the magic portal that will allow them to escape. At the same time travelers must avoid the predations of “The Beast” a terrible creature who patrols the valley.

Each turn players explore their surroundings, react to encounters, change the map of the valley and move "The Beast"

The map is a grid of tiles with four fixed points - mountains, within it. As part of their turn players get the opportunity to rotate or move one or more of the tiles of the map, changing the paths through the jungle. Players also have a short trail of tiles immediately behind them that they have already visited. This moves with them and can change in length depending on the items they are carrying. This path cannot be changed by other players. However if "The Beast" picks up this trail it will follow it and may attack the unfortunate adventurer.

Each time they enter a new tile players draw from an encounter deck. This may produce a beneficial result but more often will reveal one of the jungle denizens poised to attach them. Surviving an encounter may result in them getting treasure, including pieces of the amulet needed to escape the valley.

Escape from the valley is via a portal that moves around the outside edge of the map each turn. To escape players must move off the edge of the map onto this portal
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Pantheon
description:
In the ancient world, civilizations struggle against their enemies using the strength of their numbers, the hardness of bronze and iron, and the powers granted to them by fickle gods. Plagues, famines, and fire are suffered or inflicted while soldiers march to war in the name of the deities they serve. Only the civilization with the strongest pantheon will prevail.

Pantheon is a card game for 2-5 players created by veteran game designer Timothy Brown (co-creator of the Dark Sun campaign setting), developed by Jamie Chambers with graphic design by Digger Hayes, featuring art by Lindsay Archer, Michael Bielaczyc, Melanie Hayes, Nick Kremenek, and Joie Brown.

In Pantheon you start with a fledgling ancient culture. Grow your population, build temples, advance your civilization, and wage war on your enemies! There are many paths to victory, but when the game ends only the strongest pantheon will triumph. It features gods from ancient Greek, Norse, Egyptian, Chinese, and Indian mythology.

name: Leben in Herford
description:
A simple game published about the German City of Herford.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Essen. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Rund um die Porta-Westfalica
description:
A simple game published about the region 'Porta Westfalica' in Germany.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Essen. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben in Oldenburg
description:
A simple game published about the German City of Oldenburg.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Oldenburg. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Prestige Dice Building Game
description:
Prestige Dice Builder Game

You're in the Army NOW! Maybe it was the draft, maybe it was your patriotism, but you've landed in the Army. Your Mission is to beat the other grunts in your squad in a race to General. Why worry about dying when you can level up in life, right? How quickly can you gain prestige and become the General?

Players roll dice to gain prestige each turn. As they use the prestige to purchase cards they have more opportunities to gain prestige and level up to General.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Hawaiianopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Hawaiian Islands.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Het Groote Wiel(en) spel
description:
Het Groote Wiel(en) spel (The Large Wheel(s) Game) is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A Monopoly clone with constructions and other elements from Rosmalen, a Dutch city.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Euro Company Game Eindhoven
description:
Euro Company Game Eindhoven is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

A Monopoly clone with constructions and other elements from Eindhoven, a Dutch city.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Galapagos!
description:
Evolutionary Tabletop Game

Galapagos is a resource management game in which players take on the roles of competing species in a rainforest. Each turn, players will harvest genetic material: the currency with which they may buy mutations to change their species or propagate to increase their presence in the ecosystem. Players must balance strategy, tactics, and guile to compete in the pursuit of several unique win conditions; ultimately to ensure the survival of their genetic footprint.

-- Developer's description

Things Change.
You are a species. That's not an insult, it's the premise of [the] game. In this game, you take on the role of a unique species in a rainforest ecosystem. Your goal is to out-compete your opponents to obtain the largest ecological footprint; and I have given you several win conditions so that you can prove it.

The core mechanic of the game is called harvesting. Each turn, you will harvest genetic material (The game's currency) which you can use to buy mutations to make your creatures better equipped to compete, or propagate to increase your presence in the forest. The amount of genes you harvest depends on your presence and position in the forest. The more you have, the more genetic capital you have to work with. Neat, huh?

Win Conditions.
If you want to win the game, you'll need to be the first to achieve any one of these win conditions:

Survival of the Fittest. This one is straightforward. If your creatures are the only ones alive in the forest, you win. Do this by clashing with opponents' creatures.

Top of the Food Chain. If, at the beginning of your turn, you control three carnivores, you win. Easy, right? Go ahead, make that third carnivore. See what your opponents do.

Ecological Niche. If, at the beginning of your turn, you control a creature in each Floor tile (Blue-green), you win. Who says barnacles can't be winners? Seriously, who says that?

Okay, I think that's it. The game is designed for 2-3 players, but if you have a fourth, you should play in teams. Oh, and one more thing:

It's time to get squishy.

-- from the game manual
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Wissen und Spass
description:
Objective: be the first gaining a victory point(=marker) each from all different topics
- acting by turns -
On a circuit all meeples are moved forward by die; ending on an uncolored space - next player's turn; airport symbol - move to space of your choice; colored space - neighbor draws appropriate card:
roll the die again - number determines question/task.
Successful - get matching marker; wrong - new start out from the centre of the board.
Different topics: true/false; 2 x multiple choice; find wanted person using 3 (out of 6) random hints; find 7 matching terms within one minute; guess matching profession
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Business on the Move
description:
Business on the Move is an educational business board game.
Players run a business moving different products from China to their domestic market by land, air and sea. The game can be won in 3 ways:-

the business that delivers orders the quickest
the business with the greatest profit
the business with the lowest carbon footprint


Players must make the same decisions businesses make every day. How do I deliver? Will I make a profit? How should I grow? How can I cut my carbon footprint?

Each turn a player must choose between taking an Air/Sea turn or a Rail/Road turn. You can only do one or the other. Playing your turn then requires 4 same steps in strict order:-

Step 1 - Deciding whether to buy new assets- planes, ships, trains & trucks
Step 2 - Paying operational costs
Step 3 - Picking up an Air/Sea or Rail/Road card
Step 4 - The last thing you do in your turn is roll the dice to make deliveries. Income is earned by completing deliveries for the amount shown on your Order cards.


These 4 easy-to-follow steps are summarised on an A6 card.
Business on the Move is extremely versatile and can be played at seven different levels, changing how to play and how to win.
Extensive trials across the UK have seen the game played by nearly 600 young people aged 9-19, teachers and business professionals.
publishers: The Very Enterprising Community Interest Company

name: Gesellschaftsspiel Stuttgart
description:
Objective: Using the detailed street map of Stuttgart each player is given five companies (each divided in 4 pieces/tiles) to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.
note:
game approach is identical with the 'cityprogame' family; game production was financed by advertisements of locally based companies

name: Das Rendsburg-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Rendsburg, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Battle for Gallion's Reach
description:
Two to four players fight for mastery of the galaxy! Explore a galaxy filled with planets and other wonders! Build specialized fleets of star ships. Organize massive invasion fleets and armies. Use powerful leaders to command your forces, make and break alliances, conduct battles between ships and rise or fall on the tides of fortune and failure. Battle for Gallion's Reach is the classic eXplore, eXpand, eXploit and eXterminate space game for your table top!

- Build fleets of star ships such as Battle Fleets, Invasion Fleets and Siege Fleets and even planet killers that can destroy entire worlds!

- Defend your worlds with powerful Planetary Defenses!

- Build Star Bases where you can build your fleets, defend your empire and gather your invasion armies!

- Research advanced technologies to give your faction the edge!

- Attempt to usurp the Imperial Throne and become the Emperor!

- Space hex cards make the game map different each time you play! From huge spiral galaxies to smaller layouts for shorter, sharper games, Gallion's Reach makes sure no two gaming experiences are the same!

- Detailed and yet simple star ship combat simulation where you, as the admiral, place your fleets into battle and fight it out with your enemies!

- Simple economic system lets players concentrate on conquest strategy and fleet battles.

- Random Events keep things interesting.

- Action Cards give players secret weapons to disarm enemies, steal ships, make and break alliances and much more!

- Simple die roll-based combat.
categories: Civilization, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Kaze Ghost Warrior Card Game
description:
User Summary

A strategic card game for two or more players, each using their own deck, who must battle to defeat their opponent. It is a stand-alone game, not collectible, but is designed to be expanded and may include expansions with custom cards. Game requires one complete deck per player and each includes 40 full color cards with different pictures.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: I Don't Need to Outrun the Zombie
description:
I Don't Need to Outrun the Zombie is a game that combines press your luck dice rolling with the need to anticipate your friend's choices. Will they try to come to your aid, leave you to fend for yourself, or outright stab you in the back? Every player must choose what will best help them survive.

Game play happens in phases. In the first phase of each round, the players (in turn order) roll their dice and attempt to get the best score possible. A given die may be rerolled any number of times until a) the player accepts the number on the die or b) the die rolls a 1. If the die rolls a one, that die is locked at one for the round.

Once each player has their starting roll for the round, the scheming begins. Each player must choose to help or hinder an opponent with five possible outcomes (3 outcomes if there are only two players left).

Outcome 1 - Player A helps Player B: Player B adds 3 points to their score for the round.
Outcome 2 - Player A hinders Player B: Player B subtracts 3 points.
Outcome 3 - Player A helps Player B and Player B helps Player A: Each player adds 6 points.
Outcome 4 - Player A hinders Player B and Player B hinders Player A: Each player subtracts 6 points.
Outcome 5 - Player A helps Player B and Player B hinders Player A: Player A subtracts 6 Points and Player B adds 6 points.

At the end of the second phase, the player with the lowest score in the round loses a die. Players gain bonus chips adding 1 point to their score for the next round for each player with a higher score in the current round. The player with the highest score goes first next round.

The game ends when only one player is left with dice. All others have been eaten by the zombie.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Dice, Horror, Humor, Miniatures, Party Game, Racing, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That, Team-Based Game
publishers: Melancholy Media, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Conquista Bíblica
description:
Conquista Bíblica is a question and answer game about the Bible. There is a total of 996 questions. The game is for 2 to 6 players, starting at the age they can read.
You roll the dice and navigate over the board. The cell where you land has 6 questions associated. You roll the dice a second time, to determine the number of the question you will have to answer. You may use the Bible to look up your answer. If you answer it correctly, within 30 seconds, you get 3 “denarios” (coins). If you need the biblical reference, and answer it correctly you only get 1 “denario”.
When you reach the total of 6 “denarios”, you may conquer a book. If the cell where you land belongs to a a biblical book, you can pay 6 “denarios” in order to try to answer correctly 3 questions. If you do so, you conquered the book and receive the corresponding card! The player that conquers the more books wins!

Original Spanish description:
Conquista Bíblica é um jogo de perguntas e respostas sobre a Bíblia. Perguntas sobre reis, profetas, sacerdotes, homens e mulheres, nações, cidades, apóstolos, alimentos, armas, habitações, batalhas, viagens, etc, irão testar os seus conhecimentos e ajudá-lo a conhecer melhor a Palavra de Deus.

name: Adventure Camp: A Sequencing Game
description:
Race through an obstacle course by reading passages and answering questions about the order of events!

Adventure Camp is an educational roll-and-move boardgame where players must answer reading comprehension questions in order to progress along the track to the finish. The theme involves a wilderness trail with various shortcuts, hazards and obstacles which can move a player forward, cause the loss of a turn, etc.

name: 147 Snooker
description:
From the insert: A highly competitive and most compelling game for all ages.

The game comprises two dice and a scoring pad, with simple rules.

The six-sided red die has pot x4, miss, or foul. The other dice contains the colours of other balls.

There is no skill in this simplistic simulation of snooker. Just roll the red die, then attempt to pot a colour, and continue until all 15 red balls and all colours are potted, or until boredom sets in.

name: Doozy
description:
Doozy is a life-sized board game that encourages players to move, interact, and create with one another--away from a screen. It's a great way to meet strangers, get to know new friends, or just be silly with old friends! You can play Doozy outdoors, at a party, or for your office icebreaker!

The gameplay is simple. You take the circular spaces and create any closed loop of your choice. You roll the die. You go to the next space of that color. You draw a card, and you do what it tells you to do! The goal is to go all the way around the closed loop.

name: 10 Die Survival Games Public Domain Promo Cards
description:
From publisher blurb:

These are 6 exclusive cards with recognizable horror icons from public domain properties; 4 from the tales of H.P. Lovecraft and 2 from the movie Manos: The Hands of Fate.

name: HONCOMP
description:
Compatible Boards/Tiles for the Game "HEROES OF NORMANDIE"

New Boards / Tiles compatible
to add new grounds to originals, and so to increase the possibilities of scenarios.

name: Sex Toy Poker
description:
Sex Toy Poker is a simple bluffing game for adults only. The game contains 80 cards: 8 copies of 10 different sex toys.

1. Anal Beads
2. Dildo
3. Strap-On
4. Nipple Clamps
5. Penis Sleeve
6. Ben Wah Balls
7. Fisting Gloves
8. Auto Suck
9. Butt Plug
10. Cock Ring

On a turn, a player will pass one sex toy card face down to another player and either tell the truth and proclaim the toy being passed or lie and claim a different sex toy.

The player being passed to may agree or challenge the player passing the card. If correct, the player passing the card loses and must place it face up. If incorrect, the player being passed to must place it face up.
A player may also choose to not guess and pass it to a player who has not yet seen the card.

If a player gets 3 of the same sex toy face up, they lose and should be referred to as "Butt Plug" or "Mr. Plug" in mixed company, until another player loses and claims the title.

A player can win the game if he or she gets 7 different sex toys face up without getting 3 of the same type.

There is either 1 winner or 1 loser in a game of Sex Toy Poker.

name: Discworld Convention: The Card Game
description:
A collectible card game based on the international Discworld Conventions.

There are three main game types playable:

1) A top-trumps style game based in various people associated with the convention.

2) A short game where players attempt to run the best single event.

3) A long game where players try and run the best events as the convention timetable progresses.

In game types 2 and 3. Players build a deck consisting of event, role and modifier cards. Players in turn play events based on timetable slots, and then play roles and modifiers to improve or disrupt the events. Once all events are played (or the last event is played) players add up their score; the player with the most points wins.

name: Interrupt
description:
Interrupt is a 2-7 player connection-style game using differently shaped 3d wooden blocks. The objective of the game is to create a continuous connection with one set of blocks that spans the length of the game board.

The game board is a modular square; prior to the game players place "terrain" upon the board using neutral blocks. Each player then must decide how to bridge and/or tunnel through pieces to reach the other side. Once per turn, a player may either place a new piece into play or move one of their existing pieces on the board, as long as it isn't trapped by an opponent's piece. Alternatively, players can use a small selection of "wildcard" pieces that provide a connection for all the players.

A game is won once the first person successfully bridges the board with no edge connections between pieces.

Multiple rule variants possible - this is a family of games about building geometric connections in 3d space.

name: Find the Treasure!
description:
In Find the Treasure!, the players take on the roles of pirates searching a secret treasure. There are nine possible places on the island but each map only shows what is hidden along a specific longitude or latitude. To dig randomly is risky as each place may contain unknown dangers. Instead, the players must challenge each other for the maps or watch where the others dig and then steal whatever they find. To win Find the Treasure!, you must find out the other players' clues while guarding your own, lure them into digging where there are no diamonds and escape from the island before they realize that you have the treasure.

The gameplay is tense and interactive as the players struggle to seek through the island with one eye and watching the other players' hunt with the other. As more and more of the island's secrets are dug up, the pirates will close in on each other, some eager to fight, others to escape, and tactics and deduction rather than brute force will be decisive. May the most ruthless pirat win!

Game mechanisms include:

1. Changing and hidden game board: The island is different in each game and the location of the treasure hidden to the players.
2. Player balance: The players have similar resources (1 pirate and 1 ship) and are always equally strong.
3. Deduction: By acquiring maps, the players can deduce where the treasure is located.
4. Hidden score: The players do not know what the others have found.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Deduction, Maze, Pirates
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Take That

name: The 10 Die Trilogy
description:
You start with 10d6, then draw a card each turn. The cards can be adversaries to battle, lasting effects or one of three items needed to win the game. When you loose a monster battle you loose dice. When you run out of dice you are dead. The trilogy is comprised of three games:

The House of George Walter Michaels
The Tomb of the Damned Pharaoh
The Abyss of the Lurid Cove

The games are best suited for solo play, but they can accommodate up to 6 players.

name: Valdojka
description:
The game takes place in Valachia in Czech republic. Player becomes chief shepherd and works with his sheep during four seasons.

Each season represents one phase of a round. During spring, players roll dice to move their sheep to grazing lands. During summer season players roll dice to see which areas produce milk (which serves as a currency) or sheep.
Come autumn, the players have to move sheep back to the shepherd otherwise they freeze to death in winter. During winter the players can also buy more sheep and buildings or sell excess sheep.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to own herd of eight sheep or become the owner of building "fojství".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Christina Regina: The Card Game
description:
Christina Regina is a card game version of Christina Regina - the Board Game.
