When a Crusader card is drawn a die is rolled for its corresponding sector and a Crusader shield is placed in that village, players can destroy the Crusader shields for points and are encouraged to because if a 7th Crusader shield is ever placed on the map then all players lose the game.

The game ends when a player places their 10th player shield on a village, or when the event deck runs out. Players then tally their points for player shields, Crusader shields, vikings and ships on the board, runes, money, attack tokens, and so forth, and whoever has the most points is the winner.
categories: Exploration, Medieval, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement

name: 3-Wide
description:
In 3-Wide you decide how far to push your drivers abilities and the endurance of your race cars as you plot the strategy for a team of race cars. Winning a race requires a combination of speed, tactics, planning and skill. You will have to play the right tactics at the right time to improve your track position. Each race car driver needs to decide if they should throttle back and save fuel, or scorch their tires making a charge to the front. Will you risk a wreck, or play it safe? Will you try a bold fuel strategy, or pit with the rest of the field? 3-Wide puts you in the driver's seat, and on the crew chief's pit box!

Each tire of each car has four levels of wear. These tire wear levels in turn determine the custom colored dice that you will roll to determine the speed of your car. As the team owner you have a hand of tactic cards which can be played on behalf of your team cars. Successfully playing tactics is dependent upon the location of other cars around your car, and the timing of when the tactic cards are resolved. Driver skills are precious resources that can be used to avoid a nasty situation on the track, or to exploit an opportunity on pit lane. Pit stops become necessary as your tires wear away, and as your fuel gauge is nearing empty. Planning a good fuel strategy can be vital.

Eighteen different race tracks are modeled in terms of configuration, braking zones, tactical card deck composition, tire wear, and fuel consumption. Each track also features two different race lengths so you can play a short game or a long one.

Winning is everything, but if you don’t come across the line first maybe you can console yourself with how well your team did overall. You can also string together a series of races and have a championship season!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Simulation

name: Viva Las Vegas
description:
"The Ultimate Game of Chance". A roll and move game for up to 6 players with elements of blackjack, roulette and mock-poker.

Each player starts with $3300. The game is played by rolling a die and moving around the linear board. Squares you land on may tell you to draw a 'Blind Bid' card, or if you land on a Casino space you will be instructed as to which of the three casino games you must play, and what the minimum bid is.

From the rule book: "The object of the game is for all players to start at the airport and travel around the Financial Gaming Minefield, along the strip to Downtown and then back again as directed by the arrows on the board. Players to involve other players when playing Blackjack and Roulette. The player who reaches the airport at the finish with the most money is the winner."
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trick-taking

name: Operation D-Day
description:
Operation D-Day is a solitaire game of Combat in Europe during World War II. The player assumes the role of a commander of an Infantry Rifle Company during an Allied Amphibious Landing Operation. As the Company Commander, you are responsible for securing your Sector of Advance by successfully taking and holding key objectives with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE
The objective of Operation D-Day is to successfully take and secure an number of key objectives and destroy enemy forces in order to gain Victory Points (VP) for the Allied Forces. Once all Objectives have been secured or the Campaign Deck is exhausted, the Campaign is considered over. The Player must then total his VP and compare this with the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

GAME FEATURES: Operation D-Day is a fun and fast solitaire game filled with lots of action and replay value. If you enjoyed movies like "Saving Private Ryan", "Band of Brothers", or D-Day, you will enjoy this game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Die Ampel
description:
The players can choose between a car, a taxi, an omnibus, a tram and a truck. The goal is to reach space 80, while observing the traffic rules. Movement is determined by a die. On colored spaces, the players have to follow the rules printed on the game board.

The game is playable by as many players as vehicles are available. The board is big enough (102 cm x 70 cm) to use H0 model cars.

The game was produced for the Berliner Verkehrs-Betriebe BVG in the 1930s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reserva Ambiental
description:
In Reserva Ambiental, players must explore the diverse ecosystems this reserve for 15 rounds. Each player will control one animal species that can be trapped or predator, depending on the round and space where the Board. Researcher who also have their walk by the various ecosystems. The location of this researcher is very important in the game as it can solve problems in the ecosystem where it is, build the Research, Environmental Education Projects, Government Actions and perform mainly perform Ecosystem Research. All actions give the player points, and conduct research is what gives more points. All actions and movements of species and Researcher run through the Cards the player has in his Deck. Knowing when and where to use the Cards as best as possible is very important, as they give many options of what to do. At the end of the game, the player who get the most points is the winner.

Em Reserva Ambiental, os Jogadores terão que explorar os diversos Ecossistemas existentes nesta Reserva durante 15 rodadas. Cada jogador vai controlar 1 espécie animal, que poderá ser presa ou predador, dependendo da rodada e do espaço onde se encontra no Tabuleiro. Também terá seu Pesquisador que caminhará pelos diversos Ecossistemas existentes. A localização deste Pesquisador é muito importante no jogo, pois ele poderá resolver os problemas no Ecossistema onde se encontra, construir Centros de Pesquisa, Projetos de Educação Ambiental, realizar Ações do Governo e principalmente realizar Pesquisa no Ecossistema. Todas as ações dão Pontos ao jogador, sendo que realizar Pesquisa é o que mais dá pontos. Todas as ações e movimentos das espécies e Pesquisador são executadas através das Cartas que o jogador possui em seu Deck. Saber quando e onde usar as Cartas da melhor forma possível é muito importante, já que elas dão muitas opções do que fazer. No final do jogo, aquele jogador que mais pontos conseguir, será o vencedor.

name: Latsyrc
description:
In a silent night, a huge magic circle appears at the central plaza of Latsyrc village. The magic circle generates dark smog to the sky and forms a Magical Planet over it. The elves in the village need to find the Spirit Mediums, who can control the Crystal Spirits to access to the planet, draw the darkness magical power, and refine a new form of magical power like serum to encounter it.

In the game of Latsyrc, you are 1 of the 4 Spirit Mediums enlisted. You need to assign your Crystal Spirits on the 3D Magical Planet which placed over the Game Board, those Crystal Spirits can help you to gain different resources and also the magical power. Arrange the forms and positions of them in the best way, and compete with the others to gain enough and most magical power to settle the incident

Remember that only 1 of the Spirit Medium can be rewarded by the elves, show the elves that you are the best Spirit Medium to settle the incident and gain the treasure offered by them!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Meteor: Telemetry Rocket
description:
Bonus card for Meteor. Players could get the card by reviewing the game online.

Card text: Reveal two additional meteors when you launch this rocket.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Dream Collectors
description:
You are a Dream Collector, a broker for one of the Dream Lords, powerful beings that feast on the energy of our unconscious imagination. Your Dream Lord has tasked you to collect its favorite Dream Energies with the promise of anything you desire as a reward.

But be careful: there are other Dream Collectors hunting Dream Energies for their own Dream Lords and no Dream Lord likes to be outdone!

How to play:

Each player takes a Dream Lord that they will represent at the start of play. That Dream Lord has a favored Dream Energy and two complimentary Dream Energies listed on its card.

Once you and the opposing player have selected your Dream Lords, you each take turns placing the remaining cards orthogonally to build the Dreamscape. The objective is to build Dreampaths along the Dreamscape, your Dream Lord's favored Dream Energies that connect in a continuous unbroken path up, down, left, or right (but not diagonal).

Once the Dreamscape has been completely assembled, players score their Dreampaths. The more preferred Dream Energies in the path, the higher points value it is worth.
mechanics: Line Drawing, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Monsters of London: Familiars and Masters Expansion
description:
Familiars and Masters is the first (mini-)expansion for the dice-cardgame Monsters of London. It expands the game by 8 cards, introducing new powerful PERMANENT abilities.

The four Masters, who created the monsters released into the streets of Victorian London, join the battle: Worth four Pounds when captured their permanent abilities may soon become quite a nuisance.
It's quite the other way around with the Familiars: Their helpful abilities support the player but cost one precious Pound Sterling at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: The Game of Get to the Finish Line
description:
Cowbo, Astwonot, and pals are stranded on one side of a piece of paper with the burning urge to reach the other side. Can they make it without being shot?!

The Game of Get to the Finish Line is a game of stealth, deduction, and trickery for 2-6 players. Your goal is to cross the game board without being caught by other players.

Each game starts with every player secretly choosing a character. Remaining player slots are filled with Non-Player characters until 6 player slots are full.

Per turn, a player may move any character(s) up to 3 times. For example, a player may move a single character 3 spaces or 3 characters one space. After movement, a player may use their special "once per game elimination" ability to wipe out any suspicious challengers.

The game can end in two ways:

A character (even non-player) crosses the finish line.
All player characters have been eliminated.
mechanics: Memory, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Apples & Oranges
description:
OVERVIEW
Apples & Oranges (A&O) cards is a game designed by Ray Lauzzana.

Apples & Oranges contains a deck of 36 playing cards with various numbers of apples and oranges on each card, plus three instruction cards.

In addition, there ore two indicator cards - one for the orange team and another for the apple team.

This game may be played by two to four players. When playing with four players, they play in two teams - the orange team vs. the apple team.

When playing with two players, one payer plays the apple side, the other plays the orange side.

OBJECT OF THE GAME
The goal is to build a group of fruit that is larger than your opponents,

For example, if at the end of the game, the orange team has a cluster of 26 oranges, and the apples are dispersed into smaller groups, then orange gets 26 points, and wins. If both players’ largest groups are the same size, they are tied.

name: Trench War: A Solitaire Game of Tactical Combat in the Trenches of the First World War.
description:
INTRODUCTION: Trench War is a solitaire game of Combat in the muddy trenches in France or Belgium during World War I. The player assumes the role of a commander of an Infantry Platoon during its grueling and miserable turn in the Trenches before they are relieved. As the Platoon Leader, you are responsible for securing your Sector of Front by successfully taking enemy positions and defending yours with the least amount of casualties. Although there are many support units available to you, they may often times be limited to you by political, logistical or geographical obstacles.

GAME OBJECTIVE: The objective of Trench War is to successfully survive a Tour in the trenches along the Western Front during World War I. A Tour consists of a number of Rotations in the Trenches. The Player can play a Short Tour (1 Rotation), an Average Tour (2 Rotations) or a Long Tour (3 Rotations). Each Rotation consists of making a Rotation Deck of 20 “Trench War” Cards and once all Trench War Cards have been drawn and resolved, the Rotation is over and the Player totals his Rotation VP and adds it to his Tour VP. Once all Rotations have been completed, the Player totals his Tour VP and then compares it to the Victory Determination Table to determine the level of success.

GAME FEATURES: Trench War features plenty of colorful Game Counters, Map and Battle Mat, used for resolving Combat. The Game provides plenty of grim themes associated with the War in the Trenches. Counters include Infantry Soldiers, HMGs, Flamethrowers, MK-IV Tanks, A7 Tanks, FT-17 Tanks, Pillboxes, Aircraft, Sub-Machineguns and Light Machineguns.
If you enjoy movies like "All Quiet on the Western Front", "The Lost Batallion", "Sergeant York", "Westfront 1917" or World War One in general, you will enjoy this game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Legs 11
description:
Similar to Snap, but instead of matching a single card, players are trying to create "11" from the sum of two or more upturned cards. When players see it, they have to shout out "Legs".

The illustrations feature children playing and super-imposed with the number of the card.

name: Reise durch die Schweiz
description:
A roll and move game with numbered spaces by Otto Maier Verlag. Players start at the first space and must follow the numbered spaces in towards the center space. First one to reach the end space is the winner.

The company published a different game by the same name a few decades later: Reise durch die Schweiz

name: Rap Battles: The Game
description:
Are you the best rapper in your neighbourhood?

Challenge your friends and family to see who is the lyrical master, and who couldn't rap their way out of a cardboard box.

How to play

Pick up a "rap card" and a "star card" to determine the style of your performance. Roll the dice to select the tune on the beat box, and performs your freestyle rap. Get paid for each successfully completed rap, and the first to $1000 wins the game.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Ulm
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Ulm
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Elmshorn. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel: Werde Bürgermeister in Celle
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Celle
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Elmshorn. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Feed the Kitty (2-6p)
description: This is an early game for young children. Players start with a supply of fish, and roll dice on each turn. The dice tell whether the player should pass a fish to another player, put a fish in the food bowl, take a fish from the bowl, or do nothing for that turn. The last player with fish is the winner.

name: Airships vs Aliens
description:
Airships vs Aliens is a quick strategy boardgame for two players, with one player defending the Earth with ten Steampunk Airship miniatures, while the opposing player attempts to win the invasion using ten alien ship miniatures. The game is pure strategy with no luck elements involved.

Each side has 5 Gunships, 3 Warships and 2 Commandships. The first player to eliminiate both opposing Commandships wins. Each turn a player takes actions with one piece. An action is moving one square forward in the direction facing, turning the ship 90 degrees or firing the long range guns. Gunships have no long range guns, Warships have them with a range of 1 square forward and Commandship long guns can fire with a range of 2 squares forward. Gunships have up to 4 actions when moved, Warships have 3 and Commandships have 2.

To deepen the strategy each side has 5 command tokens that one can be used during a turn to give a ship an extra action. Another strategy element is that when you lose Warships or Commandships you may be able to bring a destroyed ship back to board as reinforcements.

name: Skillion
description:
A two player abstract game played with two sets (black and white) of triangular pieces on a hexagonal board. The board has 96 triangular shapes in blue, yellow and red. Players alternate playing one piece at a time trying to form complete hexagons of their own colour. Red areas cannot be played on until they become the only exposed area in a hexagon and at that point may only be played on when the play would creat a complete hexagon all of one colour, in which case that player wins.
Should no complete uni-coloured hexagon be formed when all legal plays have been made there is a point scoring system to determine the winner.

name: Rambleropoly
description:
All of the spaces on the game board, feature advertisements of the many stores and businesses in the town of McBain, Michigan. You go around as you would on monopoly and buy, sell and trade property.

This version [2013 Edition] is the first edition of the game, released by the McBain High School, it was released for sporting events and gifted to the 2013 graduating class.

name: Meazy N More!
description:
Meazy N More! is essentially a game system, comprising 144 dice — 36 for each player, 6 each in 6 colors. You can play with two copies of the game to allow 5–8 players. An unusual feature of this game system is that there are core rules that all the games use. The core rules instruct players to roll their dice, form legal combinations for the game they're playing, then put their unused dice back in their "rolling bins", and pass them to the left. Each such round of veritable drafting is called a "shake". Shakes continue until someone wins the game.

Meazy N More! comes with rules for four games built upon those core rules:

In Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+), you must build a "pyramid" of dice: 1×1 though 6×6; however, each "level" of one number must be a different color, and once a die is assigned to a level, that level's color is locked.
Not So Eazy Meazy (30 minutes, ages 5+) differs from Eazy Meazy by allowing the player to choose on the fly which number goes in each level; rearranging is completely legal.
Meazy Street (90 minutes, ages 8+) is the featured game (ages 8+). In addition to forming a pyramid, you must form a "straight" and a "rainbow", but these things must be done in a particular sequence. Unlike the previous two games, you calculate your score for the round based on the combinations you form.
Splitting Headache (90 minutes, ages 8+) is billed as a bonus game. In this game, you try to form the four different types of "splits", after which you may work to form the "banana split" out of the remaining dice. You calculate your score for the round based on the splits you formed by the time the round ended.


Further games for the system will be released as expansion packs and/or downloads from the publisher's website.

name: Harvest Mayhem
description:
You are a farm owner at the end of the XIX Century, but in a pretty weird world, after weird experiments vegetables have come alive and crazy events can make your plan change in a second. Plant crops, buy animals, ghater resources, manufacture products, construct buildings, achieve missions and get those Victroy Points to Win.

There are 5 basic resources (tomato, raspberry, wood, wheat and Corn). You start the game drawing 5 resource cards from the Resource deck, drawing 1 Annual Mission (1 mission/place card and 2 mission/order cards) and drawing 1 Reward Card. Also you place your mini-gameboard in front of you. Resources pay everything, wood for buildings and different costs for Manufacture products and buying/feeding animals.

At the beginning of each season, you fulfill your hand till have 5 cards, but of course this are randomly drawed from Resource deck, and you cannot give it all to random cause you have only 4 season to complete "on time" your mission, and receive the bonus and a Reward card, and there is when Planting crops become important.

At the beginning of each year, each player receives a new annual mission by drawing a mission/place card and 2 mission/order mini-cards. To obtain the bonus specified by the mission/place card as well as a reward, both missions/orders must be completed in time (by the end of the year.).

Each Resource card have the "cost" of planting the crop in the upright corner (i.e Tomato have 2), so to plant, just place a resource card/crop on the table and discard the cards necessary from your hand. ONE token is then placed on the first blank space, in the next turn you place another token or harvest if ready (The crop is ready for harvest on the turn after the last token has been placed). The harvested crops represented by tokens are placed in their corresponding space in the barn, and the card return to your hand.

Each card lists the products that can be manufactured that resource. To manufacture simply pay the cost using either resource cards, and/or resources token stored in the barn, (the cards used go to the discard pile and tokens used are back to the token pile). Then place a token on its corresponding place on the shelve. You may manufacture as many products as desired (or posible) per turn.

There are 2 kinds of buildings in the game. Common buildings (Stables, Dairy, Henhouse, Sheep Yard), each player can build his own. And uniques buildings (Train Station, General Store, Inn, and Workshop).

The game ends after 12 rounds/seasons, after which the player with the highest amount of victory points wins. Victory points obtained during the game (by completing missions) are added to the points given by Resources, products and buildings.

name: W.W.B: Trivia
description: W.W.B Trivia was one of a number of games that was to go in the W.W.B Deluxe Set that never got published. It is a trivia game that added another element to W.W.B. In the game, players would have to answer a trivia question when they landed on a space, before they rolled the die to see if they stayed. If they answered wrong, they failed and went back to start. The trivia questions were basic math problems. Examples of the questions consisted of, when a player landed on the 1 space being asked what 1+0 was, and when landing on the 5 space being asked what 2+3 was.

name: W.W.B: Deckbuilder
description:
W.W.B: Deckbuilder was one of a number of games that was to go in the W.W.B Deluxe Set that never got published. It is a deckbuilding cardgame utilizing the cards from W.W.B.

In the game, the cards had different values from $1 to $25 dollars. Players started off with a single hand of 5 $1 cards. During their turn, they could buy one card from the available remaining cards that were left, put it in their discard pile with the cards in their hand and deal 5 more cards, reshuffling when their deck was empty. Play continued until all cards were gone. Player with the most expensive deck at the end of the game won.

name: The Escape of the 9th Army, April 28, 1945
description: The absolute real battle of WW2 was the Escape of the German 9th Army from April 28th to May 1st, 1945. After the army had been by-passed in the attack of Berlin starting April 15, it became encircled and contained by Russian forces who would deal with it later. However, the Russian units containing it were minimal and found themselves in a precarious situation between the German 9th and 12th Armies. In the Halbe region, west of Berlin. The Americans were west of the 12th Army at the Elbe River and instructed not to advance further. The German forces of the 9th Army were threadbare, yet, determined to move west towards the Americans for better POW treatment. Hitler had ordered 12th Army (also threadbare) to attack east towards 9th Army. That order was ignored. Thus, the last remaining strength of the 9th Army, some 50,000 men and AFV’s struck west for 12th Army positions. In between, were Russian rearguard units, each with unclear orders as to how to handle this situation in this backwater of the Berlin area. Only 20,000 succeeded.

name: Panzerschlacht 2: The Battle for Torda, Sept 1944
description: The battle for Torda was a prequel to the Russian advance at Debrecen a month later. Torda was the first Russian attempt to trap much of the German 8th Army in the Carpathians. The battle was smaller scale and one in which the Hungarians conducted one of their few successful offensives. Very few German units were involved (except for the 23rd Panzer Division) and successfully tossed the Romanians back to the Maros River until the arrival of the Russian lead units.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Tasteful Pursuit
description:
Released by Gordon Food Service (GFS) 1986, possibly, only available for employees of the company, unknown for certain.

The Objective of the game is to collect all 10 Product Tokens, Which includes:

Beverage Systems
Center of the Plate
Clean Power
Dairy
Disposables
FACS
"Fresh Cut" Produce
Frozen
Grocery
Table Top

Each player rolls the dice to be able to draw Opportunity cards and if it is a winning card, you get a particular Product token

name: Trade Wins
description:
Simple Trivial Pursuit-like game from Canada in which players can choose to answer questions themselves for 10 points (Trade-In) or pass the question to an opponent for 5 points (Trade-Off) with the goal of getting 50 points in each of 6 categories.

Incorrect answers in the "danger zone" (between 15 and 35 points) means players must choose a penalty card, typically causing a player to lose points or lose their next turn. Players who correctly answer a question passed to them get to choose a bonus card which could earn bonus points or an extra turn.

The six categories are:
1. Movies, TV, Theatre
2. People, Places, Things
3. Food, Drink, Customs
4. Fiction, Fables, Myths
5. Music, Singers, Songs
6. Sports, Games, Hobbies

There are 120 cards in each category with 6 questions on each, for a total of over 4,300 questions.

name: Thor: Bifröst Bridge
description:
Bifrost Brige - gateway to Asgard.

Each round is one or more duels, aimed at gaining Bridge. After start, each player must play a card or cards on the Bridge or in a Storm. If he does not, he resigns from further participation in the duel, saying, "Hagal". The duel is finished when all players but one say "Hagal".

You win when you score 500 points.

name: Thumbs Up
description:
Thumbs Up is a simulation game for camp management and recreation leadership training. By experiencing various simulated situations the players will gain skill in solving camp leadership problems. The game is intended to provide the student of camp management real-life situations to deal with and gives the experienced camp director a chance to be evaluated on how they are performing their responsibilities.

The players start on a space representing the first week of camp in June and proceed to the end of camp in August. In turn, players must respond aloud to various simulated camp challenges and their movement along the board will be determined by the number of "thumbs up" and "thumbs down" they receive from the other players for their answer. The first players who makes it to the end of camp (in August) wins the game.

name: Dino Bash
description:
Dino Bash is a short, but fun game first published in Roleplayer Independent (Volume 1, Issue 6 - May 1993).

The game is simple board game, designed to provide a little light relief between role-playing games scenarios.

The game is based in a world where Dinosaurs have never died out. There are three fractions, The Carnivores, The Herbivores and The Mammals.

The game takes places in the bar; The Jurassic Arms (A3 map provided with counters) and two six sided dice are required (miniatures could be useful).

Each character has a simple profile which consists of three basic attributes; Wounds Points, Action Points and Combat Points, but also description on how they attack and any special attractions.

There are a number of special items counters which the characters can pick up around the bar to help them.

Each fraction has a background which gives the player what’s they needs to do in the game.

name: A Colmeia
description:
What is the work of bees? Pollinate the flowers, run from predators and take care of their hives. In this game, players have to move their bees across the board, to get to the flowers, pick up pollen and nectar, and return to their hive. With this win honey (victory points). To move, use the cardinal points, it should protect the trees and escape a spider that likes to steal nectar and pollen that the bees are carrying. Who will produce more honey at the end of the match?

Qual o trabalho das abelhas ? Polinizar as flores, fugir dos predadores e cuidar de sua Colmeia. Neste jogo, os jogadores terão que movimentar suas abelhas pelo tabuleiro, chegar até as flores, pegar néctar, pólen e voltar para sua Colmeia. Com isso ganharão Mel (Pontos de vitória). Para se movimentar, utilizarão os pontos cardeais, se protegerão nas árvores e deverá fugir de uma Aranha que gosta muito de roubar néctar e pólen que as abelhas estão transportando. Quem conseguirá produzir mais mel no final da partida ?

name: Falsch gefahren lieber Mann!
description:
The players have to move their 4 cars from the "Start/Ziel" space to the turning cycle of their color and back again, while observing the traffic rules. The first player who gets this done, wins the game. Players who violate the traffic rules have to pay a fine, if they do this frequently, they have to play a penalty round with one car. Movement is determined by a die. A Special die determines some advantages, like bringing a new car into play, move the traffic cops or turn the traffic lights.
On some spaces the players have to answer questions about the traffic rules.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Football
description:
"It's fourth and one, your opponent thinks you will run a Fullback Dive... But, you throw the bomb instead... It's a TOUCHDOWN!!!"

"The Game of Football" is a board game for playing American Football. The game can be played by one or two players on each team. It is a stats-type game, and on each turn players call plays and defenses, then roll dice and consult charts to determine the result of each play.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battle of the Beetles
description:
In Battle of the Beetles green and red beetles fight among themselves. Your goal is to be the last player making a valid action. In order to play Battle of the Beetles you need a modified 7 x 7 board with 44 cells, 28 white rings (“eggshells”) and 28 rounder counters (14 green and 14 red “beetles”)

In each turn a player must perform one of the following actions:


Remove the eggshell from one of your eggs. The removed eggshell is out of the game.
Capture an enemy beetle. A born beetle makes a capture in two steps: First it moves forward to a cell adjacent to it. Then it flies to a cell occupied by an enemy beetle which removed from the game. The beetle flies exactly as a knight moves in chess.
Capture a friendly beetle according to the rules mentioned above. This action can only be carried out if the player is not able to perform the aforementioned actions.


If a player cannot make any of these actions in his/her turn, he/she loses.

name: iXit
description:
iXit was published in issue #109 of the gamers' magazine FAIRPLAY.

Players throws pairs of dice and compose pairs of each one black and one white die to determine where to "iX" fields by marking them with a cross.

By this, regions of adjacent fields are built. In the end, players compare their second largest area. Whoever has the largest of these wins the game.

name: The Thing: Man Is the Warmest Place To Hide
description:
In the winter of 1982, a twelve-man research team at a remote Antarctic outpost discover an alien buried in the snow for over 100,000 years.
Soon unfrozen, the form-changing alien wreaks almighty havoc.

This set of 54 cards is the second expansion for The Thing, and offers two new Tasks for the outpost crew to work upon. The Thing player also gains four 'attacking Thing' cards to harm the team with, and provide additional nasty surprises. Numerous new weapon and skill cards to confront the chilling, inhuman threat are included.
A clutch of new cards also aim to subtly tip off the human players as to "who's human, and who's a thing," as well as force the El Capitan and others to make further unpleasant decisions.

This expansion contains no new rules or decks of cards. All of the cards fit into existing decks.

Please note: This game is strictly for adults - with profanity and horrific imagery on many of the cards.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game, Worker Placement

name: Tic Tac Stack
description: Tic Tac Stack is "a clever version of the classic game" of Tic Tac Toe. It adds a dexterity element, more players (up to 4) and the ability to change what is in a box on the board. From the box: "To play: Drop your colored chips one at a time down your ramp onto the game tray. Take careful aim and send your chip rolling, bouncing and jumping onto the play board. Your ramp swivels back and forth to help you aim, but it takes a little luck to get it to land where you want it to! As chips are played they stack on top of each other so you might get covered up on any turn." First player to get three in a row of their color wins.

name: The Rough Riders
description: This is a simple spin and move game where player begins his adventure from "camp" (10 separated routes, the bottom of game board). The first player, who reach "victory" area - wins the game.

name: Die kleine Lok Ivor
description: The players have to get the little engine Ivor from the engine shed (space 1) to Grumbly Station (space 13). Movement is determined by a die. The events on the colored spaces are explained in the game rules. Each time a player reaches Grumbly Station all players sing Ivor's song: "puuup - porp - porrp ..."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Trap a Tank
description: Trap a Tank, made in the 1930s by Wolverine, features a gold out metal game board with cardboard battlefield graphics and comes with 4 wood tanks. It is a race type game, you crank the handle on bottom and tanks vibrate along the course trying to avoid traps.

name: RainboDisko
description: RainboDisko is an action-dexterity game played on a record player. Players take turns placing pieces on a moving record ("preferably the self-titled album Christopher Cross"). Any pieces that fall before the next player places a piece cost the active player a point. The winner is the player with the lowest score when the record ends.

name: Monster Consonants
description: Monster Consonants is a matching game that teaches basic words and beginning consonants by using cards with incomplete words and picture clues. Players are dealt a hand of three cards, they then use the illustrations and incomplete words displayed on their cards to figure out what words they are trying to complete. Each player in turn asks another player for a letter card he thinks he needs. If the other player has the card, the first player makes sure the picture match, reads the correct word, and places the two cards face-down to score ten points. If the other player does not have the card, the first player may draw a card, and lay down any matches made. If the first player does not read the completed word correctly, another player may challenge, read the word, and steal the points. Play continues until a player reaches 150 points.

name: Hot Wheels Math
description:
Start your engines. Get ready to race your way to becoming the champion of addition and subtraction!

Hot Wheels Math is a roll-and-move/spin-and-move game designed to teach addition and subtraction while racing your Hot Wheels cars along a track to the finish line. The board has two sides, with separate tracks. On the Addition side, which depicts a race track, the player rolls two dice, adds the numbers together (the addition practice element) and moves that many spaces. Some spaces have special effects that can help or hinder. First player to complete three laps around the track is the winner.

The subtraction side represents a cross-USA road course. On this side, players spin the spinner, subtract the number spun from the number on their current space, and move that number of spaces. This side also features special spaces that can help or hinder players.

name: Magic Rainbow
description:
Magic Rainbow is a game designed to help children learn colors and read color words. Players move along the magic rainbow track by drawing a card with either a color or the name of a color printed on it. They then move to the next space of that color on the track (similar to Candyland). First player to reach the top of the rainbow wins. There are also obstacles (such as black clouds with rainbow slides) that can set players back.

This game has an interesting game board. It is large (20"x26") and comes as four giant puzzle pieces to be assembled.

name: Esbirros Bizarros
description:
Esbirros Bizarros (Bizarre Minions) is a party game for up to 25 players, which can be played everywhere with anoyone.

The game is played with only one deck of 25 cards, those are divided in "Power Morfys" green cards, "Skulls" grey cards, and special cards such as "Intergalacticos", "Chuchos Infernales", "The Croten One", "El Cornado" and "El Crack".

Each card will add or substract points and have an special action that the player must do. Some times this actions are imposible like "wash your brain in oil", but should do something to satisfy Goo Zman.

Each player takes 2 cards (or 1 if there are more that 13 players), this cards must not be shown to other players. Only the player that gets the card named Goo Zman, reveals it so all players can see it.
The goal of this player is to find as many Power Morfys can, and adquire the highest points posible, avoiding "Skulls" and negative cards. To do so, he must pick one player at a time to show one of his cards (the picked player choose one of his cards). Gooz Man will loose if he gets -25 points.

The players must decide if they want to help Goo Zman, or not. Since
they can persuade him to being pick with lies or helping him giving clues to who he should pick, but never reveal their cards until they are picked by Goo Zman. If the player choose to show a negative card, this player will win if Gooz Man loose. If the player choose a positive card, the player will win if Goo Zman wins. When a player already had a picked card and must show his other card, the new card will be his win chance.

There is also an special card named "Diabolo", this player will only win if he is not picked.

It's a very fun and crazy game that can last from 1 minute to 20 minutes.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Acting, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Roman Conqueror: A Solitaire Game of Conquering the Roman Empire.
description:
Roman Conqueror is a semi-historical simulation of the conquest of the Roman Empire. The Player assumes the role of the Consul of Rome during the early period of the Roman Empire. Rome is feeling the confidence of their advancements in technology, culture and military might.
OBJECTIVE: As the Consul of Rome you are anxious to spread the knowledge and culture of Rome to neighboring Territories, as well as, increasing the wealth and prosperity of the Roman population (and of course, yourself). The Player must raise Legions and assign Generals to conquer as many Territories as possible before the last Campaign Card is drawn, thus, ending your magnificent reign.

GAME FEATURES: Roman Conqueror includes many colorful counters representing the various Troops of the time, including, Legion Infantry, Auxiliary Infantry, Elephants, Heavy and Light Chariots, Peltasts, Horse Archers and Warbands. The game is Card-Driven and event includes rules for Gladiatorial Combat, Chariot Races, and Naval Combat. Enemy Civilizations include Barbarians (Germans, Belgai, Gauls), Sarmatians (Huns, Goths, Dacians), Parthians (Persians), and Carthaginians.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Wonderful Word Weaving
description:
The game consists of 24 dice. Each die has a single letter on each side.

Each player rolls all the dice and places the resulting letters in a crossword style grid. The objective is to use as few words as possible while using all the letters. The player who needs the fewest words to use all the letters is the winner. The game can be played as a single round, multiple rounds, in teams or the players may choose pass the dice undisturbed to the other player or team so each is using the same letters to form a grid.

name: Ants 4X
description:
In the game, you begin with one ant hill in a vast forest of grass. There is plenty of good foraging. And valuable items can be found. You can grow your colony by building new hills in the openings. All is well until one day….. you encounter… OTHER ANTS!

Soon it becomes clear that this is a contest for domination. You must build an army for defense, and maybe an attack or two. But you must carefully watch your food supply and the size of your army because of spoilage and fungus plagues. If you can exterminate another colony's home hill or build a great temple hill, all the other colonies will surrender to you and you will be an instant winner. Or if the forest is cleared first, you can win by having the most wealth.

Ants 4X is a diceless game. This gives the players choices instead of relying on luck. Battles are resolved by secret deployment of soldiers ants, simultaneously revealed. Of course, the explore actions, by necessity, will involve finding random items. Everything you find will be useful for something, but you may need to change your strategy.

Ants 4X is not an educational or epic game, just a fun, fast playing game that includes all the basic 4X actions, resource management and a dab of ant know-how thrown in for good measure.

name: Scotland Rising: Stirling Bridge
description:
Extra battle map, to move your Scotland Rising battles from Bannockburn 1314 back to the Battle of Sterling Bridge 1297.

Lead the forces of Andrew de Moray and William Wallace to victory, or change history by crushing the Scotish rebels by leading the 6th Earl of Surrey John de Warenne and the king treasurer Hugh de Cressingham and their men to victory!

The game was originally a Kickstarter streach goal but was not met, so the publisher is offering a digital edition which can be printed.
Original counters are needed to play this game.
Rules as base game.

Map size 11 x 17 inches.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Swords & Banners
description:
Valiant charges, bone crushing melee, and lump-in-your-throat defense has been recreated in Swords & Banners, a gaming system that uses 15mm or 25mm miniatures to recreate epic Medieval historical battles from the year 870 AD to 1424 AD.

The Swords & Banners system has been designed to provide miniature players a historical set of parameters without sacrificing playability. Extensive research into actual formations used by medieval armies has been incorporated into these rules.

The Swords & Banners system also uses modifiers that are incorporated into “At a Glance” tables, allowing players to use the tables without having to constantly refer to the rule booklet.

Also included are reproducible game rulers, markers, and overhead view stand counters (so you don’t even need miniatures to play the game), along with scenarios allowing you to get right into game-play!" (From the Introduction)

Swords & Banners is a complete print-and-play game which comes on a CD.

name: IsoImperial
description:
A settlement building game for fans of the isometric strategy boom of the late 90's
In IsoImperial you are the new lord of a settlement being built in the Middle Ages on the feudal country of Ingland.

Players get to play as competitively or cooperatively as they like, as well as a solitaire single player variant.

IsoImperial gives players over 30 different buildings to build their new settlement from a small hamlet, all the way to a bustling city. Building types consist of residential buildings, goods and economic buildings, buildings required for growth as well as the military and defence buildings required for keeping players, and random events out of your settlement.

Having a constant income is only part of the struggle, with droughts, floods, fires, roaming bandits and more coming into play. As well as balancing your stretch to victory without becoming a prime target for other players and their military.

Multiple paths to victory, be the first to achieve a city, or last 24 in game months and come out with the best score across multiple categories.

Small enough to play anywhere, big enough to get stuck in.

Isometric artwork heralds back to the late 90's strategy and empire building boom.

name: Exploits
description:
Exploits is a card game where players try to hack each others servers. The game's main mechanic focuses on combining an exploit and payload to effectively attack your opponents.

Each player has a set of servers behind a firewall, as the game progresses, the firewalls grow and develop vulnerabilities. Players take turns looking at firewalls to protect themselves and find vulnerabilities with their opponents decks. Players then attack an opponents server with their own payload and exploit, and the vulnerability in their opponents firewall. Other cards allow for DDos, botnets distributing spam, and other abilities.

name: Slow Fox
description: In Slow Fox, players try to force their opponent to jump off the board. Basic moves are jumps, and the tokens jumped over change their color and therefore their owner. A player is forced to make a jump; if he cannot make a jump, he makes a simple move changing the color of the moving token.

name: Bruce Moose on the Loose
description: Bruce Moose is set in motion and he moves around while playing music. The first kid to get rings off in the antlers. Get all those in your color off and you win...

name: Die Jagd nach dem Glück
description: The goal of the game is to be the first player to reach the star in the center of the game board. The players each have one meeple of a different size. The bigger ones are superior to the ones of the next smaller size. The smallest meeple is superior to the biggest one. If two meeples of two consecutive sizes are on the same grey or black ring, with no other meeple between them, the superior one can exchange places with the minor one, if the minor one ist the preceeding one on the track. If the superior mepple is the preceeding one, the minor meeple has to go back 3 spaces.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Three Kingdoms:  A Strategy Card Game
description:
Three Kingdoms is a turn-based, strategy card game in which players - playing as one of the major kingdoms/factions - compete to control the most spaces on the board. Using elements of both Hand Management and Area Control, players are rewarded for both their ability to optimize actions and by strategically placing Unit Cards to gain points. Some luck is involved through both drawing cards and unit placement, but players who can master their decks can dominate the battlefield..

Each kingdom/faction contains a set of 18 cards. Unit Cards are placed on the Board and determine the end of game (once all of the spaces are occupied, the game is over) and the scoring (capturing other units or occupying spaces. Strategy Cards allow for creating combinations and rule bending. The 'Board' is made up of Terrain Cards and can be configured to any shape or design - presenting a new set of challenges, potential strategies, and time limit for each new game.

Players are limited to 1 action per turn: Draw 1 Card or Play 1 Card. But, certain cards allow for the creation of combinations and special rule bending - creating a lot of nuance and strategy as the game progresses. TK is based on the Three Kingdoms period of China and the historical-fiction book, 'Romance of the Three Kingdoms,' by Luo Guanzhong.

name: Das lustige Labyrinth
description: The players start at the entrance (sun) to the labyrinth. The first to reach the exit (moon) wins the game. Movement is determined by a number-die (number of spaces to go) and a color-die (direction). The symbol-die is used only on a few special spaces. As usual the rules for the numbered spaces are explained in the game rules.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Fuchs heraus!
description:
The players insert numbered tokens into the fox's den. The entrance they use (1-6) is determined by a die. If they push another token out of the den, they get a coin from the owner of the token. If they are the owner of the pushed out token, they pay a coin into the bank. If a player pushes the hound out of the den, he has to pay 2 coins into the bank. The Player, who pusches out the fox, winns the game and the bank.

The game was published in the 1920s or 1930s.

name: Numinoes
description:
Numinoes is a strategic board game inspired by Othello (Reversi), Dominoes and modern games.

The starting position is two tiles from each player laid on the board (d4, e5 and d5, e4). The players take turn where they try turn a line by lining up with one of their tiles separated by the opponent's tiles. The players play until there is no more moves possible and the winner is the one who has the highest score calculated from the values of the tiles.

Extra tiles are special moves designed to change the tide in one or another's player favour. They are :stop, :swirl, :gold, :bomb and :star (described below).

A stop tile prevents an opponent to turn all tiles in a line up until the stop tile (included) rather than until the opponent’s bounding tile.

A swirl tile turns all the opponent’s tiles aside in all 8 directions plus all playable line up.

A gold tile behaves like stop tile but cannot be turn ever. It can be laid down at the beginning to add a handicap.

A bomb tile explodes the tiles aside in all 8 directions regardless of the colour. The tile itself can stay on the board for an added handicap.

A star tile gives extra points (e.g. 5 points) and cannot be turned ever but will not prevent a line up to turn.

name: Chroma Roll
description: Chroma Roll is an abstract dice-rolling game that consists of 29 clear rings and 54 tokens in three colors (red, blue and green). The tokens and rings are placed on a hexagonal grid before the start of the game, with rings sitting alone on a space or in stacks of two or three, and tokens randomly placed in stacks of three on spots on the game board. Hexes on the board have colored edges (in red, green or blue). Rings are moved by rolling three dice (also in red, green and blue) and moving the rings by selecting a die of a particular color and moving a ring over the hex edges of the same color as many hexes as the die shows (1-6). The object of the game is to collect colored tokens in sets, scoring points at the end of the game for each set collected.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: Roll a Ringer
description: Roll a Ringer is an abstract dice-rolling game that consists of 29 clear rings and 54 tokens in three colors (red, blue and green). The tokens and rings are placed on a hexagonal grid before the start of the game, with rings sitting alone on a space or in stacks of two or three, and tokens randomly placed in 18 stacks of three on the spots on the board, with six in each of the game colors. Hexes on the board have colored edges (in red, green or blue). Rings or tokens are moved by rolling three dice (also in red, green and blue) and moving the ring or token by selecting a die of a particular color and moving a ring over the hex edges of the same color as many hexes as the die shows (1-6). The object of the game is to collect colored tokens in sets, by either moving a ring over a stack of three tokens, or moving tokens into stacks of at least three rings.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: Pathogen: Z
description:
Pathogen: Z takes place in 2057 after GenTech, a genetic research company, released a pathogen onto a small town as leverage to use its new antigen on human test subjects. Things quickly turned bad as the virus mutated and became immune to the existing antigen. Rather then accept responsibility, GenTech sat back hoping the virus would stop spreading.

Five years later, and nearly 75% of the worlds population has been affected. Some have been reanimated from the dead, others gruesomely mutated into something that no longer resembles a human life form. Pick your side. GenTech? Rogue military? Civilian? Street Gang? Private security? Government? Scientist?

Build your deck and try to survive one more day.

Game Play

Players must construct decks from predefined Base Decks along with optional expander packs to customize their chosen deck. All packs contain no randomization or rarity. Similar CCG themes are present such as playing cards from your hand, drawing from a draw pile and having cards discarded from play through various mechanics.

Various card mechanics allow players to draw additional cards, reduce an opponents hand, introduce survivors (your team), use zombies and mutants to harm your opponent and use defensive barriers and equipment to protect your survivors while trying to defeat your opponent.

Each faction has team members which have skill levels in certain skills. These skill levels give them access to "doing" things through playing cards which match their required skill levels.

For example, a Geneticist has a Skill Level of 3 and can create more powerful mutants then say a Lab Assistant with a Skill Level of only 1.

The end game is to defeat the opposing faction by using your survivors and equipment along with their abilities to either control zombies, engineer mutants or simply use brute force in this post-apocalyptic card game!

name: Battle of Toba-Fushimi 鳥羽伏見の戦い
description:
The Battle of Toba-Fushimi occurred between pro-Imperial and Tokugawa shogunate forces during the Boshin War in Japan.
This game made a first match of the Boshin War and determined extinction of Tokugawa shogunate government
I reproduced "a fight of Toba Fushimi" at the campaign level including the Kyoto suburbs
It is a game. One is in charge of the other former shogunate prefecture forces by a game of two play in new government troop.

Victory condition
If the Shogunate forces gain control of Nijo-jo Castle or the Imperial Palace, the Shogunate forces win promptly.
Or new government troop wins promptly when new government troop gains control of the Yodo Castle.
If three points of Shogunate forces secure before the ninth turn is over; with old Shogunate forces restrictive victory
It becomes. When even if the seventh turn is over, there is not victory or defeat; the His Majesty's body (the Emperor) in San-in
A shift, the Shogunate assume a shrine of Rinno-ji Temple an eastern great emperor, and the civil war bogs down. It is with form to benefit the Great Powers
Japan becomes the colony. It is both militaries defeat when it becomes the colony.

name: Stack Tac Toe
description: Rack 'em up and stack 'em up with this multi-level version that's tic tac terrific! The objective is still to get 3 in a row horizontally or diagonally - the new challenge is to get 3 in a row vertically too. Develops problem-solving, logical thinking and spatial awareness.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Bestialwars
description:
Bestialwars is a table-top fantasy miniature war game in heroic scale of 10mm {12mm real}, set in the lands of Zaneoss, continent of the flat world of Dabbath.

Bestial Wars is a stubborn game, carrying on the great tradition of the 80’s and 90’s, all miniatures are hand sculpted and casted using lead free metal.

...we just can’t help but love things that weigh !!!

Bestial Wars uses a 12mm scale for all its models, from troops to creatures. Thanks to the small size of the models, Bestial Wars battles are going to feel and look epic; furthermore, the limited number of bases in which miniatures are arranged will allow for fast and smooth deployment and movement.
This structure makes the grand battles of Bestial Wars playable with the ease of a skirmish game!

name: Flagship Armada
description:
4X Space boardgame revolving around assymetrical factions vying for control of the galaxy.

Each player plays a Faction and is set to a home system.

In this system, he needs to expand his fleet and colonies, so more resources are added to his growing empire.

At his side, each player has a powerful starship called Flagship. This ship research new modules, tactics and technologies.

But beware, other players are doing the same!

Struggle to survive against several threats like Pirates, Transdimensional invaders and opposite factions.

In the end, only one can achieve victory!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Fire Department
description:
"Fire Department" was released as one of six in Milton Bradley's "Radio Series" of inexpensive race games costing 15 cents each. It debuted in the Bradley Games catalog of 1927 and was sold through 1933. A slightly larger but cheaper edition, at 10 cents, appeared in the 1943 catalog.

This is a simple spin and move game. Every player is the "driver of a fire apparatus," represented by a simple wooden disc. The goal is to get from the engine house to the fire. Landing on an orange space sends you forward three extra spaces and landing on a white space forces you to take one of two multiple-space detours.

name: Hals und Beinbruch!
description:
Hals und Beinbruch! sets forth simple rules which may be used in conjunction with either TSR’s Fight in the Skies or Avalon Hill’s Richtofen’s War in order to run an extended campaign.

Includes a 4 page pamphlet of rules, tables and designer's notes as well as bound British and German logbooks.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Ship Battles
description: An adaptation of 2D ship combat rules for use with any size models. Ships are constructed by using a formula table in the rulebook based on their relative size, weapons fit, arc of fire, speed, etc. Models often used are from other systems and the rules create fun, engaging battles across a space grid in a short amount of time relative to other, more robust systems.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Mit Zippo durch Herten
description:
Mit Zippo durch Herten is an educational game for children and families that has players move through and discover the city of Herten, North Rhine-Westphalia.

The game board is a map of the city. Traffic lights can hinder movement and players need to reach colored spaces that are placed in key locations and places of interest within the city.
It is also possible for players to anwser "Herten allgemein" (Herten in general) cards or play event cards to gain benefits or hinder other players.

Each player has a secret goal, which has him or her gather a number cards of different colors. Each color corresponds to different institutions, from recreational facilities to public services. A player gains a card when he enters a space of the same color on the board and then correctly answers the question given on it.

In doing so, the players get to know the layout of the city and learn about locations, services and activities.

name: Five Planets: A Companion and Scenario Booklet for Quadrant 13
description:
Five Planets is a campaign and scenario pack for Quadrant 13 (Q13).
Five Planets contains twelve scenarios set within the Pankova solar system as two adversaries fight over its priceless resources. The action begins on Peach, the outermost planet, a most desolate, moon-like place but the gateway to the system, then moves through the asteroid belt that contains huge amounts of mineral wealth to Cheteria, the ice planet. After Cheteria comes Three, the garden world that feeds the system, followed by D'Var, the desert planet whose sands conceal vast seas of valuable oil. Finally the campaign climaxes on fiery Adeen, closest to the sun, but the source of limitless power.
The campaign is designed to be played through twice: with each player first taking the part of the race invading the Pankova system, the Attackers, and then taking the part of the incumbents, the Defenders. Be warned, sometimes the Defenders are attacking, and sometimes the Attackers are defending: as first one side then the other gains an advantage.
Although written for Q13, Five Planets can be easily adapted for any sci-fi rules system. Each scenario contains a full game briefing, a map, and then a briefing for each player, including a description of the forces available. All players need to do is print off the appropriate pages for the scenario that they want to play, set up the battlefield, break out the figures, and away they go. As the army lists given are generic, players can use them to play any sci-fi army that they choose: whether based on a particular range of figures, background from another ruleset, background from a film or book, or even a background that they have made up themselves.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Evermore
description:
What began as a celebration ended in tragedy when a wizard's fiery display went awry. Now, through no fault of your own, you find yourself trapped in a time loop forced to live the same day over and over and over and over again. Your only hope lies in a wizard whose advertisement you stumbled across in your search for answers and knowledge. He has informed you that he can cast a spell, tailor made for just you, that can open a portal through space and time.

For the first time in a very long while there is a faint glimmer of hope on the horizon. All you have to do is figure out a way to locate the spell components that the wizard needs and manage your day efficiently so that you can gather them all in time...

Evermore is a card auction, set collection, dice rolling game in which 2 - 4 players will compete to gain the knowledge necessary to efficiently gather the required components to win the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Medieval

name: Augen auf im Straßenverkehr!
description: The players have to shop in 6 different Stores. The first player to gather 6 different Merchandise Cards, winns the game. The players may choose to move from shop to shop as a pedestrian or with a car or a bicycle, while observing the traffic rules. The other players can be impeded by playing a Traffic Card to close off a street or activate a traffic sign.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Greedy Billionaire and the College Student
description:
This is a card game where players are College Students trying to graduate before the Greedy Billionaire can take away all their money. They start with a supply of money and will need to pay tuition and other expenses each year (round). They score points for graduating and for avoiding bankruptcy. The Greedy Billionaire is not an actual player but he scores points for each College Student that goes bankrupt.

Players graduate by playing 4 Pass Exam cards (one each for freshman, sophomore, junior and senior year) and one Graduation card. In order to obtain enough money to pay tuition, players may play action cards to get a job, earn a scholarship and receive financial aid. But beware! Their opponents will play Greedy Billionaire Cards to send their job overseas, raise tuition, cut the education budget, pollute the earth, and accuse them of cheating.

Points are tallied at the end of each hand and the final object is to be the first player to score 150 points in several hands of play.

name: Stranger Danger
description:
Stranger Danger is a card game for daring people in public places. Challenge your friends to approach a person in the crowd and discover what strangers will do to help you win.

On your turn, draw Stranger cards to describe a person to perform a challenge with. Then select from the Challenge cards you are given by the players on either side of you. To earn points, predict how the stranger will answer a Question or convince them to perform a Request.

name: Monsters of the Hydra
description:
Adventurers seek to slay a nine headed hydra that has unleashed a myriad of monsters into the world.

This game contains tiles, chits, cards and dice.

Players win the game by either defeating the lead nine headed hydra and/or the head vampiress. The game is lost when all tiles are placed unless using the optional rule for infinite enemies.

To defeat all of the monsters, the players can gather weapons from the item deck by buying them at a shop or by using spells from the spell deck. Some items can also be found when defeating enemies.

name: Five Dragons Battle
description:
From publisher overview:

Battle with five elemental dragons in this epic card game.
Choose your card well and defend yourself !
Be the first to discard all your card to win the game.

Easy to learn and easy to play.

name: Turno
description:
This game includes 4 different playing options:

I. Turno-Race: The tiles form a race track (see box cover). Movement is determined by a die. If a player gets on a tile with an even number of dots, he turns the tile and advances as many tiles as dots show up. If a player rolls an odd number, he hast to go backward and may not turn the tile.

II. Turno-Lottery: The tiles form a 6-pointed star. The players place their meeple on a tile. If the die shows the number of their tile, they may remove the tile. The first player to remove all 6 tiles of his leg of the star, wins the game.

III. Turno-Domino: The 6-edged center tile is placed on the table. The players draw tiles and add one at a time to the center tile, till a six pointed star is formed. The first player to use up all his tiles wins the game.

IV. Turno-Boardgame: The 36 tiles combine to a game board of 6x6 tiles. The meeples start on a corner tile, have to cross the board to any tile on the other side and return to their starting tile, to win the game. Movement is determined by a die. If a player, for instance, rolls a 5 he can advance to a neighbouring tile, that shows 5 dots, or he can go to a tile showing 3 dots and further to a tile showing 2 dots.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Foot Soldier
description:
From the rulebook:

Rules for 20mm World War II through Present Conflicts

These rules are designed to re-enact table top combat for the Foot Soldier. Each figure on the board represents one Infantryman with his own type of weapon, each having a morale level of his own.
categories: Korean War, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II

name: 15 to Zero
description: How fast can you match and add your cards to go from 15 Cards To Zero? Win the game by being the first player to get rid of his or her Number Cards by matching them to an individual number on a single die or the sum of two or more dice each turn. The first to match can discard those cards from their hand to get to zero before the other players.

name: Duo Dash
description:
The animals are loose and must be brought back into the enclosures as fast as possible. If only someone could remember where the animals were last!

Dash quickly as you and the other players turn over tiles to collect pairs of animals. Find pairs according to the Goal Tiles. Match a valid pair and receive a positive point, collect a wrong pair and receive a negative point. Score the most points at the end of 3 rounds and win!

name: Tibbar's Mix to Match
description:
Tibbar is painting the town red, and orange... and even blue-green!

In Mix to Match, your kids will learn how to combine colors to create secondary and tertiary shades. Send Tibbar around his painter's palette to get to the color shown on one of your cards. Match all of your colors first to win the game.

name: Der Völkerkrieg
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 100; become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...

Note:
Likely published ~1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Political, Racing, World War I

name: Die wilden Fußballkerle: Geheimtraining
description:
In Geheimtraining (secret training) you try to pass the ball which is a disc to your team mates by flickikng it. Around each player pawn lies a rubberband to indicate the area in which you have to land the ball to successfully pass it.

The player who passes 11 perfect shots and shoots a goal wins the game.

name: Der Völkerkrieg
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching Paris (space 46); become really positive about Germany's war occurences
- moving by turns -

All players have to buy in first. Board shows German/French/Belgium Border with two separate ways (Aachen or Metz) towards Paris.
Choose one of the two routes. Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on red marked spaces you must pay or collect play money, skip a turn or move again...
Note:
Likely published 1915; indoctrination related to spirit of the age & time
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Racing, World War I

name: Der Brummer kommt!
description:
Objective: Flip carton discs into areas of different values in the box base and colored circles of the erected castle.

Instructions show relations to events of WWI:
Cannon (on the cover) is described as "Krupp's 42 cm mortar", successfully used during WWI.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, World War I

name: Erika
description: The players place their 15 meeples on the game board, one per turn. When all meeples are on the board the players move their meeples one space at a time. When a player gets 5 of his meeples in a straight line, he may remove any one meeple of any opposing player. If he does this on the black spaces, forming the name "Erika" he may additionaly reenter one of his own removed meeples. If a player manages to occupy the "Erika" spaces of his own color, he wins the game. Another possible way to win the game is to occupy any black "Erika" spaces, the two spaces left and the two spaces right to the letter "I" in "Erika" (forming a cross).

name: Der Kampf mit dem Drachen
description:
Objective: As a hero - collect as much gold as possible;
as dragon - catch all heros; game ends after all gold is collected or all heros are caught/out of the game.
- acting by turns -
The dragon is placed in the centre of the board, each hero with two pieces of gold on his starting position; remaining gold (4 pieces) are placed at the far end of the cave.
Players move according die roll forward, laterally or backwards.
A '6' can be used only passing (stepping over) the dragon, otherwise not usable. Reaching a piece of gold it should be brought back to starting position.
After each player's turn the dragon will move segmentally according die roll. A player hit by dragon's head is out of the game - unless he/she can pay a ransom (1 gold).

note:
likely published mid 1950's
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Reise ins Alpenland
description:
A roll and move game with numbered spaces by Otto Maier Verlag. Players start at the first space and must follow the numbered spaces in towards the center space. First one to reach the end space is the winner.

The company published a similar game/similar equipment: Reise durch die Schweiz;
due to the used logo ist must have been published earlier than 1892

name: Master of Fact
description:
"The game where knowledge and strategy meet"

This is a trivia game with an unusual ladder format that requires each player to climb a twisting pathway in order to win. Players answer trivia questions (taken from a booklet) as they advance. Certain spaces on the ladder affect a player's movement options. The first player to reach the peak of the ladder and answer a final challenge is declared the winner.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players age 8 and older. Includes board, pawns, booklet, storage insert, and a die.

name: A Aventura de Caboclo Bernardo
description:
A Aventura de Caboclo Bernando (The Caboclo Bernardo Adventure) is based in a true history of an unsung hero who saves many sailor lives at Brazilian coast of Espírito Santo at 1887 setember 7th.

This game mixes strategy, cooperation and the thrill of fighting a perfect storm. The players represent the fishermen at beach who should keep the rope firmly to help Caboclo Bernardo (a Brazilian hero) to save the sailors of a sinking ship and bring them safely to shore. The mission is dangerous, the fishermen may even injure themselves while pulling the rope from side to side to control it over the strong winds.

Also, an element of surprise can put everything away! Secretly, one of the players is an evil traitor who tries to sabotage the mission. He will try to cut the rope and pull it the wrong way, delaying the work of other participants until it is too late.

Portuguese edition:

Este jogo mistura estratégia, cooperação do time e a emoção de lutar contra uma tempestade. Os jogadores representam os pescadores que, da praia, devem manter a corda firme para que o Caboclo Bernardo chegue até o navio e traga os marinheiros em segurança até a margem. A missão é perigosa, os pescadores podem até se ferir enquanto puxam a corda de um lado para o outro para compensar os fortes ventos.

Além disso, um elemento surpresa pode pôr tudo a perder! Secretamente, um dos jogadores representa um malvado traidor que tentará sabotar a missão. Ele vai tentar cortar a corda e puxá-la para o lado errado, atrasando o trabalho dos demais participantes até que seja tarde demais.

name: Africa's Big 5: The Ultimate Adventure Board Game
description:
Choose your favourite animal: Lion, Rhino, Elephant, and Buffalo, Leopard or Giraffe and reap the rewards. Improve your general knowledge about wildlife world wide with 1000 trivia questions and answers.

Pick a Giraffe card (wild card) and perform the animal action or sounds, e.g. crawl like a leopard, trumpet like an elephant, snort like a warthog and many more.

Africa’s Big 5 is a fun, educational game for the whole family. Experience Africa and wildlife like never before. Adventurous trivia game with a twist. Original game play with wildcard factor adds flexibility and excitement. Watch friends and family perform basic animal actions and sounds with hilarious results. Smart device App complements game play.

name: Themel
description:
Characteristics
With this game I tried to go a step further from what I tried to do when I created Dition, based on the same design philosophy. My intention here was to make a more consistent game, regarding to the formulation of its rules. I wanted the game to have two basic, simple rules. I was concerned about keeping the concept of simultaneity of actions at all times. Some features of GO, such as "once a piece is placed, it can not move," are not really consistent at all times in the unfolding of the game, regarding the concept with which they were raised. I tried to get rid of all philosophical inconsistency at the time of defining the rules of this game.

Equipment

Pieces
The pieces are circular. These pieces are characterized in that each has a range (a circular area whose diameter is three times the diameter of the piece). Each piece has one side painted white and the other black (like in Othello), and each player may chose one side (color) to play (then, the color of a piece is defined only when that piece is placed on the board, and keeps that color has long has its still on the board). Both sides have in the center a gray circle (its just decorative), whose diameter is equal to a quarter of the pieces' diameter.
To tell if a piece is within the range of another, just take a piece and place it over the two pieces. If the piece used to measure is supported by the two pieces, one can ensure that a piece is within the range of the other (and vice versa).
A total of 152 pieces are needed.

Board
The board has two concentric squares: the peripheral (whose side is equal to 19x the diameter of the pieces) and the central (whose side is equal to 17x the diameter of the pieces).
