The peripheral defines the playing area, and acts has a neutral piece ("gray piece"). In this sense, the central delimits its range.

Rules

At the start of the game the board is empty. Black plays first. Then both players play alternately. In his turn, a player can do one or two "relocation" moves. If he cant, the game ends, and that player loses.


Notes about the terms used:
"Belt": a group of pieces conforms a "belt" if every piece of the group is within the range of at least two of the other pieces of the group.
"Conditioned": a piece is not "conditioned" to a player when it is over the board, with his color facing the board, and since the group of pieces that are within its range (regardless of color) do not conform a belt.
"Relocate": a player makes a "relocation" move when he takes a "conditioned" piece from the board or from the outside of the board, and then places it on an empty place over the board or at the outside of the board.

name: Cooling Down!
description:
Educational/environmental boardgame with several different playing modes modeled on the forums of the World Climate Conference.

Publisher's English box text:
Is there any chance to reduce the man-made CO2 concentration in the atmosphere until 2050 to around 50%?
Te members of this unusual World Climate Conference -with the simulation game "Cooling Down!" must cooperate, otherwise there is no chance. They need education and money, but also courage and luck, in order to bring the important CO2 reduction strategies into being like in real life. To build up a sustainable future, -here is a trainingfield, to learn.
What does it mean to shape and contribute in climate justice and a culture of prevention actively?
Entertaining Learning. Knowledge of the future, cooperation and communication - interesting, exciting and meaningful. Would you like to be a savoir [sic!, one of many] of the world? Here you have a chance to get in touch with this challenge.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Wer fliegt mit?: Die große Weltreise
description: The players start from different cities and have to travel by plane around the world and back to their starting point. The players roll a die to earn money. They get as many coins as they roll eyes. When they have got enough coins to pay for their journey to the next city (as indicatet near the black line between the cities) they roll the color-die to determine if the reach the city (blue), wait one turn for better weather (yellow) or have engine trouble (red). In the later case the have to pay for the journey, but have to stay where they are and resume to earn money. The first player to complete his world tour wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Ducksopoly
description: A version of Monopoly sponsored by Ducks Unlimited.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Das Kolonialspiel: Wir befreien Afrika
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching Kapstadt (Capetown) going round Africa on both sides (west & east); game ends after 4 meeples reached Capetown. Winner gets most of payments-in/victory points.
- acting by turns -
Simple 'Roll & Move' game - move one of your 4 meeples forward according die roll. Ending on marked spaces follow instructions glued on lid inside. Push back other meeples, roll again if you have got a '3', skip a turn...
Theme: 'Free Germany's ex-colonies' related to spirit of the age & time
Note:
Likely published during 1930's
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Political, Racing, Travel

name: Space Coffee
description:
>…incoming transmission…receiving PCX1g82…
>…engaging PCX1g82 [auto-msg]…
>…engaged…[auto-msg: The leader in intergalactic Space Bean cultivation, trade and shipment, Space Coffee is here. To make your first cup our first priority…[end].

>Space Coffee is a morning-time space race for 1-4 'rising' coffeenauts, and takes about 15-30 minutes to play.

>Requires one cup/pot/french press/espresso machine/device of coffee (or other beverage), Space Coffee Star Map, 2d6, 7x Space Beans/tokens, 12x Ships/tokens.

>Players roll 2d6 and add the values together to generate energy (e). Energy is used to ready or move Ships, avoid black holes, engage in Space Battle, and to harvest or deliver Space Beans to Morning Star - “the premium intergalactic coffee roasting non-stop shop”.

Energy Guage
> 8e - You may not ready a Ship.
- Use only the highest die as Energy points.

≤ 8e - You may ready one Ship or dock at the Outpost.
- Use only the lowest die as Energy points.
Always remember the age-old adage: “If you ready a Ship, take a sip!”

>Ships are readied at a player's home Outpost and sent out for Space Bean collection and delivery. But space is weird and movement can be difficult in certain areologies. A simple areology index shows how much more energy is required when entering a hex of different types:

Areology Index
Black Space — 1e to enter; sip at will
Planet - 1e to enter
Space Haze — 2e to enter; a sip of coffee upon exit
Asteroids — 3e to enter; a sip of coffee upon exit

>But beware of black holes! At the start of every turn, any Ships within a 2-hex (or 3-hex for increased difficulty) radius are 'pulled' 1-hex towards that black hole! 'Pulled' in? Gone!

>Made it to a planet with a Space Bean on it? Gotta harvest that puppy!

Harvest a Space Bean from a Planet - 1e
-Ships carrying Space Beans may only move up to 2 hexes per turn!

>Deliver Space Beans to Morning Star by moving through its hi-tech non-stop-drop trackway!

Enter an adjacent Black Space hex with an open opposite Black Space hex and successfully move to the opposite hex.
Delivery — 2e; a sip of coffee

>Docking a Ship at an Outpost lets you move any one of your Ships 1-hex in any direction at the start of your turn. And some of the old outposts have copper-coil showers, and a shower is a good thing out in deep space. But bear in mind, it only takes entering a docked Outpost hex with +3e to return a docked Ship to that player's supply!

>Thought you were safe anywhere else in space? Think again! Engage in Space Battle by moving into an occupied hex with +2e remaining! Steal a Space Bean by rolling >3 with the unused die! Force an opponent into an occupied hex, destroy him!

>The game is over when all Ships have returned to a player’s outpost (total win), or when a player’s Black Hole has devoured all of the coffee in the cup/coffee pot/french press/espresso machine/device that started the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Civilization, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Akita War 1868
description:
This game reproduces the collision of Akita War of the latter half of the Boshin War, Shonai feudal clan and the Kubota feudal clan (Akita feudal clan).
One is in charge of other Ouetsu-reppan allied force (allied force) by a game of two play in new government troop.

Victory condition
If an allied force gains control of Akita, the allied force wins promptly.
Or new government troop wins promptly when new government troop gains control of Tsuruoka.
The draw becomes the victory of the new government troop.

Sequence
1. Reinforcement • Relocation phase
2. The first Shonai feudal clan action phase
3. Kubota feudal clan action phase
4. Allied force action phase
5. The first new government troop action phase
6. The second Shonai feudal clan action phase
7. The second new government troop action phase
8. Morale recovery phase

name: Infanterie Division Kommandeur
description:
Expansion for Panzer Division Kommandeur 2, 1944 East Front.
Total 80 counters in this module.

Time Scale : 1-2 days(8-12 turns)
Play time : 4-8 hours
Players : 2
Complexity : 3 (Highest 5)

name: Autoreise durch Europa
description: The players have to travel from one of four starting points to a set destinations or reverse. The movement of the meeples is determined by a die. In some cities, the players gain or lose game coins. The first player who arrives at his destinatin wins the game. The second place goes to the player, who has the most game coins at the end of his journey.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Grün - Gelb - Rot: Das Verkehrsspiel
description: The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 60 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. At certain spaces, traffic related events hinder or help the players, as described in the game rules. The game is designed to teach children about traffic signs.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: B.L.T. A Dicey Sandwich Game
description:
BLT - A Dicey Sandwich Game is a dice rolling game where players will press their luck as they try to earn money by building BLT sandwiches, earning tips, and avoiding burnt toast.

A turn consists of a player rolling the 12 custom dice, setting aside the ones they want, and re-rolling the ones they don't. Burnt Toast die can't be re-rolled and will take money away from a player's total. A turn ends when all dice are set aside or a player can chooses to stop rolling. The first player to $50 is declared the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Kakumei! Jinsei daifūgō
description:
Kakumei! Jinsei daifūgō (Revolution! Millionaire's life) is a variant of the classic Daihinmin.

This version has a new look and adds event cards.

name: Dragon's Path
description:
English version of the SárkánySakk board game (hungarian).


For all ages with simple rules to be learned easily, and still lots of possible strategies for elder gamers to develop.
3D gameplay experience.
Uncountable board variations.
Balanced gameplay, you always have the chance to overcome your opponents playing with any dragon.
Gameplay length is adjustable to your demand by setting the winning goal to the right value


The heart of the game is moving your dragon on to an orthogonally adjacent cube. When you move from one cube to another, you rotate the cube you are leaving, rotating it in the direction you are moving. If you rotate the cube you just left to the neutral color or your dragon’s color, you get to move your dragon again. In this way, the mottled board slowly becomes green when the green dragon moves, then becomes red when the red dragon moves. The goal of the game is to be the first dragon to score 100 points. Points are scored when you are done moving for your turn. Each cube with your color face up at the end of your turn counts as a point, whether you landed on it this turn or not.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures In Turtleopolis Game
description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Adventures In Turtleopolis, is graphically based on the late 80's cartoon that originated from the comic book by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird.

2 to 4 players play as one of the four Turtles competing around the board while trying to avoid traps and bad luck spaces. The object of the game is to reach the end of each game board, which supposedly represent a different mission:

Game 1: Race for the Blimp
Game 2: Fight for the Sky
Game 3: Battle for Cereal Castle
Game 4: Dash for Home

These four boards came on the back of the Ralston Cereal Boxes and as such are in conjunction a very simplistic version of similar games like "Snakes and Ladders". Just throw the dice and let luck decide in which space you´ll end up. Some spaces have rewards while others punishments.

There was another Ralston´s TMNT cereal box board game called "Adventures Under Turtleopolis" that came out during the same time, that featured amazing art with TMNT thematic enemies and elements such as the Technodrome and sewers.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Gemcutter
description:
You are a gemcutter, a master shaper and collector of rare and beautiful gemstones. You are constantly supplied with gems of all kinds from amber to diamonds. You compete with other gemcutters to amass the most valuable collection of gems.

Each player starts the game with a single random gem and the communal Market starts with three random gems. On a player's turn, he or she draws a random gem from the bag and adds it to his or her store. Then, he or she may add one of his or her gems to the Market to gain extra actions equal to the gem's value. The gems are valued 1-5, in order from least to greatest: amber, jet, emerald, ruby, and diamond. Then, that player takes 1 action (in addition any extra actions gained) in which he or she may: trade a gem with the Market, shape a gem, or add another gem to the Market.

When a player trades in a gem, he or she may take other gems from the Market less than or equal to the traded gem's value plus one. For example, if a ruby (value 4) is traded in, it is worth 5 and may be used to trade for a diamond (value 5), an emerald (value 3) and jet (value 2), and many other combinations based on what is available in the Market.

When a player shapes a gem, he or she places it on any of the three appropriate Shaping Tracks on the player aid. A gem may be Polished, then given a Fancy cut, then a Brilliant cut. A gem cannot be given a Fancy cut until it has been Polished and cannot be given a Brilliant cut until it has been given a Fancy cut. Polished gems are worth twice as many points at the end of the game. Fancy cut gems are worth triple and Brilliant cut gems are worth quadruple their values. However, it takes a number of turns equal to its value to be shaped. For example, an emerald (value 3) takes 3 turns to make an uncut gem into a Polished gem. Therefore, the more the points, the longer it takes to shape it.

When the last gem is taken from the bag, the current player finishes his or her turn and then the game proceeds to scoring. The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Trading, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Wedge-It
description:
Wedge-It is played on a board of forty equilateral triangles arranged in a hexagonal grid. Each player has nine pieces which are equilateral triangles with handles (these are created by cutting and folding provided sheets).

The handle of each piece identifies its front. A piece may move into the space adjacent to its front by rotating around either adjacent vertex. A piece may also jump an opposing piece if its front is adjacent to one of the opposing piece's sides.

The object is to make it impossible for the opponent to move.

This is one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's "Games With Depth," all of which had folded 3D paper pieces.

name: Islamic Jihad: "The Mother of All Surrenders"
description:
Islamic Jihad is a parodic micro-game about the first Gulf War. It can be played by any number of players, each of whom represents an Iraqi Army commander. Each commander has 100 troops and must travel 10 miles (in 1/10 mile increments) in order to surrender to American troops.

Play is entirely driven by die rolls. Each turn players roll on a main table which directs them to roll on one of six other tables, which may require more dice rolls, etc. Eventually each player will find that they move backwards or forwards some number of spaces or lose some number of troops.
publishers: The Great American Game Company, Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

name: Cabriole
description:
Cabriole is a medium-weight worker placement, card drafting, and resource management game for 2-5 players aged 13 and up, and playable in 60-90 minutes.

Set in London during the early 1700's, players aim to create the most successful furniture studios by hiring skilled craftsmen such as carvers, joiners, and turners; purchasing raw materials such as wood and silk; and fulfilling customer orders for tables, chairs, and cabinets. Players must balance the need for capital with the importance of increasing their studio's prestige throughout the city. The player who has scored the most prestige points at the end of six rounds is declared the winner.

name: Archmagery
description:
Archmagery is a battle of duelling mages, their summoned monsters, dazzling and devastating spells, and powerful magical items, where only the cleverest – or sometimes luckiest – wizard will rise to ultimate power and can claim the title of Archmage!

The aim of the game is to become the most powerful wizard, which can be achieved in a number of ways, from eliminating all your rival wizards, to gaining the Artefacts of Power. Although let’s be honest – killing your opponents to win is much more fun!

Game features include:

Eight wizards, aligned to the spheres of power: Earth, Air, Fire, Water, Animal, Plant, Acid, and Death.
A host of monsters from lowly kobolds, skeletons, and gnolls, through to the might of creatures such as the dragon vine, the battle giant, and the iron golem.
A compendium of spells including those that will transform monsters, steal your opponents’ magic, deflect spells away, bind monsters immobile, strengthen and weaken monsters, and more.
A hoard of treasures including rings and amulets that grant magical immunity, enchanted horns to summon monsters to battle, magical weapons, powerful arcana to increase spellcasting power, and more.
Fast and furious game play with battling monsters and spell-slinging as each wizard strives for supremacy.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Egypt: David vs. Goliath – The Italian-African Campaign
description:
This is a WWII simulation about the campaign in North Africa. It is a typical hex and counter game with units representing regiments, brigades, and battalions maneuvering on a paper map. Players attempt to duplicate the historical results to achieve a victory.

Includes a sheet of uncut counters, a paper map, and a rule booklet. It was published in "Ziploc" format so there is no box.

Per a description in Fire & Movement #60 it is a variant for Afrika Korps and requires that game to play.

name: Around The Horn
description: While watching a baseball game, all players are dealt 7 cards. The remainder of the deck becomes the draw pile. Before each at bat, all players select one card from their hand, trying to predict the outcome of the at bat. Any number of players may select the same card. If the result of the play is a gomer or triple, player that selected that result receive 2 points. Any other result, players that selected a matching result receive 1 point. All cards selected cards are discarded replaces drawn and then next at bat is played. After the game ends the player with the most points wins.

name: Super Smash Bros. The Board Game
description:
Use Nintendo characters to battle opponents using special abilities, items and maneuverability tactics to win the battle. Matches may be timed with a timer or players may use stock number of lives.

Featuring 8 popular Nintendo Smash Bros characters to choose from; Mario, Donkey Kong, Bowser, Link, Pikachu, Fox, Samus, and Kirby!

Each of the characters will have unique special abilities they can perform and that will do damage to opponents just like in the video game. Abilities will do a certain number of damage to an opponent. Once a player’s character has reached damage level of 20 there considered critical. Perform ability 3 to give them a final smash attack to send them flying!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Video Game Theme

name: Taudelon Station
description:
Taudelon Station is a game that shares elements with traditional card games and modern economy games. Players will use their hands of cards to create resources and currency so they can build various modules. These modules are worth points at the end of the game and they also modify how the game plays as well. A unique aspect to Taudelon Station is that these modifications change the game for all of the players, not just for the players who own the modules.

Players’ hands come from a deck of cards that has five suits, numbered 1 to 9. Players will either play a combination of at least two cards that equal exactly 10 to create a resource (called Elements), or they will play a combination of cards similar to the various types of Poker hands (pair, full house, etc.) to create the currency (called Energy) that works with the resources to let players build the modules.

Meanwhile, unidentified aliens are swarming around the station, and while the game is fully competitive, the players all must defend the station against the aliens or everyone loses.

name: RPM Street
description:
A street racing deck-building game.

Each player gets a unique vehicle with varying strengths and weaknesses.

Each round, players will try to have more power than their opponents so as to get a better trophy. However, they must simultaneously strive to have sufficient handling in order to avoid taking damage, which not only saturates your deck with useless cards, but also decreases your overall score.

Once one of the three trophy card stacks (Bronze, Silver, and Gold) is depleted, the game ends. Players count their total score from their trophies and then subtract one for each damage card in their deck. Whoever has the highest score wins!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Race

name: It's a Cinch
description:
Described by the publisher as a "multiplication and division poker game," It's a Cinch is an educational game designed to teach multiplication tables. Three stacks of poker-style chips with answers to multiplication tables printed on them are placed in the center of the table. Each player is dealt five cards with single-digit numbers. Each player in turn tries to find two cards in their hand that can be multiplied to match the total on one of the three top chips. The player then captures that chip, discards the two played cards, and draws two new cards. They player may then try to capture another chip (up to three per turn). When the player reaches three chips or cannot capture another chip, play passes to the next player. If a player makes a mistake and plays the wrong cards to capture a chip, the player must put both that chip and one previously-captured chip on the bottom of one stack and pass his turn. After all the chips are claimed, the player with the most chips wins.

There are a couple of variants which add extra rules, as well as a solitaire version.

name: Quizmo Vocabulary
description: Educational game of bingo to teach antonyms and synonyms. Cards are laid out just like a bingo game (5 x 5 grid), but the "free" space is labeled either as "antonyms" or "synonyms". The rest of the spaces are words. The game leader pick a word from the 121-calling card deck and call it out. Those players with "antonym" on their free space will cover any word that is an antonym of the called word. Those players with "synonym" on their free space will cover any word that is a synonym of the called word. Any player who covers 5 spaces in one row of their card - either vertically, horizontally or diagonally, will call out "Quizmo!". They are the winner of that game.

name: The Belongers
description:
Once upon a time there were two villages--alike in every way-- nestled in a land surrounded by fog. It was obvious to each that the other did not belong...

The Belongers is a 2-player semi-abstract strategy game, played without a board, wherein each player tries to raze the opposing village to win.

The game is set up by arranging the hexagonal terrain tiles in one of the map configurations available in the rulebook (or a custom map created by the players).

On their turn, each player takes two of the three possible actions: draft a terrain tile to the map, draft a unit, or move and/or attack with a unit.

Additionally, each unit may use its special ability AND terrain bonus once per turn. Each of the units has a unique special ability, and each of the terrains offers a unique bonus...creating huge number of possible combinations for players to explore as they maneuver around the map, attack enemies (either directly, or by pushing them into hostile terrains), and finally, destroying the opposing castle.

A deep strategy war game that plays any small flat surface.

name: The Autumn War
description:
A cooperative game set in the aftermath of the War of Oak and Pine.

In The Autumn War, players each assume the role of a member of the Oak Kingdom or Pine Kingdom or a member of the outcast Walnut tribe. Players work together to reveal map locations, hoping to find the bodies of loved ones they lost in the recent battle. Along the way, they must overcome hazardous terrain, inclement weather, and insidious creatures.

Players will need to rely on each other, as well as their ability to find useful items and safe locations to protect them from harm and to survive through the night.

Can you find your lost loved ones and put them to rest before they turn into Lonely Ghosts?

name: GeoKnow
description:
Designed by contestants of the 2014 series of the hit BBC show "The Apprentice". Manufactured and distributed by Drummond Park

Explore the world with your family and GeoKnow. Learn about language, food, movies, songs, and lots more in a hilarious and and interactive way. Have fun using your best drawing, and performance skills, you have to get your team to guess what country it is!

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Blood for Blood
description: This Adventure Path Set (#18) contains 50 cards and is part of the 3rd expansion, Sands of Oblivion. With all seven Sands of Oblivion expansion decks, over 100 all-new cards are added.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Memofrutti
description: A memory game based on the theme of scents (24 scented cards). 2 levels of play: first, a matching game of fruit to it's corresponding slice, then scratch the scented area of the fruit and match the pairs based on their unique smell. Contains 12 fruit cards and 12 fruit slices cards.

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – War on the Plains
description: This Adventure Path Set (#9) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Deverenian and the other is Nothrog. It is part of the Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition's first expansion, Shattered Empires.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – The Dark Heart of the Forest
description: This Adventure Path Set (#1) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Free Kingdoms and Elf is the other. This marks the beginning of Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Against the Tyrants
description: This Adventure Path Set (#2) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is The Chosen and Dwarf is the other. This is the second set for Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Forbidden Knowledge of Kylnion
description: This Adventure Path Set (#4) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Elf and Nothrog is the other. This expansion is for Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Ambush in the Swamps of Eban-Tarsis
description: This Adventure Path Set (#5) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Nothrog and The Chosen is the other. This expansion is for Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – The Gargoyle's Retribution
description: This Adventure Path Set (#6) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Dwarf and Deverenian is the other. This expansion is for Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Pop City
description:
The object of the game is to end up on your colored circle in POP CITY ESTATES with the most money or win automatically by being the first person to reach the POT-O-GOLD.

Players start with $2,500 each. Using two dice die the players make their way around the board through the 8 Soda Towns buying properties as the go.

name: Obsessive Cartographer
description:
Obsessive Cartographer is a solitaire game for the Tiledeck.

Setup

Shuffle the tiles face-down.
Draw one tile and place it face-up on the table.


Overview
You just woke up in a dark room (represented by the tile on the table). You see one to four doorways (spots at the edges of the tile) leading out of the room. This suggests you are in a mappable location. You are obsessed with mapping, and of course have your cartography tools with you. Choose a direction to explore, and try to map all 60 rooms!

Goal
Map the darkness!

Play

On each turn, choose a doorway to walk through (anywhere on your budding map).
Draw a room (tile), and place it face-up adjacent to that doorway, such that a doorway on the new tile matches with the one through which you just walked. If there are any other adjacent rooms, their doorways or walls must match: You can never have a doorway up against a wall!


Game End

If the room you drew can’t legally fit, you have discovered that you have made a cartographic error, and you go into fits thinking about how you can fix your map! You lose consciousness, and while you lie on the floor, your mind carefully blocks out the whole experience.
If, however, you place the 60th room legally, you are quite pleased with yourself, pack up your new completed map, and take a nap. While you sleep, something gives you a mighty whack on the head and eats your map; you won’t remember any of this when you wake.

name: The Greatest Military Commander
description:
1. An epic military game focused on ranks and branches.

2. Win trick to defeat your opponents.

3. Formulate a plan that works best for your hand

4. Be the first to discard all your cards to win the game.

5. Make strategic moves with variou special cards.

name: Warlord: Saga of the Storm – Ports of Treachery
description: This Adventure Path Set (#8) contains 110 cards in two different pre-constructed decks; one is Free Kingdoms and elf is the other. This expansion is for Warlord: Saga of the Storm 4th Edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Kikes Kekis
description:
Meet the Giges and Gegis in this quick-witted card game.
Be the first to see correct combinations.
Train your concentration, speed, judgment, and awareness.
Win by scoring the most points.
Don't stammer ! Make the right call !

A useful tool to sharpen your mind and keep it sharp.
Easy to learn and easy to play.

name: Oklahoma Boomers: Silver Mines
description:
Oklahoma Boomers: Silver Mines is a mini-expansion for Oklahoma Boomers, that adds silver mines to the game.

Players will score 10 points for every silver mine located within their homestead at the end of the game.

The mini-expansion contains 5 silver mines represented by translucent crystals, that are placed on the board at the beginning of the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Oklahoma Boomers: Red River
description:
Oklahoma Boomers: Red River is a mini-expansion for Oklahoma Boomers, that adds river tokens to the game.

"The Red River runs along the border between Oklahoma and Texas, flowing towards the Mississippi. At its widest, it is 150 meters wide from shore to shore. Quite an obstacle today, and even more so for the people living there around 1890."

The mini-expansion contains 18 Red River tokens.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Pigeon vole ou pas?
description:
A communication and speed game for the whole family where you have to do the appropriate movement linked to the shown card.
Pigeon is flying but what is the mouse doing?
Do it fast and correcly and win the game!

name: Vanquish
description:
The Earth is a dead husk. Having mined all of its resources, facing a population many times that which could be possibly sustained and slowly mutating it into a massive, cloying, choking city, we had no choice but to set our greedy eyes on the planets around us and conquer new lands.

After the Information War of the 21st century, the Corporations dissolved national borders and began a new war of their own: the Resource War. Like their European ancestors, who conquered and fought over new land, the corporations started to clash for control of the stars around Earth, as if they had claims to them from the moment of their conception.

Thus began the new arms race, but this time the lessons learned from past wars would be embraced and used to leverage as much advantage as possible. Research into more advanced abilities to control not only the battles, but the hearts and minds of the people who fight them would become key to victory.
Vanquish is a game of intergalactic warfare amongst rival corporations in Earth’s dark future with a near endless number of system configurations and multiple paths to victory – through the council, through research of technologies and advanced abilities, via the creation of popular utopian worlds, or by the might of your powerful fleets.

Each player steps into the powerful and all encompassing shoes of the head of one of the five corporations fighting for the control of the universe. You will need to use cunning, guile, diplomacy, deception, and tactical thinking to make the decisions that will hopefully bring victory, control, renown, and respect to your corporation.

In each round of the game, players select four actions to perform. Players in turn perform one of these. Whenever an action is performed, all other players may also perform that action. The available actions are: Fleet (move ships), Research (develop tech), Council (Create votes on new rules), Planetary (develop your civilization), Energy (generate resources) and Logistics (build new ships). Players score points for colonizing worlds, developing tech, building colonies, passing votes and developing their civilization. The game ends when one player has accumulated 15 points, but that player does not necessarily win, as there are bonus points scored for being the best player in each of several categories.

name: Contact
description:
User Summary:

Contact is a 30 minute social game for 4-16 friendly players. It focuses on physical contact between participants; testing imagination, communication, and intuition—An ice breaker meant to challenge social boundaries.

Players gather in a circle and take turns interacting with new partners. Each pair finds a way to make physical contact that hasn't already been done in the game. If they succeed, they each earn 1 point.

Each player receives a quirk card that tells them one way they must behave during the game (e.g. "Avoid Eye Contact"). If you can guess a person's quirk, you received a point, and they get a new quirk.

The game ends when everyone has partnered with everyone else once. The person with the most points wins.

NOTE: This was game was a submission to the Golden Cobra Challenge 2014. However, it is much more of a social/party/ice-breaker game than a role-playing game, and has been added as such to BGG with the permission of the designer. The rules for the game are available on the Golden Cobra Challenge website.

name: Angriff auf Moskau
description:
Angriff auf Moskau (Valkyria Chronicles Parallel Worlds)
Blended Wargaming & RPG

This game portrays the battle for Moscow in 41, blended within the Valkyria Chronicles Parallel Worlds.

PRODUCT


Modular Game Series.
30 Episodes per Map.
Simple I-go, You-go system.
Simplified Terrain Effect Chart (TEC).
General (Characters) activate combat units.
Ages 8 and up.




GAME


Valkyria Wehrmacht Divisions.
Valkyria Soviet Corps.
1 Turn = 1 Week.
Playing time: ½h to +20h.
Each commanding General has unique abilities (through Card playing).




ACTIONS


Deploy powerful Panzer Divisions.
Deploy fearful SS Hitlerjugend Divisions (These don’t make prisoner).
Hordes of Soviet Corps.
Build bridges at rivers.
Siege Cities.




FEELINGS

Intense Card Playing.
Intense Battle Situations.
Character RPG gaming.

name: Vino de vrolijke inktvis
description:
Vino de vrolijke inktvis (Vino the happy squid) is a game of color, suitable for kids aged 3 years and up.

Every player chooses a color and and puts it in front om him/her.
The youngest player starts and throws the die. If your color has been thrown, you may put 1 of your beads on vinos legs. First player with no beads left, is the winner.

This game is designed to learn different colors and counting.

name: ROOT\G: boardgame
description:
RootG is a sci-fi strategy boardgame set in a futuristic world where humans are near to be enslaved from the overwhelming techonlogy of the HIksos, an alien race from the outer space.

The player chanllege each other for activating the cube, the weapon create for save the humanity

In R.O.O.T.\G: tile based game two or three players compete to reassemble the electronic board of the ancient Cube. Players place tiles in turns and build up circuits trying to reach their secret objective. Each tile may modify the speed of each player and may turn the tide. Only a perfect balance of strategy, creativity, foresight and promptness will allow you to catch the perfect timing to beat your opponents!

thanks to the three ruleset you can easly play with the "child educational mode" designed to introduce younger people to the dynamic world of eletronics, otherwise you can play with normal, advanced or the "Hard-Code" ruleset for harder games

name: LilleStorm til fest
description:
To train children's growing understanding of playing games with relaxing fun and social interaction.
The game also stimulates children's recognition, helps them understand abstracts and, not least, trains their language skills.

The game is a memory game, but instead of matching two face down cards as in the classic Memory, the player need only to remember one; the player board contains three objects similar to those in the game, and the player need to find the object from their player board(s).

In turn (starting by the youngest player), each player flips over one face down card and show it openly; if the player see it matches his/her player board (s)he can take it and place it there, if it is wrong the tile is flipped and the next player have the turn.

When matched three items, the player now needs to find (or remember where to find) a "happening". First to match three (or six if played with two boards) items and a happening wins the game.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: EUROPA - ASIEN - AFRIKA  Eine Reise in heisse Länder mit Sinalco
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space (135)/ending round trip.
- moving by turns -
active player moves forward according die roll; ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.
note:
likely published during 1960's

name: Die Gulaschkanone: Ein Heeres-Nachschub-Spiel
description:
The two players each have 3 armies (red, yellow, blue) with 3 divisions. The goal of the game is to bring a provision transports (meeples) from the depot to every division. Movement is determined by a die. On several spaces the transports will be shelled and may be delayed or destroyed. The player who gets the most transports (meeples) to his field kitchens wins the game.

This Game was published during World War II.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Six Degrees of Separation
description:
Six Degrees of Separation challenges players to build their own chain of Actors and films that separate two actors by 6 Degrees.

Players must race to be the first to create an alternating chain of 8 actors and 7 films they have in common. With six actors between the first and last, you get a separation of Six Degrees.

There are no turns. The game ends when one player has succeeded in completing a six degree chain.

But it's not that simple...

Films and Actors each have different point values. The winning player is not necessarily the the first player to achieve six degrees, but the one with the highest value chain.

Players will find Action cards that can help them or hinder their opponent(s). Maggie Smith might have a Wardrobe Malfunction on the red carpet or "I, Frankenstein" might be voted Best Film.

Having started his film career in 1978’s “Animal House”, by 2000 actor Kevin Bacon had come to appear in many of the most successful films in the last decade of the twentieth century. Appearing in such films as “JFK”, “A Few Good Men”, “Apollo 13”, and “Hollow Man”, just to name a few, Kevin Bacon seemed to have worked with just about every other popular actor in Hollywood.

1993’s “Six Degrees of Separation”, with Stockard Channing, Will Smith, and Donald Sutherland, speculated that every person on the
planet was only removed from another person by no more than six other individuals between the two.

It didn’t take long for a new parlor game to make its way through the L.A. party scene, and eventually into the general population called “Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon”. Players, starting with Kevin Bacon and another actor from any film that had ever been made, are challenged to create a chain between the two using films in which pairs of actors appear.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Batalla de Zama
description:
Second game in the Grandes Batallas del Mundo (GBM) series.

Batalla de Zama is a "wargame", based on the battle at Zama 202 BC, where Annibal lost against Publio Cornelio Escipion. It was the end of the Second Punic War.

It has simple rules: The units can move one to three spaces (depends of each type) and battles are resolved by dice rolls; thus modified by strength of the units (infantry, cavalry, elephant) and area.
The aim is to kill the opponents leaders or to capture the opponents "flag-spaces".

The miniatures are beautiful hand painted figures.

The rules and the units are similar to the components of the first GBM game (Batalla del Metauro). The board is the main difference. It inlcudes also a new miniature, the Roman Trumpeter. the new rules for this unit are printed on the back of the board.
This game was only published by Rojas y Malaret in Spain.

name: El Alamein!
description:
Fourth game in the Grandes Batallas del Mundo (GBM) series.

German-Italian (Rommmel) vs Ally armies (Montgomery) in the II World War battle, in El Alamein! (North Africa).

Each aplayer controls infantry, artillery, tanks and airplanes. The movement and the combat of the units are different. Combats are solved by dice rolling, with unit and terrain modifications.
On the board there are some special items: railroads along the coast (to move faster), or mines (you can desactivate a mine and move later on this space).

The phases in the round are controled by a cilindrical "time scoreboard".

To win you need to place two units on the flag spaces of the other player's army.

name: Batalla de Zama Complemento de la serie Romanos contra Cartagineses
description:
Big expansion, for the first (Batalle del Metauro) and the second (Batalla de Zama) game in the "Grandes Batallas del Mundo" (GBM)

game series by Rojas y Malaret.
It includes new figures and miniatures: Three trumpeters for the Roman player (unit not included in the first game, only in the second), and two horses and one elephant for the Carthaginian player. The box included all the collectible materials these games always had inside (historical booklet, cards, etc.).

The miniatures are beautiful hand painted figures.
This expansion was only published by Rojas y Malaret in Spain.

name: Pick Stick Oh!
description:
From the the box:

A great new card game based on Pick Up Sticks. Pile the cards and take turns picking up as many cards as you can. Can you move your card without shifting the stack? It's fun--it's quick. It's Pick Stick Oh!

Pick Stick Oh! is a new twist on the classic Pick Up Sticks, played with cards rather than sticks. Players are dealt cards and then take turns tossing them into a pile. Each card must overlap another card. After all the cards are placed, each player takes turns trying to take a card off the stack without shifting any other cards sideways (lifting up is okay). Cards have point values from 1 to 5. If a player takes a red 2 or 3 successfully, he or she gets another turn. The player with the most total points at the end of the game wins.

name: Spring!
description:
Each player starts with one pawn at the starting space with the red flag. The goal of the game is to reach the center space (blanket) with all pawns of one's color (4 or 2). Movement is determined by a die. Only on the roll of a 6 another meeple may enter the game. If a pawn gets to a cove it may jump over the blue spaces, if the result of the die allows it. Otherwise it has to take the long way around the cove. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the other meeple is thrown into the water and has to start again.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SS Tiger Keil
description:
SS Tiger Keil is a two-player war simulation game that recreates the extreme fighting opposing the German II SS-Panzer Corps and the Soviet 5th Guards Tank Army employing a modern and innovative twist in gameplay.

Prologue

“…within the wide ranging continuous battle, a week after the Germans started Operation Zitadelle the Soviets finally launched powerful counterattacks against the Germans. One engagement stood out in the south at Prokhorovka, the 5th Guards Tank Army counterattacked the II SS-Panzer Corps, resulting in a large clash of armor just outside the settlement on 12 July 1943...”

Estimates vary about the numbers involved but it generally thought that a combined total of over a thousand tanks clashed that day, which today proves to be incorrect.

Product

• A “classical” revamped war board game portraying the 12th of July climatic battle at Prokhorovka;
• Game concept complexity targeted at a specific audience such as:
  o Memoir 44 players;
  o Axies & Allies players;
  o Although, very suitable to new or experienced wargamers;
• Streamlined gameplay mechanics offer adequate pace of play;
• Gameplay delivers operational and tactical feelings, depending on what the player is doing;

Quality Compliance

Initial design captured 100% sourced realistic historical data (based on George Nipe Jr. study);
Map and OOB reflects most updated information about the battle;
Game may reflect most updated and accepted outcome of the battle, but the game system guarantees that every game is totally different;


Features

Stacking: 1 combat unit per Hex;
No CRT (no security echelons in combat);
No Halving Calculations (only minor additions and subtractions);
Armor range firing (up to 1.5 km for the Tiger I);
LOS (1 rule);
Maximization of Mechanics Streamlining (focused on learning pedagogics);


Scale

A hex represents approximately 750 Meters of terrain from side to side;
Each turn represents an average time span from 1 to 2 hours;
Combat units are mostly infantry regiments, Mechanized, Tank Brigades and Panzer Kampfgruppe;
Some units add simple chrome to the game and gameplay;


Play Time

Scenarios range from 1/2h to 4-5 Hours
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Na gruzińskim szlaku
description: This 2-4 player game teaches the participants about Georgia, by using trivia cards with questions that the players need to answer to achieve their goals. It has been created as part of a special Polish/Georgian state cooperation program.

name: Wenn der Hund mit der Wurst...
description:
Objective:
be the first reaching home with your dog & sausage
- moving by turns -
Each player, starting from home posisition (corner), moves forwards according die roll, trying to catch the sausage in the centre of the board with a matching number. As soon as you got it you should move back home avoiding to lose the sausage to another player/dog...
note: game likely published early/mid 1960s
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Generales
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 2 miniatures, sandclock, 2 cups and die, plus historical booklet and 1 collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Caballería romana
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 4 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Caballería cartaginesa
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 4 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Cartagineses
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Íberos
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Príncipes romanos
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Legionarios
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Romanos contra Cartagineses: Elefantes
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Romanos contra Cartagines" series.
With 2 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.

name: Pieles Rojas contra Cuchillos Largos
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Guerras Indias" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.
Miniatures:
- 4 yankees: 1 official + 3 soldiers
- 4 indians: 3 warriors + 1 chief with horse
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Pieles Rojas de caballería contra Cuchillos Largos
description:
Expansion of the GBM games, in the "Guerras Indias" series.
With 8 miniatures, plus historical booklet and 1 random collectible card.
Miniatures:
- 4 yankees: 1 official + 3 soldiers
- 4 indians: 3 warriors with horse + 1 chief with horse
categories: American Indian Wars, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures

name: Pitch Master
description:
The players are the owners of competing advertising agencies, producing TV spots, printed ads etc.

The game board and part of the game mechanics are closely related to monopoly (Dice, Movement, Income on start field, chance/community-like cards). The players buy resources like a film production company or a gourmet restaurant, which they and the other players need for their campaigns.

To win, a player has to obtain three different prizes. (1) Young Businessman Award: Obtained by having 250k money. (2) Ad Award: Obtained by reaching one of three fields on the game board. (3) Pitch Award: Obtained by winning three pitches.

For a pitch, two players draw storyboards for an ad campaign about a given topic and then do a presentation of their idea. Then the other players decide who wins the pitch.

The game box shows the ORF (Austrian national public service broadcaster) Logo. Copyright by Berlini/Jung Pollak, Designed by EDGE project, WIEN. Produced by Schmidt Spiele.
categories: Dice, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Rondo Familienspiele
description:
A set of different, paper-based parlor games in a cardboard brochure folder containing 3 separate booklets with 24 pages each. Each booklet contains the rules of the game and the corresponding texts for the board games.

Many variations around the general idea of a printed text which is enriched by the players by secretly and subsequently adding names, attributes and other words to the story. This is mostly done by filling in a word, folding the sheet to cover it and passing it on to the next player. In the end the sheet is unfolded and read aloud to the amusement of the participants. As a variation, the words are asked for and filled in by a gamemaster, who doesn't disclose the original text until the very end.

Available topics were as follows:

Series 1: Sekretär, Lebensart, Literatur I (Assistant, Lifestyle, Literature I)
Series 2: Inserate, Heilerfolge, Literatur II (Newspaper Ads, Successful Cures, Literature II)
Series 3: Historie, Biographie, Literatur III (History, Biography, Literature III)
Series 4: Steckbrief, Gerichtssaal, Literatur IV (Profile, Court of Law, Literature IV)


The Jugendstil (Art Nouveau) design of the games may place them in the early 20th century (around 1900-1910).

name: Stardrive
description:
The earth has been stripped of resources and now the human race has set out to colonize a New World. On the way players will explore planets and astroid, build outposts and Starbases, excavate alien artifacts, upgrade abilities and often blow each other up. Once players land on the new world they will choose which branch of government to form, and this will determine how they will score points based on the actions they took getting there.

StarDrive is a clever combination of racing and 4X game elements.

A turn consists of rolling dice and placing them on a faction control panel, and then taking an action determined by the dice that were placed. Dice that are not used to perform an action can be saved for later turns or rerolled.

There are eight factions to choose from and many ways to customize them during play
categories: Dice, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: AkTYwuj Warszawę
description: AkTYwuj Warszawę (Activate Warsaw) is a game for 2 to 6 players, aged 8 and up, which focuses on the civic involvement of young people. Its goal is to move around the board and complete tasks found around the landmarks of the Polish capital of Warsaw. In order to do this, players have to answer questions about civic issues and activities.

name: Magiczna Warka
description:
Magiczna Warka is a game about historical trivia surrounding the town and community of Warka. The goal of the game is to find the fragments of a magical crystal, scattered across different time periods and places in and around the town. Player tasks include reaching a particular space on the board or answering questions to gain the crystal fragments they need to collect to win.

The game's creation has been requested by the Local Activity Group Warka. The project was co-financed by the Polish Ministry of Culture and National Heritage.

name: Plus i Minus: Nietypowo o Zdrowiu
description:
This game aims at educating the players about positive and negative behaviour connected to health, physical activity, nutrition etc. It has been designed by an association specializing in working with troubled youth. The game is informative and encourages players to search for more information on the topics it's covering.

Players move around the board if they are able to complete different tasks, including answering quiz questions, doing light workout (like situps) and showing situations via pantomime. Each completed task allows the player to move forward on the board, and the first player to the finish line wins.
publishers: Centrum Profilaktyki i Edukacji Społecznej PARASOL, Kuźnia Gier

name: Proces Legislacyjny
description: The game has been created by request of the Polish Chancellery of the Senate, and has been financed by that institution. Its goal is to teach the players about the process of legislation in Poland. In this simple educational game, players move around the board and interact with the game by drafting and collecting cards.

name: Pioniersi
description:
The game was produced by request of the Dobra Sieć foundation. It was aimed at teenagers living in the eastern parts of Poland, and was distributed among local NGO, recreation centres, public libraries etc.

The players move around the board and answer quiz-style questions to gain points needed to complete their goals. An alternate type of task may be to reach a particular space on the board, which directs the player's movement.

name: Achtung Kreuzung: Das neue Verkehrsspiel
description: The players have to move from "Start" to "Ziel". Movement is determined by two diece. If a player gets to a space with a traffic card, he has to observe the rules on the backside of the card.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mud Eagle One
description:
ATTN: Cpt [DATA WITHHELD]

Captain,

At 0747Z, a foreign object that had entered the Earth`s atmosphere within U.S. airspace airburst in a multi-megaton event over [DATA WITHHELD]. The blast area is Code Black.

Hostile non-terrestrial combatants have emerged from the debris plume and have engaged national defense elements. These elements are being depleted.

Your Lawmaker has been assigned to the task force Mud Eagle 1 (ME1). ME1 is to prepare for an immediate combat operation outside of the Pentagon’s defense perimeter. You will depart for this operation at current readiness status.

ME1`s mission is to hold it’s position against any attack while evacuations occur. You will not be relieved from this mission.

ME1 is weapons free from the moment you recieve this communication, Cpt. [DATA WITHHELD]

Do not tune in to any civilian communications for any reason.

Katherine L. Weinberg,

Chairman, National Security Council

Mud Eagle One is a cooperative score attack strategy game for 1-2 players. Each player is the captain of a Lawmaker; a warship-esque super-heavy land vehicle. Their objective is to hold at all costs against hostile attackers, inflicting as much damage as possible against enemy contacts until being destroyed.

Players will draw personnel, vehicle, gear and munitions cards that will comprise their forces to be leveraged for their mission. These forces will require a constant stream of logistics support to remain operational, and managing those logistics will be the key to achieving a positive score.

Play time is about 2 hours.
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Magellan: Bijkomende geschiedkundige kaarten
description:
This is an extension to the Fallon game Magellan. This extension contains 50 additional historical cards in 5 themes:

Temporary history
Mountains
Harbours
Farming and cattle breeding
Wars and vulcanoes

name: Escape
description:
Game developped by the former Danish football player Knud Lundberg.

Each player gets:

One board, divided into four quarters (A, B, C and D)
One set of pieces, which are six coloured tokens (Green, Red, Yellow or Blue) and 30 Black. The coloured markers have arrows which is important to the game.


The purpose of the game is to catch the other players snakes, even by hitting it's head or by trapping it:
In the beginning each player chooses his colour, with each their Quarter, (s)he then places the coloured pieces in the shape of a snake (here the arrows is important, as they shows the snake's direction).

The players hide this information and the first player places a black marker on each of the other players Quarters of his/her own board where (s)he believes that the other player's snake(s) are located; the other players place a black marker on the same spots. If a snake is hit it have to be anounced and the black marker is placed under the coloured. When the third piece is placed, the players move their snake one step ahead, and the next player goes. When it is your turn you move your snake one space - but you are not allowed to place the head where there already is a black spot.

The player who get's his snake closed in, or hit in the head is out of the game.

The game is from the 1950s.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: World's Fair Game
description: Brilliantly lithographed board, showing an exact reproduction of the Exposition grounds and buildings at Chicago. The object of the game is to move your piece around the board and the person who exits the grounds first wins. The board measures 13 1/2 x 20 1/2 inches.

name: Bunny Hop
description:
Bunny Hop is "a child's first alphabet game."

Players draw cards to move along a track marked with the letters of the alphabet. When a player lands on a space, he or she must name the letter on the space. An older player or adult determines if the player is correct. When a player passes the starting space, he or she collects a carrot token. The first player to circle the board twice and collect two carrot tokens wins.

In the advanced game, each player must name the letter on the space, say a word that starts with the letter and name the letters before and after.

The game board is made of twelve large puzzle pieces which must be assembled before play.

name: Fruitz of the Spirit
description:
From the box:
"Collect 5 matching Fruitz from the Seed Pile, the Good Soil Pile, or another person to fill up your row! When the Fruitz have been pick, the person with the greatest Harvest wins! Try to avoid the deceitful and wicked Sinful Nature card or you could be in a jam."

Fruitz of the Spirit is a set collection game of set collection. Cards display pictures of various fruits and are named for virtues mentioned in Galatians 5:13-23.

Players try to collect as many sets of five matching cards as possible from a total of nine different card types. Each player starts with five face-down cards. They turn one up at a time, and may take the card from the face-up draw pile if it matches or draw a face-down card. They may also take any matching cards that any other players have face-up. A Sinful Nature card causes the player to lose a turn. When a player makes a set of five of the same card, known as an orchard, he may harvest the orchard by turning the cards upside-down and setting them aside.

The game ends when the draw pile is exhausted. The player with the most harvested orchards wins.

name: The Great Bug Hunt
description:
From the box:
"Bug out with the highest score by counting as may insect cards as possible without turning over a bird card."

The Great Bug Hunt: The Unbuglieveable Insect Counting Card Game! is a push-your-luck type card game. Players take turns turning over cards one at a time from the draw pile of 46 bugs and 6 birds. They score one point for each bug card turned over. Tbey may choose to end their turn whenever they like. However, they must avoid turning over one of the bird cards. If they turn over a bird, it eats all their bugs and their turn ends with no points scored. If a player ends their turn before turning over a bird, they keep their points. When all bird cards have been turned over, the entire deck is reshuffled. First player to a predetermined number of points (40 for 2 to 4 players and 25 for 5+ players is suggested) wins.

name: Pro Circuit Racing
description:
From the PDF

A Simple Hobby Game for 1 to 8 Players

In the real world, Pro Circuit Racing is a game that models small scale races around a closed circuit. It's a racing game for 1 to 8 players (or more if you feel the need) that is controlled by rolling dice to see how far cars race.

However, it has a mythology all its own...

The PCR Concept
Pro Circuit Racing, or PCR, is a race concept developed to be friendly to the spectators, cheap and environmentally friendly. It is a busy race day with non-stop action.

name: The Belt
description:
From the PDF

Welcome to The Belt!

In the 23rd century humanity has been cast to the stars. Hardy spaceship pilots mine the asteroid belt between Earth and Mars for raw materials. It's a dangerous job, but the rewards are generous as the Colonial Administration needs as much of the precious minerals as they can get to ensure the survival of humanity.

- - -

The Belt is a game for two to four players where the objective is to mine as many asteroids as you can and get the rocks back to base before the end of the game. Each player takes it in turns to move their ship towards an asteroid in order to mine it (see Mining). Once the asteroid has been mined the player must move their ship to their base and deposit the asteroid chunks there before moving off to get more asteroids. Beware, though, because pirates roam the Belt and will attack any ship trying to move rocks out of the belt.

The win conditions can be set by the players. You could create a time-limit with the winner being the player who collected the most asteroids; or the first to get # asteroids wins.

Players take turns putting all the asteroid counters within the designated 'field', then the three pirate counters are placed in the centre of the board next to each other.

1D6 die is rolled on each players turn, which provides a random maximum move distance for them that turn. If ships come within 6 hexes of each other or the pirates they may get shot at. Once a player is on the same hex as an asteroid they roll a 1D3 and it takes that many turns to mine it successfully. A maximum of two asteroids can be held by a ship, it must then return to its base to unload.

Rules for targeting and firing on the other ships creates added tension, and repairs can also be affected but leave the ship vulnerable.

name: Triple
description: A fast game of observation & memory containing 5 different games. Prove you're fast, perceptive and with a great memory! Be the first to spot identical symbols between the cards. Whoever succeeds-wins! Play in a pair, group or by- yourself. Are you up for the challenge?

name: Century Run Bicycle Game
description: This is a very simple track game depicting a bicycle race across country. On a turn, you spin the spinner and advance the number of spaces indicated. The first player who reach the Home space is the winner.

name: Snake Game
description: Snake Game is simple spin and move game. Players are moving along snake body with 54 stops. The first player, who reaches the 54th space wins the game.

name: Horse Party
description:
Help put together a barnwarming party and make sure everyone has a good time!

Dipsy Dipsy, Ice Cream Delivery Mare Extraordinaire, has just purchased a brand new barn to live in. And you know what that means – barn warming party! There’s just one small problem: she forgot to send out the invitations! Fortunately you (and your opponent) have agreed to help, by gathering all of Dipsy’s friends and customers. All you need to do is make sure that the guests arrive in proper groups and help them to bring the right gifts and and make sure someone brings the gifts and…Oh dear!

The objective of the game is to create complete sets of guests and gifts, and then to claim the set when completed. Players take turns playing a guest and or a gift on a set until it is completed. Each guest requires at least one other guest and up to two gifts in order for the set to be complete. The player who completes the set collects it, and the player who collects the most cards by the end of the game wins!

name: Insight Out
description:
Insight Out is "the game that gets your family talking."

From the box:
"The easy-to-learn format is perfect for any child age 3 or older. Two sets of age-appropriate question cards promote communication and discussion with children of any age."

Insight Out is a roll-and-move game in which players move their cards along a track, drawing cards and answering questions or performing actions based on the spaces they land on. Questions are designed to stimulate discussion among family members, and there are two levels--for younger and older children. If a player chooses not to answer the question or do the action drawn, he or she may go back to the original space and re-roll once. If the re-roll also results in drawing a card, then the player must do the action on the card or go back to the original space and lose his or her turn. The winner is the first player to reach the Finish space.

An advanced game adds a few extra rules, such as spaces where cards may be given to another player and the need to roll the exact number to land on the finish space.

name: Domino Discovery Fractions
description:
From the box:
"Domino Discovery is an exciting matching game that reinforces basic learning skills and provides hours of fun. It is an easy and creative way to involve children in learning activities."

Domino Discovery Fractions is an educational take on Dominoes, with the added element of requiring players to recognize and match equivalent fractions as well as fractions expressed as numbers and as pictures. From a total of 40 dominoes, each player is dealt five and one starting domino is placed on the table. In turn, each player must find a domino with a fraction that matches one end of a domino already in play, and play their domino against that one. If they have not matches, they must draw from the draw pile until they can play a domino. Play ends when one player successfully plays all their dominoes.

In order to play successfully, players must use their knowledge of equivalent fractions (such as 1/2 = 2/4) as well as understanding visual representations of fractions (such as knowing that a picture of a circle with one of three pieces colored in is equal to 1/3).
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Symtactics
description:
Symtactics is a simulation of tactical urbanism set in the Hong Kong region in the year of 2047. It involves both tactical as well as strategic decision making. It was printed in an edition of 20,000 for the Hong Kong edition of the New City Reader which was created specifically for the 'Uneven Growth' exhibition on view at the Museum of Modern Art from Nov 22, 2014 to May 10, 2015.

Ideally, Symtactics is played with 5 players. All players must complete tactical interventions at 8 sites around the Hong Kong region while dealing with catastrophic events. Players can either play for a collective win, working together to beat an ever increasing inequality meter or they can play individually.

Interventions are created by matching resource cards to icons printed on the site hexes. A player must successfully match three icons or use wildcard resources as dictated by the current round's market situation. Once an intervention is completed, the resources used go into a pile as marked on the board. There are 8 piles that correspond to the sites on the map and another 8 towards the north of the board, corresponding to the development of global inequality.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Science Fiction, Travel
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: That's Mine
description:
Choose your card wisely, then wager victory points to gain the advantage over your competition.

The game of rock, paper, scissors has been played in various forms for hundreds of years. That's Mine is a fast paced time filler game that adapts this enduring mechanic to a card game. It adds support for more than two players and introduces a risk/reward wagering element.

Each round involves all players choosing a numbered card with rock, paper or scissors and resolving battle as expected. Things get interesting when players wager existing victory points to influence when they enter the competition. Every hand is resolved leaving only one winner with a simple yet decisive tiebreaking system.

Each wager builds the kitty and the survivor exclaims "That's Mine" while claiming their winnings.

name: Ritratto d'Autore: capolavori al Maschile
description: Experience the thrill of making a single framework, bizarre and imaginative, borrowing the mustachioed smile Gauguin or Van Gogh's restless gaze to achieve a Bacchus certainly more extravagant than that of Caravaggio. But the game does not last long because to win the game then you have to make a genuine portrait, paying tribute to the great masters such as Raphael and Picasso, and composing their own portraits. You have to search in different areas of the game puzzle missing to complete your portrait, and the 10-sided die will tell you if you can take them freely, or you have to challenge your opponent in a feud with the nuts, or you will have to answer a question right on portrait you want to dial or the Artist who painted it ... The questions on Art and its Masters are more than four hundred, and were divided between questions Difficulty standard and ... questions "for the little ones", specially designed to accompany children to the discovery of Art. With "Portrait d'Autore, masterpieces to Male 'gaming experience encompasses a mix of different emotions. The good fortune of being able to identify and take the missing pieces joins skill in answering questions, and everything blends the fun and imagination. The different portraits that will consist in the match, one of the most curious of the other, will not fail to arouse continuous emotions and feelings in the players. The main objective of the Game and what to discover the art and his most famous portraits, while stimulating the observation and discovery, fantasy and imagination, through the magic of a Portrait of the Author that is gradually becoming ... a true portrayal! Portrait of author also proposes to transfer to the players some knowledge of art history, through a lot of questions about the artists, their works, and on Art in general, which sometimes require the observation and research of the details: even children will learn in a spontaneous and always fun, challenging each other with questions to measure ... baby!

name: Cardles: Cards in Puzzle
description:
You can cross the Cardles in order to discover new games/
With Cardles you can play cards in a completely new original way. The game contains two bunch of Cardles with which, taking advantage of the innovation of the crossings, they can be used to adapt classic card games or to create new games, especially crafted to use these special cards.

Buying this game you actually buy two bunch of jigsaw puzzle cards.
The book “Twenty and more games with the Cardles” in detail describe the rules of many games, between which the games of combination like 40 Scale and Machiavelli, some varying of Domino, the games for children like Rubamazzetto and One, let alone many solitary ones, all returned still more exciting thanks to the particularitity of the crossings.
Cardles is a particularly apt game to all the lovers of the cards, children, boys or adults, that they will remain bewitched from the new look and the inusuale format regarding the familiar cards. The visual impact of the Cardles is of sure effect, because every piece of the jigsaw puzzle contain the image of a card, included the Jokers, the figures, and the Ace of Spades “signed” like in the bunch of traditional cards.

name: Before Scotland: 750 AD – Kingdoms
description:
Set in 8th century Northern Britain, Before Scotland: 750 AD - Kingdoms is a tactical combat deck building strategy game. It is historical in nature with a rich context and set of mechanics drawn from original sources.

The game begins in 750 AD and lets you play as one of four nations who struggle for supremacy: the Angles, Britons, Gaels, or Picts. After choosing a leader and moral cause that give special abilities to your kingdom, each player draws up to 7 random cards from their Kingdom Reserve deck. They travel through the Environment and scout the Terrain at the battlefield; these are event cards that alter the impending engagement. From the cards-in-hand (i.e. the Warband), each player may select up to 3 Warband Unit cards that face-off with a competing kingdom. After a simultaneous reveal, cards are resolved one-versus-one with additional Supply, Tactics, or Training cards from the Warband that are used to modify the encounter. Winning cards enter the Hoard. Losing cards are flushed into the Barrow. The game ends when the Kingdom Reserves are exhausted and the player with the largest hoard wins.

This game is targeted at the casual gamer and is a gateway to the more in-depth title Before Scotland: 750 AD - Empires which layers in a working economy and geographic constraints.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Exalted of Kalos
description:
Save Kalos. Work as a team - but look out for yourself.

These are the concerns in Exalted of Kalos. Monsters pour from the wilderness, trying to overrun the land. Your group, the mightiest heroes in Kalos, must stop this invasion. After the invaders (and at least one deadly "boss") are routed, only one of your number will be granted the title "Exalted of Kalos".

Exalted of Kalos finds the sweet-spot in between several gaming styles. It is easy to learn, even for beginners. At the same time, experience and tactics play a vital role. EoK plays much like a "board collapser" cooperative game - where the players work together against automated challenges. However, it also gives each individual their own agenda.

Players each take control of a character with their own strengths and weaknesses. Players must manage power and timing to make the most of their turns. This is crucial, not only in surviving as a group, but in making themselves stand out individually.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Bang the Button!!!
description:
Bang the Button!!! is an educational and interactive game that has been developed for learners of English as a foreign language for beginner levels. (Starters, A1 and A2, according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFR)).

It is a unique, very complete game that can (and should) be used as a complement to any method (digital or more traditional) that is used in the classroom. Playing the game at home is of course also great fun!

Especially the oral skills (speaking and listening) are trained in this game that is played in small groups (3 – 6 players). The game allows a lot of interaction between the players, exactly what we want in foreign language teaching.
The game is also very useful for getting rid of the usual shyness that many learners feel. The game is very challenging and educational.

The game Bang the Button is, as mentioned above, very complete and includes a variety of aspects, such as:

vocabulary
grammar
communication
culture
movement
interaction
constant participation of all players
a healthy dose of competion
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scepter
description:
Think of it as Magic: the Gathering meets Monopoly.

You and your party protect you homeland, and win your opponent's scepter. This is a game of battling special abilities to obtain land, pour magic into your land with magic stones.
