Six letter cards (with the letters S-E-R-V-A-S) are placed face-down in front of a larger word saying "SERVAS". The active player draws one of the cards and flips it open, then can decide to draw the card at the letter just drawn, or quit. If s/he quits, s/he scores a point for the card and keeps it. If s/he continues and draws a letter where the adjacent card has already been drawn, s/he loses the cards for the current turn.
When all cards have been drawn, the procedure is repeated with the other player starting. After two rounds, the player with most points is the winner.

name: Desert Attack
description: Very basic wargame simulating the Land/Air battle for an oil-rich country. Players use military force to protect tankers and refineries and to move oil to "safe" areas.

name: Reindeer Races: Lucky Reindeer
description:
Reindeer Races: Lucky Reindeer adds a new very lucky reindeer to the base game. The Lucky Reindeer races as a single deer (instead of a team) and has special luck tokens which allow him to modify cards. He also draws 4 cards instead of 2 when skiing.

This is the third expansion for Reindeer Races. When combined with the Reindeer Races: The Lone Reindeer and Reindeer Races: Super Reindeer, the game can be played by up to 7 people.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Chunky Fighters: Alf Leganblanc
description: Chunky Fighters: Alf Leganblanc is the first expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the sorcerer. This fighter has the power to attack two fighters at once (using the lowest rolled die).

name: Chunky Fighters: Bastet Bhôl
description: Chunky Fighters: Bastet Bhôl is the second expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the mummy warrior. This fighter has the power to curse other fighters or heal himself.

name: Chunky Fighters: Carlos Amoal
description: Chunky Fighters: Carlos Amoal is the third expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the skeleton warrior. This fighter has the power to scavenge other wounded fighters and claim additional life points.

name: Chunky Fighters: Gélvanhan Poulpe
description: Chunky Fighters: Gélvanhan Poulpe is the fourth expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the giant squid warrior. This fighter has the power to disarm his opponents so they cannot use their weapons die.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Chunky Fighters: Lilly Kantrop
description: Chunky Fighters: Lilly Kantrop is the fifth expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the werewolf warrior. This fighter has the power to transform into a very strong wolf, but if she suffers two injuries she will transform back into a human.

name: Chunky Fighters: Sarah Dynn
description: Chunky Fighters: Sarah Dynn is the sixth expansion to Chunky Fighters. The expansion comes with the dice and card for the mermaid warrior. This fighter has the power to mesmerize her one opponent with her siren song. As long as she sings, that opponent will be unable to perform an action.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Giza
description:
The game is as simple and ingenious as a pyramid. It has simple rules. Each player has a small pyramid in his own color with four golden joker blocks stuck at the bottom. On his turn a player builds a block on the larger central pyramid. Blocks can be build on top of four other blocks as long as no other color has the majority in those four blocks. First player to build the top block wins the game.
The rules contain four variants.

name: Bürgermeisterspiel:  	Werde Bürgermeister in Magdeburg
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Magdeburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Magdeburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Negotiation, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel:  	Werde Bürgermeister in Erfurt
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of Erfurt
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Erfurt. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Bürgermeisterspiel:  	Werde Bürgermeister in Bad Harzbug
description:
Objective: be the first to get the permanent majority of votes for the coming election of the mayor - learn more about the city of bad Harzburg
- moving/acting by turns.

Each player rolls the die, moves according the number, follows instructions of space landed on; buys, if possible and/or (preferable) votes.

"Chance" cards are created with circumstances out of the history of Bad Harzburg. Correct answers give economic advantages.

Voting process about the next mayor: Each owned company corresponds to a number of votes. The results of each voting are kept and the final winner is the first player who reaches the target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Leben in Bochum
description:
A simple game published about the German City of Bochum.
By playing the players get to know a little bit about the city and its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of Bochum. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Leben im Landkreis Hameln-Pyrmont
description:
A simple game published about the area Landkreis Hameln-Pyrmont.

By playing the players get to know a little bit about the area Landkreis Hameln-Pyrmont its shops.
During each player's turn they roll a six-sided dice to move along a game-board depicting a map of the area Landkreis Hameln-Pyrmont. At certain spaces players can acquire cards of the shops or they can go sightseeing by following the instructions on the back of the card. Sometimes there is only information written, sometimes you have to pay an amount of money or at other times you may earn some cash.

The game ends when the last player reaches the finish space with his playing piece. The winner is the person who has acquired the most sightseeing and/or shop cards.

name: Tornado
description:
Each player gets one pawn, starting in the corner with the same color. The money chips should be divided evenly between the players. Goal of the game is to be the first to get in the middle of the spinning wheel, thus collecting all the money there.

A player turn consists of rolling both dice and move your pawn the number of spaces shown on the number dice forward, entering your "target way" to the middle of the spinning wheel only at the entrance marked with your color. If you rolled green on the other dice, you draw and execute an event card after moving. You draw no card if you roll red. The event card tells you either to put a number of your money chips into the middle of the spinning wheel or to spin the wheel in clockwise or counter-clockwise direction. Thru spinning the wheel, the pawns may slide in (to the center of the wheel) or out. To end the game, the last space of the target way has to be reached exactly.

name: Dentipoli
description:
The game for your teeth health!

Place your pawn at the start space. As your turn, roll both dice and move your pawn that many spaces forward. Execute the action of your landing space, i.e. drawing event cards, getting teeth etc.

The goal of the game is to get white teeth (good ones) and avoid black teeth (the bad ones). The game ends when one player has filled up his teethcard completely. The winner is then the player with the most white teeth on his teethcard.

name: The Unwinnable War: 1914-1918
description:
It began a hundred years ago. Generals imagined it would be a quick Napoleonic-style war to settle nationalist and imperialist conflicts... but soon enough it became a nightmare. Hundreds of thousands suffered and died, as war raged for four years - from the trenches of Flanders to the steppes of Ukraine, from the mountains of the Alps to the deserts of Syria, from the depths of the ocean to the heights of the sky. No one had a clear understanding of how the war could be won. And in the end, it wasn't. It was only stopped for twenty years.

The Unwinnable War is a block wargame for 2 to 4 players. One or two players may play either side, the Central Powers and the Entente.

The game is PnP, i.e. all materials are freely downloadable. However, players need to provide their own components, including the 70 wooden blocks in order to play the game.

name: Spel van het jaar 2008
description: Very basic quiz games with question regarding trivia of 2008. It uses a similar system to Trivial Pursuit but is done solely by cards and chips.

name: Toy Story 3: Aventura no Quintal
description: Help Buzz to complete this mission. Simply assemble the Board and help Buzz going on the Board between the toys. In this game, luck is fundamental. Friends of Buzz, as the cowboy Woody, Jessie the Cowgirl, the little horse Bullseye and the dinosaur Rex are also in the game.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Survival Horror Breathers Set 1: Teen Investigators
description:
From publisher blurb:

Supernatural investigators Ricky, Scottie, Thelma, Daisy and their faithful hound Scooter find themselves in the middle of a full blown zombie outbreak when their van is impounded whilst investigating the old Langley Mansion on the outskirts of town. Now it’s a race against time to search SHPD for their vehicle key and make their escape before being over-run by the infected!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Survival Horror: Horror Hospital Expansion Pack
description:
From publisher blurb:

Deputy Cho found herself trapped in the SH Medical Facility as the outbreak took hold. In the panic she overheard the research staff discussing a sample of some kind of virus, but figured it was too far outside her pay-grade to worry about it. Professor Elliot, one of the surviving researchers, soon convinced her that the sample may be the only chance to halt the oncoming storm. Despite her better judgement, she agreed to help him retrieve the sample before trying to summon rescue from the centre’s rooftop helipad…

Horror Hospital expands your Survival Horror experience with new room tiles, weapons, items and characters in a brand new scenario! Face down new doctor zombies and fend off surprise Shambler attacks in your search for the virus sample! Should you get up close and personal with the Tire Iron or go for multiple targets with the Molotov Cocktail? The choice is yours, just make sure you make it to the chopper!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Survival Horror: Nick-Mall Santa
description:
From publisher blurb:

He’s made his list, he’s checked it twice, and those zombies have definitely been naughty not nice…
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Survival Horror: TG-Combat Specialist
description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed for both SURVIVAL HORROR TABLETOP GAME (with 2 weapon set options, bases and weapon and stat cards) and ZOMBIE FIGHTER(alongside 2 zombies, bases and stat card) she will cover all your gaming needs!

30mm Character figures for Modern Horror gaming.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Xit
description:
Xit is a themeless abstract strategy game for two players using some of the principals from the Tixel family of games, including the piece activation mechanics, only reversed.

In Xit, players take turns moving an active (square) piece on a 6x6 (or 8x8) game board. Some of the pieces are missing one or two of their corners. After a piece is moved it is inactivated (by turning it 45 degrees in either direction, or from square to diamond). When a piece is moved past an inactive piece it will push that piece back to its active state it if there is a corner of that piece in its path. Players capture (remove from the board) any pieces of their opponent's activated in this way. Their own pieces remain on the board, ready to be played again.

If a player has no more active pieces, they lose the game.

name: Green Lantern: Make a Match
description:
Hal Jordan, Sinestro, Abin Sur and other characters in the the Green Lantern world are hiding. On your turn, pick any two cards. If they match, you get to keep them.

Find a pair of the special Green Lantern ring cards and you get to take the ring. There are several of those in the game, so it moves from player to player. Be the one who has it at the end of the game and you'll get bonus points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Jewels of Tara
description: Jewels of Tara follows the tale of Princess Tara & her lost jewelry. The Jewels of Tara are lost in a spiral take on a Snakes and Ladders board. You must find the jewels, which are represented by cards. Take jewels you find to her trusted jewelers in the "labyrinth", who can certify their authenticity. They will also fashion the jewels you find into articles of jewelry. Bring the best jewelry to Princess Tara first to win!

name: Foozle
description: Foozle is a progressive bid game for three to eight players, in which players attempt to take exactly as many tricks as they bid or be penalized. Unlike many bidding games, Foozle is not a partners game, but an individual "cut-throat" type of card game.

name: Jack and Jill
description:
Try to move Jack or Jill to the top of the hill without getting knocked to bottom by marbles rolling down the hill. Marbles released from a plastic well at the top of the hill.

To play, a player spins the spinner. Then the player moves a marker up the stepping stones on the incline as many spaces as indicated by the spinner. The player then puts a marble in the well. Play then passes on to the next player.

The well releases all the marbles at some indeterminate point when the weight gets too heavy. When that happens if a player's marker is not behind one of the safe spaces, then it may get knocked down. If the player's marker gets knocked down then the player must start over at the bottom of the hill.

Contents:'
1 Game Board
2 Game Board Support Posts
1 Well
1 Well Trap
1 Well Roof
2 Well Roof Posts
1 Spinner (8 spaces, three 1's, three 2's, one 3, and "Pass")
2 Jack Pawns
2 Jill Pawns
30 Pee Wee Marbles

The pawns were made by using stickers which the buyer had to attach to the plastic stand-up playing pieces.

name: Snelbieden
description:
Snelbieden is a fast paced card game focused on trick-taking.
The game originated in East-Flanders, Belgium as a pub game.

The goal is to bid on how many points you will be able to get, and then get those points through trick-taking. Everyone starts at 41 points, the first one to get to 0 points wins.

It can be played with a standard card game deck, using 32 cards (from 7 to aces).

name: Computer Wargame #1: Round Vernian Vifam
description:
This is a computer Wargame from Bandai. It is based on an early 80's Japanese anime featuring fighting between piloted mecha. The game has several miniatures and an electronic device that records attacks and damage.

This is the first game in the series. Others are Heavy Metal L-Gaim #2 and Godzilla #3

name: Flappy Golf Quiz
description:
Nine-hole course to play with dice instead of clubs.
and 90 questions on how the good golfer should behave on course.

The game is a normal game of golf played by up to four players throwing dice in turns.

The golf course is made up of nine borads, each representing a different hole. If the ball goes off the fairway during the game, the player must answer some questions in order to continue.

name: Going Places in North America
description:
Explore North America!

Explore the continent’s cities and landmarks — from the cold expanses of Canada to the sun-drenched beaches of the Caribbean.

Each player receives one Destination card to determine his or her starting position, or "hometown". Another 12 Destination cards are then dealt to each player. The goal is to plan a round trip from your "hometown" via the 12 destinations. The first person to complete a round trip wins!

To aid the traveler, train stations, airports and harbors are available as a quick travel option if a player has a corresponding Compass card. The Compass cards can help or stall your trip in a number of ways, including changing the outcome of the game. A player is never safe until he or she has returned home!

Designed for 2-4 players and takes you on a different path around the continent each round!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Travel the States
description:
Travel the States is a card game for two players. Each player must build the best arrangement of cards in their playing area to gain the most victory points at the end of the game.

The cards show American tourist attractions, e.g., Manhattan, Graceland (Memphis), Niagara Falls, and Grand Canyon, and they are associated with five multicolored zones. In addition, each card shows a transportation icon. To place a card in their playing area, the player must care for the limitations and pay for the traveling costs by discarding cards with the appropriate transportation icon.

Whoever scores the most victory points according to the number of cards in their playing area and attractions in the zones and states wins.

name: Directo lauamäng
description:
Promotional game for Estonian Business software company Directo.

There are piece of map with Finland and Baltic States on the board. Each player has 6 bidding cards in hand: 4 cards with destination cities and two special cards:
"Any city" allows You to move to any city what is not destination for any other player this round.
and "Trouble" moves the specialists/deals on the board.

In each round new specialists/deals appears on the board. Players choose one of their cards and try to hire a specialists for his company or make a good business deals.
They reveal the destinations simultanously.
If only one player chooses the destination he gets all specialists/deals from that city.
If more than one specialist choose the destination they share the profit but make blind offer for the specialist(s). Who offer more money puts it on the bank and hires the specialist to his company.

The more different specialists You have the more money You earn at the end of each round. But beware to hire same kind of specialist already working in Your company - both leave!

After six rounds the player with the most money wins.

name: It's Time to Conquer Earth!
description:
It's Time to Conquer Earth is a card and dice game, where you play the part of a wacky alien, scrambling to get a foothold on earth for your impending invasion before those silly humans realize what you are up to and retaliate.

Players take turns rolling their ships, (represented as dice of varying sizes,) to either abduct numerous different characters on the board, ranging from cows to kings, or to acquire tech, which is used to buy bigger and better ships, or to play one of the cards special to your given alien race. These cards will let you modifiy your rolls, make different characters easier to abduct, let you mess with other people's ships, and numerous other effects.

Characters have varying difficulties, representing how well you have to roll to abduct them. You start out with a 6 sided die, but you may buy larger dice with tech as the game progresses. Upon abducting a character, you may choose to brainwash them, netting you influence points, or you may choose to keep them contained to take advantage of their various effects.

Each time a character is abducted, the threat level goes up, representing how aware the humans are of your shenanigans. As the threat gets higher, so to does the difficulty of the game, as the humans start to retaliate or protect themselves in different ways. The game ends once the threat reaches 100, where the humans are finally acutely aware of your presence and ready to retaliate. At that time, each player counts up their influence points, and the player with the most influence points wins!

name: The Game of MVP Dating
description:
From the box:

"MVP Date before it's too late! MVP Dating prepares you to be the best in the game by giving you chances to gain and use Morals, Values and Principles (MVPs) in dating scenarios.

The Game of MVP Dating is a roll-and-move game. The object is to master the outer "date-for-fun" path by accumulating three "dating experiences" chips and gaining 5 morals, values and principles (MVPs) cards. Players may use MVP cards to avoid negative "1-on-1" dating experience card penalties or to dump a date. When a player has accumulated the correct number of dating experiences and MVP cards he or she can move to the inner "Get Married" track. when they land on a "Get Married" space and have only one date left, they may stay on the space until they roll a 6 to get married and win the game.

This game is designed to teach dating morals and values to unmarried teens and young adults with the ultimate goal being marriage.

name: Corporate Ladder
description:
From the back cover:

A game for two or more enterprising players, Corporate Ladder combines general knowledge, business sense, gut instinct and the wisdom of experience to take you from the company mail room to the loftiest position of all -- Chairman of the Board.

Should you consider inviting your boss and his or her spouse to a cocktail party in your own home?

What's the difference between a golden parachute and the golden handcuffs?

How many semester hours do most MBA degrees require?

Do you know the original name of the Amex?

What's the most common flaw in an executive's attire?

Answers to 1800 questions like these may surprise you as you scratch and claw your way to the top playing Corporate Ladder. You'll have to make decisions on office politics, corporate etiquette, personnel, finance and banking, manufacturing, advertising, accounting and many more.

Corporate Ladder is ideal for families, cocktail parties, business groups and students. Scheme, perform, wriggle, wend your way to the top, and once you get there, don't look back. Somebody might be gaining on you!

name: Crime & Time
description:
From the front cover:
Experience Court and Jail Procedures!
Object: life and crime, court action, detention. Player with most money at game end is winner. Game can be played in short amount of time or can be lengthy - you decide.
Equipment: Game board, player pieces, sentence log, playing money, sentencing cards, appeal/parole cards and pair of dice.

User Description:
Roll and move game where players go along the outer track receiving money for various life events, but also are at risk of being convicted of various crimes. Cards from the "Sentencing" pile determine how long a player must go to jail (i.e. the inner track) or whether they have received probation. Various spaces on the inner track (each circuit around being one year) also earn you money and random card draws may win you appeals, probation, or an overturn of your conviction. Score sheets ("Sentence log") allow players to keep track of all the crimes they've been convicted of and how much time they've served for each. According to the game rules, there is no set goal; players must agree on a length of time to play or an amount of money to reach first.

The game is apparently intended as a criticism of the lenient "revolving door" of the U.S. criminal justice system, similar to "Capital Punishment" or "Public Assistance." Although the game was made in 1995, it fails to take into account the then new but growing "three strikes" system in many states, as well as criminal court's tendency to impose harsher sentences on repeat offenders.

name: Hilarious Health care
description:
1994 anti-nationalized healthcare game in response to the early, failed attempts by the Clinton administration to introduce a system like Obamacare.

The object of the game is to outlive the other players and benefit the most, financially, from a nationalized healthcare system. The instruction book is filled with right-wing sarcasm -- the playing pieces represent various tropes like "pork barrel" etc. -- and the cards punish or benefit players (ala Community Chest and Chase) using hypothetical examples of pro-liberal or anti-conservative bias in the Federal government's bureaucracy.

Around the board, players get appointed to various positions in the healthcare bureaucracy and suffer various illnesses. Each "position" has two spaces to win appointments to (rather than purchasing like in Monopoly), and unlucky players who land on your department have to pay their healthcare fees to you. Beware of getting caught in the inner circle of healthcare waiting periods!

This game is similar in tone to Public Assistance or Capital Punishment, in both its conservative/Republican anger and its cringe-worthy cards and spaces.

name: Public Utility
description: Object: to obtain as much money as possible. Each player is a ripped off customer at the start of the game. You can advance to a higher pay rate by drawing a Ripoff or Profit card giving you a promotion, or by landing on a space indicating that you are hired or promoted to that particular pay status. Land on the Stock Market space and you get to play the stock market.

name: American War of Independence: Brandywine
description:
Brandywine is a large scale game of the early Revolutionary war using the rules from the American War of Independence Campaign Sets. The game is approximately three times as large as those found in the Campaign Sets.

The game includes an 11x17 inch map, counter sheet, and three pages of rules.

Players take turns moving their forces and attacking enemy units in order to achieve the specific objectives for a battle. One important difference to typical wargames is that before the moving player can attack, his units are subject to defensive fire from the opponent.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Year of the Yuppie Game
description:
A game for 25 to 40 year olds on their way up the ladder of success. Are you a Yuppie (young urban professional)? Or do you just aspire to be one? How do Yuppies get ahead and stay ahead? Why are they so successful?

The Year of the Yuppie Game is the game of success for 25 to 40 year olds on the way up. You'll experience money--and lots of it. You'll move up the ladder of success, screwing over fellow employees, friends and relatives. You'll suffer breakups, divorces and mergers. You'll play the stock market for big stakes.

In the process, you'll laugh your head off!

Up to 5 players being the game with a car and $50,000. The first player to escape the "rat race" receives $100,000 and the game is ended. The player with the most money is declared the winner.

name: Scram!
description:
SCRAM!'' is an exciting strategy game for the entire family!

In SCRAM! up to 4 players are represented by a color on the game board. Players share from a common pool of tokens - each with their own special ability.

Players take turns placing tokens to create chain-reactions that move their tokens into scoring position and send opponent's tokens scrambling away... or make their token SCRAM! by driving it off the game board!

The player with the highest value tokens on their own color at the end of the game wins!

name: Mia and me: Einhörner in Gefahr
description:
Game description from the publisher:

After defeating Panthea, there is at last peace in Centopia — at least until a circus island called Funtopia suddenly appears, with this place being run by a merry circus director named Rixel. The elves fear that Rixel is holding animals captive on his island, and they soon discover that the ringmaster has been sent by a powerful dark elf from Dystopia with orders to return a winged unicorn to Dystopia.

In Mia and me: Einhörner in Gefahr, the young players must help Mia and her friends keep the unicorns from being captured by Rixel and banish the danger from Centopia.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Colonial Battlefleet:  Star's Reach
description:
From the publisher's website:

Since it's release in 2010, Colonial Battlefleet has taken starship gaming by storm. It combines fast and easy gameplay with a tactical depth few other systems can match. Colonial Battlefleet: Star's Reach is a new expansion for the Colonial Battlefleet core rules.

Colonial Battlefleet: Star's Reach takes the top-selling Colonial Battlefleet rules to the next level by adding a slew of new features fans have been clamoring for!

This supplement includes:

3 new fully developed races. Each race has its own culture, armory, tech levels, and special abilities to supplement the "build it yourself" options found in the core rules.

New fighter types, and new fighter options including blister turrets, and shields.

New weapon systems, including 3 varieties of Spinal Mount allowing you to bring unprecedented (yet balanced) power to be battlespace!

New options for movement, shields, and damage control.

New tech enhancements for your ships including a true cloaking device.

15 new starship designs, using the new races and technology.

You demanded, we delivered!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Negative Feedback
description: Negative Feedback is a game about negative feedback loops where the players compete to obtain a hand with 0 cards in it. The players go about satisfying this desire by taking cards from other players hands, swapping hands, and other actions. In effect, although it sounds paradoxical, players run out of cards by taking cards from other players. As an added bonus every card has a whimsical statement on it!

name: Eau Claire Trivia
description:
From the publisher:

So you think you know Eau Claire?
Inside there are hundreds of trivia questions about your town and your area businesses.

name: Ani-Gram-It
description: Ani-gram-it is a beautifully designed board game that teaches children the ins and outs of the animal kingdom through play. Children are challenged to “build” animals from the inside out, using intuitive building blocks of anatomical information. Each play leads to new discoveries about how animals are made—and reinforces how they are classified in the natural world.

name: Ani-gram-it To Go
description: Perfect for travel and impromptu sessions of biology, Ani-gram-it To Go comes complete with 100 laminated, color-coded cards and can be played on a table, the floor, the grass, a picnic blanket, or any other number of spaces! It’s a great fit for the whole family, with little ones learning to name body parts and recognize different animals before they can even play.

name: Dominant Clan
description:
The objective of Dominant Clan is to be part of the largest clan with the highest rank.

The game uses Action cards in manipulating the gameplay. Some action cards allow players to swap identities, stumble players, nullify effects and even changing the scenario of the game.

At the beginning of each game which is the revealing phase, each player is dealt with 3 Item cards which work as identities. Similar matched identities creates clan which introduce the leader system. Dominant leaders have higher abilities than any player in the game where they have the ability to use their member's cards which is the key to securing the outcasts. Ranks of each player plays the role of power and defence. Ranks are given to those who are worthy of becoming a leader.

In this game there is the Item Deck and the Action Deck. When the game starts, each player is given a choice to choose either drawing an Item card or an Action card. Then the player can either keep those cards or use the Action cards. For every player can only hold up to 3 cards in-hand, it forces players to a good challenge of planning and execution among members. This also leads to multiple strategic ways of winning the game. Backstabbing betrays can happen and so does denouncing friendships for a game! As much as sabotaging is a prominent factor of the game, it is also a heavy cooperative game that fosters communication among players.

After a number of clan members is reached, the game ends with a rank comparison with the outcasts and the dominant leader. The highest rank holder wins the game. With a draw as a result, the dominant team takes the victory.

Dominant Clan is currently in the process of publishing and is estimated to be released in late 2015.
One of the first modern European card games designed by a Malaysian.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Wiener Wettrennen
description:
A simple, dice based horse racing game set in Vienna / Austria.
Six tin horses and dice trays come with this game, which probably was produced in Austria in the late 1930's (swastika symbol used as a watermark on the rules).
The Publisher might be 'Mohehauser' or 'Hohehauser' according to the stamp on the game's backside.
The course has 100 fields from start to finish. All multiples of 10 are colored in black. Fields 35, 56 and 68 show hurdles, field 77 a water jump. In clockwise order, players roll one die and move their horses forward accordingly. If a horse stops on a black field, the player loses one turn. On a hurdle the player looses two turns, on the water jump he's out of the game. The player who first reaches field 100 is the winner. If he however exceeds 100, he has to move back the exceeding number of steps.

A betting mechanism is built into the game: Each player has to pay 10 or 20 units to enter the game. Losing a turn costs 2 units, loosing two turns 3 units. Dropping out of the game costs 10. The winner takes it all.

German rules:
1. An diesem sehr interessanten Spiele können 2 oder mehrere Personen teilnehmen; jeder Teilnehmer setzt nach Übereinkommen der Gesellschaft 10 oder 20 Marken in die Kassa. Jeder Spieler bekommt einen Reiter und setzt denselben der Reihe nach mit den Vorderfüßen zwischen die 2 Linien Nr. 1, dann wird gewürfelt und wer das meiste wirft, beginnt das Spiel und setzt immer den Reiter mit den Vorderfüßen in den Raum der gewürfelten Nummer. Wirft jemand einen Zehner, z.B. 10, 20, 30, so zahlt er 2 Marken in die Kassa und darf einmal nicht würfeln.
2. Kommt jemand auf ein Hindernis, so bleibt er auf seinem Platze, darf 2 mal nicht würfeln und zahlt 3 Marken in die Kassa, hat aber jemand das Unglück und fällt ins Wasser, so hat er 10 Marken zu zahlen und muß vom Spiele austreten. Wer Zuerst die höchste Nummer erreicht hat, gewinnt das Spiel; wenn er aber darüber hinaus kommt, muß er um soviel Augen wieder zurück als er geworfen hat.

name: Lindy Hop Off
description: Race game using a d6 die to control movement on board. Starting player chosen by draw of a city card.

name: Captain Hop Across Junior
description: Simple race game featuring Charles Lindbergh's flight across the Atlantic Ocean. Players markers are planes. The spinner is on the board and represented as the propeller Lindbergh's plane.

name: The Great Nameless
description:
1-4 players work together to prevent the fabric of all reality from being torn asunder while competing against one another to further their own personal goals.

The ultimate Creator of all universes is also a mindless force of chaos and destruction. That which it has created it will eventually destroy. It is mindless, but all-powerful. The first of its creations to survive and assume intelligence consider themselves Its sons and daughters: the Excubiae. At the beginning of time, they worked together to seal away the Great Nameless, in order to protect the Realms they had created for their own progeny.

In true Shakespearean fashion, these siblings developed alliances and rivalries, and began working with and against one another, all while their Creator attempted to work Its way through their ancient seals...

In The Great Nameless, each player assumes the identity of their very own god. They lord over their own Realm, create miracles, and force their worshippers to do their bidding. They may even manifest in physical form, greatly affecting the battlefield before them.

The game consists of different decks, tailored to each god, and a central, autonomous deck that represents the unstoppable force that is The Great Nameless.

Players race up and down a doom track to seal away their Realms from the center of the board, and work to help their allies and sabotage their enemies.

Players accumulate victory points for placing seals, destroying the armies of The Great Nameless, destroying the forces of their foes, and playing valuable cards of their own.
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Mythology, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme

name: Bad Lands: Curse of the Skinwalker
description:
Bad Lands: Curse of the Skinwalker is a western horror co-op survival game where you and your friends take control of a posse of heroes fighting off a pack of vicious were-beasts and other folklore creatures.

Build your own adventures - The Bad Lands box comes with 6 heavy duty, double-sided, linen coated Board Tiles. You only need 4 Board Tiles play. We will include several different pre-made adventures for you and your friends to play, or you can make your own! The board tiles are double sided, and you can lay them out in a variety of ways to build your town your way.

Form your Posse - Bad Lands is a co-op survival game for 1-4 players. While most players will just control 1 Hero per game, you can still quite easily have a larger posse. The more Heroes in the adventure, the more Villains you will have to face, and the tougher the game will be.

Kill Some Bad Guys - Bad Lands features a whole host of vicious Skinwalkers and minion beasts for your Heroes to vanquish. The core boxed game comes with a deck of 30 Encounter Cards. You draw a card, and it tells you what Villains are going to jump out and attack the Heroes.

Get some Loot! - Of course, no adventure is complete without cool rewards. When you defeat tough Villains, they will leave a Loot Marker behind. If your Hero picks one up, you can draw a Loot Card from the deck. Each Hero may carry an unimited amount of Loot Cards, but may only equip and use two.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing

name: Fritz und Franz: Die beiden Ausreißer
description:
Up to two players play the two runaways Fritz and Franz. The other players play the brother, sister, wench or servant, who try to catch the runaways. The runaways get a headstart and start at space 6. Every time a pursuer gets on the same space as a runaway, he gets 2 gamecoins. At space 7 the drawing of a card decides, which way to follow. Only Fritz and Franz may choose their way. On several spaces, the players get benefits or obstructions. If Fritz or Franz are the first to arrive at space 60, both runaways have won the game. If a pursuer is the first to arrive, he wins the game.

The game was published in the 1920s. It seems to be inspired by "Max und Moritz"
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Fahrschule
description: The players start at the Driving School at space A and have to traverse the game board till they arrive at space E back at the Driving School. On several spaces the players get points, penality points, obstructions or benefits. The first player to arrive at space E gets 12 poits, the second 6 points, the third 3 points and the rest get 1 point. The player who gets the most points, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game of Fun at the Circus
description: Essentially a Snakes and Ladders type game, but with a circus theme. The game uses a spinner for movement. It has four colored wooden pawns for the players to mark their positions.

name: Puru puru kabe DON
description:
User summary:

A free game distributed on Game Market fall 2014, making a satire of the current meme that cool boys would impress girls by slapping their hand into the wall which the girl was leaning against, stopping her from simply walking away.

This action is called a "kabe-DON" or a "wall slap". Puru puru kabe don translates to "Trembling wall-slap".

The game consists of a standee card with the picture of a girl, and four double-folded cards with the picture of a boy, holding his hand on the edge of the cards.

Each player gets 1 folded boy card and one try each. The goal of the game is to tip the folded boy card so that it leans on the girl standee card, without the latter tipping. If the player succeeds, he gains 1 point. If the girl card tips, or the boy card doesn't lean on the girl card, the player scores –1 points. If he refuses to try, he scores nothing. Play as many rounds as there are players, switching start player, and the player with the most points at the end wins.

name: The Vanderbilt Cup Race
description:
A simple race game for children. The movement was controlled by a d6 die, numbered 1-6. There were six different colored cars for the players.

The track had four different kinds of problem spaces - tire trouble, equipment trouble, a smash-up, and running wide on a curve. There were also spaces to fill-up with gas that had to be hit with an exact throw.

name: Kroki
description:
The players have to guess words drawn by their teammates

Each turn one of the teammember as a designer draws a card, chooses one of the three words and shows it to the designers of the other teams.

He starts drawing the chosen thing by using the special wooden pieces (triangle, square etc.) and his teammate may say what
word the drawing reminds him.
If it is wrong word the next designer starts to draw it.
Team who is the first to say that word scores a point.

The first team with total of 5 points wins.

name: Mes Premières Énigmes ! Princesses
description:
Guess what's behind the clues! A range of puzzles in pictures that allows children to develop their observation and deduction skills.

Three are 42 cards with three fun and colorful illustrations on one side of the card and the answer on another side of the card.
Which child will be the fastest to guess the answer?

Player with the most guessed cards at the end of the game is the winner
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Real-time

name: Mes 1ères Enigmes Animaux
description:
Guess what's behind the clues! A range of puzzles in pictures that allows children to develop their observation and deduction skills.

Three are 42 cards with three fun and colorful illustrations on one side of the card and the answer on another side of the card.
Which child will be the fastest to guess the answer?

Player with the most guessed cards at the end of the game is the winner
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Real-time

name: Mes 1ères Enigmes Objets
description:
Guess what's behind the clues! A range of puzzles in pictures that allows children to develop their observation and deduction skills.

Three are 42 cards with three fun and colorful illustrations on one side of the card and the answer on another side of the card.
Which child will be the fastest to guess the answer?

Player with the most guessed cards at the end of the game is the winner
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Real-time

name: WYSIWYG: Among Thieves
description:
WYSIWYG [wiz-ee-wig]: What You Steal Is What You Get. In WYSIWYG you play a light fingered thief. Your goal is to loot, pickpocket, and burgle your way to fame and riches. But watch out for the city guard! They'll put a stop to your life of crime at every turn of the die.

Each player is attempting to collect Items, everyone gets one go at stealing from the target. As you collect the items, you will trade them in at a Fence each fence is represented by a color wink. when you have 3 items with the same color wink. i.e. the locked Chest, The Ancient Tablet, and the Treasure Map. You trade them into the Green Fence. You get a Green wink to represent being "Solid" with this Fence.

Winner is the first thief to become "Solid" with 5 of the 7 available Fences. But keep an eye out. The other thieves maybe aiming to take your ill-gotten goods from you! And with the Fence Rewards come item cards that can assist in their nefarious plans to take your loot, freeze it in place, or use a fire bomb to wipe it from existence. Because, in WYSIWYG there truly is "No Honor Among Thieves"

name: Horse Racing Game
description:
Simple race game using 2 dice two move horses around track. Track has obstacles. Players must agree on how many laps for race before race begins.

Whole game is contained in a 3.5x4 inch folding "matchbook." Dice are formed by putting two cardboard cutouts together to form 3-D form.

name: Bowling Game
description: A simple bowling game that was in a matchbook format about 3.5x4 Inches. The bowling balls were formed by interlocking two cardboard cut-outs. To score the players rolled the ball towards the inclined scoreboard made from opening matchbook cover. Cover has different score on various holes.

name: Stockyards
description: Stockyards is a trick-taking, set collection, economic card game for two to four players. In the game, players are selling sheep, swine, and steer to the auction house at wholesale price. After the wholesale pay out, an auction commences. The players leverage trick-taking mechanism to win a meat-packing company a lot of livestock while earning a commission. After earning a commission minus any penalties, the non-winning players may attempt to fulfill contracts using a set collection mechanism. Players will place contracts secretly on a company. At the end of the game, the contracts are revealed for each company and livestock are processed earning the contracting player money. If a contract is not fulfilled, the player loses money. The game lasts for ten rounds and the player with the most money at the end is the winner.

name: Color Rouli
description:
A game filled with colour that children win by being patient and not rushing to put all their tokens on the merry-go-round.

Each player has 6 tokens representing children who want to go on the ride . The first player throws the color dice. There are two possible outcomes:

purple, the player places a "child" token in the purple box and can reroll.
other colors, e.g. blue: If the blue attraction is free, then the player can place a "child" token and may choose to reroll or pass. But if the blue attraction is busy, the player removes the token "child" of the ride and his turn is completed. The first player to place all his chips "child" on the ride wins.

name: Big Appleopoly
description: Monopoly clone series done in multiple cities, with local businesses donating to charity in return for being included as properties to be purchased. Big Appleopoly charity is Phoenix House.

name: Rolling in the Money
description:
Rolling in the Money is an educational game designed to teach children to count coins and make change. There are two levels. In level one, players roll five "money dice," (which have the names and values of US coins on each side, as well as an X, indicating no money). They then take the indicated plastic coins from the tray. Next, they may choose to roll as many dice as they wish that did not come up with Xs a second time, and take the indicated coins. They may then do so a third time. The goal is to get a total as close to one dollar as possible without going over. After each player has rolled, the player closest to $1 wins. Five rounds are played, and the player who wins the most rounds is the winner. This level teaches counting and adding coins.

In level two, each player starts with five dollars. On each round they roll two money dice and pay the amount indicated to the bank by making change from one dollar. At the end of the round, the player with the most change left wins, and keeps his change. All other players put their change back in the tray. At the end of five rounds, the player with the most money in his or her pile wins. This level teaches making change from a dollar.

Level one offers a small amount of strategy (the press your luck mechanic of deciding whether to roll more dice and how many to roll) while level two is entirely luck.

name: Whirl-It
description:
Spinning a top knocks balls into holes numbered 1-8. The rules sheet indicates that each player should take 5 turns and the player with the largest number of points wins.

The rules do no indicate how many players but more than 4 seems unwieldy.

One game seen has 7 red balls and one yellow ball. The yellow ball was noted to be of a different material. In some games a special colored ball scores in some special manner such as double point value. However since the rules don't stipulate any such special scoring presumably the game originally had 8 red balls.

name: Time Bingo
description: Time Bingo is an educational game designed to teach children to read analog clock faces. This game plays the same as traditional bingo, but with a twist. Each player is given a card with a series of different-looking analog clock faces depicted--with Roman numerals, Arabic numerals or no numbers. The caller then draws cards with times depicted in digital format. The called may either read the time aloud, show the card to the player or do both. Players must then read the clock faces on their card and mark any matching times. First player to complete a row or column of clock faces calls bingo. The caller then checks to make sure they have made the correct matches, and if so declares that player the winner. If not, play continues until a row or column is correctly completed.

name: Flash
description:
Simple game with a spinning top to knock over four "bowling pins" and score points. Two pins are on 5 points and two pins are on 10 points.

The scoring board is enclosed in a wooden frame. A twist is that between where the top is dropped and the scoring "bowling pins" are four pegs which are fixed to the board. These pegs cause the top to bounce around.

The top is a wind-up top in two parts. The bottom metal part of top has the round top with a metal spindle. The spindle fits into the wooden upper part which has a spring inside the center hole and a pin on the outside edge to interlock with the bottom part. Thus one can wind up the top and holding the top between two fingers you can push the top loose by pushing down with a third finger.

name: Old Hogan's Goat
description: A simple race game for children. The players use marbles as markers. A die, d6 numbered 1-6, is used to control the number of spaces to move. A twist is that some holes are large enough for the marble to fall though the board and the marble must be started again.

name: Scoots: The Educated Marbles Game
description:
Scoots are ball bearings inside a plastic cone. Cone is big enough that ball bearing rolls inside the cone.

There are two blue scoots, two red scoots, and one yellow scoot used as a target for the game Scoot.

Scoots game package has three games:

Scoots:
Players shoot their "scoot" towards target and try to knock opponent out of the way. Closet to target wins.

Five Little Indians
Players try to knock over cardboard Indians for points. Each Indian has a different point value.

Marble Arch:
Where Indians are punched out leaves holes in bottom edge of cardboard that become a foldout target. Players try to shoot their scoot through the scoring holes for points.

name: Knock-Off!
description:
Knock-off uses the frenzied flipping of two electrical panic buttons by each of two contestants as competition. Object of button play is to direct Big Bopper, a grinning 6 armed ball-shaped robot, as he moves to knock off your opponent's fall guy before he can knock off yours.

Big Bopper runs across what looks like a raised bridge and the two fall guys are at either end. Wires from switches for control run along outside bottom edge of the bridge walls.

The toy is battery operated.

name: Hop 'N Stomp
description: Players strap a pad with suction cups to their feet and try to pick up rubber dics on the floor which have point values. High score when all discs have been picked up is the winner.

name: Masters del Universo
description:
The cards are divided between the forces of good and evil i.e. He-Man and Allies against the cohorts of Skeletor.

Each player gets 4 cards and another card is revealed. If you card is a 'Good' character, the first player must play a 'Bad' character to win the trick and vice-versa. Players draw a new card and the top card of the deck is revealed again, and play continues. The player who wins the most tricks after the last card is revealed from the deck, wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: De Fabeltjeskrant 3D zoek-de-verschillen spel
description:
Players build a diorama from the box by putting the 2 side panels between the box lid and bottom. Players build the starting scene by placing some 5 or 6 (of the in total 16) playing pieces into the slots inside the box. Now all players try to memorize the scene before 1 player turns away the scene and adds a playing piece to the scene. Now the scene is turned back. The rest of the
players now try to find out which playing piece has been added.

The first player to state which playing piece has been added scores 1 point. Now the next player can add a playing piece to the scene etc. etc. until a player scored 3 points and wins the game. Players can also start with a lot of playing pieces in the slots and remove a piece in each turn. A combination of these 2 versions is obviously the hardest way to play the game.

name: Game of Mickey Monk
description:
Simple children's golf themed race game. Players use dice for movement along track.

Boxtop has stylized chimp in white shirt with white/red check pants and cap in a backswing with a driver to hit a golf ball. Stylized fairway scene in background.

name: Caverns & Crystals: Rule the Rock!
description:
Aggressive worker placement. Control a tribe of stone creatures fighting, mining & building in the heart of an asteroid. 1 to 4 players. Caverns & Crystals is a worker placement game that relies on direct conflict between players as each tries to gather the most resources and build their tribe of Stone Imps to its maximum potential.

The board is made up of six hexagonal cards in a circle representing an asteroid drifting through space. As the game progresses (depending upon the turn cards that are placed in the center)three resources are placed upon the cards: Stone, used for spawning more members of your tribe, Metal, used to beat your opponent into submission and precious power crystals which will win you the game! By tactically placing your Stone Imps onto different Cavern Cards on the board you can dominate an area and ensure it is your imps who bring the crystals home. Be careful however, as somewhere in that asteroid there is a very hungry space squid placed secretly by another player that will devour your tribe and a vacuum that will eject them into space!
Most importantly you have an Imp king leading your tribe who will give your imps a dramatic boost when used with forethought. At the beginning of the turn a set of six cards is passed around to each player who takes one secretly. Each card gives your king a power to use for that turn whether it is sneaking into an opponents home to take their resources or surprising your opponents by teleporting your tribe at the last minute. You will have to think very carefully as you select your card and ponder what your opponents have chosen.
Caverns & Crystals can even be played Solo where it ceases to be a game of deducing your opponents' actions and becomes an intense puzzle where a player must be as efficient as possible to succeed. The Game Itself comes in a small tin ensuring it remains safe and undamaged between plays.

So do you have what it takes to build your tribe and Rule the Rock!

name: Turnier
description:
There are 4 different moving playing pieces in two colors: 1 favorite, 1 herold, 5 servants and 4 mounted knights. The players have to get their favorite into the opposite castle or capture the enemy favorite to win the game. On the game board, which looks like a chess board, only the red and green spaces are used. Movement is diagonal. The brown spaces in the middle of the game board between the red und the green area are safe spaces (Asyl).

The favorite moves 1 space in any direction.
The herold moves 1 or 2 spaces in any direction.
The mounted Knights move 2 spaces in any direction and can jump over other piecess, they may not occupy Asyl.
The servants move 1 space in any direction. Knights and servants may not move backwards till their own favorite has passed Asyl and is on the enemy half of the game board.
Any piece can capture any enemy piece if it moves onto the space it is occupying.

name: Electric Jack Straws
description:
An electric version of the Jack Straws game. The twist in this game is that metal tweezers are used to pick up the straws through a metal lid. Touching the lid with the tweezers sets off the alarm as in the electric game Operation.

The straws have various colors and a point value is assigned to each color.

There were multiple version of this game.

name: Cattura
description:
Renaissance Wars were a series of conflicts that involved most of the city states of Italy in a struggle for power and were marked with numerous alliances, betrayals and battles.

"Cattura" means "to capture" and that's the goal of the game, capture cards from the battlefield and score the most victory points at the end of the battle.

During a turn a player can either place a card on the battlefield, resolving any actions in the red zone of the card or capture a card from the battlefield, rezolving any actions in the blue zone of the card.

A game ends when either a player captures four cards in front of him or a player has no more cards in his hand.

Scoring is based on the value of captured cards cards and the combinations of crests

name: C'est pas Sorcier: Mystères de la science 2
description:
Discover the mysteries of science.

The player in his turn draws a card and announces the theme. He reads the first clue, then the next until any other player finds the right answer and wins the card. The first player who has a card of each theme wins.

There are 40 2-sided picture cards with 5 themes such a:
ecology, geology, mathematics, medicine etc.

name: C'est pas Sorcier: Mystères de la science
description:
Discover the mysteries of science.

The player in his turn draws a card and announces the theme. He reads the first clue, then the next until any other player finds the right answer and wins the card. The first player who has a card of each theme wins.

There are 40 2-sided picture cards with 5 themes such a: chemistry, physics, biology, astronomy, archeology.

name: Les énigmes des Chevaliers et Châteaux-Forts
description:
Tournaments and fortresses, to you to win the battle!

The player in his turn draws a card and announces the theme. He reads the first clue, then the next until any other player finds the right answer and wins the card. The first player who has a card of each theme wins.

There are 40 2-sided picture cards with 5 themes such a:
castle and city, nobility, knights etc.

name: Magical Reunion
description:
User summary:

A quirky card game with a trick-taking-ish mechanism. Players are dealt ingredient cards numbered –1 to 4, with varying colours. These are played, in turn, in a kettle that can hold up to a certain total. when the kettle is filled, the player who played the last card on the kettle distributes the ingredients to all players in a certain order. Then, the players in order get to use their ingredients to create magic items from a lineup.

The first player to create all five types of magic items, or who has most types when the game end conditions are met, wins the game.

name: Touhou Genso Yugiban
description:
User summary:

A roll-and move dice-driven battle board game based on character from Project Shrine Maiden.

The players walk around on the board, defeating characters and gaining them for their team, finally trying to take on the final boss.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pink Elephant
description:
Simple children's game which combines Bingo with a top.

The bingo aspect is that the winner is trying to mark a line of three on a 5x3 card of animals. Instead of "Bingo!" the player shouts "Pink Elephant!" Winner of the particular game gets point chips from other player depending on circumstances. PLayers then shuffle cards and start another round.

Overall winner is player who has the most points at the conclusion of play. (The rules are nebulous on how many rounds should be played.)

Another twist in this game is how the squares to be covered are to be selected. Instead of a draw bag as in Bingo a top is used. On the tops spindle are placed two plastic discs. One red and one white. The top with the two discs is spun in the game box bottom which has a gridded board with various colored animals in it.

The red disc indicates what color of animal should be covered and the white disc indicates what animal. There are also provisions in the rules for covering multiple spaces. As an added twist it is acceptable to nudge the top to try and get it to throw a disc off in a particular direction!

name: Lost Legacy: Game Market spring 2014
description:
User summary:

A half unofficial Lost Legacy set, based on the Japanese indie board game scene, where every card represents an indie board game publisher.

Please refer to the family entry for details on the publication of various Lost Legacy sets.

name: Lost Legacy: Game Market fall 2014
description:
User summary:

A half unofficial Lost Legacy set, based on the Japanese indie board game scene, where every card represents an indie board game publisher.

The Lost Legacy in this set is "Lost Legacy Legend".

Please refer to the family entry for details on the publication of various Lost Legacy sets.

name: Bandersnatch
description:
A Bandersnatch is a 3D figure with feet, a body, a tail and a nose. To win the players are trying to build Bandersnatch in rounds as in Cootie. But there are a couple of twists to the simpler game of Cootie.

To win a chance on getting a body part the player must win a spinner. The catch is that there is one less spinner than there are players. So in each round one player won't get a chance to obtain a Bandersnatch part.

The players all grab for a spinner when any player builds a hand of 4 cards of the same color. So there is an action/dexterity element to the game too.

Play begins with dealing 4 cards to each player. On a signal of go from the dealer all players look at their cards. If no one has four of a kind then each player passes card card face down to player on left. Again on go player pick up card and dtermine if they have four of a kind.

name: 4:20 The Boardgame
description:
4:20 is a dice rolling game for 1 to 4 players. The aim of the game is to roll as many joints from your boss’s stash as possible.
But what fun is that unless you get to dabble in the goods?
By the time the clock hits 4:20am the player with the most J’s is declared King of Toke!
Just make sure you stay awake! Take too many puffs and risk ‘greening out’.
Move around the apartment, gather Joints, feed the munchies by raiding the refrigerator,
session up in the living room, or strip down and jump in the hot tub. The night is yours!

Setup:
Place the Board in the middle of the table. Place the time marker on the 4:20pm square of the time track.
Shuffle the Kitchen, living room, Hot Tub and Bedroom card decks and place each deck beside the corresponding room on the board.
Place the Joint tokens beside the board in reach of everyone.
Each player chooses a character and takes the corresponding player board and avatar.
The person who’s the biggest stoner starts. If you can’t decide who that is – play rock paper scissors to decide.
The Starting player places there character on any room in the house (except the bathroom). In clockwise order each player places their character in any empty room they choose (once again, not the bathroom). Only one player can be in any room at the same time.

How to Play
The starting player takes the 5 dice and rolls them all. They can then put aside any die they wish to keep (this is called “locking”). The player has 2 rerolls (unless stated otherwise like in “The Bedroom”) so can roll the dice 3 times in total per turn. After your rerolls you apply your results.
Each Turn Consists of
Resolve room power on board if it states “Start of Turn”
Roll all Dice. Put aside any dice you wish to keep (All clock dice are automatically “locked” – see below)
Reroll (this is optional) any dice up to 2 times except “locked” dice. They must be put aside.
Resolve dice (see below for results and order)
The Dice Results are as follows

J = Take one J token (1 per J)
M = Move. You must move to another location in the apartment. If it is occupied by another player they must move to your location as only one player per room is allowed. If 2 M’s are rolled you do not move and must take a card from the room deck you are in. If 3 M’s are rolled and you have no rerolls left you must move to the bathroom square. Your turn is over and disregard any other dice results except clock rolls. (do not collect J’s or dish out puffs)
C= Clock. Time passes and for every C rolled the time marker moves one square up. Every C rolled is instantly “locked”. You cannot reroll any C results (unless a card states otherwise).
P= Puff. All other players take a puff and must move their awake marker up one square on their player boards.


Order in a turn
When applying results, do so in the following order.
1 IF you have 3 “M’s” Proceed directly to bathroom , Ignore all other dice except clocks this turn. Advance clock if applicable and your turn ends.
2 Take all J’s
3 Everyone else takes Puffs
4 Move or take room card and resolve (if applicable)
5 Advance clock
6 End your turn. Pass dice to player on your left

Bathroom:
Nature called and you had to go to the bathroom. Damn, the locks broken.. How the hell do you get out you ask?! Getting stuck in the bathroom is no fun at all.
As soon as you enter the bathroom lose 5 J’s (they fell in!)
Roll dice as usual but.....Bathroom rolls are a bit different
No” J” results count when rolling dice, you can still make the others take puffs and the clock still ticks on as normal.

Escaping the Bathroom:
The only way out of the bathroom space (unless you have a card) is by rolling and “locking” 2 “M’s”. You must then go to any empty room in the house and play on as normal. If you have any rerolls left this turn you may continue to roll unlocked dice. Resolve dice normally at the end of your turn (ignoring the 2 “M’s” used to escape the bathroom).
Time / Awake Tracks / Game End
If any players awake track hits “white out” that player has fallen asleep and is out of the game. If all other players fall asleep the last player awake is the winner.
As soon as the time track hits 4:20am the game is over. All awake players add up their J’s and the stoner with the most wins! If that is also tied the most awake stoner wins....
If both J’s and Awake are tied..... geeeze?!? Play again!!

name: Three Inch Glory II
description:
Three Inch Glory is a wargame set in the 18th Century and designed for play with Playmobil® figures.

Requirements:

two armies of 10 to 100 figures each
a ruler for measuring formation maneuvers
a 20-sided die or a computer for the spreadsheet calculator


End conditions differ by scenario, but the basic game is to play until an army surrenders or is eliminated.

name: Three Inch Glory III
description:
Three Inch Glory is a wargame set in the 18th Century and designed for play with Playmobil® figures.

Requirements:

two armies of 25 to 250 figures each
a deck of cards for officer/orders activation
a ruler for measuring formation maneuvers
lots of 6 sided dice for resolving attacks


End conditions differ by scenario, but the basic game is to play until an army surrenders or is eliminated.

The third iteration of the game has been simplified from the previous edition. Notably, the rulebook is half the previous length.

name: Big Game Hunt
description:
From the designer:
A game of dinosaur hunting for ages 7 and up! These straightforward, fun rules take up an entire 2 pages, including character record sheets! Plenty of fun with miniature figures, toy dinosaurs and anything else you have lying about.

User note:
The game calls for a deck of cards for activation (though the specific rules are ambiguous). Uses 1-2 d6 with modifiers for most actions. Solo play is possible, because dinosaurs move relative to the nearest hunter.

name: Bugs!
description: Bugs! is a simple miniatures combat game played with plastic insects, tokens for goals (like candy), a few polyhedral dice, and a ruler. A player must get at least one bug on each goal to win.

name: Come With Me If You Want To Live!
description:
Come With Me If You Want To Live! is a roll-and-move game with "take-that" cards.

Players take the role of leaders who seek to save a chosen few. Each is convinced that only they can save their followers from a coming apocalypse. Your goal is to have the most followers at the end of the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: 1936: España Dividida
description:
1936 - Spain divided, is based on the classic system of "A House Divided", modified to play modern warfare wargame.
After the failed coup, led by the army, against a weak republic, the Spanish territory and society, it is split almost exactly in half, into two opposing camps.
This is a game for two players, Nationalist and Republican.
The Nationalist army with better troops form North Africa, best foreign support of Hitler and Mussolini, get advance control of the country.
The Republican, despite having major cities, will have to organize a new army, on the basis of militia enlisted from the start of the war.
The objective of the game is that the Nationalis player controls whole country before the end of the war. Otherwise the Republican wins the game.
It is also possible that the Republican player wins before the end of the game.
The game features a map of 25,5x22 , one 5/8?? counter sheet.
The army of players is divided into grades. These are, columns, regular, veterans and elite. The two armies will evolve during the game to better qualities or worse depending on conditions of each side.
The full game lasts 29 turns, each player starts with 14 combat units.
There aviation support units, artillery and armored.
Also special units such as moros, requetés, Italian, international militia etc ...

name: Montevideo y Maracaibo. Escenarios para Cien Cañones por Banda (combate naval 1750-1800)
description: Published in Alea magazine 31, add two new scenarios (Montevideo 1814 abd Maracaibo 1823) and new counters for Argentina, Colombia and Spain, and two correction counters for Cien Cañones por Banda.

name: Thorobred
description:
Seems to be a simple race game with dice. The set includes d6 dice, 6 plastic horses with jockey (yellow, white, black, green, red and blue) and a board with 6 lanes which has a number of spaces marked off. Guessing that the main game is a simple race to end of row and back which would be about 30 spaces.

Boxtop has a race trail rail from left right and curving around back to right. Above rail mostly red and below yellow. "Thorobred" is at the top of the box, in yellow print on the red backtop. There are four horses showing on left side of box.

name: Donjon: A Dice Game
description:
A dice-rolling game where you (and up to 5 more friends) explore an ancient dungeon with monsters and treasure! Defeat the boss monster, and win the game!

On each of your turn, navigate the dungeon to encounter monsters and treasure. If you encounter a monster, only one of you lives!
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Zucchini
description:
SQUASH the competition in the farming game that grows on you!

Share a plot of land between your friends and compete to harvest the most zucchini. During your turn, you have the choice to lengthen a vine or grow a zucchini in size. Once you grow a zucchini to 3 cards in length, draw an Action Card. You might get to fertilize your plants, kill your opponents' chances with blight, or harvest a vine for points. The first player to 30 points is the winner!

It's time to get growing.

name: Lek og lær: farver + former + mengder
description: An educational game aimed at preschoolers, where the point is to match shapes, colours and numbers. It is played as a lotto game – tiles are drawn from a pool, and are placed on matching squares on the players' boards. The twist is that the active player does not show the tile to the others, but instead calls out the type, colour and number of shapes depicted (e. g. "six red triangles"). The first to cover all squares on their board is the winner.

name: Skirmish Dice: Cursed Artifacts
description:
Ancient and mysterious entities, known only as Artifacts, drift from planet to planet engulfing entire civilizations. They travel together, appear on a planet, and cause nations to frenzy. Most recently, they appeared on Gallia. Players represent factions fighting for control of these Artifacts. Some want them destroyed entirely. Some simply don’t want them in enemy hands. And still, others want to use their power to enslave the world. Players will have to build their teams and enter the battlefield. Lose, and you have failed your people, perhaps your entire civilization.

Skirmish Dice is a customizable skirmish game. Using powerful leaders, sizable brutes, clever totems, and more, players customize their teams and send them into battle. Units are represented by dice on the field, and each unit’s corresponding card holds its actions, abilities, statistics, and more. The game is highly tactical and meant to move, meaning you can get the experience of a skirmish/squad level miniatures or card game in a smaller timeframe.

While the units are dice, the game doesn’t suffer from luck-induced chaos. The dice faces are significant to character abilities and are rolled to receive offensive and defensive bonuses. It’s streamlined and quick to learn, but the strategy runs deep as team building can offer hundreds of combinations within factions.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Seafari Under the Sea
description: Seafari Under the Sea is a spin-and-move game where players move around a track of bubbles "under the sea." Each player has a puzzle picture card, and all the puzzle pieces are face-down on the table. As they move, players land on spaces that allow them to pick one, two or three puzzle pieces. They must take face-down pieces and try to match them to their puzzle. If they match, the may be added to the puzzle. If not, they are returned to the face-down pile. Some spaces also force players to put a puzzle piece back or stay on the space until a certain number is spun. The first player to complete his or her puzzle wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alpha-Bus
description:
Alpha-Bus is an alphabet learning game for young children. The board is shaped like a bus and consists of an outer track of spaces marked with the letters of the alphabet in order. Inside the track are spaces where tiles with each of the letters printed on them are placed face-down. Each player rolls the die and moves their piece along the track. When they land on a letter, they choose a face-down tile of the same color. If the letter matches, they must say the name of the letter and then may roll again. If the letter does not match or they misidentify it, their turn is over. The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

The board is two-sided. On one side, players must match upper-case with upper-case letters. On the other side, a more difficult match between lower-case and upper case is required.

name: Farm Wars
description:
Each player is a farmer living in the remote village of Farmaria. The aim of the game is to grow their farm and col-
lect as many Victory Points, (V.P.) as possible. On the Farm are a number of fields and commodities owned by each player. The V.P. represent the reputation of every player in Farmaria along with the quality of their farm. The game requires strategy along with commercial and business development aptitude.

This is a Strategy game for 2 to 5 players The players invest on their farms using an Action Choice Token System while at the same time the try to upgrade their property in an efficient way, stop other players from winning or interrupt their plans and avoid catastrophic events. The player with the most Victory Points wins the game.

name: Mineral Quiz
description: An educational card game based around asking each other questions on a variety of rocks and minerals. There are a total of 400 questions on 40 different cards. Simple game that is easy to pick up.

name: ATS Core Module: Sujewo Heights – Tigers in the Mud 1944
description:
Tigers in the Mud - Eastern Front Stand at the Panther Line: An all new take on the classic Ostfront battle with remastered, ENLARGED MAP that makes this a one-of a kind experience with armor, armor and did we mention armor? By early 1944, Army Group North held a front that bore the marks of previous battles; a long line built around Leningrad.
