Of course, STAVKA’s Baltic Front planners were determined to break the hold and finally free the city. 1943 ended with Army Group North facing the Russian Third Shock Army. Fighting had continued unabated through a muddy fall, and on into the month of December. Although the Germans had successfully held their front, the fighting power of Armee Gruppe Nord had been greatly reduced. The dead and wounded landsers were replaced by Latvian, Estonian, and Spanish soldiers. When OKW pulled the 5th Mountain Division out of the line, without a replacement, the time had come for a shortening of the front. The result became known as the ‘Panther Line’.
Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

You also need to own the following to play:

Russian Personnel 2014 Edition
German Personnel 2014 Edition
ATS Russian AFVs and H Weapons - 2014D
ATS German AFVs and H Weapons 2014D
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: ATS Core Module: On the Road to Rome – Gothic Line 1944
description:
On the Road to Rome 1944: SANTA MARIA INFANTE: A brand new take on the struggle along the ridge ... along the road to Rome. The Germans are dug in, the Americans well-armed ... the outcome is in YOUR hands. The battle for Santa Maria Infante was important in the opening of the Allied offensive toward Rome on 11 May 1944. Strong Allied forces were concentrated on the west side of the Italian peninsula to renew an effort stopped by the winter and heavy German resistance. Eighth Army was poised for attack through the Liri Valley along the axis of Highway No. 6; main Fifth Army faced a chain of mountains, in a 13-mile zone from the Liri River to the sea. The forces in the Anzio Beachhead were ready to strike when their opportunity came as a result of progress on the other fronts.

Welcome to the ATS CORE MODULES, all new for 2014. New map, larger, on cardstock, folding with no trimming needed -- did we mention new terrain art throughout AND larger hexes? Perfect for those classic -- YET ALL NEW ATS COUNTERS -- the you'll have on the map deciding history ... all ... over ... again! This module is for owners of the ATS 2014 Color Rules plus ATS Standard Small Markers + Large Markers but may also be used easily by owners of any past edition of the ATS rules. All Special Rules and AFV Cards needed for play are included, along with ALL NEW FOLIO STYLE packaging.

You also need to own the following to play:

American Personnel 2014 Edition
German Personnel 2014 Edition
ATS U.S. AFVs and H Weapons - 2014D
ATS German AFVs and H Weapons 2014D
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Zombie Apocalypse Geocaching: Exclusive Kickstarter Pack
description:
Kickstarter backers received the following promo cards, which could also be purchased separately during the Kickstarter:

Group of three survivors
Serum Z9Y
Serum Z4Y
Timed high explosive
The Zombie Hunter
Zombie Overlord


They also received 26 card stands so that the Zombies will be 3-D when they walk around the board.

name: Tussipect-Winterspiel
description: Simple roll-and-move-game. The first player to reach space 120 wins the game. The angular spaces are event-spaces, which are explained in the game rules..
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Odol-Spiel
description:
Simple roll-and-move-game with health graphics. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game. The yellow spaces are event spaces, which are explained in the game rules.

The game was published in the early 1960s.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Draftamania: Rise of the Promotions
description:
Draftamania: Rise of the promotions is the fast-paced card game of wrestling promotion management. A game of Draftamania takes place over a number of turns. Each turn comprises of three phases:

The Pre-Show phase - Where players draft wrestlers to their roster and buy special Booster cards (to both improve their Roster and to hinder their opponents). Each player draws a House Show card and books their wrestlers to appear in their show. Finally decisions are made about the outcomes of the various segments such as which wrestlers are receiving pushes.

The Showtime phase - Where players take turns describing (commentating) their Show and roll the dice to determine the results of the various Segments. Even the best laid plans and flawless booking can be undone on the night by bad luck, injuries or a crucially timed disruptive Boosters played by an opponent.

The Post-Show phase - In the aftermath of the show players vote to give the best General Manager award to one player. Additionally, gate receipts are calculated, Rosters reorganised and Wrestler’s appeased.

The phases are played simultaneously by the players with the exception of part of the Showtime phase where players take turns to commentate on their own show and roll the dice to decide the results of Segments. During the each of the phases the players will have the opportunity to build a roster of wrestlers for their Promotion. These wrestlers are further developed with Booster cards, such as pleasing moves, story lines, equipment and arenas, dirty tricks to play on rival player's promotions.

Finally each player will then book their Wrestlers into Shows and Pay-Per-View special events in order to gain Popularity Points (PP). At the end of each Post-Show phase, the players count their Popularity Points; the player who reaches the goal number (different for the different variants) has managed to impress Network TV bosses, signed a TV Network deal and wins the game.

name: The Tideline of Exile
description:
User Summary:
亡国のタイドライン (The Tideline of Exile) is a game by 中村 泰之 (Yasuyuki Nakamura) for the doujin circle merry-andrew-works.

This is a card game with a WW2 theme of Submarine vs Submarine combat. The game uses an identity concealment system. In the confusion of war, players collect gold, confidential documents and defectors. The submariners try to evade mines and torpedoes, navigate dangerous waters and escape depth charges launched by the enemy.

Designer Summary:
潜水艦ｖｓ潜水艦 Ｕボートがテーマの正体隠匿系カードゲーム。戦争の混乱で四散した「金塊」「機密文書」「亡命者」を集め、機雷や魚雷、爆雷の待ち構える危険な海域を仲間と共に脱出しましょう！
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Nautical, World War II
publishers: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

name: The Enclave
description:
Flavor backstory:

The Enclave is a city of opportunity and adventure; a place to earn a name for yourself. It's treacherous surroundings offer endless chances to take on daring quests and slay fearsome monsters.Of course slaying monsters requires quality gear, and you won't just find it laying around. But no worries, there are always tasks to be done to earn some coin; such as helping the blacksmith forge some tools, or helping the Inn Keeper fix up the place. While the Enclave has always been known as a "safe haven" from the terrors that surround it, recently it's fortification has been tested due to a Dragon that has made home near by. Although adventurers do come through often, not many are brave enough to go toe to toe with a dragon. That's where you come in! It's about time someone stood up to that gigantic, fire-breathing, armor-like-scale covered, razor fanged, flying pest. No true Hero wants to share that glorious triumph, so your on your own. It's time to forge your legacy!

Gameplay Description:

Each player stars the game by choosing a Hero. There are 4 races to choose from, Human, Elf, Dwarf, and Orc. Each has a unique starting deck of skill cards and 1 unique trait card. The skills are Strength, Dexterity, and Focus. These will be the power behind your actions. Each side of the main deck has 4 revealed cards. One side represents outside the Enclave, the other represents inside it. You will use the cards in your hand drawn from your deck to interact with the revealed cards. This includes slaying a monster, completing a task, or buying gear. Your actions reward experience in the form of skill cards. These are collected and then added to your deck once you level up. You can either buy bigger and badder gear, or upgrade what you have. You can also spend all of the cards in your hand to gain a new talent card which is added to your deck. Once you feel your ready to go, you can face off with the Dragon. Defeat it, and you've not only won the game, but also forged your name in glory for all of eternity! Or at least until an expansion comes out with a bigger dragon....

What makes it Unique:

Experience: Unlike other deck-building games, you don't "buy" cards from the main pool and add them into your deck. Instead you complete tasks and defeat monsters to earn "experience" in the form of skill cards. Those are what get's added to your deck. How does more of the same card help you? Most importantly, adding MORE of these cards allows you to level up your character. This also gives you a chance to really fine-tune your character. If you want to wield a sword, you'll need strength behind it, and so completing Strength tasks earns you more Strength cards. The more Strength cards in your deck, the more often you will draw them. Also, the more cards in your deck, the more turns you can take before you need to rest (recycling your discard pile for your deck). There are also trait cards such as Relentless, Fearsome, Agile, and Clever. Each of these provides a different effect when played. At the end of the game, you've built a truly unique Hero with a unique deck of cards to power it!

Leveling: Each player only starts with a hand of 3 cards, which is then increased by leveling up your Hero. The larger hand size gives the player more potential power behind their actions, which is not only required to defeat the Dragon, but feels very rewarding.

Theme implementation: The tasks in the game are simple labor jobs but the skills required to complete them are intuitive and logical. For example, the Blacksmiths' task requires Strength to forge ingots while the Alchemist' task of preparing potions requires Focus. This helps eliminate that disconnect many deck-building games have.

These are just some of the many unique mechanics that make The Enclave a deck-building game that we feel truly stands out among the rest!

The game is set to release at the end of April, 2015.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Audatia: Armour Expansion Pack
description:
Audatia: Armour Expansion Pack expands an Audatia Duel Deck with a range of armoured combat cards.

The expansion enables you to use armoured fighting techniques when duelling against an armoured or unarmoured opponent.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Medieval

name: Assassins of Vance
description:
Assassins of Vance is a game for 2-4 players in which you maneuver to become the leader of the Assassins Guild in Vance, city of splendor. It is the first board game designed by Vic Davis, owner and operator of Cryptic Comet Games. Vic's previous games have been computer turn based strategy games and have won praise from critics and fans alike for their stimulating board game like mechanics.

Players first select a player card that represents their Assassin each possessing a unique one time use special ability and then assign dice from a pool to 4 attributes: Combat, Stealth, Traps and Lore. The assignments indicate how many dice are rolled for each corresponding challenge type and what face results constitute success when the dice are rolled.

Play then proceeds in rounds where each player takes his turn. 2 and 4 player games last 8 rounds while 3 player games last 9 rounds.

During their turn players can choose 2 of 8 possible actions (some actions can only be chosen once)

1. Visit the Guild Healer (pay gold to remove wound tokens)
2. Draw Guild Stipend (gold) (only once per turn)
3. Buy an Item Card
4. Buy a Spell Card (if you have a skill card that allows this)
5. Visit the Guild Sorcerer (pay gold to charge a spell)
6. Draw 2 Secret Objective Cards (keep 1 or none)(only once per turn)
7. Play a Guild Card for its Guild Event text
8. Attempt a Mission Contract Card (only once per turn)

The objective of the game is to accumulate Influence Points (IP). Influence Points can be gained by either successfully completing Mission Contract cards or buying influence cards at the end of the round during the Influence Bidding Phase where cards are auctioned off to the highest bidder. Each influence card has an IP value and a unique passive special ability that can help the player out during the game.

Mission Contract cards are at the heart of the game and represent assassination targets that the guild has available for its guild members. Players can play Guild Cards face down before the round begins to the revealed Mission Contract cards on the table in order to help their own or hurt their opponents' chances of accomplishing the mission. Missions vary from level 1 to 5 and offer an array of rewards from Influence Points to gold and additional ability die. However, the greater the rewards, the higher the risk that your assassin will be wounded or fail the mission. Take too many wound tokens and you are out of the game.

Each mission is composed of a chain of challenges corresponding to the 4 ability types on the player cards i.e. combat, stealth, etc.. Players determine the level of the challenge (number of successes needed) from the contract card and then select a challenge card from the top 3 revealed cards of the Challenge Deck. The challenge card indicates the type of challenge and the pass/fail rules. Players roll the appropriate number of dice, use Guild Cards, Item Cards, Skill Cards, Spell Cards and fate tokens (rerolls) to modify the results and hopefully win the challenge. Players can press their luck along the challenge track to earn better rewards but must be careful as a red skull challenge that is failed means that the mission is failed and all rewards are lost. Sometimes things just don't go well from the start and the player may elect to abort the mission.

Players also have the opportunity to use Guild Card Interrupts to take actions during their opponents turns to disrupt their carefully laid assassination plans.

When the last round finishes players add up their IP from their completed Mission Contract cards, Influence Cards and completed Secret Objective cards(uncompleted cards penalize the player). The player with the most IP wins and becomes the Master of The Assassins Guild in Vance.

name: Rot-Eins-Rund
description:
Educational game for kids to learn colors, different shapes and the numbers 1-5.
The number of shapes on the Players Card have to match to the written number on the board, to place the card in front of him.
First games should start with 4 open Cards for each kid.
There is a round course with fields showing a shape and a number.
There is 1 pig figure which is moved by the Players.
On Players turn he puches an arrow, rotating to a field showing 1 to 4 feet. The Player can choose if he moves the pig this number of feet forward or back on track.
If the Player has a card showing exact the number of this kind of shapes he can turn the Card face down.
Next Players turn.
Winner is the first player having all Cards turned face down.
In further games the number of cards can be increased to 9 and it's possible to add a Memory part. All Cards are face down first and you have to know without looking first which of your cards match the pig field. (found Cards are turned to face up)

name: PRADO
description:
On the steps of the Prado, four enemy tribes try to dispossess each other. The tribe chiefs have to be rescued. Otherwise the tribe is lost.
Position of the pawn gives the number of fields it can be moved. Captured pawns are out of the game.
The owner of the last tribe chief wins the game.

name: Marco de los Apeninos a los Andes
description:
Game based on a character from a Spanish children's film about a young boy's journey from the Appenines to the Andes.

32 cards in four suits of 8 cards. The first player lays a card. The next player must play either the same colour card or the same value of the played card. The four cards numbered 5 may be played as a Joker and can represent any umber or colour.

The object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First to do so scores nil points. The other players score points equal to the value of each card left in their hand. Wild cards still in a hand score 25 points against the holder. The player with the lowest score when a pre-arranged number of games have been played, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Land of Legends
description:
Land of legends is a board game that will intrigue any and all fans of strategic and PvP type battles. The number of player may vary from 2 to 4 with an age limit of 13 and up. The rules of the game are very simple.

The main objective of the game is to rule over the entire island.

In the Land of Legends game there are 2 races: human and undead.

At first you have to choose between those races, as well as the place where player want to place his castle.

Locations of castles can be established through discussion, if positions cannot be agreed upon players must roll the dice to establish castle placement.

In the game there are two playing fields: The World Map and The City. The World Map is where you will send your armies to battle your opponents and capture enemy castles; throwing dice will move your army in the direction of your choosing. During your journeys you will encounter bonuses and obstacles. Also during your journey throughout the world map you can develop your castle. While on the playing field of the World Map players will land on certain places that will move them to the City Map where they will have the opportunity to hire mercenaries such as: Wizards, Archers, Swordsmen and Horsemen. Players will also be able to buy or find various artifacts and potions for their hero.

name: Los Mundos de Yupi
description:
Game based on a character in a Spanish children's series.

All the cards are dealt out and play continues in the same way as quartet games. You ask another player for a certain numbered card. If that person has it, the card is given to the player who asked for it. Then he may ask another player (or the same player again) for another numbered card. If he gets a positive response, his turn continues. But if the player asked does not have that cards, the questioner's turn ends and the player asked starts the next round of questions.

The object is to lay face-down in front of you any set of 3 consecutively numbered cards. These are safe and cannot be taken by anyone else. On future turns you may add further numbers as long as they are of a consecutive number. When all the cards are placed in such 'runs', the game ends and the player with the most cards, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flipped Progress
description:
Flipped Progress is a game pre-developed as a Global Game Jam challenge of 2015 which the theme was "What do we do now?".

In this game players shall cooperate to balance the environment between nature and pollution, also, managing energy points which are required to perform actions.

Every turn, the board acts through a dice and the possible outcome is: nature grows, industries produce both energy and pollution, cities grow or finally new location tiles are placed. Players can shift the odds on their favor against the board by using a dice system in which faces can be changed.

Each tile generates its own type of tokens and as they get filled up with these tokens they can or spread it to neighbor tiles or it's own tile is flipped to reveal an opposite aspect of itself, for example, woods can become a desert and a city can become ruins.

At the end of a turn, players choose how to spend energy: changing the environment or generating progress.
Finally, At the count of 5 progress points, the players wins.

name: Fool's Dice
description:
Fool's Dice is a simple race and gambling game where players roll dice and attempt to move their marker up a metaphorical mountain. Players initiate "scrambles" where they roll specially-designed "target dice" to create a target number, then roll "number dice" to see if they can score under that target number. If they do so, they can move their marker a specified number of steps up the mountain. They can choose to gamble and continue their "scramble" until they fail to meet their target.

If the target roll is not met, they will fall back to where they started at the beginning of their turn. Additionally, they must pay a penalty. These penalties are devised at the start of the game by the players and provide the "party" atmosphere, since penalties can be things like "Wash one dish in the sink," or "Run around the room 10 times."

Players also have three chances to knock a player's marker back down the mountain. This action, combined with the supposed humorous nature of the penalties, provides as the box says, "An extremely unique and wildly intense party game for two to six players."

According to the interior of the rule book, the first printing of this 1991 edition was of 3000 copies.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ChitChat
description:
ChitChat is a card game for two players that simulates the exchange of small talk between two acquaintances at a social function. Each player has a pet topic and the first player to make a couple of points on their pet topic wins the game. Alternatively if one player lets the conversation lag, then their opponent has won.

The game is played with a deck of cards formed from two regular decks.
The suits are considered to match the following topics:
Hearts - sport
Diamonds - economy
Spades - politics

The cards are laid out in a track as played, showing the flow of conversation. The game tracks who is currently winning the argument by having the layout stepped towards the currently dominant player. Strategy revolves around the tension between holding cards back to block versus capitalizing on an advantage. You can win by scoring a few points, or by running your opponent's hand down so that they are unable to play.

name: Hacker Rat! Card Game
description:
HACKER RAT
This is a strategic hacker-powered version of russian roulette.

Players take turns drawing cards until someone draws an hacker RAT and loses the game. The deck is made up of cards that let you avoid blowing up by peeking at cards before you draw, forcing your opponent to draw multiple cards, or shuffling the deck.

The game gets more and more intense with each card you draw because fewer cards left in the deck means a greater chance of drawing the hacking RAT and blowing up computer devices.

name: Command & Conquer: The Board Game
description:
This game is a free web-published board game on Command & Conquer 1: Tiberian Dawn.

It is a wargame for 2 players. Build your base, harvest precious crystals of Tiberium, and crush your enemy.

You have tokens for your units and your buildings. Maintain power in your base, harvest Tiberium and eliminate the construction yard of your opponent.

Additional features allows you to play with event cards which are spicing up the game !
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Silesia
description:
From the publisher's catalogue:

The players' task is to develop industry and infrastructure in Silesia - region know for it's abundant natural resources. They erect mines, ironworks and factories as well as extend their reach by laying rails. At the same time they have to take care about Silesian environment by reforesting wastelands.

User Summary:
Silesia is new board games by Krzysztof Matusik in the game line started by Cargo Train. The basic components are 110 cards. Silesia is a card game where players will focus on building, mining and producing in combined engines.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Environmental, Industry / Manufacturing, Trains

name: People Are People
description:
From the publisher's catalogue:

You are a city founder. Like each and every city, yours also needs inhabitants. You've got a whole year to create and ideal community. During each season you'll be able to choose from among many professionals. Pick them and take care of relations between them. Use their abilities to help develop your growing community.

User Summary
People Are People is a new board games by Krzysztof Matusik from game line started by Cargo Train. The basic components are 110 cards. People Are People use card drafting mechanic like in 7 Wonders. In this game players try to build their own ideal, perfect, utopian society. But as we all well know, people are only humans and it isn't as easy as it sounds.

name: DOV: Days of Valour
description:
DOV is the base set of rules for WW2 and Modern Tactical wargaming at the Squad and Platoon level. It is the base product for the "Valour" series of games, and handles all the rules for the small-scale tactical combat play for that system. Unit's and counters represent squads, individual tanks, support weapons, crews, etc.

This game can be played either stand alone with miniatures for 15mm, GHQ, or HO miniatures. The company also has several hex map and counter add on modules that can be used for more traditional non-miniatures based play.

DOV is a fast paced set of game rules that strikes a good balance between realism in war game simulation play and playability. Unit cards contain detailed weapons, vehicle and nationality based attributes that give players a crisp experience of the small scaled fighting realities of that historical era.

When combined with the add on modules for Flags of Valour, this system also integrates with a new kind of Fog of War set of mechanics never before used in war gaming.

The base rules are an 80 page booklet, 12 page data book, Command and STRAT cards, along with a sheet of control and marking counters for Unit Status.

Comes with data cards on the vast majority of German, American, Russian, British, and Commonwealth troops used during World War 2.
categories: Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Barbie Charmed Travels
description: Players roll the die to move around the game board, attempting to land on Destination Spaces in order to collect charms to put on their charm bracelets. Once a player has collected 4 charms (one of each possible color), they only have to return to their Home Space to win the game.

name: Hundi PIPIK
description:
12 wolfs are around the moon.
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and choose the sum of one or both dice to place his pawn onto the wolf with the same value.
Game ends if all wolfs have at least on pawn on it.
The players count their points depending the positions of their pawns and the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Promethean Wars
description:
2 Players, ages 12 & up

Game Components:
Miniatures
Modular Terrain
Dice
Cards
Tokens
Rulebook
Field Manual
Command & Control Panel

Kickstarter Date: Summer 2016 (tentative)
Much more info coming soon!

Promethean Wars is currently being developed and tested on Tabletopia as well. If you're interested in testing the current build, please message the creator.

Game Description:
Two players take up the role of opposing sides as infantry squad leaders. Your squad has been called upon to re-gain control of a sector that is getting overrun by your opponent. Kill enemy targets, complete objectives, and regain control of sectors to score points to win. As a leader you will need to monitor your squad's tenacity, manage risks, apply countermeasures. You will also decide when to take tactical halts allowing your members to catch their breath, apply first aid, and reload weapon systems.

name: The 10th War
description: The 10th War is a head to head battle game about World War 10. It is based in the future around 2300 AD. There are currently two factions, the rebels and the oppressors. Customize your deck, command vehicles, events, characters, and equipment. Use those cards to attack their forces, roll dice, and once their characters have all been cleared out of the way, you can attack and destroy their base, winning the game.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: How I got to the E.R
description:
How I got to the E.R is a party game that has no room for a solid plan and keeps the creative juices flowing, but thats what ultimately makes the game great! With the lack of time to create your story, what comes out is normally weird, sometimes creepy, and usually hilarious.

GAMEPLAY: Each player is dealt three unique cards and attempts to tell the best story they can within one minute. Once their time is up, it's up to the other players to judge how entertaining the story really was.

name: Air King Game
description: Typical spin and move game. The player who finished first, wins the game.

name: Akatsuki no Tetsudo
description:
暁の鉄道　(Akatsuki no Tetsudo) has the players building the famous Yamanote railway line in Tokyo during the Taisho era. The winner is the player who makes the most money, by dominating the best routes and carrying luggage.

Publisher's summary:
大正時代の東京を舞台に山手線を構築する鉄道敷設、荷物運搬ゲーム。よく利用される路線を支配していればより多くの収益がもらえ、さらに運んだ荷物自体も価値があり、ゲーム終了時により裕福ならばゲームに勝利となる。
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Tile Placement
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Dorako no Yamawake
description:
User summary:
ドラコの山分け　(Dorako no Yamawake) is a pirate themed card game. Players turn up treasure cards in the centre, then compete for them using their cutlass cards. You can gain points by collecting treasure cards of up to 2 different colours, but you start losing points from the third and later colours.

Publisher's summary:
手番プレイヤーは任意の枚数の財宝カードをめくり、それを取る気ならば刀剣カードで取る気を示す。より高い数値を示した人から順番に１枚ずつ財宝カードを取る。財宝カードは２色までがプラス得点になるが３色目からはマイナスになる。
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Laugh Riot!: The Comedy-Improv Card Game
description:
Laugh Riot! is based on a comedy-improv exercise that professional comedians and actors have enjoyed since... like, forever.

108 cards supply endless fodder for the funniest stories that you’ve ever heard, and that you’ve ever told.

The game is based on a comedy improv exercise called “Yes and…”

This exercise is the foundation for good improv: Agree with what your partner has said, and then add something to it.

Laugh Riot! takes the “Yes, and” exercise and combines it with a simple and competitive color and suit matching game. There are 5 different types of cards, that are played in different ways, allowing for chaining of multiple cards, forcing other players to draw cards, and skipping other players, making for a fun and friendly competition to win-while also cooperating to tell a funny story.

On each player’s turn, s/he plays one or more cards and uses whatever word is on the card in a sentence that continues the story, and starts with “Yes, and.”

The humor tends to come naturally by just following the rules of the game. There is no pressure to be funny or creative, and really anyone can tell a funny story.

name: Sport Goofy Game
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Be the first one to pull your team over the line. The proper placement of four different coloured player cards on either side of the rope will show your ability as a quick thinker. This is a fast-paced tug of war game for two or four players that teaches you to match up colours. You still have to watch out that you don't lose your balance and let the other team pull you into the water because you didn't match up your colours correctly.

name: Dainashi
description:
User summary:
だいなしカードゲーム (Dainashi card game) means Spoil and in this game, players try to reach a winning combination of cards whilst also spoiling their opponents' efforts. The cards are in numbers and colours and each player sets the number cards out in front of the other players. The deck also has Special cards with a variety of effects. If you can get four or more cards of the same colour in front of you, you win.

Publisher summary:
"３～５名で遊ぶカードゲームです。
各プレイヤーは手札の中から数字や特殊カードをセットして勝利条件を目指します。
他プレイヤーの勝利条件を邪魔しつつ、勝利を目指します。"
publishers: デバッグフリーク (DEBUG FREAK)

name: P.A.G. Space Battles
description: A two player science fiction wargame played with cards on a tabletop, where each card represents a single space ship or piece of terrain. Objectives are either destroy all of opponents ships (cards) or varied by scenario.

name: Subette Kororin
description:
User summary:
すべってコロリン (Subette Kororin) is a racing game with penguins in the Antarctic. Although it is a simple roll and move game, the way you move depends on whether you roll a 1 or 2, or a 3-6. If you only roll numbers from 3 to 6, then you add these together and move forwards. But any roll of a 1 or 2 counts as a negative multiplier, and you might go forwards or backwards.

For example: A roll of 3,4,6 gives you 3+4+6=16 forwards. A roll of 2,2,6 gives you 6*-2*-2=24 forwards. But a roll of 1,2,2 gives you 0*-1*-2*-2=0.

Publisher's summary:
ペンギンたちの南極でのレースゲーム。双六ですが、１と２が、マイナスの掛け算の目。３～６が足し算の目。掛け算の目を活用すれば一発逆転も狙えます。
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Dazzling Zoo
description:
Welcome to Dazzling Zoo! In our zoo, we only have 5 different animals. Just don't turn round and leave! Our animals are not as usual. Come in and try to figure out their face, color and living place. Only the visitor who has clearest mind will successfully recognize the right animal. So, feel free to explore this dazzling zoo and look how colorful our zoo is, and make sure that you won't feel dizzy after visiting our zoo. Have fun!

Dazzling Zoo is a game that need players to recognize different conditions the next card shows on its back. There are 3 conditions on each card's back, which is 'animal', 'animal's color', and 'living place'. Once the zoo face shows up, player need to figure out the right answer and touch the right tile as soon as possible. However, players should also beware of trapping situation, that if the zoo face is exactly the same as the answering tile, the right tile immediately becomes the wrong tile. Therefore, it is not a game for the quickest player, but for the player with cautiousness as well.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Print & Play

name: Quest for Excellence
description: Quest for Excellence is a take on the game Scrabble, but it adds a different way of playing. There are these cards, kind of quest cards with questions on. If you get the questions right you score extra points in the game, with a bonus if you collect sets of 3 of the card types, by getting all three questions on a card correct. If you do you keep the card and add it to you set of those cards. There are also no double or triple words score blocks on the board, but point amounts for placing a vowel or consonant on a specific place on the board. The board looks like a Scrabble board, but the scoring just works different. The tiles also have a score amount as stated on the board. I would so think of this game as Scrabble, but with more bells and whistles.

name: MegaJail
description:
In the future, crime is out of control. Aliens, gangs, and worse run amok in the unified worlds of the United Galactique. The best solution was the MegaJail, provided by MegaJail Inc., a maximum security franchise.

In MegaJail, the players are Wardens proving who is the best at running a wing of a MegaJail in order to secure a lucrative MegaJail contract. Whoever scores the highest Reputation (your score) after a pre-set turn limit wins. Lots of things influence your Rep - you lose it when Cons (prisoners) escape, or get injured, paroled, or other things. The MegaJail Inc. management also dislikes you spending too much cash, so keep an eye on your budget!

You get Cons in a draft at the beginning of each turn. Then you have a phase with players taking to actions to build new things (like Cells or Facilities). During Lockdown, Cons are put in Cells, which is the major puzzle of the game. Finally News Events happen, Cons may act out, and a new turn is started.

Just scoring the best isn't enough though - Cons cause Hazards, such as Unrest, Contraband, and ongoing Damage - and Cons can get Angry from overcrowding, high Unrest, or other events. If all the Cons are Angry at the end of the turn, the entire MegaJail melts down, and everybody loses.

Part puzzle, part jail sim, part campy. Can you be the best Warden and run your own MegaJail?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Simulation, Take That, Trading

name: ATS Historical Module: Objective Schmidt
description:
ATS OBJECTIVE SCHMIDT is a detailed historical module that tells the story of the Battle of the Huertgen Forest with a broad sweep, and detailed historical map. The presentation is a large as the battle was ... in terms of importance to Allied hopes to be ‘home for Christmas’ ... 1944. Those hopes were dashed by bitter German resistance in the dark, dank wooded hills and villages around the Kall River. Names like Kommerscheidt, Vossenack, and Germeter, not to mention the infamous Kall Trail ... ring out in the history of the battle. Every one of those places is depicted, and more, allowing the tactical-level gamer to contest every inch, or pull back and await reinforcements ... or lay in a mortar barrage ... or stand pat and await new orders. Whatever was possible to local commanders is in YOUR hands as you re-make history in minute detail.

The map presentation is extensive, providing almost a dozen square feet of gaming area with evocative terrain artwork by a professional military illustrator What’s more, when combined with ATS HUERTGEN HELL, OBJECTIVE SCHMIDT creates another CH monster battlefield measuring some six feet in length ... there just has never been anything like it. You’ll be able to gaze across the expanse of the battlefield on both sides of the Kall River, including multiple villages, hundreds of terrain features. And yet, many scenarios play on portions of the overall map area, making the module easy to dive into and get your dice rolling without delay.

The module includes two sheets of 176 5/8” die-cut German and American Personnel and Weapon counters, plus a sheet of 108 AFV/VEHICLES in 3/4” size, a total of 460 counters in all—everything you need to play (just bring your standard ATS markers). You also receive 10 scenarios (all playable on the map provided) in color format, and color Battlefield WalkaroundTM special rules in 3-hole format. THIS IS NOT A COMPLETE GAME! Ownership of the ATS 2014 rulebook and play aids plus standard system small and large marker counters is required (plus one or more 10-sided dice).
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Donnerloch
description:
Players try to buy lots on the game map. Lots will in urn bring the revenues. The lots that pay out are determined by dice.
In the first phase, every player gets one lot for free
In the second phase players can buy additional lots, using the revenues as money.
In the last phase of the game, the lots pay dividends, but every turn there is a high chance that one random lot becomes worthless (i.e. contains a "Donnerloch").
Players win when they buy certain combinations of lots or -if no one is able to - have the most money at the end.

name: Senretsu Penguin
description:
User summary:

戦列ペンギン (Senretsu Penguin) is a follow-up game to Siege Penguins, and continues the story of the epic penguin civil wars.

It is a 2 player game about the war between the North and the South (like the American Civil War) in the world of penguins.
Each player uses 5 action cards effectively to change the war situation and aims to march towards the stronghold of the opponent, or defeat his armies thoroughly so that their morale is broken.

Publisher's summary:
"ペンギン世界の南北戦争を題材とした２人用対戦ゲームです。
５枚のアクションカードを駆使して戦況を動かし、
最終的に相手の本拠地に攻め上るか、あるいは、
士気がドン底に落ちるほどコテンパンに叩き潰すことを目指します。

name: Sinkirou No Junijikan
description:
User summary:
蜃気楼の12時間 (Sinkirou No Junijikan) is a game which takes place in a mirage house that exists for just 12 hours. In this game of mystery and suspense, four gentlemen, namely an Englishman, a Detective, a Thief and a Murderer, enter the house (Sinkirou-tei). Whilst they play out 12 rounds of the game, each person tries to keep their identity secret whilst also achieving their hidden goals.

Publisher summary:
"蜃気楼邸に集まった4人の紳士が織り成す
サスペンスパーティー。
プレーヤーは英国紳士・探偵紳士・怪盗紳士・殺戮紳士
のいずれかに扮して、自らの正体を隠しつつ12ラウンドを過ごし、
それぞれに定められた勝利条件を目指します。"

name: Kanju
description:
User summary:

漢獣 (Kanju) is a language-based game whereby, from the kanji radicals, you try to guess the four-character idiom cards in your opponents' hands. The game starts by selecting two of the five idiom cards you're dealt. Therefore, the game is very language-dependent and you need a reasonable knowledge of Japanese to play it.

Publisher's summary:
漢字の部首や画数をヒントにして、対戦相手の四字熟語を推理する推理ゲームです。 四字熟語は最初の手札の５枚の中からプレイで使う２枚を選び、ゲームをスタートします。

name: Perfect Alliance
description:
User summary:
パーフェクトアライアンス (Perfect Alliance) is a game from Japan produced by Loto&Beyser games.

It is a draft game where you use resources to complete quests. During the draft, if the conditions fit, the players become allies, and the goal is to complete the quest together with your ally.

Publisher summary:
リソースを使ってクエストの条件をクリアするドラフトゲームです。ドラフトでは条件が揃うとプレイヤー同士が仲間になり、 最終的に決定した仲間と一緒にクエストのクリアを目指すことになります。

name: Poupar para Ganhar!
description:
Poupar para Ganhar! is a simple game in which 2 participants attempt to play Action cards that allow them to save more for their family than the other. Which Action cards gain you the most points is dependent on your Objective cards.

Turns go through 3 phases:


Claiming Objective cards
Playing Action cards
Drawing Action cards to bring your hand total up to 3


Play ends when both piles of Objective cards have been depleted OR when a player reaches the third turn phase and is unable to draw back up to 3 Action cards. Whoever has managed their households the best and accrued the most savings points is the winner.

name: Summoners
description:
INFO: 2 or 4 players, 10-15 minutes per game.

HOOK: High quality miniatures, fast paced gameplay, each card is its own piece of art.

BRIEF OVERVIEW: Summoners is a spell casting, card dueling board game. Players choose a summoner to command and duel head to head. Summoners all have their own unique abilities to use along with a spell deck of 25 cards. Each Summoner has 4 unique pets that they control. Gain mana to cast summoning spells and bring your pets to the game board or cast other spells to deal damage, enhance pets, or heal your summoner.

There are four summoner classes and each starts with 20 health. Attack with your pets or cast your spells cards to take your opponent's summoner to zero health. If you've played any CCG's such as Magic, Game of Thrones, or Star Wars, the dueling wizard mechanics will be familiar to you.

WIN: The first player to take their opponent's summoner to zero health wins.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Battle Crusaders
description:
Battle Crusaders is a card game consisting of 110 fighter character cards with stats on and 50 magic cards which can change the state of play at any time.

Before the game starts the players can choose how many hands they play in multiples of the number of players. This means that the game can be played for short periods (e.g. 1/2 hour or a few hours). The winner is the player who has won the most hands at the end.

The dealer rotates clockwise round the table and after shuffling the cards, starting with their self, deals out seven cards to each player but also finishing with their self, so they will have eight cards. The reason being that they will go first as will every dealer in turn which makes the game fair. The rest of the pack is then put into the centre of the table and the top card is turned over and laid face up on the table next to the pack. If this is a fighter card the player can either then go against that fighter or, choose to go against the next player in turn with the stats and if the card wins that card is laid down on top of the other one for the next player to fight. If the first card down is a magic card it is ignored and they must go against the next player with a fighter card or lay down a magic card and so on.The winner of the hand is the first person (or persons,which it can be with one of the magic cards)to get rid of all their cards.

The more the game is played the more skilled the players can become, especially with the magic cards,and reading the play ahead.

name: Movie Time!
description:
"The game of great lines from great movies! Great lines from some so-so movies! And okay, some really memorable lines from a few bad movies!"

Movie Time! is a trivia game about movie quotes.

Players are given quotes from movies and they must identify which movie they come from. Each quote gives a score between 1 and 4, depending on the difficulty of the question. The first player to 50 points wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: USA Trivia Tour
description:
1985 supplemental trivia card set for use with Trivial Pursuit board.

500 cards with 3,000 questions in 6 categories: GEOGRAPHY, ENTERTAINMENT, HISTORY, FAMOUS PEOPLE, SCIENCE/NATURE, POTPOURRI.

name: Das preussische National-Schach
description:
A chess variant played on a 11x11 board, with the pieces updated to 18th century warfare.

Each player has:
1 King (moves like a King in chess)
2 Life Guards (moves like a Queen)
2 Cuirassier (moves like a Bishop)
2 Dragoons (moves like a Bishop)
1 Life Hussar (moves like a Knight)
2 Winged Hussar (moves like a Knight)
2 Light Cannons (moves like a Rook)
11 Fusiliers (moves like a Rook, but only 1 square, captures like a Bishop, but only adjacent pieces)
2 Artillery Batteries (moves like a Rook, but only up to 2 squares and captures like a Rook, but not by replacement)

name: New-erfundenes Grosses Königs-Spiel
description:
A game similar to chess, but unlike chess the game is played on a point-to-point movement board.
The aim is to capture the enemy king.

It was designed not merely as pastime, but also to teach military and political principles.

Each player has 30 pieces:
1 King
1 Marshal
1 Colonel
1 Captain
2 Chancellors
2 Heralds
2 Chaplains
2 Knights
2 Couriers
2 Adjutants
3 Body Guards
3 Halbardiers
8 Private Soldiers

name: Gocar
description:
You take control of six cars with the aim of being the first to drive them across the city and park them in their designated bays.

Each player has six cars and a set amount of money. Each car has a traffic sign associated with it and they must be parked in the correct bay on the opposite side of the board from where they start.
The board is in a grid with some squares being blank, others with a 'hazard' (where a fine must be paid), others redirect the player in a different direction and another square awards the player with money for good 'road craft' The first player to park their cars is the winner. Any player who becomes bankrupt automatically loses
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Schau links, schau rechts
description:
The aim of this game is for children to learn and realize certain rules which should never be forgotten.

The role of children in this game is twofold.
They move in the roads, either as a pedestrian or as a driver.

As drivers, they must previously obtain a driving licence and they must drive by the right side of the road paying attention to the lights, etc ...

As pedestrians, they must not ever forget before leaving the pavement to look to the left, look to the right and walk fast so that they can go safely and quickly home.

Who will answer at least five questions correctly?

Who will arrive more quickly at an end?

A educative traffic game.

name: Got It! A Scavenger Hunt Game
description:
All you have to do is get five objects and bring them home. But then you discover you'll have to navigate waterways and toll roads, and you can't go there without a pass. And you have to figure out the best route to take based on the roll of the die. And while Action cards can help you, they can also help your opponents, and even snatch defeat from the jaws of victory. And you don't think the other players are going to sit idly by and watch you move about unimpeded, do you?

Got It! is a game that's easy to learn, but tricky to win -- and since the objects you must get change each game, it's never the same twice. But with skillful use of your moves and a little luck, you'll be able to look at the other players with a grin and say "got it"!

Playing Got It! starts with the deck of Object cards. Each player is dealt five objects, and must roll the die and move around the board to land on the matching spaces. Landing on an object space "gets" the object, but it's not safe until the player gets it back "home" to their starting space. There are specially marked spaces that provide toll passes and boat passes -- a toll pass can get a player from one side of the board to the other quickly, while a boat pass lets players go after objects on the islands. There are also spaces that let players draw "action cards", some of which are used immediately and others which are held on to and used on later turns. The action cards can provide help (extra moves, extra turns, etc.) or hindrance (lose a pass, lose a turn, etc.). The first player to get all five of their objects home wins.

name: "That's Par, for the course..."
description:
Golf Anywhere
Golf in good weather or bad
Get that low score you've always wanted
It's fun and easy, anyone can play
A great way to learn the concepts of golf
Fun for the whole family

Each player takes a score sheet (Included) and a pencil. Each die is a club with it's name and available yardage's and or penalities on each side.

Pick a die and roll that "club" take it's yardage that you rolled and subtract it from the distance to the hole. Keep rolling till you sink the ball.

Complete 9 or 18 holes and the winner is the player with the lowest score.

name: Micromech Melee
description:
Microgame submission for 2015 Geekway to the West Design Competition. The game is a two player card game that takes about 15 - 20 minutes to play. It utilizes a deck of 22 cards--20 tactics cards and 2 Cool Down cards, as well as a range location card.

During the first part of the game, each player drafts eight tactics cards which are added to a Cool Down card to form his or her hand.

During the second part of the game, players simultaneously choose tactics to send their micromechs out to attack. Attack, ranged attack, defense and speed values are determined not only by the card played, but also by the cards that have been played previously. Cards can only be replenished into the hand by playing a Cool Down card. First player to incapacitate his or her opponent is the winner.

name: BEEP. BEEP. ATTACK!: Robotic Masters Coop expansion
description: The first expansion to BEEP. BEEP. ATTACK! is a Cooperative Expansion where players fight Master Bots in an Epic 3 stage battle!

name: Feeding the planet
description:
The Earth needs to be fed: move your counters around the board and fill up your boxes with fruit before the hungry caterpillar can eat it. By achieving this, you'll feed the planet! Feeding the planet is a collaborative game for all the family, to teach everybody how nice it is to play and win together as a team.

Feeding the planet is a collaborative game developed for Expo 2015 in Milan.

How to play:
On the board there are some tokens face down: each token can show a fruit, a caterpillar or the Expo2015 mascot.
Each player throws the dice and moves their counter: according to the token, the players pick fruit, move their counter wherever they want or draw a piece of the caterpillar jigsaw.
When all players have completed their individual boards and the harvest is safe, the players have won!
However, if the jigsaw with the caterpillar is completed, they have lost.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ultimate Battle Soul: Konjiki no Gash Bell!! (Final war in ancient times BOX)
description:
Theme:
究極バトル魂：金色のガッシュベル!! （古の最終決戦BOX） or Ultimate Battle Soul: Konjiki no Gash Bell!! (Final war in ancient times BOX) uses characters from manga and anime Konjiki no Gash Bell!! (known in the West as Zatch Bell!)Pitting one team of Mamono demons against another leads to a tournament of battles in order to become the king of Mamono world.

Game-play:
A chess like game with a dice-driven combat, modified by using magic powers of the demons. Demons' skill are described on the "spell book" cards. One card represents one demon and contains 6 unique skills. Players construct up to 4 demons team with unique names. Figures of the demons move between 3 zones: offense, defense and moon light zone. Demons' skills are triggered on specific zones and require AP (action points). Each demon figure has a counter with a max. 12AP, which are simultaneously its life. During a turn player can do 2 actions.

Goal:
The game is won by a player who resets all opponent's Mamono demons counters (life) to zero.

Components:
There are preconstructed starter (this BOX), and two other sets:
Vol.1 降臨編 - booster singles, 7 different figures, 2 figures (coloured and uncoloured) in 1 booster
Vol.2 回帰ゼオン編 - booster singles, 7 different figures, 2 figures (coloured and uncoloured) in 1 booster
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement
publishers: Bandai, Tamashii Nations, Toei Animation, 小学館 (Shogakukan)

name: Gettysburg: Into the Wheatfield
description: This is GETTYSBURG: INTO THE WHEATFIELD for ATS. No one that has studied this battlefield is unaware of where the infamous Wheatfield is. We've all walked that hallowed ground. Now, students of the battle that own CWATS can re-fight the battle in detail on the historical map. You'll need to own CWATS of course -- but if you buy direct from CH, you'll also receive a copy of the DEVIL'S DEN counter sheet—allowing you to choose one module or the other with FREEDOM! Isn't that what all the shooting was about in 1863! Of course, we suggest you nail BOTH CWATS modules: Devil's Den and Into the Wheatfield, but the choice is yours! Order your men Prone, call for a Bayonet Charge! Choose your cannon ammunition. Send a Courier out to the end of your line. It's all up to you as YOU are In Command (at least we hope you are, as the rules say, units that are not In Command ... are Out of Command ... or Isolated .. or OOC and Isolated ... oh the detail!

name: Crazy for you
description:
Crazy for you is a russian roulette card game for 1-4 players, playing time is 30 minutes. Set in a unique fight between friends and kisses, You put the stack of cards on the table face down. Players take turns drawing them. Like Russian Roulette, if you draw an YOU NOT GETTING ANY (blocked) card, you die and you’re out of the game with no kisses.

How to win: Be the person who has some clothing he/she is announced the winner!

How to Play: You put the stack of cards on the table face down. Players take turns drawing them. Like Russian Roulette, if you draw an YOU NOT GETTING ANY (blocked) card, you die lose you’re out of the game. But you can save yourself from losing by playing a Deactivate card to keep the game from being Blocked, or make someone steal a kiss.

There are also special cards that make the game more interesting. For example, attack cards that feature girl taking out their clothes, or allow you to spank in the future or shuffle a kiss. Use the cards in good fun or sexy cruel intentions against your opponents.

name: King of Tortuga
description:
King of Tortuga is a pirate-themed player elimination card game for up to eight players. The setting is the pirate enclave of Tortuga during the heyday of piracy in the early 18th century where a number of crews are in the city and decide to fight to see who is the best. As the Captain of the crew if you are successful you will be declared the King of Tortuga and the the most powerful pirate this side of Blackbeard.

The game is easy - each player is given five cards that have a variety of attack, defense and special cards. Each card has either a point value and/or an explanation of what they do to let you know what to do. Each player also is given 12 markers. The markers represent your crew. As your crew inflicts damage your opponents will lose more crew members until eliminated until opponents are gone... but you.

name: Nova Insula
description:
Nova Insula lets the players define the shape of a new island rising from the sea and compete on who gets most vegetation and different animal species to live on it. The winner will make the biggest impact by growing thick forests for their animals to thrive and hunt for food in.

In the game the players take turns in placing either hexagonal terrain cards to form the island and grow vegetation on existing terrain or animal cards representing groups of reptiles, arachnids, mammals and insects to live on the island.

The game ends when any player runs out of either cards, after which victory points are calculated based on how well and much each player has contributed to the now fully formed island. The player with most points is naturally the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: IQubes
description:
Categories with dice.
5 letter dice have all the A-Z letters.
2 Dice has 12 categories (6 categories each).
20 coins to win.

The game is played simultaneously.
The first player rolls 6 dice: one category die to his choice and all 5 letter dice.
Now there is one category and 5 letters to choose from.
The first player to call out loud a valid word that matches the category die and one of the letters, wins one coin.
The game continues on this manner until there are no more coins to win. The player that collected the highest number of coins wins the game.
categories: Dice, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Jakten på Makten
description:
This is a board game about Swedish politics. It is for you who like to play boardgames with friends and family and is interested in politics and want to learn more and challenge your friends in who know the most.

How to play:
All players choose what politician to play with, and then you move your player with the help of two dices. For advanced players you can use stepping cards to adjust your steps back or forward, depending on on what strategy you have. On each step you can earn - or steal, a percentage (points) depending on the type of card you get. The player with the most percentage in the end of the game will win.

Card categories:

- Quotes
You need to answer what politician who said the quote.

- Media
The media cards will give you points och tell you to give point sto your fellow players depending on what you have done and what the media is reporting.

- Politician parties
Questions about the different political parties.

- Debate
Here you choose your debate strategy against one of the other players, and dependent on the result you will either steal percentage from the other player, or give away. This part is based on rock, paper and scissors.

Who knows the most
On this type of cards you can choose, dependent on the category of the card, if you want to answer it or let one of the other players do so. Dependent on your strategy, and if the answer is correct or not, you and the other player will either get percentage, or you will have to give percentage away.


Swedish
Jakten på Makten är ett brädspel om politik och samhället för dig som gillar sällskapsspel, politik eller bara vill ha ett väldigt unikt svenskt spel där du och dina motspelare garanterat lär er något och får något att diskutera. Alla kan spela spelet, oberoende av politisk inriktning.

Så spelar du:

Ni väljer vilken makthavare ni ska ha som spelpjäs, den turas ni om att förflytta längs spelplanen med hjälp av två tärningar (och med hjälp stegkort för er som är strategiskt lagda och inte gillar tärningar). För varje varv ni går kommer ni närmare mandatperiodens slut. När det sker är det den som har flest procent (poäng) som vinner. Procenten kan du få när du landar på spelplanens olika rutor, nedan står det vilka rutor som finns.

Citat:

Du får ett citat uppläst och ska gissa vilken politiker som har sagt det. Gissar du rätt får du en procent.

Media:

Mediakorten innehåller påståenden som du drabbas av, du kan t.ex. behöva ge bort en procent för att du sagt att Stockholmare är smartare än lantisar eller få en procent för att du höll ett fantastiskt sommartal.

Partikunskap:

Du svarar på en fråga som har med partierna att göra, svarar du rätt får du en procent.


Debatt:

Du möter valfri spelare och den som vinner debatten får procent. Debattera gör ni genom att visa varsitt debattkort samtidigt. Om den ena har ett kort där det står "humor (tar fakta)" och den andra har ett kort där det står "fakta (tar arg)" vinner den förstnämnda. Det är lite som sten, sax, påse.

Vem vet mest:

Precis som i TV-programmet får du välja om du vill svara på frågan i kategorin du hamnar på eller om någon annan spelare ska göra det. Svarar du själv får du procent vid rätt svar och blir av med procent vid fel svar. Väljer du att någon annan ska svara får ni båda procent ifall svaret är korrekt.

name: With Hakkebutt And Dagg
description:
Border Reiver Miniature Wargaming Rules.

Rules for fighting out raids and retribution between rival border clans in sixteenth century Britain. Each player raises an army of between 10 and 30 models: each represents one Reiver and ideally players will have mounted and dismounted versions of each.

Models are classified according to armour, weapons, and their ability to fight as border raiders. Dice are rolled to resolve combat and morale tests.

4 scenarios are included as are campaign rules.

Although these rules are intended for wargames set in the sixteenth century, they should provide a workable foundation for raiding games set earlier and later in history; they have worked quite well for me with Highwaymen, for a variety of ‘sword and shield’ skirmishes, and for the medieval border wars between England and Scotland.

name: TGABA
description:
TGABA (Trivia Game About Black Americans) can be played by two or more players, or by a group divided into teams. A moderator is needed to ask questions and decide which participant answers correctly and fastest.

One questions is asked for each card. The team answering each question correctly "owns" that card; the team "owning" the greatest number of cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Rose Garden
description:
The game is played on an 8x8 board representing a garden.

There are two players – White and Red. Each player has sixteen pieces consisting of:


A piece of garden Décor
Three Queens
A dozen Roses


The garden Décor (a statue and a bench) once set does not move and cannot be captured by either side. In other words, they act as permanent Blocks.

The Queens move and capture just like Chess Queens.

The Roses, once placed, do not move.

The game is played in two phases – “Planting” and “Gathering”

Planting: The players first each set their own piece of Décor on any empty space on the board. This is then followed by their Queens. The players must place their Queens so no Queen can immediately attack an opponent’s Queen. Lastly, all the Roses are arranged around the board, in any remaining empty spaces.

Gathering: Once all the pieces are set, players then can move their Queens around the board, capturing an opponent’s pieces – both Roses and Queens.

Goal - There are two different ways to win:

Capture all twelve of your opponent’s Roses
Capture all three of your opponent’s Queens

name: Plague: Land of the Dead
description:
Survive an undead apocalypse and deliver the cure to eliminate the pandemic. Players work together to save humanity from near certain doom.

Simulating Hordes of Zombies migrating throughout a metropolis, players move through the city attempting to combine elements of a cure to eliminate the Zombie infestation.

Each Player chooses a different Role to play for the game with a variety of different abilities and carrying capacities. With Five Roles to choose from players must develop different strategies every game in order to fight off the multitude of zombie hordes.

The five roles are; Sniper, Hunter, Medic, Mechanic and Scavenger.

Gather Weapons, Equipment, and Vehicles.
Store Supplies: Food, Ammo, Medicine, and Fuel in Hideouts.

No Dice - No Complicated Rules - Easy and Fun to Play

name: What The Fact
description:
What the Fact (WTF) is an outrageously fun, quick & easy (like your mom) party game. Dice make the game about the players & what you'll post on social media to win.

A player selects a black card and rolls the dice to find out which player the card is about. Each of the other players turn in a gray card that fills in the blank and completes the fact. The person giving the most outrageous card wins the round.

The dice symbol represents whichever name came up on the dice. Where it gets even more interesting: if you roll a "WTF", the card is up for grabs! The symbol then represents YOUR OWN NAME and the first person to post the phrase online gets the point. This could lead to some interesting What The Fact moments!

name: Quintix
description:
You control the destiny of five fearless warriors. You will battle your way through three types of terrain: the damp Darkwoods, the rugged mountains, and the open plains. On your quest you will encounter trolls, deadly Knights and face attacks from every side. It is your mission to advance your satyr through the regions of battle, avoiding the death traps and protecting him at all costs. Because if you're satyr dies, your chance of winning the war dies with him.

Players roll dice to move around a track, through different regions of the board, and attack the other player by again rolling dice and comparing to a combat resolution chart to modify the rolls.

name: Hold My Hand
description:
Hold my hand is a party card game for 4-8 players. Players are children lost in fairy forest, trying to get out without becoming fairies. Children are scared, and unaware that one of them might be a fairy.

The game is played drafting cards. In each turn players look at the cards in their hands, put one card either in front of themselves(1) or in between themselves and player next to them(2 or 3). (look at the picture). These cards are put face down.
Then pass rest of the cards to the left.
Then players decide which card that is in between will they look at...

You have the game and the rules in the files section, so just take a look ;)

name: Donkey Derby
description:
Party game. In the box there is a roll of twine. This should be cut to 4 equal lengths. One end of the twine is tied to a chair leg and the other end is held by the players. So, the players at the starting line will all be holding a length of twine (about 12 feet long) and they must pull it backwards so that the twine doesn't sag in the middle and the line should be about 18 inches off the floor. Each player now has a 'Donkey' put on to their twine, as near to the players' as possible.

On the word "Off", each player has to jog their twine furiously so that their donkey heads towards their chair. The first to touch the chair leg with their donkey's nose, wins.

The game can be modified to allow young children to play.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Party Game, Racing

name: Hananowa
description:
User summary:
ハナノワ (Hananowa) is a game from the Japanese dojin circle Comet. Comet is a community group using board games to bring people together. This game shows their goals in action.

Hananowa is a very quick game based on communication. The players work together to create a story aiming towards the ending on the closure card. But whatever you come up with, you have to tie it to the item cards that you draw throughout the game.

Publisher summary:
このゲームはコミュニケーションを楽しむゲームです。
結末カードに書かれた結末に向かって、みんなでお話を作ります。
ただし、アイテムカードをめくってそこに書かれたものに関係する話をしなくてはなりません。

name: Net the Fox
description:
A game of skill and chance for two!

FROM THE GAME BOX:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: For the hunter to capture the fox.

PIECES NEEDED TO PLAY : Two different colored pegs and 1 pair of dice. The Fox makes the first move. Both he and the Hunter can only move along the lines. Both Fox and Hunter alternate turns moving only one space at a time. The Hunter tries to force the Fox into a position where the Hunter's next move would be into the same hole the Fox is in. When the Hunter reaches this position he rolls the dice. If he rolls an even number, he has netted the Fox. If he rolls an odd number the Fox may take two moves and thus gets away. The game continues until the Hunter again corners the Fox. At this time the Hunter again rolls the dice. If an even number is rolled the Hunter wins, but if an odd number is rolled the Fox has eluded the Hunter for the second time, and the Fox is the winner.

name: My Metropolis
description:
You and your friends are business moguls and there is a new plot of land in the city that is ripe for building! You want to build the most floors, have the tallest sky scrapers, and screw over your opponents. Each tunr you take your fortune into your own hands by choosing more or less risky bets on what numbers will be rolled and what resources to collect.

Corporate America was built on ruthless tactics and stock photography. The dark humor and art reinforces this point with leadership cards that players strategically utilize to gain ground on their opponents.

My Metropolis is a 3-4 player worker game that features worker placement and resource collection. Inspired by Settlers of Catan and Small World, My Metropolis is a fast paced and cut throat gaming experience with varied strategy and unique artwork.

name: Wild Cards
description:
Wild Cards are a collection of rules for games that utilize a deck of 52 playing cards. Each card contains the rules for a unique game made up by Nick Pace. I have played these a few times at parties and with family after being challenged to make up some good social games. Think of these as a replacement for the useless joker cards that accompany every box of playing cards.

The artwork is all done by my friend JP, which is based upon a concept sketch I give him. He does a great job with the cartoon graphics since these games are meant for people of ages 8+. Great for family outings, waits at the airport, and parties.

name: Bank Vault
description:
A shipment of rare gold bullion coins are being transported to your bank for safe overnight keeping.

As employees of the bank, you and your 'team' have special access to the outside of the vault where the coins are being stored. Each of your team has knowledge of a small part of the combination.

But plans have changed and betrayal is imminent, your 'friends' aren't so quick to give up their information. And an alarm has been tripped, and you all have 5 minutes to get the coins and get out...

In Bank Vault you have 5 minutes to figure out the code to the vault. The first person to determine the full code is the winner. The code is a series of four digits, each of a different color.

Each person at the table knows one of the numbers, and may be willing to share information via quid pro quo. Although you must realize that:


one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding numbers
one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding colors
and everyone else is telling the truth

name: Captain's Quarters
description:
Captain’s Quarters is a tile rummy game that replaces colored numbers with the maritime signal flag alphabet. The name Captain’s Quarters is a reference to the nautical theme but also a pun. Each of the 26 flags in the alphabet are divided into quarters creating 104 graphic tiles. Like other tile rummy games, the tiles are used to make groups that can be rearranged to create new groups; however, you will find out quickly the quartered flags add a revolutionary type of gameplay.

The goal is to be the first player to play all of his or her tiles after assembling at least two nautical signal flags correctly.

Captain’s Quarters is a fresh new addition to the world of rummy and mahjong both thematically and mechanically.
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Can You Match It?
description:
From the back of the box:
Children learn about the connections between objects and develop language and logic skills. This game is played with jumbo-sized, self-correcting cards. What goes with the chair? That's easy - it's the table! If you're not sure, just see if the two puzzle pieces fit together. Rules for 4 different games are included.

name: The Motor Race
description: A simple roll and move game. Players must race (using a die) to Home (Square 67). There are 10 squares with special instructions that must be obeyed should your car land on one. First to Home, wins.

name: Bitwa na Ławicy Dogger
description: Game covers the Battle of Dogger Bank. It was a naval battle fought in the North Sea on 24 January 1915, during the First World War, between squadrons of the British Grand Fleet and the German High Seas Fleet.

name: Card Crash Demolition Derby
description:
Welcome to the wild world of demolition derby! In the arena, nobody is safe and even taking out your opponents means you may be helping others take you out at the same time. To survive to the end you must learn to drive the line between aggressive and defensive driving and a little luck along the way doesn’t hurt either.

A 2-4 player take that style game in which you play cards to crash, bash and crush your opponents. If you can manage to survive to the end you'll find yourself crowned as the Demolition Derby King!

Game Contains:
4 Player Health Cards
8 Hit Cards
4 Defense Cards
4 Modifier Cards
4 Special Cards

name: Towers Of Power
description:
Race your team around the forests and swamps, icy tundra and lakes, caves and mountains, in a quest to collect to collect precious gold.

Fear not. If your character dies, you can resurrect her at one of the infamous Towers of Power and gain new special abilities, accumulating priceless gems and be one step closer to victory.

STYLE: Mostly Competitive
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

name: Crystal Crisis
description:
Your party must hike through a frozen wasteland, climbing mountains and crossing dangerous frozen lakes to track down the mysterious Snow Demon.

Collect precious Ice Crystals until you have enough to form the almighty Crystal Sword, then battle the Snow Demon atop a mighty Glacier.

This is a semi-cooperative game best with 3 - 5 players.

STYLE: Semi-Cooperative
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

name: FunHouse Party
description:
Travel through a mad dimension of fun and fear!

Players attempt to gain as many Fun Points as possible, while chased by the Clown Patrol, trapped in Endless Mazes and the frightening Hall of Mirrors!
Can you survive long enough before becoming Absolutely Terrified?

STYLE: Competitive
IDEAL for 3 - 5 players

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

name: Dig Dwarf Dig
description:
Dwarves crawl through the dark caverns to drink 2000 Year Old-Ale, Mine for Copper and discover Weapons of Extraordinary Greatness.

Descend deep into the labyrinth to find the Mighty Lantern! Can your band of greedy heroes reach Level Six?

This is a semi-cooperative game best with 3 - 5 players.

In the Tak-Tyx format, most games utilize a shared map and players track their resources and abilities using the fingers on their actual hands. Tokens are not needed and all the rules required to play are printed on the flip-side of the map.

name: Atrium: The ISB Game
description:
ISB - The Indian School of Business - is a premier B-school (top 50 global schools as per Financial Times) and Atrium was designed to celebrate ISB's 10th anniversary and make players (re)live that experience.

To graduate from ISB requires 32 academic credits. However, there is more to ISB life than academics alone. The 1 year long flagship Post Graduate Program has parties, student clubs, networking opportunities etc. In Atrium, the objective is to get to 32 points through a combination of academic courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB.

Based on die roll, players accumulate time which they can use to collect academic, personal, or networking hours. Hours are traded for courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB cards in a race to be the first to get to 32 points
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: Boom Bokken: "Kaboom" and "Jump" promo cards
description:
Those promo cards are special goodies to Cannes 2015.

The "Kaboom" card can be played only when a player must play a card. He indicates a player, and the bomb explodes immediatly.

The "Jump" card can be played only when a player must play a card. He chooses his right or left neighboor, who must play instead.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Twisted Skies: Imperial Edition
description:
The vast and powerful Red Fork Empire! Elder juggernaut of the Steampunk Multiverse! This special standalone edition of Twisted Skies features the thrilling, bizarre, and adventurous citizens of the Empire as they battle their ancient enemy The Dull with the power of Creativity! This set can be played as its own special set or it can be integrated with other sets and expansions of Twisted Skies to bring the wonder of the Red Fork Empire to your games of Twisted Skies!

Players take control of an elite airship. By manning and equipping the ship and crew, players take turns attempting to complete mission cards in an attempt to earn enough Victory Points to win. Other players can try to Interrupt the current player from succeeding at a mission, or can form alliances to help each other.

Twisted Skies is played in a sequence of Phases that make up each player’s turn. Players take their turns one at a time proceeding clockwise around a table. The active player taking
