their turn is known as the Mission Attempter The Sequence of play for the phases of a turn are as follows:

1. Ready all Exhausted Cards
2. Draw one Manifest Card
3. First Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card
4. Open Trading. Players openly trade cards with the Mission Attempter
5. Draw one Catalyst Card. If it is a Mission Card place it on the Table.
6. Mission Attempt. The Mission Attempter tries to gain points by completing Missions.
7. Pirate Trading. Players blindly trade cards from their hands with the Mission Attempter
8. Second Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card

Once a player has made the Second Drop ( and resolved any effect of that Drop) then their turn is over.

name: Shiv
description:
Shiv - a game of incarceration and blood - is a 3 player micro-game where players control prison gangs vying for influence by offing other in-mates.

Each player has a unique hand of 7 gang members that they will deploy face-down to one of three locations. Players perform actions listed on their cards as well as locations as they attempt to bluff, maneuver, and shiv the opposition.

Intrigue and drama are the focus as player's target influential members of the opposition's gang and claw for power while limiting their exposure.

Social, dynamic, and completely devoted to theme there is no other micro-game like Shiv.

name: GaLakTik TakTik GT01 Basic Set
description: Choose your favorite Empire and Starship and command it in a pitched battle with enemy ships. Exciting new combat system can be learned during your first battle. Battles usually last less than an hour. The combat system can be quickly learned, but can take a lifetime to master. The game readily adapts itself to tournament and campaign play, with or without a Game Master. Starships and data also provide ready-made "allies" or "bad guys" for existing Sci-Fi and Adventure Games. Additional D6 and D10 speed play.

name: Customer Clues
description:
Customer Clues is a re-theme of Clue distributed to U.S. Bank Employees as a training tool. It plays nearly the same as Clue, but adds a deck of Mystery Product Cards. These cards have questions about bank products, sales techniques, etc. that must be answered when players land on certain marked spaces on the board.

Like Clue, players move from room to room making guesses as to the cards in the mystery envelope, but in this rethemed version they move around a bank branch, and must deduce which product was sold to which customer in which room. As mentioned above, as players move around the board, they may land on spaces which will force them to answer questions about bank accounts, policies and procedures.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Find the Rhyme
description: Find the Rhyme is an educational matching game for young children, designed to teach the concept of rhyme. The game consists of 20 pairs of rhyming picture cards, each of which is cut like a puzzle piece on one edge, so that each card only fits with its designated pair, and when fit together will form a rhyming phrase (e.g. "a dragon in a wagon"). Anywhere from six to twenty left-side cards are laid out in a line. Each player takes a turn choosing a right-side card and trying to match it with one left-side card to make a rhyme. If the match is correct, the player keeps the pair. If not, the tile is returned. Play continues until all pairs are matched and the player with the most pairs wins.

name: Mouse-O-Mania
description: Mouse-O-Mania is a roll-and-move game included as a pull-out insert in the children's book "Geronimo Stilton: A Christmas Tale." Players must roll dice and move along a track, trying to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party. Along the way, players land on spaces referring to events in the book. These spaces may move them forward or back or cause them to gain or lose turns. The first player to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party by landing on the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

name: Idaho Farmers Market
description:
Plant. Grow. Harvest. Sell. Farmers Market is a game themed around supplying customers with what they desire at the local farmers market. During the game, players will plant corn, wheat grain, potatoes seeds, wait for them to grow so they can harvest them. Milk can be drawn from Cows, and the rare chicken can also be found annoying the players if they don't supply a customer who needs a chicken/ cow their eggs/milk. After the goods are ready, they can be supplied to the Idaho Farmers Market for consumption.

Other options in the game include advancing the technology to get a greater harvest, planting long-growing watermelons (the hit of the day).

Deck manipulation is the main mechanism in farmers market. Players each have their own deck of staple cards. Unlike a normal deck builder, during the game, a few cards will be added to their deck (plant) that will be removed next time they are drawn. Other cards may be added to your deck to help out the harvesting of crops, or change cows or chickens to milk, eggs, or meat, if the patrons request it.
On a player's turn, they draw and play all 5 cards, keeping one card from turn to turn if storing it.
The game ends when all the patrons have showed up and asked for their wants.

A solo game exists that has a timer of rounds, in the way of patron cards orders that must filled before you run out of time.

The patron cards pages must be printed 3 times.
The farmers market 10 pages of cards need to be printed once per player. The backside picture may be printed on the back of the harvest cards, not the patron cards.
A.I art from night Cafe has been used for the playtest pnp files.
mechanics: Contracts, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Multi-Use Cards, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Most Princess in the World
description:
User summary:

The players are all princesses wanting to become the most princess princess in the world. They must collect accessories, dresses and education so that they will gain fame from being rescued by heroes when the demon lords attack. They also need to watch out for weight-gaining food and tea parties, and be careful not to nag too much.

The game centers around making "negative" bids for the available cards for the current round. Players bet "nagging points" to gain the card they want; however these nagging points are negative VP.

When someone gains a demon lord card, all players are captured and the game is interrupted by a hero rescue auction, in which the players bid for what hero to be rescued by. Depending on the hero and the player's stats, players will gain fame by being rescued. When three demon lords have been defeated, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

name: Vowel Bingo
description:
From the instructions:
"Vowel Bingo is a fun-filled way to strengthen and reinforce vowel skills. Each playing card contains eight labeled illustrations of objects having long or short vowel sounds in their names. The purpose of game play is to match each object's game with its correct vowel."

Vowel Bingo is similar to standard bingo, but in order to place their markers, players must know and match short and long vowel sounds. Each player has a card with as series of pictures labeled with the corresponding words. The caller calls out a vowel sound--long a, for example--and players must search their card for a word/picture with a long a in the word. When a player has a complete row, their card is checked by the caller to make sure the vowels are identified correctly. If so, the player wins. If not, play continues until someone has a correct row.

name: The Gallows
description:
The Gallows are ready! Mages accused of wickedness are prepared to meet their end. It's high noon and yet the sky darkens as if it too knows what the future brings. Today, all of mages on the gallows will face their final fate. One by one the wicked will be executed until only one remains...

...and you want that one remaining to be your client. That's right you're a lawyer and the mage you are protecting is a secret. Your job is to protect your mage by making sure all the other mages on the gallows are executed first. Of course, the other lawyers are also secretly protecting one of the mages.

In The Gallows each player is secretly defending one of the characters in the center. On your turn you add one vote token to any character and then move one vote token from a character to a different character. Once a character has enough votes they are executed. Whoever had the most votes on a character when they are executed scores the conviction worth one point. When only one character remains in the middle, whoever was protecting them scores an acquittal worth lots of points.

Play consists of players trying to manipulate the votes so they score convictions and prevent their own defendant from getting convicted.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – The Final Frontier
description:
Star Trek The Next Generation The Final Frontier Action Game.

The Ferengi are up to their capitalist ways again. They have overrun the engineering room and are going after the energy matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. They are trying to steal the dilithium crystals to sell on the open market. These crystals are the energy system on the U.S.S. Enterprise. They would secure at least 5000 bars of gold pressed latinum for the Ferengi, and would turn the Starship Enterprise incapable of warp travel. Your mission is to defend the engineering room against the Ferengi and not let them get away with any of the crystals. Your mission is clear...Engage!

PLAY SUMMARY:

Get your scoops ready to catch the Ferengi as they leave the five Jefferies tube openings, as the phasers are pulled from the matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. Catch a Ferengi and get a piece of your Starship Enterprise. Catch the dilithium crystal by mistake and you loos a piece of your U.S.S. Enterprise. Be first to complete your scoring disk and you win.

name: Blue Water Fleet
description:
Two fleets clash in a fast paced and exciting game of naval and air combat for two players - or up to four players if two sets of the game are used, Each player tries to find his opponent's ships, hidden within sea cards - and sink them before his opponent do the same.

The game is played with two sets of 'sea' cards arrayed in 5 stacks of 7 cards each - a total of 35 sea cards for each player/fleet, in those cards the players must hide 6 ships: Battleship, Cruiser, Aircraft carrier, two destroyers, submarine and two Mines cards, the ships and mines can be placed in any order and possition within those 5 stacks.

During the game the players use a selection of three types of action cards, attack cards (red) Recon cards (blue) and Fleet cards (green), at each round players start with six cards on their hand, their composition (how many cards from each type they will have) is given by the 'formation' their fleet is following, for example: the recon formation will give more recon cards to a player than attack and fleet cards while a more aggresive formation (Full attack) will give to the player more attack cards than recon and fleet.

While the players only have six action cards on their hands at the start of each round discarding any that they use during the round and drawing new ones to replenish their hand (according to the formation they are in) they also have the 'Hangar deck' space, where they may land aircraft cards (some cards within the action decks are 'Aircraft cards') the hangar deck can have up to 6 aircraft cards and those cards can be used to attack and or to defend the fleet from attacking aircraft, a land/resupply system of not-ready / ready aircraft in the game simulates the whole process of landing aircraft supplying them and taking them off to accomplish missions.

Game Contents:
70 sea cards.
63 attack cards.
63 recon cards.
63 fleet cards.
lots of damage counters.
2 formation dials
2 formation pointers
2 hangar space decks.
Rulebook
game was ranked 6th in the Epitrapezio contest (Greece 2015)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Nautical, World War II

name: Sub Runners
description:
Sub Runners is a historical-fiction Pacific submarine adventure.

STORY

In 1942, As VJ day looms near, Maximillion Erhardt directs a secret submarine full of Chinese gold to secret locations to secure retirement gold for Nazi SS. Gary Shaft, a captain in the American Navy, is on the hunt for the submarine and, most importantly, the gold. Meanwhile, Hajime Yamamoto stockpiles ammunitions and weapons to mine the incoming American Fleet.

A generation later...

America Shaft looks on as her son Kirk dives deeper than he has ever swam before checking on a local tip about the Nazi Gold. The modern spy and government infiltrator, Olli Valentiner, manipulates the local governments, listing the Shafts as enemies of state. In other news, a string of murders has occurred across Asia as the twins, Hero and Kira Yamamoto leave their mark on the traitors who lost their family’s wealth.
GOALS

Sub Runners is a card-driven deduction game for three players. Players take on the roles of three families: The Erdharts, The Shafts, or The Yamamotos. Players gather resources across the world trying to complete their initial goals. The Erhardts: to make three gold deposits, The Yamamotos: to sink the search Corvette, and The Shafts: to sink the submarine. Once the submarine has been mined, Heinrich dies, or the submarine completes three drops, it crashes somewhere in the vast ocean.

The final goals now come to bear. The Shafts must find the crash in the ocean and then recover the gold. The Yamamotos may recover the gold or kill all the other players. The Erhardts may kill the other players or defend the crash site until one of the play decks has been exhausted to win.

name: Black Hand
description:
Black Hand is a bluffing and deduction microgame for 3 to 6 players. In it, players take on the role of members of the Black Hand, the secret society responsible for the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand and the beginning of World War I. The aim is to correctly guess the correct combination of assassination weapons (pistols, knives, bombs, and poison) required to kill the Archduke. There’s a hitch in the plans, however—there are traitors hidden within the Black Hand, who work for the Crown and are looking to uncover the assassination plot! Players are secretly divided into those loyal to the cause and traitors who seek to thwart the plot to assassinate the Archduke. Players have to determine who they can trust and who is hiding an ulterior motive!

This game was designed to be entered into the 2015 BGG & Geekway to the West Microgame Competition. It is played with 46 mini-cards (each mini-card is half the size of a poker-size playing card).

name: Terror Of the Skies: Wrath Of Fate
description:
Wrath Of Fate Expansion for Terror Of The Skies
35 new cards to add to the fun of your core set, including:


4 new hero cards from The Wrath Of Fate (Lilith Tess, Timony the Clockwork Ballerina, Gyrod the Automaton, and Doctor Calgori)
7 new weapon cards and new hero weapon rules
plus 24 more quests, actions, and events!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Sergeants D-Day: Pershing expansion
description: For everyone willing to back D-Day Sergeants at the $250+ dollar "Heavyweight" Level, they will receive a KickStarter Exclusive Reward of being the only people ever allowed to purchase the Jagdtiger and Pershing Tank expansions.

name: Sergeants D-Day: Paratrooper – M1 Garand Rifle Team
description:
The US Paratrooper Rifle Team is the cornerstone of any infantry division. With four soldiers carrying M1 Garand rifles, these troops excel at long range fire support and movement. They are versatile enough to enter any combat situation.

Contents:

4 private soldiers with M1 Garand rifles
32 Cards, 4 Soldier card, 28 Action cards
4 Hidden Movement markers
4 Soldier markers
